However, with the release of "Hell of a Tester" in 1998, they transitioned to a more solid rock sound, earning gold status in Finland. Their fifth album, "Dead Letters" (2003), marked a significant breakthrough, selling over 2 million copies worldwide and featuring the hit single "In the Shadows." This success led to numerous awards, including the 'Best Nordic Act' at the 2003 MTV Europe Music Awards. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rasmus))

In 2025, The Rasmus released "Weirdo," their latest album, and embarked on the "Weirdo Tour," performing across Europe and other regions. ([therasmusstore.com](https://www.therasmusstore.com/))

Their music blends alternative rock, gothic rock, and indie rock elements, characterized by dark atmospheres and anthemic melodies.

bands.name: Airbourne
bands.description: Airbourne is an Australian hard rock band formed in Warrnambool, Victoria, in late 2001. The founding members are Joel O'Keeffe on lead vocals and lead guitar, his brother Ryan O'Keeffe on drums, and David Roads on rhythm guitar and backing vocals. In mid-2004, Justin Street joined as the bassist and backing vocalist. The band's music is characterized by energetic performances and a sound reminiscent of classic rock influences. They have released several studio albums, including "Runnin' Wild" (2007), "No Guts. No Glory." (2010), "Black Dog Barking" (2013), "Breakin' Outta Hell" (2016), and "Boneshaker" (2019). In June 2025, they released "Gutsy," their first new music in six years, signaling their continued presence in the rock scene. The current lineup includes Joel O'Keeffe, Ryan O'Keeffe, Justin Street, and Brett Tyrrell, who replaced Jarrad Morrice on rhythm guitar in mid-2023. Airbourne has been recognized for their dynamic live shows and has shared stages with bands like Iron Maiden, Motörhead, and The Rolling Stones.

bands.name: Triptykon
bands.description:
Triptykon is a Swiss extreme metal band formed in 2008 by Thomas Gabriel Fischer, the founder of Hellhammer and Celtic Frost. The band's name, derived from the Greek word for "triptych," signifies Fischer's third musical endeavor. Triptykon's music is characterized by a fusion of doom, gothic, black, death, and avant-garde metal elements, creating a dark and atmospheric sound.

Their debut album, "Eparistera Daimones," released in March 2010, received critical acclaim for its depth and intensity. The album features artwork by H.R. Giger and includes tracks like "Myopic Empire," which originated from a demo by Celtic Frost. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eparistera_Daimones))

In April 2014, Triptykon released their second album, "Melana Chasmata," which continued their exploration of dark and complex musical landscapes. The album was well-received, further solidifying the band's reputation in the metal community. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triptykon))

The current lineup includes Thomas Gabriel Fischer on vocals and rhythm guitar, Victor "V. Santura" Bullok on lead guitar and vocals, Vanja Slajh on bass and backing vocals, and Hannes Grossmann on drums and percussion. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triptykon))

Triptykon's official website is [www.triptykon.net](http://www.triptykon.net/), where fans can find more information about the band and their discography.

For streaming their music, Triptykon is available on platforms like SoundCloud. ([soundcloud.com](https://soundcloud.com/tryptikon-1))

Their music is also available on Spotify.

Triptykon's music is available on Spotify.

The band's genres include doom metal, gothic metal, black metal, and death metal.

The current lineup includes Thomas Gabriel Fischer on vocals and rhythm guitar, Victor "V. Santura" Bullok on lead guitar and vocals, Vanja Slajh on bass and backing vocals, and Hannes Grossmann on drums and percussion. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triptykon))

For more information, visit their official website at [www.triptykon.net](http://www.triptykon.net/).

bands.name: Heaven Shall Burn
bands.description: Heaven Shall Burn is a German extreme metal band formed in 1995 in Saalfeld, Germany. Initially known as Before the Fall, they changed their name to Consense in 1997 and then to Heaven Shall Burn in 1998. The lineup consists of vocalist Marcus Bischoff, guitarists Maik Weichert and Alexander Dietz, bassist Eric Bischoff, and drummer Christian Bass. Their music blends elements of melodic death metal and metalcore, characterized by aggressive riffs, intricate melodies, and socially conscious lyrics addressing themes like anti-racism, anti-fascism, and animal rights. The band has released ten studio albums, including "Asunder" (2000), "Whatever It May Take" (2002), "Antigone" (2004), "Deaf to Our Prayers" (2006), "Iconoclast (Part 1: The Final Resistance)" (2008), "Invictus (Iconoclast III)" (2010), "Veto" (2013), "Wanderer" (2016), "Of Truth and Sacrifice" (2020), and "Heimat" (2025). "Heimat," released on June 27, 2025, marks their first release in five years since "Of Truth and Sacrifice." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heimat_%28album%29)) The album was recorded at the band's own studio, The Dude Ranch, operated by guitarist Alexander Dietz, and mixed by Danish producer Tue Madsen. ([heavenshallburn.com](https://www.heavenshallburn.com/band/)) The band's name is inspired by the Marduk album "Heaven Shall Burn... When We Are Gathered," reflecting their appreciation for the Swedish black metal band's influence. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heaven_Shall_Burn..._When_We_Are_Gathered))

bands.name: Ten56.
bands.description: ten56. is a French deathcore band formed in 2020 by vocalist Aaron Matts, following his departure from Betraying The Martyrs. The lineup includes guitarists Quentin Godet and Luka Garotin, drummer Arnaud Verrier, and bassist Steeves Hostin. The band's music is characterized by a blend of deathcore, nu metalcore, and industrial elements, delivering a raw and aggressive sound. Their debut EP, "Downer Part.1," was released in April 2021, followed by "Downer Part.2" in January 2023. In September 2024, they collaborated with deathcore band Cabal on the single "Still Cursed." Their first full-length album, "Downer," was released in 2023, and their sophomore album, "IO," came out in September 2025. ([ten56.bandcamp.com](https://ten56.bandcamp.com/))

bands.name: Incantation
bands.description:
Incantation is an American death metal band formed in 1989 by guitarist John McEntee and drummer Paul Ledney. Originating from Fair Lawn, New Jersey, the band is renowned for its dark, cavernous sound that blends death metal with elements of doom and black metal. Their debut album, "Onward to Golgotha" (1992), is considered a seminal work in the death metal genre, characterized by its morbid atmosphere and complex compositions. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onward_to_Golgotha)) The band's lyrical content frequently explores themes of anti-Christianity, Satanism, and occultism. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands//885)) Over the years, Incantation has released twelve full-length albums, including "Mortal Throne of Nazarene" (1994), "Diabolical Conquest" (1998), "The Infernal Storm" (2000), "Blasphemy" (2002), "Decimate Christendom" (2004), "Primordial Domination" (2006), "Vanquish in Vengeance" (2012), "Dirges of Elysium" (2014), "Profane Nexus" (2017), "Sect of Vile Divinities" (2020), and "Unholy Deification" (2023). ([incantation.com](https://www.incantation.com/pages/incantation-discography)) The band's lineup has evolved over time, with McEntee remaining the constant member. As of 2025, the current members are:



Incantation's music is characterized by its heavy, down-tuned riffs, blast beat drumming, and guttural vocals, creating a dense and oppressive sound that has influenced numerous bands within the death metal scene. Their commitment to maintaining an underground presence has garnered them a dedicated fanbase and critical acclaim within the metal community.

bands.name: Hexvessel
bands.description: Hexvessel is a Finnish band formed in 2009 by British musician Mat "Kvohst" McNerney, known for his work with Dødheimsgard and Code. Seeking to explore a different musical direction, McNerney relocated to Finland, immersing himself in the country's rich mythology and pre-Christian heritage. This cultural backdrop inspired the formation of Hexvessel, a project that blends elements of black metal, ritual folk psychedelia, and doom rock, often infused with gothic undertones. The band's music delves into themes of nature mysticism, personal spiritual transcendence, and the exploration of liminal spaces between light and darkness. Their discography includes: "Dawnbearer" (2011), "No Holier Temple" (2012), "When We Are Death" (2016), "All Tree" (2019), "Kindred" (2020), "Polar Veil" (2023), and "Nocturne" (2025).

bands.name: Konvent
bands.description: Konvent is a Danish death/doom metal band formed in Copenhagen in 2015. The all-female quartet quickly made a significant impact on the metal scene with their heavy, dark sound and powerful performances. Their debut album, "Puritan Masochism," released in 2020, showcased their ability to blend deep death metal growls with slow, crushing doom riffs, drawing comparisons to bands like Candlemass and Paradise Lost. The album received critical acclaim for its intensity and atmosphere. In 2022, Konvent released their sophomore album, "Call Down The Sun," which further solidified their reputation in the genre. This album continued their exploration of dark themes, with tracks like "Grains" and "Pipe Dreams" exemplifying their evolving sound. The band's lineup consists of Rikke Emilie List on vocals, Sara Helena Nørregaard on guitar, Heidi Withington Brink on bass, and Julie Simonsen on drums. Their music is characterized by guttural vocals, heavy riffs, and a relentless rhythm section, creating a sound that is both menacing and captivating.

bands.name: Ambush
bands.description:
Ambush is a Swedish heavy metal band formed in 2013 in Växjö, Sweden. The band draws inspiration from classic heavy metal acts such as Judas Priest, Accept, and Iron Maiden, blending traditional metal roots with high-octane energy and raw emotion. Their music is characterized by blistering riffs, soaring solos, and powerful lyrics. Ambush's discography includes the following albums:

- "Firestorm" (2014)
- "Desecrator" (2015)
- "Infidel" (2020)
- "Evil In All Dimensions" (2025)

The band has also released singles such as "Natural Born Killers" (2014), "Hellbiter" (2019), and "Barabbas" (2022). They have performed at various European festivals, including Muskelrock, and have toured alongside acts like Enforcer and Cobra Spell. ([thenwothm.com](https://thenwothm.com/2025/04/24/ambush-drop-new-single-announce-album-evil-in-all-dimensions/))

In 2025, Ambush signed with Napalm Records and released their fourth album, "Evil In All Dimensions," on September 5, 2025. The album features tracks like "Evil In All Dimensions," "Maskirovka," "Iron Sign," "The Night I Took Your Life," "I Fear The Blood," "Come Angel of Night," "The Reaper," "Bending The Steel," and "Heavy Metal Brethren." ([thenwothm.com](https://thenwothm.com/2025/04/24/ambush-drop-new-single-announce-album-evil-in-all-dimensions/))

The current lineup consists of:

- Oskar Jacobsson (vocals)
- Karl Dotzek (guitar)
- Olof Engqvist (guitar)
- Oskar Andersson (bass)
- Linus Fritzson (drums)

For more information, visit their official website.

bands.name: Architects
bands.description:
Architects are a British metalcore band from Brighton, East Sussex, formed in 2004 by twin brothers Dan and Tom Searle. The band currently consists of Dan Searle on drums, Sam Carter on vocals, Alex Dean on bass, and Adam Christianson on guitar. They have been signed to Epitaph Records since 2013. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Architects_%28British_band%29))

Initially known as "Counting the Days," the band changed their name to "Architects" after the song "The Architect" by Every Time I Die. ([jampack.com](https://www.jampack.com/artists/architects)) Their early music was characterized by chaotic, rhythmically complex compositions, drawing influences from bands like The Dillinger Escape Plan. Over time, their sound evolved to incorporate more melodic and atmospheric elements, blending metalcore with progressive metalcore and alternative metal. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Architects_%28British_band%29))

Architects' discography includes several critically acclaimed albums. Their ninth studio album, "For Those That Wish to Exist," released in 2021, became their first chart-topping album on the UK Albums Chart. The follow-up, "The Classic Symptoms of a Broken Spirit," was released in October 2022. Their eleventh studio album, "The Sky, the Earth & All Between," was released on 28 February 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Architects_%28British_band%29))

Throughout their career, Architects have been known for their energetic live performances and their ability to blend technical musicianship with emotional depth. Their music often explores themes of personal struggle, societal issues, and existential angst. ([jampack.com](https://www.jampack.com/artists/architects))

bands.name: Setyøursails
bands.description: Setyøursails is a German metalcore band from Cologne, formed in 2017 by vocalist Jules Mitch and guitarist André Alves Rodrigues. They debuted with the self-produced album "Enough" in 2018, followed by "Nightfall" in 2022, which received critical acclaim and featured collaborations with artists like Rudi Schwarzer of Annisokay and Andy Doerner of Caliban. Their third album, "Bad Blood," released in April 2024, showcases a blend of metalcore, melodic hardcore, and post-hardcore elements, addressing themes such as mental health, personal struggles, and societal issues. The band has toured extensively across Europe, supporting acts like Annisokay, Emil Bulls, and Cypecore, and performing at festivals including Full Force and Summer Breeze. In 2025, they embarked on their first headlining tour in Germany and played at the Wacken Open Air festival.

bands.name: Blood Command
bands.description: Blood Command is a Norwegian punk rock band from Bergen, formed in 2008 by guitarist Yngve Andersen, vocalist Silje Tombre, and drummer Sigurd Haakaas. The band's music is characterized by a fusion of punk, hardcore, and melodic rock elements, often referred to as "deathpop." Their debut album, "Ghostclocks," released in 2010, received critical acclaim and was nominated for a Norwegian Grammy. The band has since released several albums, including "Funeral Beach" (2012), "Cult Drugs" (2017), "Praise Armageddonism" (2022), and "World Domination" (2023). In 2021, Australian vocalist Nikki Brumen joined the band, bringing a fresh dynamic to their sound. Blood Command is known for their energetic live performances and has toured extensively across Europe, performing at major festivals and supporting acts like Biffy Clyro and Protest the Hero. Their music often explores themes of rebellion, individualism, and empowerment, resonating with a diverse audience.

bands.name: Thron
bands.description:
Formed in 2015 in the Black Forest region of Germany, Thron is a blackened death metal band that draws inspiration from early to mid-90s black and death metal, as well as traditional heavy metal. Their music is characterized by icy melodies, harshness, and a haunting atmosphere, influenced by bands like Dissection, Unanimated, Sacramentum, and Mercyful Fate. ([thronkvlt.com](https://www.thronkvlt.com/))

Thron released their self-titled debut album in 2017, followed by "Abysmal" in 2018, "Pilgrim" in 2021, and "Dust" in 2023. "Dust" incorporated elements from the early 80s, inspired by bands like Iron Maiden, Judas Priest, and Mercyful Fate, as well as 90s bands like Tiamat, Edge of Sanity, and Sentenced. ([metalforcesmagazine.com](https://www.metalforcesmagazine.com/site/news-thron-release-fourth-studio-album-dust/)) In 2025, they announced their fifth album, "Vurias," set for release on October 31, 2025, featuring the single "The Hunter and the Prey." ([metalodyssey.net](https://metalodyssey.net/2025/10/13/thron-announce-new-single-for-the-hunter-and-the-prey/))

Thron's current lineup includes Samca (vocals), PVIII (guitars/synth), Ravendust (guitars), SXIII (bass), and J (drums). ([thronkvlt.com](https://thronkvlt.com/))

([thronkvlt.com](https://www.thronkvlt.com/))

bands.name: Warcry
bands.description:
WarCry is a Spanish power metal band formed in 2001 by vocalist Víctor García and drummer Alberto Ardines, both former members of Avalanch. The duo began recording songs they had composed in their spare time, leading to the creation of their debut album, "WarCry," released on April 17, 2002. The album received positive reviews, with Kerrang! describing it as "a very good debut from a very good band that has pleasantly surprised everyone." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WarCry_%28album%29))

Following the success of their debut, WarCry released "El Sello De Los Tiempos" in December 2002, which further solidified their presence in the Spanish metal scene. The band's third album, "Alea Jacta Est," released on January 1, 2004, marked a shift towards a more progressive metal sound, incorporating twin-guitar harmonies and collaborative songwriting. The album was well-received, with Metal Archives stating that "WarCry has become the biggest metal band in Spain after this 3rd release." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WarCry_%28band%29))

In 2005, WarCry released "¿Dónde Está La Luz?" which debuted at No. 16 in Spain and was noted for its heavier sound and more socially conscious lyrics. The band's fifth studio album, "La Quinta Esencia," was released on September 18, 2006, and peaked at No. 19 on the Spanish charts. The album was the last to feature drummer Alberto Ardines and guitarist Fernando Mon, who left the band in August 2007. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Quinta_Esencia))

WarCry's music is characterized by powerful vocals, intricate guitar work, and epic themes, often exploring personal and social issues, history, and fantasy. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with Víctor García remaining the constant member. As of October 2025, the current lineup includes Víctor García (vocals), Pablo García (guitar), Santi Novoa (keyboards), Roberto García (bass), and Rafael Yugueros (drums). ([warcry.es](https://www.warcry.es/))

WarCry continues to be a prominent figure in the Spanish metal scene, known for their energetic performances and dedication to the genre.

bands.name: Paleface Swiss
bands.description: Formed in 2017 in Zürich, Paleface Swiss is a deathcore band known for their aggressive riffs, brutal rhythm section, and distinctive vocals. The lineup includes vocalist Marc "Zelli" Zellweger, guitarist Yannick Lehmann, bassist Tommy Lee, and drummer Cassiano "Cassi" Toma. They debuted with the EP "Chapter 1: From The Gallows" in 2018, followed by "Chapter 2: Witch King" in 2019. In 2020, they released their first full-length album, "Chapter 3: The Last Selection," which featured tracks like "Curse Us" and "The Rats." Their 2022 album, "Fear & Dagger," delved into themes of mental health and personal struggles, receiving critical acclaim. In 2023, they added "Swiss" to their name to distinguish themselves from another artist named "Paleface." Their third album, "Cursed," was released on January 3, 2025, showcasing their evolution with tracks like "Hatred" and "River of Sorrows." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paleface_Swiss))

bands.name: Trivium
bands.description: Trivium is an American heavy metal band formed in Orlando, Florida, in 1999. The band's lineup consists of vocalist and guitarist Matt Heafy, guitarist Corey Beaulieu, bassist Paolo Gregoletto, and drummer Alex Bent. Trivium's music blends elements of metalcore, thrash metal, and progressive metal, characterized by intricate guitar riffs, dynamic vocals, and complex song structures. Their debut album, "Ember to Inferno," released in 2003, showcased their early style and garnered attention in the metal community. The 2005 follow-up, "Ascendancy," marked a significant evolution in their sound, featuring the hit single "Pull Harder on the Strings of Your Martyr." In 2006, they released "The Crusade," which embraced a more thrash-oriented approach. The 2017 album "The Sin and the Sentence" marked the return of Heafy's screaming vocals and introduced drummer Alex Bent. Their 2021 release, "In the Court of the Dragon," continued to explore complex musical themes and solidified their reputation in the heavy metal scene. Trivium has been recognized for their technical proficiency and has influenced a new generation of metal bands.

bands.name: Limp Bizkit
bands.description: Limp Bizkit is an American nu-metal band formed in Jacksonville, Florida, in 1994. The lineup consists of lead vocalist Fred Durst, guitarist Wes Borland, bassist Sam Rivers, drummer John Otto, and turntablist DJ Lethal. Known for blending aggressive rock with hip-hop elements, they gained mainstream success with their 1999 album "Significant Other," featuring hits like "Nookie" and "Break Stuff." Their 2000 follow-up, "Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water," debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and sold over a million copies in its first week. The band's energetic performances and bold fashion style helped them rise to fame quickly. Despite periods of inactivity, Limp Bizkit remains a symbol of early 2000s counterculture, known for pushing boundaries and unapologetically doing things their own way. In 2025, they announced the "Gringo Papi" South America Tour, featuring special guests YUNGBLUD, 311, ECCA VANDAL, Riff Raff, and Slay Squad.

bands.name: Saor
bands.description: Saor is a Scottish one-man metal project founded in 2012 by Andy Marshall, formerly of Falloch. The name 'Saor' translates to 'free' in Scottish Gaelic, reflecting the project's commitment to artistic liberty. Saor's music uniquely blends atmospheric black metal with traditional Scottish and Celtic folk elements, incorporating instruments like tin whistle, bagpipes, and violin. This fusion creates a soundscape that transports listeners through Scotland's rugged landscapes and rich history. The project's discography includes several acclaimed albums: 'Roots' (2013), 'Aura' (2014), 'Guardians' (2016), 'Forgotten Paths' (2019), 'Origins' (2022), and 'Amidst the Ruins' (2025). Each release continues to explore themes of Scottish heritage, nature, and personal emotion, solidifying Saor's position in the atmospheric black metal scene.

bands.name: Deadlands
bands.description: Deadlands is a metalcore band from Long Island, New York, known for their dynamic sound that blends heavy music with accessible melodies. Formed in 2010, the band has evolved over the years, consistently expanding their musical horizons and engaging with a diverse audience. Their music is characterized by intense vocals, powerful guitar riffs, and a rhythmic foundation that drives their energetic performances. In 2012, Deadlands released their debut album, "Evilution," which featured guest appearances from notable guitarists such as Hank Shermann and Michael Denner of Mercyful Fate, and Andy LaRocque of King Diamond. The album received mixed reviews, with some critics praising its aggressive style and others finding it lacking in originality. In 2024, Deadlands signed with Spinefarm Records and released the single "Villain," marking a new chapter in their musical journey. The song delves into themes of empowerment and self-realization, reflecting the band's growth and maturity. In 2025, they announced their upcoming EP, "Seven," set to release on June 27, 2025. Each track on the EP is inspired by one of the seven deadly sins, showcasing the band's ability to intertwine thematic depth with their metalcore sound. The lead single, "Limbo," focuses on the destructive aspects of lust and its impact on personal relationships. Deadlands continues to push the boundaries of their genre, aiming to create music that resonates with a wide audience while staying true to their heavy roots.

bands.name: Mantar
bands.description:
Mantar is a German sludge metal duo formed in 2012 by drummer Erinç Sakarya and guitarist/vocalist Hanno Klänhardt. Originating from Bremen, the band relocated to Hamburg, with Klänhardt residing in Gainesville, Florida since 2015. The duo's music is characterized by a raw blend of doom metal, black metal, and punk influences, creating a heavy and aggressive sound. They perform without a bassist, relying solely on guitar and drums to produce their distinctive style. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantar_%28band%29))

Mantar's discography includes several studio albums:

- **Death by Burning** (2014): Their debut album, released on Svart Records, established their presence in the metal scene.

- **Ode to the Flame** (2016): Released under Nuclear Blast, this album marked their first collaboration with the label.

- **The Modern Art of Setting Ablaze** (2018): Continued their evolution, showcasing their unique sound.

- **Grungetown Hooligans II** (2020): A cover EP released through their own label, Mantar Records.

- **Pain Is Forever and This Is the End** (2022): Released via Metal Blade Records, this album received critical acclaim and charted in Germany, Switzerland, and Austria.

- **Post Apocalyptic Depression** (2025): Their latest full-length album, released on February 14, 2025, via Metal Blade Records. ([doomed-nation.com](https://doomed-nation.com/german-sludge-duo-mantar-presents-new-full-length-album-post-apocalyptic-depression-out-now-via-metal-blade-records/))

Mantar's music is influenced by bands such as the Melvins, Darkthrone, and Motörhead. They are known for their energetic live performances and have toured extensively across Europe and the United States. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantar_%28band%29))

bands.name: Five The Hierophant
bands.description: Formed in London in 2014, Five The Hierophant is an instrumental metal band known for their unique fusion of black metal, doom, jazz, and ambient elements. Their music is characterized by dark, atmospheric soundscapes, often incorporating unconventional instruments like saxophone, violin, and various percussion instruments. The band's discography includes the self-titled EP (2015), the full-length album "Over Phlegethon" (2017), and the EPs "Magnetic Sleep Tapes Vol. I" and "Vol. II" (2019). In 2021, they released "Through Aureate Void," which further explored their experimental sound. Their latest album, "Apeiron," was released on October 18, 2024, via Agonia Records, showcasing their continued evolution in creating hypnotic and hallucinatory musical experiences.

bands.name: Twenty One Children
bands.description: Twenty One Children is a dynamic punk duo from Soweto, Johannesburg, South Africa, formed by friends Thula and Abdula. They blend U.S.-inspired skate culture with their unique Sowetan identity, crafting a sound that’s fresh, defiant, and brimming with energy. Their music channels the raw intensity of bands like Dead Kennedys, Dead Milkmen, and Suicidal Tendencies, while carving out their own thrilling path. ([dottodotfestival.co.uk](https://www.dottodotfestival.co.uk/artist/twenty-one-children/)) Their discography includes singles such as "Scare Tactics" (released July 31, 2025) and "Two Kings And A Skink" (released November 17, 2023). ([twentyonechildren.bandcamp.com](https://twentyonechildren.bandcamp.com/)) They have also released a self-titled EP in 2025. ([slovenly.bandcamp.com](https://slovenly.bandcamp.com/track/let-it-doom))

bands.name: Nothing More
bands.description: Nothing More is an American rock band from San Antonio, Texas, formed in 2003. The band initially faced challenges in securing a record deal, leading them to release independent albums throughout the 2000s. In 2011, they decided to work independently again, aiming to produce a record that matched major label quality on an independent budget. This effort culminated in their self-titled fourth studio album, released on June 24, 2014, under Eleven Seven Music. The album delves into themes such as the intersection of religion, corporations, mental illness, and capitalism. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nothing_More_%28album%29)) Their fifth studio album, "The Stories We Tell Ourselves," was released on September 15, 2017, debuting at number 15 on the Billboard 200 chart. The band continued to tour extensively in support of this album, including a headlining North American tour in 2019. In 2022, they released their sixth studio album, "Spirits," followed by their seventh album, "Carnal," on June 28, 2024. The band is known for their elaborate and energetic live performances, often incorporating unique elements like "The Scorpion Tail," a 14-foot-tall animated structure made from scrap metal and auto parts. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nothing_More))

bands.name: Cavalera Conspiracy
bands.description: Cavalera Conspiracy is a Brazilian-American heavy metal band formed in 2007 in Phoenix, Arizona, by brothers Max and Igor Cavalera, former members of Sepultura. The band was initially known as Inflikted, releasing their debut album under this name in 2008. Their music blends elements of thrash, groove, and death metal, characterized by aggressive riffs and rhythmic intensity. Over the years, the lineup has evolved, with notable members including guitarist Marc Rizzo and vocalist Joe Duplantier. In 2023, the band re-recorded Sepultura's early works, releasing 'Morbid Visions' and 'Bestial Devastation' with updated sound and artwork. In 2024, they continued this project with a re-recording of 'Schizophrenia', further solidifying their legacy in the metal genre.

bands.name: Nanowar Of Steel
bands.description: Nanowar of Steel is an Italian comedy heavy metal band formed in 2003 in Rome. Originally known as Nanowar, they changed their name in 2006 to Nanowar of Steel as a parody of the Italian power metal band Rhapsody, which had recently altered its name to Rhapsody of Fire. The band's music is characterized by humorous takes on heavy metal themes, often parodying the genre's conventions and stereotypes. Their style blends elements of heavy metal, power metal, death metal, folk metal, and comedy rock, creating a unique and entertaining sound. Over the years, Nanowar of Steel has released several albums, including "Other Bands Play, Nanowar Gay!" (2005), "Into Gay Pride Ride" (2010), "A Knight at the Opera" (2014), "Stairway to Valhalla" (2018), "Italian Folk Metal" (2021), and "Dislike to False Metal" (2023). They are known for their satirical music videos, such as "Giorgio Mastrota" and "Norwegian Reggaeton," which have garnered millions of views on YouTube. In 2019, they signed with Napalm Records and released "Valhallelujah," a Christmas song combining heavy metal and gospel. The band's current lineup includes Gatto Panceri 666 on bass, Potowotominimak and Mr. Baffo on vocals, Mohammed Abdul on guitar, and Uinona Raider on drums. Their official website is [https://www.nanowar.it/](https://www.nanowar.it/), and they are available on Spotify.

bands.name: Soen
bands.description: Soen is a Swedish progressive metal band formed in 2010 by former Opeth drummer Martin Lopez. The lineup includes vocalist Joel Ekelöf, guitarist Cody Lee Ford, drummer Martin Lopez, and keyboardist Lars Åhlund. They are currently signed to Silver Lining Music and have released six studio albums, with their most recent, "Memorial," released on September 1, 2023. Their music is characterized by intricate rhythms, nuanced melodies, and introspective lyrics, blending elements of progressive metal, progressive rock, and alternative metal. The band has undergone lineup changes over the years, with bassist Stefan Stenberg returning in February 2025 after Oleksii "Zlatoyar" Kobel's departure. Soen's discography includes "Cognitive" (2012), "Tellurian" (2014), "Lykaia" (2017), "Lotus" (2019), "Imperial" (2021), and "Memorial" (2023).

bands.name: Leprous
bands.description: Leprous is a Norwegian progressive metal band formed in 2001 in Notodden, Norway. The group was founded by singer and keyboardist Einar Solberg and guitarist Tor Oddmund Suhrke. They released their debut album, "Tall Poppy Syndrome," in 2009, which received positive reviews for its blend of progressive metal and alternative rock influences. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Einar Solberg (vocals, keyboards), Tor Oddmund Suhrke (guitar, backing vocals), Robin Ognedal (guitar, backing vocals), Simen Børven (bass, backing vocals), and Baard Kolstad (drums). Leprous has released several albums, such as "Bilateral" (2011), "Coal" (2013), "The Congregation" (2015), "Malina" (2017), "Pitfalls" (2019), "Aphelion" (2021), and "Melodies of Atonement" (2024). Their music is characterized by complex compositions, dynamic vocals, and an innovative approach to progressive metal. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leprous))

bands.name: Phil Campbell And The Bastard Sons
bands.description: Phil Campbell and the Bastard Sons is a Welsh rock band formed in 2016 by former Motörhead guitarist Phil Campbell, following the death of Motörhead frontman Lemmy Kilmister in 2015. The band comprises Campbell's three sons—Todd (guitar, harmonica), Tyla (bass), and Dane (drums)—alongside vocalist Neil Starr. Their music blends hard rock and heavy metal, drawing from Campbell's extensive experience in Motörhead and his sons' fresh perspectives. The band debuted with a self-titled EP in November 2016, showcasing their raw, gritty rock 'n' roll style. Their first full-length album, "The Age of Absurdity," was released in January 2018, produced by Romesh Dodangoda. The album received positive reviews and won Best Debut Album at the 2018 Metal Hammer Awards. In November 2020, they released their second album, "We're the Bastards," produced by Todd Campbell during the COVID-19 lockdown. The album continued their tradition of energetic rock, featuring tracks like "Born to Roam." In June 2023, the band announced their third album, "Kings of the Asylum," set for release on September 1, 2023, marking the first album with new vocalist Joel Peters, who replaced Neil Starr in 2021. The album includes singles such as "Schizophrenia," "Hammer and Dance," and "Strike the Match," reflecting the band's evolving sound. Throughout their career, Phil Campbell and the Bastard Sons have toured extensively, performing at major festivals like Wacken Open Air and Hellfest, and have been known for their high-energy live performances.

bands.name: Soilwork
bands.description:
Soilwork is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in Helsingborg in 1995. Initially known as Inferior Breed, they changed their name to Soilwork in late 1996, signifying "working from the ground up." The band has released twelve studio albums, blending elements of melodic death metal and alternative metal.

Their discography includes notable albums such as "A Predator's Portrait" (2001), which introduced clean vocals alongside traditional screaming, and "Natural Born Chaos" (2002), incorporating alternative metal influences. In 2019, they released "Verkligheten," their first album with drummer Bastian Thusgaard, and in 2022, "Övergivenheten," featuring bassist Rasmus Ehrnborn.

Tragically, guitarist David Andersson passed away in September 2022. Touring guitarist Simon Johansson was made a permanent member in March 2023.

bands.name: Misery Index
bands.description:
Misery Index is an American death metal band formed in 2001 in Baltimore, Maryland. The band was established by bassist and vocalist Jason Netherton, guitarist and vocalist Mike Harrison, and drummer Kevin Talley. Their music is characterized by a blend of death metal with strong influences from hardcore punk and grindcore, often addressing themes such as politics, class struggles, and societal issues. The band's name is derived from the economic indicator of the same name, reflecting their focus on societal and economic themes. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misery_Index_%28band%29))

Over the years, Misery Index has released several studio albums, including "Retaliate" (2003), "Discordia" (2006), "Traitors" (2008), "Heirs to Thievery" (2010), "The Killing Gods" (2014), "Rituals of Power" (2019), and "Complete Control" (2022). Their music is noted for its aggressive style and politically charged lyrics. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Misery_Index_%28band%29))

The current lineup consists of Jason Netherton (bass, lead vocals), Mark Kloeppel (rhythm guitar, co-lead vocals), Adam Jarvis (drums), and Darrin Morris (lead guitar). ([miseryindex.com](https://miseryindex.com/))

For more information, visit their official website at [miseryindex.com](https://miseryindex.com/).

bands.name: Our Promise
bands.description: Formed in late 2020 in Stuttgart, Germany, Our Promise is an explosive metalcore sextet that blends metalcore, hardcore, and pop punk. The band was established by musicians eager to explore new musical frontiers, resulting in a dynamic twin-vocalist assault that has captivated audiences. From the outset, they embraced full independence, drawing inspiration from the entrepreneurial strategies of urban artists to take control of their destiny. Their music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, powerful breakdowns, and emotionally charged vocals that resonate with listeners. Lyrically, they delve into themes of personal struggle, suffering, and hope, fostering a deep connection with their growing fanbase. Since their formation, Our Promise has achieved significant milestones, including millions of Spotify streams and performances across more than 15 countries in the EU and UK. They've graced stages at major festivals such as Wacken, Summer Breeze, and the Impericon Festivals. Their debut EP, "Unbreakable," showcases their unique sound and has been well-received by fans and critics alike. The band's commitment to their craft and their audience has solidified their position as a rising force in the metal scene.

bands.name: Mittel Alta
bands.description: Mittel Alta is a German musical duo that emerged in 2023, blending medieval aesthetics with modern rap and spoken word elements. The duo consists of Sir Schwanzelot and Sir Gernhardt Reinlunzen, who combine rap and spoken word with a consciously medieval visual and linguistic style. Their music is characterized by a fusion of medieval trap, black metal, and deathcore elements, creating a unique and energetic sound. Their discography includes the albums "Minnebang" (2023), "Bastard Barden" (2023), "Bergfriedigung" (2023), "Musik für den Pöbel" (2024), and "Fass Nacht" (2025), as well as the EP "Traubenstampf" (2025) and singles like "Der Chef ist tot" and "Auf dem Dorffest" (2025). The duo has been announced for the Summer Breeze Open Air 2026 in Dinkelsbühl, Germany, reflecting their growing presence in the music scene.

bands.name: Of Mice & Men
bands.description: Formed in 2009 in Costa Mesa, California, Of Mice & Men is an American rock band known for their dynamic blend of metalcore, hard rock, and nu metal. The group was founded by former Attack Attack! vocalist Austin Carlile and bassist Jaxin Hall. Over the years, the lineup has evolved, with current members including drummer Valentino Arteaga, guitarists Phil Manansala and Alan Ashby, and bassist and lead vocalist Aaron Pauley. The band's self-titled debut album was released in 2010, showcasing their metalcore roots. Their subsequent albums, such as "The Flood" (2011) and "Restoring Force" (2014), incorporated elements of nu metal and hard rock, reflecting their evolving sound. In 2019, they released "Earthandsky," marking a return to their metalcore origins. In 2023, they released "Tether," followed by the single "Another Miracle" in 2025, signaling a new chapter with Century Media Records. The band's music often explores themes of resilience, mental health, and human connection, resonating deeply with fans. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Of_Mice_%26_Men_%28band%29))

bands.name: Ashenspire
bands.description: Ashenspire is an avant-garde black metal band formed in Glasgow, Scotland, in 2013. The band is known for their experimental approach, blending black metal with elements of jazz and neoclassical music to create a unique and challenging sound. Their lyrics often address themes such as urban decay, anti-imperialism, and anti-capitalism. Ashenspire's discography includes their debut album, "Speak Not of the Laudanum Quandary," released in 2017, which critiques British imperialism. Their second album, "Hostile Architecture," released in 2022, delves into the widening wealth gap and societal alienation. The band has been praised for their innovative compositions and thought-provoking messages. ([musicwebzine.com](https://www.musicwebzine.com/ashenspire-to-release-new-album-hostile-architecture/))

bands.name: Faun
bands.description: Faun is a German band formed in 1998, renowned for blending ancient sounds with modern music. Their style encompasses pagan folk, darkwave, and medieval music, utilizing instruments such as the Celtic harp, Swedish nyckelharpa, hurdy-gurdy, bagpipes, cittern, and flutes. The band's lyrics are performed in various languages, including German, English, Latin, Greek, Scandinavian, and Hungarian. Over the years, Faun has released multiple studio albums, with their 2019 album "Märchen & Mythen" marking the first to feature member Laura Fella and the last to include founding member Fiona Frewert. Their 2025 album "Hex" delves into themes of witchcraft and female magic, highlighting the various aspects of female magic in different cultures. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%A4rchen_%26_Mythen))

bands.name: Art Nation
bands.description: Art Nation is a Swedish melodic rock band formed in Gothenburg in 2014 by vocalist Alexander Strandell and guitarist Christoffer Borg. The band quickly gained recognition with their debut album, "Revolution," released in 2015, which showcased their ability to blend polished riffs, anthemic choruses, and emotionally charged lyrics. Their dynamic live performances earned them nominations for Sweden's prestigious "Gaffa-priset" in 2015, 2016, and 2017, including categories like "The Best Live Act of the Year" and "Swedish Breakthrough of the Year." In 2016, they penned the official anthem for the "Gothia Cup" soccer tournament, performed live on national TV and in sold-out stadiums. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Strandell, Borg, and bassist Richard Svärd. Their discography includes "Revolution" (2015), "Liberation" (2017), "Transition" (2019), and "Inception" (2023). In 2025, they released "The Ascendance," an album that pushes towards a more modern heavy sound while maintaining their signature melodic style. The album features tracks like "Halo," "Thunderball," and "Unstoppable," exemplifying their refined sound. The band has shared stages with iconic acts such as Nightwish, Twisted Sister, and Hammerfall, and has performed at major festivals like Sweden Rock. Their music is available on platforms like Spotify and Apple Music.

bands.name: Disillusion
bands.description: Disillusion is a German progressive metal band formed in 1994 in Leipzig. Initially playing thrash metal, they evolved into a distinctive blend of progressive and melodic death metal. Their debut album, "Back to Times of Splendor" (2004), received critical acclaim for its intricate compositions and atmospheric depth. The follow-up, "Gloria" (2006), marked a stylistic shift with more electronic elements and distorted vocals. After a hiatus, they returned with "The Liberation" in 2019, showcasing a matured sound. Their latest release, "AYAM" (2022), further solidified their reputation in the metal scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disillusion_%28band%29))

bands.name: Holocausto Canibal
bands.description: Holocausto Canibal é uma banda portuguesa de goregrind formada em 1997 na cidade do Porto. O grupo é conhecido por suas letras explícitas e performances ao vivo intensas, que frequentemente incorporam elementos teatrais e visuais impactantes. O nome da banda é uma homenagem ao filme "Cannibal Holocaust" de 1980, refletindo sua estética e temática centradas em gore e perversões. A formação atual inclui Z. Pedro no baixo, Eduardo F. e António C. nas guitarras, Diogo P. na bateria e Ricardo S. como vocalista de sessão. Ao longo de sua carreira, a banda lançou diversos álbuns, incluindo "Gonorreia Visceral" (2000), "Sublime Massacre Corpóreo" (2002), "Opusgenitalia" (2006) e "Gorefilia" (2012). Em 2023, lançaram o EP "Patamares de Crueldade". O estilo musical da banda combina elementos de death metal e grindcore, com letras que exploram temas como gore, canibalismo e perversões sexuais, sempre cantadas em português. As capas de seus álbuns são notoriamente gráficas, contribuindo para sua reputação na cena do metal extremo. A banda continua ativa, mantendo uma base de fãs dedicada e realizando apresentações ao vivo enérgicas.

bands.name: Elvenking
bands.description: Elvenking is an Italian folk metal band formed in 1997 in Sacile, Friuli-Venezia Giulia. The band was established by guitarists Aydan and Jarpen, with vocalist Damnagoras joining in 1998. They are known for blending power metal with folk melodies, creating a distinctive sound that has evolved over the years. Their debut album, "Heathenreel," released in 2001, received critical acclaim for its fusion of metal and folk elements. Subsequent albums like "The Winter Wake" (2006) and "The Scythe" (2007) continued to explore themes of fantasy and folklore, with "The Scythe" being their first concept album centered around the death of a beautiful woman. In 2012, "Era" marked a return to their traditional sound, incorporating more folk elements. The band has maintained a consistent lineup with Aydan on guitars, Damnagoras on vocals, Lethien on violin, Jakob on bass, and Symohn on drums. Their music often delves into themes of fantasy, folklore, and nature, reflecting a deep appreciation for storytelling and the mythical. Elvenking's discography includes several studio albums, with their latest release being "Reader of the Runes – Luna" in 2025.

bands.name: All Time Low
bands.description: All Time Low is an American rock band formed in Towson, Maryland, in 2003. The lineup consists of lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist Alex Gaskarth, lead guitarist Jack Barakat, bassist/backing vocalist Zack Merrick, and drummer Rian Dawson. The band's name is derived from lyrics in the song "Head on Collision" by New Found Glory. Initially formed during their high school years, All Time Low began by covering songs from pop-punk bands like Blink-182. They released their debut EP, "The Three Words to Remember in Dealing with the End," in 2004 through local label Emerald Moon. Their first studio album, "The Party Scene," followed in 2005. In 2006, they signed with Hopeless Records and released the "Put Up or Shut Up" EP, which included re-recorded tracks from their debut album along with new material. Their second studio album, "So Wrong, It's Right," was released in 2007, featuring the hit single "Dear Maria, Count Me In." Over the years, All Time Low has released nine studio albums, including "Nothing Personal" (2009), "Dirty Work" (2011), "Don't Panic" (2012), "Future Hearts" (2015), "Last Young Renegade" (2017), "Wake Up, Sunshine" (2020), "Tell Me I'm Alive" (2023), and "Everyone's Talking!" (2025). Their musical style encompasses pop-punk, pop rock, power pop, emo pop, and alternative rock. The band cites influences such as Blink-182, Green Day, MxPx, New Found Glory, Saves the Day, and The Get Up Kids. All Time Low has been recognized with various awards, including the Alternative Press Music Award for Artist of the Year in 2015 and the Rock Sound Award for Album of the Year in 2018. They have also been nominated for multiple iHeartRadio Music Awards, winning Alternative Rock Song of the Year in 2022 for "Monsters" featuring blackbear.

bands.name: Deafheaven
bands.description: Deafheaven is an American blackgaze band formed in 2010 in San Francisco, California. The group began as a duo with vocalist George Clarke and guitarist Kerry McCoy, who previously performed together in the grindcore band Rise of Caligula. They recorded and self-released a demo album in April 2010, blending traditional black metal with post-rock elements. The demo led to the recruitment of three additional members and the signing with Deathwish Inc. in December 2010. Their debut album, "Roads to Judah," was released in April 2011, featuring themes of philosophy, melancholy, and introspection. In 2013, Deafheaven released "Sunbather," which received widespread critical acclaim and was named one of the best albums of the year by Spin magazine. The band's third album, "New Bermuda," was released in 2015, followed by "Ordinary Corrupt Human Love" in 2018. In 2021, they released "Infinite Granite," marking a departure into a more shoegaze-influenced sound. In 2025, Deafheaven returned to their black metal roots with "Lonely People with Power," released on March 28, 2025, through Roadrunner Records. The album was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen and features guest appearances by Interpol's Paul Banks and Boy Harsher's Jae Matthews. The current lineup includes George Clarke (vocals), Kerry McCoy (guitar), Daniel Tracy (drums), Shiv Mehra (guitar), and Chris Johnson (bass).

bands.name: Old Man's Child
bands.description:
Old Man's Child is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 1993 in Oslo. The project was initiated by guitarist and vocalist Galder (born Thomas Rune Andersen), who had previously been part of the death/thrash band Requiem. After Requiem's dissolution in 1992, Galder shifted his focus to black metal, leading to the formation of Old Man's Child. The band's music is characterized by a blend of symphonic and melodic black metal elements, often exploring themes of Satanism, evil, sorrow, misanthropy, and death. Galder has remained the sole constant member throughout the band's history, with various musicians contributing over the years. Notably, drummer Tjodalv, who had been part of the original lineup, rejoined the band in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Man%27s_Child))

Old Man's Child's discography includes several full-length albums:

- **Born of the Flickering** (1996): The debut album, released through Hot Records, features tracks like "Demons of the Thorncastle" and "Swallowed by a Buried One." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Born_of_the_Flickering))

- **The Pagan Prosperity** (1997): Released via Century Media, this album includes songs such as "The Millennium King" and "Behind the Mask." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pagan_Prosperity))

- **Ill-Natured Spiritual Invasion** (1998): This album continues the band's exploration of dark themes, with tracks like "Towards Eternity." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Old_Man%27s_Child/Ill-Natured_Spiritual_Invasion/1342))

- **Revelation 666: The Curse of Damnation** (2000): Features songs like "Phantoms of Mortem Tales" and "Hominis Nocturna." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revelation_666_%E2%80%93_The_Curse_of_Damnation))

- **In Defiance of Existence** (2003): Continues the band's legacy with tracks such as "The Spawn of Lost Creation." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slaves_of_the_World))

- **Vermin** (2005): Includes songs like "Enslaved and Condemned" and "The Plague of Sorrow." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Old_Man%27s_Child/Vermin/90982))

- **Slaves of the World** (2009): Features tracks like "Slaves of the World" and "Saviours of Doom." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slaves_of_the_World))

In August 2024, Galder departed from Dimmu Borgir after nearly 25 years to focus on Old Man's Child. He announced plans to finalize a new album and begin touring with the band. In March 2025, Galder announced that Tjodalv would be returning to the band to tour in the summer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Man%27s_Child))

The band's official website is [oldmanschild.tk](http://www.oldmanschild.tk/), and they have a presence on SoundCloud at [soundcloud.com/oldmanschildofficial](https://soundcloud.com/oldmanschildofficial).

bands.name: Slaughter To Prevail
bands.description: Slaughter to Prevail is a Russian deathcore band formed in 2014 in Yekaterinburg. The band is known for its aggressive sound and powerful performances, blending deathcore and nu metal elements. Their debut EP, "Chapters of Misery," was released in 2015, followed by their first full-length album, "Misery Sermon," in 2017. In 2021, they released "Kostolom," which included singles like "Agony" and "Demolisher." In 2025, they released their third studio album, "Grizzly," featuring singles such as "Viking," "Conflict," "Kid of Darkness," and "Behelit." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slaughter_to_Prevail))

bands.name: Godsmack
bands.description: Godsmack is an American rock band formed in 1995 in Lawrence, Massachusetts. The lineup consists of lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist Sully Erna and bassist Robbie Merrill. The band has released nine studio albums, including their self-titled debut in 1998, which achieved 5x Platinum status. Their 2000 album, "Awake," debuted at number five on the Billboard 200 and was certified 2x Platinum. In 2023, they released "Lighting Up the Sky," their final studio album before the departures of guitarist Tony Rombola and drummer Shannon Larkin in 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Godsmack)) Known for their dynamic live performances, Godsmack has been a significant presence in the hard rock and alternative metal scenes.

bands.name: Hardcore Superstar
bands.description: Hardcore Superstar is a Swedish rock band formed in Gothenburg in 1997. Known for their energetic performances and a sound that blends hard rock, glam metal, and sleaze rock, they have been a significant presence in the Swedish music scene. The band was initially formed by vocalist Joakim "Jocke" Berg and bassist Martin Sandvik, who had previously played together in the band Link. They were joined by guitarist Thomas "Silver" Silver and drummer Mika "Dyna Mike" Vainio. Their debut album, "It's Only Rock 'n' Roll," was released in 1998, followed by "Bad Sneakers and a Piña Colada" in 2000, which marked their first international release. In 2005, they released their self-titled album, "Hardcore Superstar," which received critical acclaim and solidified their reputation in the hard rock genre. The band's lineup underwent changes over the years, with guitarist Vic Zino joining in 2008 and drummer Magnus "Adde" Andreasson departing in 2024 after 25 years with the band. Their most recent album, "Abrakadabra," was released in 2022, showcasing their continued evolution and commitment to their musical roots.

bands.name: Ignite
bands.description: Ignite is an American melodic hardcore band from Orange County, California, formed in 1993. They are known for their energetic performances and socially conscious lyrics. Their 2000 album, "A Place Called Home," marked their commercial breakthrough, featuring themes of environmentalism and social justice. In 2016, they released "A War Against You," which charted in multiple countries, including Germany and Hungary. In 2022, they released their self-titled album, "Ignite," introducing new vocalist Eli Santana. The band's music blends melodic hardcore with punk rock influences, characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and introspective lyrics. They have toured extensively, visiting over 40 countries, and have supported organizations like Earth First and Doctors Without Borders. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignite_%28band%29))

bands.name: Naxen
bands.description: Naxen is a German black metal band formed in 2018 in Münster, North Rhine-Westphalia. The band was founded by LN, who serves as the primary songwriter, guitarist, and vocalist. The current lineup includes FH on drums and SP on bass. Naxen's music is characterized by a blend of traditional Scandinavian black metal, Eastern European melodies, and atmospheric elements reminiscent of U.S. black metal, creating a sound that is both dark and immersive. Their lyrical themes often explore darkness and despair, reflecting the band's commitment to the black metal genre's raw and misanthropic roots. The band's discography includes their debut album "Towards the Tomb of Times" (2020), the EP "The Perilous Path of Pain" (2021), and their sophomore full-length album "Descending Into A Deeper Darkness" (2024). The latter album, released on May 3, 2024, through Vendetta Records, showcases Naxen's evolution as songwriters and solidifies their position in the underground black metal scene. The album was produced and mixed by Fabian Schulz at Sunsetter Studio and mastered by Brad Boatright at Audiosiege. The tracklist includes: 1. Our Souls Shall Fall Forever 2. To Writhe In The Womb Of Night 3. A Shadow In The Fire – Pt. III (A Life Led By Loss) 4. Triumphant Tongue Of A Thousand Swords

bands.name: Lordi
bands.description: Lordi is a Finnish rock band formed in 1992 by lead vocalist and costume designer Mr. Lordi (Tomi Petteri Putaansuu). Known for their elaborate monster costumes and theatrical performances, the band blends hard rock and heavy metal with horror-themed elements. They gained international fame in 2006 by winning the Eurovision Song Contest with their song "Hard Rock Hallelujah," marking Finland's first victory in the competition. Over the years, Lordi has released multiple studio albums, including "Get Heavy" (2002), "The Arockalypse" (2006), and "Limited Deadition" (2025). Their music is characterized by catchy melodies, heavy guitar riffs, and theatrical performances that incorporate pyrotechnics and horror motifs. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with Mr. Lordi remaining the constant member. Other members have included Mana (drums), Kone (guitar), Hiisi (bass), and Hella (keyboards).

bands.name: Psycho Mosher
bands.description: Psycho Mosher is a Colombian crossover thrash metal band formed in Bogotá in 2010. Known for their high-energy performances, they blend elements of thrash metal, punk, and hardcore, creating a raw and powerful sound that resonates with fans worldwide. Their music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, ferocious drumming, and strong vocals, delivering a sensory assault that energizes listeners. The band's lyrics often explore themes of anti-radicalism, anti-tyranny, and partying, reflecting their rebellious spirit and commitment to challenging societal norms. In July 2025, they released their debut album, "Trapped into the Madness Vortex," under Selvajaria Records. The album features tracks like "At the Edge of the Abyss of Insanity," "Madness Vortex," and "I.F.H.B.M.", showcasing their dynamic range from fast-paced songs to grooving mid-tempo tracks. The lineup includes Maria Alejandra Becerra on vocals, Daniel Samia and Gilber Steven Frade Martin on guitars, Luis on bass, and Diego Andres Trujillo Guio on drums. Psycho Mosher continues to captivate audiences with their electrifying shows and rebellious energy, making a significant mark on the metal scene.

bands.name: Pendulum
bands.description: Pendulum is an Australian electronic rock band formed in 2002 in Perth, Western Australia. The group was initially composed of Rob Swire, Gareth McGrillen, and Paul "El Hornet" Harding, who had backgrounds in rock and metal music. They began by producing drum and bass tracks, gaining recognition with their debut single "Vault" in 2003. Their first album, "Hold Your Colour," released in 2005, achieved platinum status in the UK and showcased their unique blend of electronic music with hard rock elements. In 2008, they released "In Silico," which incorporated more rock influences and debuted at number two on the UK Albums Chart. The band continued to evolve, releasing "Immersion" in 2010, which featured collaborations with artists like In Flames and reached number one in the UK. After a hiatus, Pendulum returned in 2021 with the EP "Elemental," followed by "Anima" in 2023, featuring collaborations with Matt Tuck of Bullet For My Valentine and trap metal artist Scarlxrd. Their dynamic performances have included headlining major festivals such as Glastonbury and Download, solidifying their status as one of the most influential electronic bands of their time.

members.name: Rob Swire
members.role: Lead Vocals, Synthesizers, Guitar, Keyboards, Bass Guitar, Production, Dj

members.name: Gareth McGrillen
members.role: Bass Guitar, Backing Vocals, Production, Dj

bands.name: Pig Destroyer
bands.description: Formed in 1997 in Alexandria, Virginia, Pig Destroyer is a prominent grindcore band known for their aggressive sound and evocative lyrics. The lineup consists of vocalist J.R. Hayes, guitarist Scott Hull, drummer Adam Jarvis, bassist Travis Stone, and sampler Alex Cha. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Prowler in the Yard" (2001), "Terrifyer" (2004), and "Head Cage" (2018). In 2024, they released a remastered version of "Terrifyer" to commemorate its 20th anniversary. ([pigdestroyer.bandcamp.com](https://pigdestroyer.bandcamp.com/album/terrifyer-20th-anniversary-remaster)) Their music is characterized by rapid tempos, complex song structures, and themes exploring human frailty and despair. ([pig-destroyer.com](https://www.pig-destroyer.com/about))

bands.name: Master Boot Record
bands.description: Master Boot Record (MBR) is an Italian electronic metal project founded in 2016 by producer Victor Love (Vittorio D'Amore). The project uniquely blends heavy metal with synthesized electronic music, creating a distinctive sound that has garnered a dedicated following. MBR's discography includes 14 albums, with notable releases such as "Floppy Disk Overdrive" (2020) and "Personal Computer" (2022), both released under Metal Blade Records. In 2024, MBR released "Hardwarez," further solidifying their position in the electronic metal scene. The project has also contributed to the cyberpunk point-and-click adventure game "VirtuaVerse," providing both the soundtrack and narrative elements. Live performances have featured guitarist Edoardo Taddei and drummer Giulio Galati, with the band scheduled to perform at major European festivals like Brutal Assault in 2024. MBR's innovative fusion of metal and electronic music continues to push the boundaries of the genre.

bands.name: Kittie
bands.description:
Kittie is a Canadian heavy metal band formed in London, Ontario, in 1996. The original lineup consisted of guitarist Fallon Bowman, drummer Mercedes Lander, vocalist and guitarist Morgan Lander, and bassist Tanya Candler. They gained prominence with their 1999 debut album, "Spit," which blended nu metal with elements of thrash and death metal. The album's aggressive sound and themes of personal struggle resonated with a wide audience, leading to commercial success and a gold certification by the RIAA. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spit_%28album%29))

In 2001, Kittie released "Oracle," a more aggressive album that leaned into death metal and thrash influences. The band continued to evolve with subsequent releases, including "Until the End" (2004), "Funeral for Yesterday" (2007), and "In the Black" (2009), each showcasing their growth and experimentation within the metal genre. After a hiatus, Kittie reunited in 2022, performing at major festivals and releasing their seventh studio album, "Fire," on June 21, 2024. The album features the single "We Are Shadows," which peaked at number 20 on the Billboard Mainstream Rock Airplay chart. ([thebandindex.com](https://thebandindex.com/band/kittie))

Kittie's music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and a mix of clean and screamed vocals. Their lyrics often explore themes of personal empowerment, resilience, and social issues. Over the years, the band's lineup has seen changes, but the core of Morgan and Mercedes Lander has remained constant. Their influence is notable in the metal community, particularly among female-fronted bands. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kittie))

bands.name: Allt
bands.description: Allt is a progressive metalcore band from Karlskoga, Sweden, formed in September 2020. The band's name, meaning "everything" in Swedish, reflects their philosophy towards music, aiming to embody diverse and expansive influences. Shortly after forming, in October 2020, Allt released their debut EP titled "Dark Waters." This initial release marked the beginning of their presence in the progressive metalcore scene, blending elements of metalcore, djent, and thall music styles. In April 2022, Allt released their second EP, "The Seed of Self-Destruction," further expanding their repertoire and showcasing their evolving sound in progressive metalcore. The band gained traction within the metal community and later in 2022 secured a significant career milestone by signing with Century Media Records, a prominent record label known for working with influential metal artists. This partnership provided Allt with increased exposure and resources to broaden their musical reach and prepare for their debut full-length album. In 2024, Allt released several key singles including "Remnant" in June, followed by "Aquila" in July, which marked a breakthrough for the band. They announced their debut studio album "From The New World," released on October 4, 2024. The album features a dystopian theme inspired by films like "Terminator 2," emphasizing futuristic and post-apocalyptic narratives. The release was met with positive reviews, marking a significant milestone in their career. Alongside the album release, Allt announced their participation in Imminence's The Black European tour with Aviana in October 2024 and planned a European tour in March 2025. Their increasing touring schedule and critical acclaim have expanded their international presence and fan base.

bands.name: Decapitated
bands.description: Decapitated is a Polish death metal band formed in 1996 in Krosno. The group is composed of guitarist and founder Wacław "Vogg" Kiełtyka, vocalist Eemeli Bodde, bassist Paweł Pasek, and drummer James Stewart. Decapitated is recognized as one of death metal's most respected bands and is known for their technical and groove-oriented style. They have released seven studio albums, including "Winds of Creation" (2000), "Nihility" (2002), "The Negation" (2004), "Organic Hallucinosis" (2006), "Carnival Is Forever" (2011), "Blood Mantra" (2014), and "Anticult" (2017). In 2022, they released "The First Damned," a compilation of early demos. In 2024, vocalist Rasta departed the band and was replaced by Eemeli Bodde. As of October 2025, Decapitated is working on new material for their ninth studio album, with a tentative release date in 2026. ([decapitatedband.net](https://www.decapitatedband.net/band))

bands.name: Queensrÿche
bands.description: Queensrÿche is an American progressive metal band formed in 1980 in Bellevue, Washington. Initially known as Cross+Fire and later The Mob, they adopted the name Queensrÿche in 1982. The original lineup featured guitarists Michael Wilton and Chris DeGarmo, bassist Eddie Jackson, drummer Scott Rockenfield, and lead vocalist Geoff Tate. The band is renowned for its intricate compositions and thematic depth, blending heavy metal with progressive elements. Their 1983 self-titled EP garnered significant attention, leading to a contract with EMI Records. Their 1988 concept album "Operation: Mindcrime" is widely regarded as one of the greatest in metal history, offering a narrative of corruption and revolution. The 1990 album "Empire" marked their commercial peak, featuring the hit "Silent Lucidity." Over the years, lineup changes occurred, with DeGarmo departing in 1998 and Tate leaving in 2012. Todd La Torre joined as lead vocalist in 2012, and Casey Grillo became the drummer in 2017. Queensrÿche continues to tour and record, with their latest album, "Digital Noise Alliance," released in 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queensr%C3%BFche))

bands.name: Shining
bands.description: Shining is a Swedish black metal band formed in 1996 by Niklas Kvarforth in Halmstad. Initially a solo project, Kvarforth began as the band's vocalist in 2000, after releasing their first EP, "Submit to Selfdestruction," in 1998. The band's name signifies "the path to enlightenment," according to Kvarforth, and is not related to Stephen King's novel or its film adaptation. Shining's music is characterized by dark, aggressive, and depressive elements, incorporating progressive aspects with clean guitars, pentatonic scales, guitar solos, and varied vocal styles. Their lyrics often explore themes of suicide, depression, evil, misanthropy, negativity, life, death, isolation, and hate. Over the years, Shining has released eleven studio albums, including "Within Deep Dark Chambers" (2000), "Livets ändhållplats" (2001), "III – Angst, självdestruktivitetens emissarie" (2002), "IV - The Eerie Cold" (2005), "V - Halmstad" (2007), "VI - Klagopsalmer" (2009), "VII - Född förlorare" (2011), "Redefining Darkness" (2012), "IX – Everyone, Everything, Everywhere, Ends" (2015), "X – Varg Utan Flock" (2018), and their self-titled album "Shining" (2023). The band's lineup has evolved over time, with current members including Niklas Kvarforth (vocals), Peter Huss (guitar), Charles Hedger (guitar), Alex Friberg (bass), and Tuomas Tahvanainen (noise and discomfort). Shining's music is available on their official website and streaming platforms like Spotify.

bands.name: Einherjer
bands.description: Einherjer is a Norwegian Viking metal band formed in 1993 in Haugesund. The band's name is derived from Norse mythology, referring to the warriors who join Odin's hall after death. Their music blends elements of black metal with folk influences, creating a distinctive sound that retells Norse legends through their lyrics. After releasing their fourth album, "Blot," in 2003, the band disbanded but reunited in 2008, releasing "Norrøn" in 2011. Their latest album, "North Star," was released on February 26, 2021, marking their return to Napalm Records after 25 years. ([metaladdicts.com](https://metaladdicts.com/einherjer-release-new-single-and-video-west-coast-groove/))

bands.name: Devourment
bands.description:
Devourment is an American death metal band from Dallas, Texas, formed in 1995. Known for their aggressive and brutal style, they are considered pioneers of the slam death metal subgenre. The band has experienced multiple lineup changes and periods of inactivity but has maintained a dedicated following throughout their career.

**History:**

Devourment was established in 1995 by drummer Brad Fincher and guitarist Braxton Henry, both former members of Necrocide. They were joined by vocalist Wayne Knupp, and together they released their first demo, "Impaled," in 1997. Their debut full-length album, "Molesting the Decapitated," was released in 1999, featuring tracks like "Festering Vomitous Mass" and "Choking on Bile." The album's cover art, "Man Without Head" by Joel-Peter Witkin, is a notable aspect of their discography. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Devourment/Molesting_the_Decapitated/3019))

In 2000, the band released a compilation album titled "1.3.8.", which included the new track "Babykiller," along with songs from their previous releases. Following vocalist Wayne Knupp's death in 2007, Devourment reformed with new members and released "Butcher the Weak" in 2005, "Unleash the Carnivore" in 2009, and "Conceived in Sewage" in 2013. Their most recent album, "Obscene Majesty," was released in 2019. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1.3.8.))

**Style:**

Devourment's music is characterized by heavy, downtuned guitars, rapid drumming, and guttural vocals. Their lyrics often explore themes of gore, death, and societal issues, contributing to their reputation for unrelenting brutality.

**Discography:**

- "Impaled" (1997) – Demo
- "Molesting the Decapitated" (1999)
- "1.3.8." (2000) – Compilation
- "Butcher the Weak" (2005)
- "Unleash the Carnivore" (2009)
- "Conceived in Sewage" (2013)
- "Obscene Majesty" (2019)

**Genres:**

Slam Death Metal, Brutal Death Metal

**Members:**

- Ruben Rosas – vocals (1998–1999, 2002, 2014–present), guitars (2005–2014)
- Brad Fincher – drums (1995–1999, 2001, 2014–present)
- Dave Spencer – bass (2014–present)
- Marvin Ruiz – guitars (2023–present)

**Official Website:** ([devourmentofficial.com](https://www.devourmentofficial.com/epk))

**Spotify:** ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Devourment))

**Metal Archives:** ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Devourment/818))

bands.name: A Perfect Circle
bands.description: A Perfect Circle is an American rock supergroup formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1999 by guitarist Billy Howerdel and Tool vocalist Maynard James Keenan. The band's debut album, *Mer de Noms*, released in 2000, showcased a fusion of alternative metal and art rock, entering the Billboard 200 at No. 4 and achieving platinum status. The lineup for this album included Paz Lenchantin on bass, Troy Van Leeuwen on guitar, and Tim Alexander on drums. Their second album, *Thirteenth Step* (2003), continued this trend, featuring the hit single "Weak and Powerless." After a hiatus in 2004, the band reunited in 2010, releasing *Eat the Elephant* in 2018, which incorporated more progressive rock elements. In 2024, they released "Kindred," their first new song in six years, as part of a three-way split EP titled *Sessanta E.P.P.P.* ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Perfect_Circle))

bands.name: Slope
bands.description: Slope is a German metal band formed in Duisburg in 2014. The quintet blends elements of hardcore, funk, and hip-hop, drawing inspiration from bands like Beastie Boys, Rage Against the Machine, and early Red Hot Chili Peppers. Their music is characterized by infectious grooves, sharp riffs, and thought-provoking lyrics that address personal struggles and societal issues. In February 2024, they released their second studio album, "Freak Dreams," via Century Media Records, featuring tracks such as "Talk Big," "It's Tickin'," and "Chasing Highs." The album showcases their unique style, combining hardcore/punk attitudes with deep influences in funk and hip-hop. The current lineup includes Simon Blümel (vocals), Fabio Krautner (vocals), Philipp Jeske (guitar), Florian Fehrmann (bass), and Patrick Schulten (drums).

bands.name: Elder
bands.description: Elder is an American progressive rock band formed in Massachusetts in 2006. The group consists of frontman and lead guitarist Nick DiSalvo, bassist Jack Donovan, guitarist/keyboardist Michael Risberg, and drummer Georg Edert. Initially, Elder's music was rooted in stoner and doom metal, drawing influences from bands like Kyuss and Sleep. Their 2008 self-titled debut album showcased this heavy, riff-driven style. However, with their 2011 release, "Dead Roots Stirring," the band began incorporating elements of psychedelic and progressive rock, marking a significant evolution in their sound. This trend continued with subsequent albums: "Lore" (2015), which delved deeper into progressive rock territories; "Reflections of a Floating World" (2017), recognized by Rolling Stone as the fifth-best metal album of that year; and "Omens" (2020), which further refined their progressive approach. In 2021, Elder collaborated with the German band Kadavar to release "Eldovar – A Story of Darkness & Light," blending their styles into a cohesive psychedelic experience. Their latest album, "Innate Passage," released in 2022, continues to explore and expand their progressive rock influences. The band's dynamic compositions often feature extended instrumental passages and intricate melodies, appealing to fans of both metal and psychedelic rock. Elder's music is characterized by its heavy riffs, intricate melodies, and dynamic rhythms, creating immersive and expansive soundscapes.

bands.name: Mayfire
bands.description: Mayfire is a Norwegian progressive metal band formed in 2019, known for their innovative fusion of metal, progressive rock, and electronic music. Their music is characterized by complex rhythms, intricate melodies, and thought-provoking lyrics. In November 2023, they released their debut album, "Cloudscapes & Silhouettes," which blends influences from Dream Theater, Leprous, In Flames, and Ghost. The album features tracks like "Shadows," which includes a guest appearance by Baard Kolstad of Leprous. ([progrockjournal.com](https://progrockjournal.com/news-mayfire-published-the-official-video-for-the-track-the-age-of-kings-taken-from-their-new-album/)) The band is signed to Rock of Angels Records and has been recognized for their unique approach to modern progressive metal. ([theprogspace.com](https://theprogspace.com/ppe25-mayfire/))

bands.name: Final Dose
bands.description: Final Dose is a London-based band that emerged in 2020, initially conceived as a one-man project by vocalist Bruno F. during the UK lockdown. The project quickly evolved into a full-fledged band, releasing their debut EP, "Dark Places," in 2021. Their music is characterized by a ferocious blend of black metal's icy malevolence and the raw, uncompromising power of punk, creating a sound that is both aggressive and cathartic. In 2023, they released their first full-length album, "Void Inside," which received critical acclaim for its raw and blackened hardcore style. The album delves into themes of mental health and societal decay, reflecting the band's commitment to addressing pressing social issues through their music. In April 2025, Final Dose released their second full-length album, "Under the Eternal Shadow," via Wolves of Hades. This album continues their exploration of dark themes, incorporating elements of Dungeon Synth and Folk to enhance the bleakness and despair conveyed in their music. The band's lineup has remained consistent, with Bruno F. on vocals, Jack Thompson on bass, and a rotating cast of guitarists and drummers contributing to their evolving sound. Final Dose has also been active on the live circuit, performing across the UK and Europe, and they are scheduled to perform at La Marbrerie in Montreuil, France, on October 31, 2025. ([finaldose.bandcamp.com](https://finaldose.bandcamp.com/))

bands.name: The Ghost Inside
bands.description: The Ghost Inside is an American metalcore band from El Segundo, California, formed in 2004. Originally known as A Dying Dream, they changed their name to The Ghost Inside in 2006. The band is renowned for their intense and energetic performances, blending deeply personal vocals with urgent riffing and powerful breakdowns within a heavily melodic modern hardcore framework.
