Their discography includes five studio albums: "Fury and the Fallen Ones" (2008), "Returners" (2010), "Get What You Give" (2012), "Dear Youth" (2014), and "The Ghost Inside" (2020). After a hiatus due to a serious tour bus accident in 2015, the band returned with their self-titled album in 2020, marking their first release since the incident. In 2024, they released their sixth album, "Searching for Solace," produced by Dan Braunstein, Cody Quistad, Carson Slovak, and Grant McFarland. The current lineup consists of vocalist Jonathan Vigil, lead guitarist Zach Johnson, rhythm guitarist Chris Davis, bassist Jim Riley, and drummer Andrew Tkaczyk.

bands.name: House Of Protection
bands.description: House of Protection is an American electronic rock duo from Los Angeles, formed in April 2024 by Stephen Harrison and Aric Improta, both former members of Fever 333. The duo's music blends elements of post-hardcore, electronic rock, electronicore, and hardcore punk, creating a unique and dynamic sound. Their debut single, "It's Supposed to Hurt," was released on April 30, 2024, followed by their first EP, GALORE, on September 13, 2024, both under Red Bull Records. The EP received critical acclaim, with tracks like "Pulling Teeth" showcasing their energetic style. In 2025, they released their second EP, Outrun You All, on May 23, featuring singles such as "Fire" and "I Need More Than This." The band has been recognized for their innovative approach, earning a spot on Spotify's "Artists to Watch 2025" list. They have also toured with Bad Omens and Poppy in Australia and are set to support Architects on their 2025 European tour. ([metalontap.com](https://metalontap.com/house-of-protection-share-new-single-fire-off-forthcoming-ep-outrun-you-all/))

bands.name: 200 Stab Wounds
bands.description:
200 Stab Wounds is a death metal band from Cleveland, Ohio, formed in 2019. The band consists of Steve Buhl (vocals, lead guitar), Raymond MacDonald (rhythm guitar), Todd Thompson (bass), and Owen Pooley (drums). They are signed to Metal Blade Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/200_Stab_Wounds))

Their debut EP, "Piles of Festering Decomposition," was released in 2020, showcasing their brutal and groove-laden style. In 2021, they released their first full-length album, "Slave to the Scalpel," through Maggot Stomp. In 2024, they released their second album, "Manual Manic Procedures," after signing with Metal Blade Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/200_Stab_Wounds))

Their music features classic gore-metal horror themes with a contemporary edge. ([ampwrecked.com](https://ampwrecked.com/bands/200-stab-wounds))

The band has been active in the live scene, supporting acts like Gwar and The Black Dahlia Murder, and performing at festivals such as the New England Metal and Hardcore Fest. ([earsplitcompound.com](https://www.earsplitcompound.com/200-stab-wounds-live-takeover-underway/))

For more information, visit their official website at https://www.200stabwounds.net/.

bands.name: Savatage
bands.description:
Savatage is an American heavy metal band formed in 1979 in Tarpon Springs, Florida, by brothers Jon and Criss Oliva. Initially known as Avatar, they changed their name to Savatage before releasing their debut album, "Sirens," in 1983. The band's early sound was rooted in classic heavy metal, drawing influences from bands like Judas Priest and Iron Maiden.

In 1987, producer Paul O'Neill joined, introducing symphonic elements that marked a shift towards progressive metal. This collaboration resulted in the critically acclaimed "Hall of the Mountain King." The 1990 album "Gutter Ballet" further solidified their progressive metal direction, featuring the title track and "When the Crowds Are Gone."

Tragedy struck in 1993 when guitarist Criss Oliva was killed in a car accident. Despite this loss, the band continued, releasing "Handful of Rain" in 1994, which included a tribute to Criss titled "Alone You Breathe." Over the years, Savatage has been known for their conceptual albums, such as "Dead Winter Dead" (1995), which tells a story set during the Bosnian War.

After a hiatus, Savatage reunited in 2014 for a performance at Wacken Open Air. In April 2023, Jon Oliva confirmed plans to record a new studio album, tentatively titled "Curtain Call," with an intended release date of 2026.

bands.name: Bad Omens
bands.description: Bad Omens is an American heavy metal band from Richmond, Virginia, formed in 2015 by vocalist and producer Noah Sebastian, guitarist Nicholas Ruffilo, and bassist Vincent Riquier. The lineup expanded with the addition of guitarist and producer Joakim "Jolly" Karlsson and drummer Nick Folio. Their self-titled debut album was released in 2016 under Sumerian Records, showcasing a blend of metalcore, alternative metal, and industrial influences. The band's second album, "Finding God Before God Finds Me," released in 2019, continued their exploration of heavy and melodic elements. In 2022, they released "The Death of Peace of Mind," featuring the platinum-certified single "Just Pretend," marking a significant milestone in their career. The band's music is characterized by cinematic production, serrated riffs, and emotive vocals that blur the line between aggression and atmosphere. They have toured extensively, including appearances at major festivals like Louder Than Life and Aftershock in 2025, and have supported acts such as Parkway Drive and Underoath. Bad Omens continues to evolve, blending metalcore, alternative metal, and industrial influences to create a distinctive sound that resonates with a wide audience.

bands.name: Sepultura
bands.description: Formed in 1984 in Belo Horizonte, Brazil, Sepultura is a pioneering heavy metal band that has significantly influenced the genre over four decades. Initially founded by brothers Max and Igor Cavalera, the band's lineup has evolved, with current members including bassist Paulo Jr., guitarist Andreas Kisser, vocalist Derrick Green, and drummer Greyson Nekrutman. Sepultura's music seamlessly blends thrash metal, groove metal, and alternative metal, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with fans worldwide. Their discography boasts several acclaimed albums, such as "Beneath the Remains" (1989), which marked their international breakthrough, "Arise" (1991), and "Roots" (1996), the latter incorporating Brazilian tribal rhythms. In 2020, they released "Quadra," further solidifying their legacy. In December 2023, Sepultura announced a farewell tour to celebrate their 40th anniversary, culminating in 2026, after which they plan to disband.

bands.name: Heavysaurus
bands.description: Heavysaurus is a German heavy metal band formed in 2017, inspired by the Finnish band Hevisaurus. The band combines heavy metal music with dinosaur-themed performances, creating a unique experience for children and families. Members perform in elaborate dinosaur costumes, delivering energetic shows with child-friendly lyrics and powerful riffs. Their discography includes albums like "Rock 'n' Rarrr Music" (2018), "Retter der Welt" (2020), "Pommesgabel" (2024), and "Pommesgabel Reload" (2025).

bands.name: Internal Bleeding
bands.description: Internal Bleeding is an American death metal band formed in Long Island, New York, in 1991. They are pioneers of the slam death metal subgenre, characterized by heavy grooves and rhythmic, palm-muted guitar riffs. Their music often incorporates elements of hardcore punk and hip hop, with lyrics addressing dark, socio-political issues. The band released their debut album, "Voracious Contempt," in 1995, followed by "The Extinction of Benevolence" in 1997. After a hiatus, they reunited in 2011, releasing "Imperium" in 2014 and "Corrupting Influence" in 2018. Their latest album, "Settle All Scores," was released on October 17, 2025, showcasing their continued evolution in the death metal scene. ([internal-bleeding.com](https://internal-bleeding.com/biography-internal-bleeding/))

bands.name: Primal Fear
bands.description: Primal Fear is a German power metal band formed in 1997 by vocalist Ralf Scheepers and bassist Mat Sinner. The duo established the band after Scheepers was not selected to replace Rob Halford in Judas Priest. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1998, entered the German LP charts at number 48, marking a strong start in the German metal scene. Over the years, Primal Fear has released several albums, including "Jaws of Death" (1999), "Nuclear Fire" (2001), "Black Sun" (2002), "Devil's Ground" (2004), "Seven Seals" (2005), "New Religion" (2007), "Unbreakable" (2012), "Delivering the Black" (2014), "Rulebreaker" (2016), "Apocalypse" (2018), "Metal Commando" (2020), and "Code Red" (2023). Their music is characterized by a blend of power metal, heavy metal, and elements of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, speed metal, and 1970s European hard rock. In August 2024, the band underwent significant lineup changes, with guitarists Alex Beyrodt and Tom Naumann, drummer Michael Ehré, and bassist Alex Jansen departing. Subsequently, guitarist Thalìa Bellazecca and drummer André Hilgers joined the band. Despite these changes, Primal Fear continues to be active, with plans to release their fifteenth studio album, "Domination," in September 2025. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/primal-fears-mat-sinner-explains-last-years-lineup-changes-says-everybodys-super-happy-at-the-moment))

bands.name: Volbeat
bands.description:
Volbeat is a Danish rock band formed in Copenhagen in 2001, known for their unique fusion of heavy metal, hard rock, and rockabilly influences. The band was established by vocalist and guitarist Michael Poulsen, who previously led the death metal band Dominus. Seeking a new musical direction, Poulsen formed Volbeat, combining elements of rock and roll, country, and metal to create a distinctive sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volbeat))

Their debut album, "The Strength/The Sound/The Songs," released in 2005, achieved significant success in Denmark, reaching No. 18 on the charts. The band's second album, "Rock the Rebel/Metal the Devil," released in 2007, debuted at No. 1 on the Danish Albums chart, marking their first chart-topping release. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_the_Rebel/Metal_the_Devil)) In 2010, "Beyond Hell/Above Heaven" was released, featuring the hit single "A Warrior's Call," which was written as an entrance song for Danish boxer Mikkel Kessler. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Warrior%E2%80%99s_Call))

In 2025, Volbeat released their ninth studio album, "God of Angels Trust," on June 6. The album was preceded by the single "By a Monster’s Hand," showcasing the band's continued evolution and energy. ([reflectionsofdarkness.com](https://www.reflectionsofdarkness.com/releases/23716-volbeat-new-album-and-world-tour))

The current lineup consists of Michael Poulsen (vocals, guitar), Jon Larsen (drums), and Kaspar Boye Larsen (bass). Notably, guitarist Rob Caggiano departed the band in June 2023, with Flemming C. Lund of The Arcane Order filling in for the Summer 2023 tour. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/volbeat-to-announce-details-of-new-album-single-and-tour-this-thursday))

Volbeat's music is characterized by tight, hooky, and thunderous sound, blending galloping riffs with melodic contrasts. Their energetic live performances have solidified their reputation as one of the most dynamic rock bands in Europe. ([volbeat.org](https://www.volbeat.org/tour))

([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volbeat))

bands.name: Sabaton
bands.description:
Sabaton is a Swedish heavy metal band formed in 1999 in Falun, Sweden. Known for their militaristic aesthetic and lyrics centered on historical warfare, they have become a prominent act in the metal scene. The band's name, "Sabaton," refers to a piece of medieval foot armor, aligning with their thematic focus on battles and heroism. ([sabaton.net](https://www.sabaton.net/band/))

Their musical style is characterized by powerful riffs, orchestral elements, and a distinctive vocal delivery. While often categorized as power metal, Sabaton prefers to define their sound as a unique form of heavy metal, emphasizing their focus on historical themes rather than traditional power metal motifs. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabaton_%28band%29))

Over the years, Sabaton has released eleven studio albums, including "Primo Victoria" (2005), "The Art of War" (2008), "Carolus Rex" (2012), "The Great War" (2019), and "The War to End All Wars" (2022). Their 2012 album "Carolus Rex" achieved significant success, being certified gold in Poland and platinum in Sweden, marking it as one of the most successful Swedish heavy metal albums. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sabaton_discography))

The band's lyrics often delve into historical events, particularly wars and significant battles, providing listeners with both entertainment and education. Their energetic live performances, featuring elaborate stage setups like a full-sized tank drum riser, have earned them a dedicated global fanbase. ([sabaton.net](https://www.sabaton.net/band/))

As of October 2025, Sabaton's lineup includes Joakim Brodén (vocals & keyboards), Pär Sundström (bass), Chris Rörland (lead guitar), Hannes Van Dahl (drums), and Thobbe Englund (lead guitar). ([sabaton.net](https://www.sabaton.net/band/))

bands.name: Insanity Alert
bands.description: Insanity Alert is an Austrian crossover thrash band formed in Innsbruck in 2011. The group is known for its energetic performances and humorous lyrics, often centered around themes like partying, skateboarding, and horror. Their music is characterized by fast-paced riffs and a blend of thrash metal and hardcore punk influences. The band released their self-titled debut album in 2014, followed by 'Moshburger' in 2016, '666-Pack' in 2019, and 'Moshemian Thrashody' in 2024. ([season-of-mist.com](https://www.season-of-mist.com/release/insanity-alert/)) They have toured extensively across Europe and Japan, playing over 350 shows and festivals. ([concerts.hypebot.com](https://concerts.hypebot.com/artist/i/1813826-insanity-alert))

bands.name: Stick To Your Guns
bands.description:
Stick To Your Guns is an American hardcore punk band from Orange County, California, formed in 2003. The band is known for its energetic performances and socially conscious lyrics, addressing themes such as social justice, personal integrity, and resilience. Their music blends elements of hardcore punk, metalcore, and melodic hardcore, creating a distinctive sound that resonates with a diverse audience.

Their discography includes several notable releases:

- **For What It's Worth** (2005): The debut studio album, featuring tracks like "For What It's Worth" and "Colorblind," which showcase the band's early style and thematic focus. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/For_What_It%27s_Worth_%28album%29))

- **Comes from the Heart** (2008): This album continued their exploration of personal and social themes, with songs such as "This Is Where My Heart Lies" and "Such an Outrage." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comes_from_the_Heart))

- **Diamond** (2012): The band's fourth album, which debuted at number one on Billboard's Heatseekers Chart, featuring tracks like "We Still Believe." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stick_to_Your_Guns_%28band%29))

- **True View** (2017): Released under Pure Noise Records, this album includes songs like "The Sun, The Moon, The Truth: Penance of Self" and "Married to the Noise." ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/True_View))

The current lineup consists of:

- Jesse Barnett (vocals)

- Andrew Rose (bass)

- Chris Rawson (guitar)

- Josh James (guitar)

- Adam Galindo (drums)

For more information, visit their official website: ([sticktoyourguns.bandcamp.com](https://sticktoyourguns.bandcamp.com/))

bands.name: Ensiferum
bands.description: Ensiferum is a Finnish folk metal band formed in Helsinki in 1995. The name "Ensiferum" is derived from the Latin word meaning "sword bearing." The band is known for blending elements of folk music with metal, creating a distinctive sound that has captivated audiences worldwide. Their music often features themes of legends, fantasy, battles, and heathenism. Over the years, Ensiferum has released nine studio albums, including their self-titled debut in 2001, "Iron" in 2004, "Victory Songs" in 2007, "From Afar" in 2009, "Unsung Heroes" in 2012, "One Man Army" in 2015, "Two Paths" in 2017, "Thalassic" in 2020, and "Winter Storm" in 2024. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with current members including Markus Toivonen (guitars, percussion, vocals), Petri Lindroos (vocals, guitars), Sami Hinkka (bass, vocals), Janne Parviainen (drums), and Pekka Montin (keyboards). Ensiferum's music is characterized by a fusion of melodic death metal, power metal, and folk influences, often incorporating traditional instruments and epic storytelling into their compositions.

bands.name: Agnostic Front
bands.description: Agnostic Front is a pioneering American hardcore punk band from New York City, formed in 1980. They are considered one of the most influential bands in the New York hardcore scene and are credited with pioneering the crossover thrash genre. The original lineup included guitarist Vinnie Stigma, bassist Diego Casalins, drummer Rob Krekus, and vocalist John Watson. After Watson's arrest, Roger Miret joined as the vocalist in 1983. Their debut EP, "United Blood," was released in 1983, followed by their seminal album "Victim in Pain" in 1984, which solidified their status in the hardcore scene. The band's style evolved over the years, incorporating elements of crossover thrash, Oi!, and street punk. They have released numerous albums, including "Cause for Alarm" (1986), "Liberty and Justice For..." (1987), "Something's Gotta Give" (1998), "Another Voice" (2004), "Warriors" (2007), "The American Dream Died" (2015), and "Echoes in Eternity" (2025). The current lineup consists of Roger Miret (vocals), Vinnie Stigma (guitar), Craig Silverman (guitar), Mike Gallo (bass), and Danny Lamagna (drums).

bands.name: Man With A Mission
bands.description: Man with a Mission (MWAM) is a Japanese rock band formed in Shibuya, Tokyo, in 2010. The band comprises five members: Tokyo Tanaka (vocals, leader), Jean-Ken Johnny (guitar, vocals, rapping), Kamikaze Boy (bass guitar, backing vocals), DJ Santa Monica (DJ, sampling), and Spear Rib (drums). They are renowned for wearing uniquely designed wolf masks during performances and in music videos, a distinctive feature that sets them apart in the music scene. The band's origin story is a creative narrative where they are portrayed as "Ultimate Life Forms" created by Dr. Jimi Hendrix, a fictional character combining the legendary guitarist and a master wolf biologist. According to this tale, they were frozen in Antarctica for decades before emerging to share their music with the world. MWAM's musical style blends elements of hard rock, nu metal, rap rock, and alternative metal, drawing comparisons to early Linkin Park and Zebrahead. Their energetic performances and unique sound have garnered them a dedicated fanbase both in Japan and internationally. They have released several studio albums, including "Man with a Mission" (2011), "Mash Up the World" (2012), "Tales of Purefly" (2014), "The World's On Fire" (2016), "Chasing the Horizon" (2018), "Break and Cross the Walls I" (2021), and "Break and Cross the Walls II" (2022). Notably, their single "Kizuna no Kiseki," a collaboration with singer Milet, served as the opening theme for the third season of the anime "Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba" in 2023. This track achieved significant commercial success, peaking at number 2 on the Billboard Japan Hot 100 and number 4 on the Oricon Singles Chart. MWAM continues to captivate audiences with their dynamic music and compelling live shows, solidifying their status as a prominent act in the Japanese rock scene.

bands.name: Emperor
bands.description: Emperor is a seminal Norwegian black metal band formed in 1991 in Notodden, Norway. The band was founded by guitarist and vocalist Ihsahn and guitarist Samoth, who were later joined by drummer Trym Torson. Emperor is renowned for pioneering symphonic black metal, blending traditional black metal elements with orchestral arrangements to create a unique and atmospheric sound. Their debut album, "In the Nightside Eclipse" (1994), is widely regarded as a landmark in the black metal genre, featuring tracks like "I Am the Black Wizards" and "Inno a Satana." The band's subsequent albums include "Anthems to the Welkin at Dusk" (1997), "IX Equilibrium" (1999), and "Prometheus: The Discipline of Fire & Demise" (2001). After disbanding in 2001, Emperor reunited for select performances in 2005–2007 and again in 2013–2014. In 2016, they reformed for a third time and have since performed at various festivals and tours, including a notable appearance at Wacken Open Air in 2025. Emperor's influence on the black metal scene is profound, inspiring countless bands and shaping the genre's evolution.

bands.name: Wyatt E.
bands.description:
Wyatt E. is a Belgian drone/doom metal band formed in 2015 in Liège. The band was founded by Sébastien von Landau and Stéphane Rondia, who serve as the primary members, with Jonas Sanders and Gil Chevigné contributing as drummers. Their music is characterized by immersive sonic landscapes that incorporate traditional Middle Eastern instrumentation, drawing inspiration from Mesopotamian mythology. This unique blend creates a distinctive sound that sets them apart in the doom metal scene.

In 2015, Wyatt E. released their debut EP, "Mount Sinai/Aswan," which garnered attention for its innovative approach to the genre. The following year, they released their first full-length album, "Exile to Beyn Neharot," through the Jerusalem-based label Shalosh Cult. This album received critical acclaim for its atmospheric depth and thematic exploration of ancient Babylonian themes. In 2022, the band released "āl bēlūti dārû" ("The Eternal City" in Akkadian), an album that further solidified their reputation in the doom scene. Mixed by renowned producer Billy Anderson, the album led to an extensive 95-concert tour across Europe and the Middle East, including performances at prestigious festivals such as Roadburn, Mystic Festival, and DesertFest.

In 2023, Wyatt E. composed the soundtrack for the French psychological thriller "Bowling Saturne" and released a live collaboration with the English band Five The Hierophant and singer Tomer Damsky under the name Atonia. The band has signed with Heavy Psych Sounds Records and is set to release a new album, "zamāru ultu qereb ziqquratu – Part 1," in early 2025. This album is the first chapter of a two-part concept series that delves deeper into ancient Babylonian themes, continuing their exploration of Mesopotamian mythology through a modern musical lens.

bands.name: Acid King
bands.description: Acid King is an American stoner metal band from San Francisco, California, formed in 1993. The band was inspired by Ricky Kasso, who was nicknamed "Acid King" due to his chronic hallucinogenic drug use. Their self-titled debut EP, released in 1994, features a photograph of Kasso on its cover. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_King_%28band%29)) The lineup has evolved over the years, with Lori S. remaining the constant member, serving as the vocalist and guitarist. Other members have included Joey Osbourne (drums), Peter Lucas (bass), Guy Pinhas (bass), and Mark Lamb (bass). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_King_%28band%29)) Acid King has released several studio albums, including "Zoroaster" (1995), "Busse Woods" (1999), "Acid King III" (2005), and "Middle of Nowhere, Center of Everywhere" (2015). Their music is characterized by heavy, slow-moving riffs and a psychedelic atmosphere, blending elements of stoner metal and occult rock. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_King_%28band%29)) In 2023, they released "Beyond Vision," which marked a new era for the band, incorporating a more expansive and interstellar sound. ([acidking.com](https://www.acidking.com/pr/))

bands.name: Insomnium
bands.description:
Insomnium is a Finnish melodic death metal band formed in Joensuu in 1997. Their music is characterized by a blend of melodic death metal with elements of doom, black, folk, and progressive metal, creating a sound that is both dark and atmospheric. Lyrically, they often explore themes of darkness, sorrow, loss, pain, and nature.

The band released their debut album, "In the Halls of Awaiting," in 2002, which received critical acclaim for its atmospheric depth and emotional intensity. They followed this with "Since the Day It All Came Down" in 2004, further solidifying their reputation in the metal community. In 2014, they released "Shadows of the Dying Sun," which continued to showcase their evolving sound. Their 2016 album, "Winter's Gate," was a concept album based on a short story by bassist and vocalist Niilo Sevänen. In 2023, they released "Anno 1696," a concept album set during a period of witch hunts in Northern Europe, accompanied by a short story written by Sevänen. ([insomnium.net](https://insomnium.net/band/))

The current lineup consists of Niilo Sevänen (vocals, bass), Ville Friman (guitars, clean vocals), Markus Vanhala (guitars), and Markus Hirvonen (drums). Former members include Tapani Pesonen, Timo Partanen, Ville Vänni, and Jani Liimatainen. ([insomnium.net](https://insomnium.net/band/))

Their music is available on major streaming platforms, including Spotify. For more information, visit their official website at [www.insomnium.net](https://www.insomnium.net/).

bands.name: The Body
bands.description: The Body is an American experimental metal duo formed in 1999 in Providence, Rhode Island, by guitarist/vocalist Chip King and drummer/programmer Lee Buford. Known for their innovative approach, they blend elements of sludge metal, doom metal, noise, and power electronics to create a distinctive sound. Their discography includes eight full-length albums, such as "The Body" (2004), "All the Waters of the Earth Turn to Blood" (2010), "Christs, Redeemers" (2013), "I Shall Die Here" (2014), "No One Deserves Happiness" (2016), "I Have Fought Against It, but I Can't Any Longer." (2018), "I've Seen All I Need to See" (2021), and "The Crying Out of Things" (2024). They have also released numerous collaborative albums, EPs, and splits with artists like Thou, Full of Hell, and Uniform. Their music is characterized by heavy, non-weak modern sludge, incorporating samples, electronic processing, acoustic instruments, and elements of dub, classical, blues, and numerous other genres into their relentlessly experimental music. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/The_Body))

bands.name: Def Leppard
bands.description: Def Leppard is an English rock band formed in Sheffield in 1977. Initially part of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM), they evolved into a hard rock and pop rock ensemble. The band's lineup has remained consistent since 1992, featuring Rick Savage (bass, backing vocals), Joe Elliott (lead vocals), Rick Allen (drums), Phil Collen (guitar, backing vocals), and Vivian Campbell (guitar, backing vocals). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Def_Leppard)) Their 1987 album, "Hysteria," is among the best-selling hard rock albums, with over 20 million copies sold worldwide. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Def_Leppard/Hysteria/38218)) In 2025, they received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, recognizing their significant impact on the music industry. ([defleppard.com](https://defleppard.com/))

bands.name: Life Of Agony
bands.description: Formed in 1989 in Brooklyn, New York, Life of Agony is an American alternative metal band known for their emotionally charged music and intense live performances. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Keith Caputo, bassist Alan Robert, and guitarist Joey Z. Their 1993 debut album, "River Runs Red," is a concept album that tells the story of a teenager from a troubled household who ultimately attempts suicide. The album was named by Rolling Stone as one of the "Greatest Metal Albums of All Time." In 1995, they released their second album, "Ugly," which showcased a rawer, more melodic side while still delivering heavy grooves and anguished intensity. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with drummer Sal Abruscato leaving in 1996 and rejoining in 2003, and later departing again in 2018. In 2017, they released "A Place Where There's No More Pain," their first studio album in 12 years, which received critical acclaim. In 2025, they celebrated the 30th anniversary of "Ugly" with a tour performing the album in its entirety.

bands.name: Ex Deo
bands.description: Ex Deo is a Canadian symphonic death metal band formed in Montreal, Quebec, in 2008. The band serves as a side project for Kataklysm frontman Maurizio Iacono, focusing on themes from ancient Roman history. Their music is characterized by a blend of death metal with symphonic elements, creating a cinematic and epic sound that transports listeners back to the Roman Empire. The band's lineup includes Iacono on vocals, Stéphane Barbe on bass, Jean-François Dagenais on guitar, Dano Apekian on guitar, and James Payne on drums. Ex Deo's discography includes the following albums: "Romulus" (2009), "Caligvla" (2012), "The Immortal Wars" (2017), and "The Thirteen Years of Nero" (2021).

bands.name: Illdisposed
bands.description: Illdisposed is a Danish death metal band formed in 1991 in Aarhus. The group was established by vocalist Bo Summer and guitarist Lasse Bak. Over the years, Illdisposed has become a prominent act in the Nordic death metal scene, known for their groovy rhythms, melodic yet hard-hitting riffs, and a distinctive vocal style. Their discography includes 15 studio albums, with their latest release, "In Chambers of Sonic Disgust," scheduled for June 28, 2024. ([distortedsoundmag.com](https://distortedsoundmag.com/illdisposed-announce-new-album-in-chambers-of-sonic-disgust/)) The band's music has evolved over time, incorporating elements of melodic death metal and groove metal. Notable albums include "Four Depressive Seasons" (1993), "Submit" (1995), "There's Something Rotten... In the State of Denmark" (1997), "1-800 Vindication" (2004), and "Burn Me Wicked" (2006). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illdisposed)) The current lineup features Bo Summer on vocals, Jakob "Batten" Hansen and Ken Holst on guitars, Kussen Jensen on bass, and Rasmus Schmidt on drums. ([bnrmetal.com](https://www.bnrmetal.com/v5/band/band/Illd))

bands.name: Accept
bands.description: Accept is a German heavy metal band formed in 1976 in Solingen by guitarist Wolf Hoffmann, vocalist Udo Dirkschneider, and bassist Peter Baltes. Their early years trace back to the late 1960s under the name Band X. The band is renowned for its influence on speed and thrash metal, contributing significantly to the German heavy metal scene of the 1980s. Their 1983 album "Balls to the Wall" achieved gold certification in the United States and Canada, featuring the iconic title track. Over the years, Accept has undergone numerous lineup changes, with Hoffmann being the sole constant member. As of 2024, the lineup includes Hoffmann, vocalist Mark Tornillo, guitarist Philip Shouse, drummer Christopher Williams, and bassist Martin Motnik. In April 2024, they released their seventeenth studio album, "Humanoid," produced by Andy Sneap. The album received positive reviews, with critics praising its consistency and energy. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanoid_%28Accept_album%29)) In September 2025, the band announced parting ways with guitarist Uwe Lulis, returning to a traditional two-guitar lineup. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/accept-parts-ways-with-uwe-lulis-returns-to-traditional-two-guitarist-lineup)) Accept continues to be a prominent force in the heavy metal scene, known for their powerful sound and energetic live performances.

bands.name: Magnolia Park
bands.description:
Magnolia Park is an American rock band formed in Orlando, Florida, in 2018. The group blends elements of pop punk, emo, metalcore, alternative rock, nu metal, and post-hardcore to create a distinctive sound. The band consists of lead vocalist Joshua Roberts, rhythm guitarist and backing vocalist Tristan Torres, lead guitarist and backing vocalist Freddie Criales, drummer Joe Horsham, and keyboardist, programmer, and backing vocalist Vincent Ernst. They are currently signed to Epitaph Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnolia_Park_%28band%29))

Magnolia Park's discography includes four studio albums:

- "Halloween Mixtape" (2021)
- "Baku's Revenge" (2022)
- "Halloween Mixtape II" (2023)
- "VAMP" (2025)

They have also released five EPs:

- "Vacant" (2020)
- "Dream Eater" (2021)
- "Heart Eater" (2022)
- "MoonEater" (2023)
- "SoulEater" (2023)

Their latest album, "VAMP," released on April 11, 2025, is a neo-gothic concept album set in a futuristic world known as the Nocturne Nexus. The album features singles like "CULT," "WORSHIP," and "SHADOW TALK," showcasing the band's evolution towards a heavier, nu-metal and metalcore-influenced sound. ([kerrang.com](https://www.kerrang.com/magnolia-park-announce-new-concept-album-vamp))

Magnolia Park has gained recognition for their energetic performances and genre-blending style, earning a dedicated fanbase and touring with notable acts such as Simple Plan, Sum 41, and A Day To Remember. ([epitaph.com](https://www.epitaph.com/artists/magnolia-park/bio))

bands.name: Full Of Hell
bands.description: Formed in 2009 in Ocean City, Maryland, and Central Pennsylvania, Full of Hell is an American grindcore band known for their aggressive and experimental approach to extreme music. Their sound is a fusion of grindcore, powerviolence, sludge metal, and noise, characterized by blistering tempos, piercing shrieks, and a relentless assault on the senses. The band released their debut album, "Roots of Earth Are Consuming My Home," in 2011, followed by "Rudiments of Mutilation" in 2013. In 2014, they collaborated with Japanese noise artist Merzbow on a self-titled album, "Full of Hell & Merzbow." Subsequent releases include "Trumpeting Ecstasy" (2017), "Weeping Choir" (2019), "Garden of Burning Apparitions" (2021), and "Coagulated Bliss" (2024). The band's lineup consists of Dylan Walker (vocals, electronics), Spencer Hazard (guitar), Dave Bland (drums), Sam DiGristine (bass, saxophone, backing vocals), and Gabe Solomon (guitar). Their music has been described as "blistering," "brutal," and "experimental," reflecting their commitment to pushing the boundaries of extreme music. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Full_of_Hell_%28band%29))

bands.name: Groza
bands.description: Groza is a German black metal band formed in 2016 in Mühldorf am Inn, Bavaria. Initially conceived as a one-man project by vocalist and multi-instrumentalist P.G., the band expanded into a full lineup by early 2018. Their debut album, "Unified in Void," was self-released in 2018, showcasing a raw black metal aesthetic with haunting melodies and intense rhythms. In 2021, they released "The Redemptive End," which entered the German album charts at number 78, marking a significant milestone in their career. Their third album, "Nadir," released in 2024, delves deeper into emotional and atmospheric elements, reflecting the band's growth and maturity. The album received critical acclaim, entering the German album charts at number 28 and the Austrian charts at number 18. Groza's music is characterized by searing melodies, raging blast beats, and melancholic clean guitar passages, drawing comparisons to bands like Mgła and Uada. Lyrically, they explore personal themes such as depression and suicide, offering a raw and introspective perspective. The current lineup includes P.G. on lead vocals and bass, U.A. on backing vocals and lead guitars, and T.H.Z. on drums. Groza has extensively toured Europe, performing over 160 shows in more than 25 countries, and continues to engage with a growing international audience.

bands.name: Twisted Sister
bands.description: Twisted Sister is an American heavy metal band formed in 1972 in Ho-Ho-Kus, New Jersey. They gained prominence in the 1980s with their anthemic songs, outrageous costumes, and theatrical performances. Their breakthrough album, "Stay Hungry" (1984), featured iconic tracks like "We're Not Gonna Take It" and "I Wanna Rock," which became staples of 1980s glam metal. The band achieved multi-platinum status in the U.S., with "Stay Hungry" selling over 3 million copies by 1995. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stay_Hungry_%28album%29)) After a farewell tour in 2016, Twisted Sister reunited in 2025 to announce a 50th-anniversary world tour, "Twisted Forever, Forever Twisted," set for 2026. ([twistedsister.com](https://www.twistedsister.com/news/twisted-sister-returns-2026-twisted-forever-forever-twisted-566))

bands.name: Self Deception
bands.description: Self Deception is a Stockholm-based modern rock band formed in 2005 by vocalist Andreas Clark and drummer Erik Eklund. Over the years, the lineup has evolved, currently comprising Andreas Clark (vocals), Ronny Westphal (guitar), Patrik Carlberg Hallgren (bass), and Erik Eklund (drums). The band's music is characterized by a dynamic blend of anthemic modern metal and powerful melodic rock, incorporating elements of alternative rock and electronic rock. Their sound is marked by rapid-fire guitars, growling vocals, and kick drums blasting at double-speed, combined with electronic textures, EDM-style beat drops, and arresting, singable melodies. Lyrically, Self Deception explores themes such as existentialism, nihilism, anti-religious beliefs, and war. They aim to create an atmosphere and deliver a message through their music, focusing on depth and authenticity over mere extremity. In 2023, they released their latest album, "You Are Only As Sick As Your Secrets," which includes hit singles like "Fight Fire With Gasoline," "PSYCHO," and "Stockholm Hearts." The band has shared stages with acts like Electric Callboy, Danko Jones, and Adept, and has performed at prestigious festivals, including the Sweden Rock Festival. In July 2025, Self Deception signed with Napalm Records, marking a significant milestone in their career. They have also announced tours across Europe and North America, bringing their explosive live energy to major events like Open Air Gränichen in Switzerland and Rockstadt Extreme Fest in Romania.

bands.name: Lacuna Coil
bands.description: Lacuna Coil is an Italian gothic metal band formed in Milan in 1994. Initially known as Sleep of Right and later Ethereal, they adopted the name Lacuna Coil in 1998. The band is renowned for their dual-vocal approach, featuring Cristina Scabbia's melodic vocals alongside Andrea Ferro's growls, creating a distinctive sound that blends gothic metal with alternative elements. Their discography includes ten studio albums, with notable releases such as "Comalies" (2002), "Karmacode" (2006), and "Black Anima" (2019). In 2025, they released "Sleepless Empire," showcasing their evolution and continued relevance in the metal scene.

bands.name: Brainstorm
bands.description: Brainstorm is a German power metal band formed in 1989 in Heidenheim, Baden-Württemberg. The founding members include guitarists Torsten Ihlenfeld and Milan Loncaric, and drummer Dieter Bernert. They released their first demo, "Hand of Doom," in 1990, followed by "Heart of Hate" in 1992. Their debut album, "Hungry," was released in 1997, establishing them as a prominent act in the German metal scene. The band's lineup solidified with the addition of lead vocalist Andy B. Franck in 1999. Over the years, Brainstorm has released several albums, including "Metus Mortis" (2001), "Soul Temptation" (2003), and "Wall of Skulls" (2021). Their music is characterized by a blend of heavy and power metal elements, often exploring dark themes. In 2025, they released "Plague of Rats," produced by Seeb Levermann, marking a significant milestone in their career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainstorm_%28German_band%29))

bands.name: Lamb Of God
bands.description:
Lamb of God is an American heavy metal band from Richmond, Virginia, formed in 1994 as Burn the Priest. The lineup consists of vocalist Randy Blythe, guitarists Mark Morton and Willie Adler, bassist John Campbell, and drummer Art Cruz. The band is recognized as a significant member of the new wave of American heavy metal movement. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamb_of_God_%28band%29))

Since their formation, Lamb of God has released eleven studio albums, including two under the name Burn the Priest. Their most recent album, "Omens," was released in October 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamb_of_God_%28band%29))

Their music is characterized by a blend of groove metal, metalcore, and thrash metal elements, with themes exploring pain, politics, death, violence, and heresy. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Lamb_of_God))

The band's official website is [lamb-of-god.com](https://www.lamb-of-god.com/), and they are signed to Nuclear Blast Records.

bands.name: Danko Jones
bands.description: Danko Jones is a Canadian hard rock trio formed in Toronto in 1996, consisting of vocalist and guitarist Danko Jones, bassist John "JC" Calabrese, and drummer Rich Knox. Known for their energetic live performances and a sound blending hard rock, garage rock, and punk, the band has released eleven studio albums to date. Their latest album, "Leo Rising," is set to be released on November 21, 2025. ([dankojones.com](https://www.dankojones.com/)) The band's discography includes notable albums such as "Born a Lion" (2002), "We Sweat Blood" (2003), "Never Too Loud" (2008), "Below the Belt" (2010), "Rock and Roll Is Black and Blue" (2012), "Fire Music" (2015), "Wild Cat" (2017), "A Rock Supreme" (2019), "Power Trio" (2021), and "Electric Sounds" (2023). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danko_Jones)) Danko Jones has been recognized with multiple Juno Award nominations, including Best Rock Album and Best Video. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danko_Jones)) The band has toured extensively, sharing stages with acts like Guns N' Roses, Motörhead, and The Rolling Stones, and has a reputation as one of the best live acts in rock music. ([badtasteempire.com](https://www.badtasteempire.com/artists/danko-jones/))

bands.name: Death Angel
bands.description: Death Angel is an American thrash metal band formed in 1982 in the San Francisco Bay Area. The original lineup consisted of cousins Rob Cavestany (lead guitar, backing vocals), Dennis Pepa (lead vocals, bass), Gus Pepa (rhythm guitar), and Andy Galeon (drums), all of Filipino descent. In 1984, vocalist Mark Osegueda joined the band, completing the classic lineup. They released their debut album, "The Ultra-Violence," in 1987, which is considered a classic in the thrash metal genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Ultra-Violence)) The band's music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, rapid drumming, and socially conscious lyrics. Over the years, Death Angel has released nine studio albums, including "The Art of Dying" (2004), "Killing Season" (2008), "The Evil Divide" (2016), and "Humanicide" (2019). "Humanicide" received a Grammy nomination for "Best Metal Performance" in 2019. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanicide)) The current lineup features Rob Cavestany, Mark Osegueda, Ted Aguilar (rhythm guitar), Damien Sisson (bass), and Will Carroll (drums). They continue to tour extensively, performing both classic and new material for their dedicated fanbase. ([deathangel.us](https://www.deathangel.us/))

bands.name: Signs Of The Swarm
bands.description: Signs of the Swarm is an American deathcore band from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, formed in 2014. The band has released five studio albums, with their latest, "To Rid Myself of Truth," released on August 22, 2025. Their music is characterized by aggressive breakdowns, guttural vocals, and dark, apocalyptic themes. The current lineup includes drummer Bobby Crow, vocalist David Simonich, guitarist Carl Schulz, and bassist Michael Cassese. They have toured extensively, sharing stages with bands like Lorna Shore and Despised Icon. Their discography includes "Senseless Order" (2016), "The Disfigurement of Existence" (2017), "Vital Deprivation" (2019), "Absolvere" (2021), and "Amongst the Low & Empty" (2023). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signs_of_the_Swarm))

bands.name: Imperial Age
bands.description: Imperial Age is a Russian symphonic power metal band formed in Moscow in 2012 by vocalists and composers Alexander "Aor" Osipov and Jane "Corn" Odintsova. Initially, the band was a duo, with Osipov handling lead vocals and Odintsova providing backing vocals and keyboards. Their debut album, "Turn the Sun Off!" (2012), featured collaborations with musicians from notable Russian bands such as Arkona and Epidemia, receiving positive reviews internationally. In 2014, the band embarked on a month-long expedition to Tibet, filming a music video for "Aryavarta" at locations including Lake Manasarovar and Mount Kailash. The same year, they toured Russia as headliners and supported acts like Tarja Turunen and Therion. The band's second album, "The Legacy of Atlantis" (2018), is a metal opera narrating the story of a magician from Atlantis reborn in medieval Italy. The album featured guest appearances from Thomas Vikström, Nalle Pahlsson, and Christian Vidal, with the P.I. Tchaikovsky Moscow State Conservatory Chamber Choir contributing to the recording. In 2022, Imperial Age released their third album, "New World," which received positive reviews in both European and American media. The band has faced significant challenges, including relocating to Turkey in 2022 due to the political situation in Russia and later moving to the United Kingdom in 2023. Despite these obstacles, Imperial Age has maintained a strong presence in the metal scene, known for their epic orchestrations, powerful vocals, and enchanting melodies that blend elements of symphonic and power metal.

bands.name: Landmvrks
bands.description:
Landmvrks is a French metalcore band from Marseille, formed in 2014. Originally known as "Coldsight," the band underwent a name change to "Landmarks" and later stylized it as "Landmvrks." The lineup consists of vocalist Florent Salfati, guitarist Nicolas Exposito, guitarist Paul "C. Wilson" Cordebard, bassist Rudy Purkat, and drummer Kévin D'Agostino. They are signed to Arising Empire.

The band released their self-produced debut album, "Hollow," on May 10, 2016. In 2018, they signed with Arising Empire and released their second album, "Fantasy," on May 2, 2018. In January 2019, drummer and founding member Nicolas Soriano left the band, and Kévin D'Agostino replaced him shortly after. The band has since released additional material, solidifying their presence in the metalcore scene.

bands.name: Deserted Fear
bands.description: Formed in 2007 in Eisenberg, Thuringia, Deserted Fear is a German death metal band known for their melodic and groove-infused sound. The trio consists of vocalist and guitarist Manuel Glatter, guitarist and main songwriter Fabian Hildebrandt, and drummer Simon Mengs. Their debut album, "My Empire," produced by Dan Swanö, was released in 2012, establishing their presence in the metal scene. Subsequent albums include "Kingdom of Worms" (2014), "Dead Shores Rising" (2017), "Drowned by Humanity" (2019), and "Doomsday" (2022). In 2025, they released "Veins of Fire," marking a new chapter in their career. The band has shared stages with acts like Obituary, At the Gates, and Dark Tranquillity, performing over 250 shows across Europe. ([desertedfear.de](https://www.desertedfear.de/en/pages/band))

bands.name: Rise Against
bands.description: Rise Against is an American punk rock band formed in Chicago in 1999. The group consists of vocalist and rhythm guitarist Tim McIlrath, lead guitarist Zach Blair, bassist Joe Principe, and drummer Brandon Barnes. Initially known as Transistor Revolt, they released a self-produced demo in 2000 before changing their name to Rise Against in 2001. Their debut album, "The Unraveling," was produced by Mass Giorgini and released through Fat Wreck Chords. The band's music is characterized by melodic hardcore elements, aggressive sound, rapid tempos, and socially conscious lyrics addressing topics like animal rights, economic injustice, and environmental issues. Over the years, Rise Against has released several successful albums, including "Revolutions per Minute" (2003), "The Sufferer & the Witness" (2006), "Appeal to Reason" (2008), "Endgame" (2011), "The Black Market" (2014), "Wolves" (2017), "Nowhere Generation" (2021), and "Ricochet" (2025). The band has been recognized for their energetic live performances and commitment to activism, often supporting progressive causes and promoting social change.

bands.name: Chopper
bands.description: Chopper is a Uruguayan heavy metal band formed in 1989 in Montevideo. They are known for their thrash and heavy metal style, with lyrics addressing personal and societal themes. The original lineup consisted of Fabián Furtado (vocals), Ernesto Ferraro (guitar), Federico Sanguinetti (guitar), Luis "Peruano" D'Angelo Vázquez (bass), and Leonardo Rodríguez (drums). Their self-titled debut album was released in 1993, followed by "Sangrando" in 1997. After a hiatus, the band reunited in 2013 and released "Hechos Consumados" in 2014. The current lineup includes Fabián Furtado (vocals), Ernesto Ferraro (guitar), Federico Sanguinetti (guitar), Luis "Peruano" D'Angelo Vázquez (bass), and Leonardo Rodríguez (drums).

bands.name: The Scratch
bands.description: The Scratch are an Irish band from Dublin, known for blending traditional Irish music with heavy metal elements. Formed in 2016 by former members of the metal group Red Enemy, the band initially consisted of Daniel Lang (cajón, percussion, lead vocals), Conor Dockery (guitar, backing vocals), and Gary Regan (guitar, backing vocals). They began by busking across Ireland, gaining significant attention after a viral performance at the Rory Gallagher International Festival in 2017. This exposure led to sold-out shows in Dublin and a growing fanbase. In 2018, they released their first EP, "Old Songs," followed by "The Whole Buzz" in 2019. Their debut album, "Couldn't Give a Rats," was released in 2020, reaching #9 on the Irish Album Charts and #2 on the Independent Charts. Their second album, "Mind Yourself," produced by James Vincent McMorrow, was released in 2023, debuting at #1 on the Irish vinyl chart and earning a nomination for the Choice Music Prize. The band's music is characterized by high-energy acoustic riffs, soaring melodies, and a fusion of folk and metal styles. In 2025, they supported Dropkick Murphys at Alexandra Palace and performed at Download Festival, continuing to expand their international presence.

bands.name: Mayday Parade
bands.description: Mayday Parade is an American rock band formed in Tallahassee, Florida, in 2005, emerging from the merger of two local bands, Kid Named Chicago and Defining Moment. Their debut EP, "Tales Told by Dead Friends," released in 2006, sold over 50,000 copies independently, leading to a signing with Fearless Records. Their first full-length album, "A Lesson in Romantics," came out in 2007, followed by "Anywhere but Here" in 2009. The band has since released several albums, including "Mayday Parade" (2011), "Monsters in the Closet" (2013), "Black Lines" (2015), "Sunnyland" (2018), and "What It Means to Fall Apart" (2021). In 2025, they began a three-part album series, starting with "Sweet" in April and followed by "Sad" in October. Their music blends elements of pop-punk, pop rock, and emo, characterized by emotive lyrics and energetic performances. The current lineup includes Derek Sanders (vocals), Alex Garcia (guitar), Brooks Betts (guitar), Jeremy Lenzo (bass), and Jake Bundrick (drums).

bands.name: Aluk Todolo
bands.description:
Aluk Todolo is a French instrumental trio formed in 2004 in Grenoble, consisting of drummer Antoine Hadjioannou, bassist Matthieu Canaguier, and guitarist Shantidas Riedacker. The band's name, "Aluk Todolo," translates to "the Way of the Ancestors" in the Torajan language of South Sulawesi, Indonesia, reflecting their interest in animist beliefs. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aluk_Todolo))

Their music is a unique blend of black metal, krautrock, psychedelic rock, and zeuhl, creating a hypnotic and trance-inducing soundscape. They describe their style as "Occult Rock," focusing on the exploration of hidden cosmic and mental powers through instrumental compositions. ([burningambulance.com](https://burningambulance.com/2012/11/20/interview-aluk-todolo/))

Aluk Todolo's discography includes:

- **Descension** (2007): Their debut album, released on Public Guilt and Riot Season, recorded in the Elders Cave in the Alps. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aluk_Todolo))

- **Finsternis** (2009): A single-track album divided into five parts, released on Utech Records and later reissued by The Ajna Offensive and NoEvDia. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aluk_Todolo))

- **Occult Rock** (2012): A double album featuring eight tracks that delve deeper into their "Occult Rock" concept, released by The Ajna Offensive and NoEvDia. ([aluktodolo.bandcamp.com](https://aluktodolo.bandcamp.com/album/occult-rock))

- **Voix** (2016): A single 45-minute piece divided into six tracks, continuing their exploration of hypnotic and experimental sounds. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aluk_Todolo))

- **Lux** (2024): Their latest album, recorded at Kerwax Analog Recording Studios in July 2023 and released in September 2024. ([utechrecords.com](https://www.utechrecords.com/product/aluk-todolo-lux-cs))

Aluk Todolo has performed extensively in Europe and the United States, including appearances at the Roadburn Festival and opening for Faust in New York. ([swampbooking.com](https://swampbooking.com/aluk-todolo-paris/))

Their music is available on various platforms, including Bandcamp, where they offer digital and physical copies of their albums. ([aluktodolo.bandcamp.com](https://aluktodolo.bandcamp.com/album/archives-vol-1))

bands.name: Get The Shot
bands.description: Formed in 2009 in Quebec City, Get The Shot is a Canadian hardcore band known for their aggressive fusion of thrash metal, death metal, and beatdown elements. The band released their self-produced EP "In Fear We Stand" in 2009, followed by their debut album "Perdition" in 2012. They have since released "No Peace in Hell" (2014), "Infinite Punishment" (2017), and "Merciless Destruction" (2022). In 2024, they signed with Arising Empire and released the single "Dominant Predation," featuring Zelli from Paleface Swiss. In May 2025, vocalist Jean-Philippe Lagacé departed, with guitarist Olivier Roy assuming vocal duties. ([arising-empire.com](https://arising-empire.com/artists/get-the-shot))

bands.name: Voivod
bands.description: Voivod is a Canadian heavy metal band formed in 1982 in Jonquière, Quebec. Known for their unique blend of progressive and thrash metal, they have been pioneers in the technical thrash metal subgenre. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Denis "Snake" Bélanger, guitarist Denis "Piggy" D'Amour, drummer Michel "Away" Langevin, and bassist Jean-Yves "Blacky" Thériault. Over the years, the band has undergone several lineup changes, with Langevin being the only consistent member. Their music often explores themes of science fiction, society, and philosophy. Notable albums include "Nothingface" (1989), which marked their mainstream success, and "Dimension Hatröss" (1988), a concept album that received critical acclaim. Their most recent studio album, "Morgöth Tales," was released in July 2023, featuring re-recorded versions of their classic tracks. Voivod's innovative sound and thematic depth have earned them a dedicated global following and a significant influence on the metal genre.

bands.name: Kim Dracula
bands.description: Kim Dracula, born Samuel Wellings on November 24, 1997, in Hobart, Tasmania, is an Australian singer, songwriter, musician, and rapper who has gained prominence for his unique blend of metal, trap, and industrial music. Emerging in 2020, he first garnered attention with a metal cover of Lady Gaga's "Paparazzi," which went viral on TikTok and amassed millions of views on YouTube and Spotify. This success propelled him to become the fourth-most followed Australian TikTok music artist of 2020. In 2022, he released singles like "Make Me Famous" and "Drown," the latter being described as "a barrage of sounds and styles...as weird as it is wonderful." His debut album, "A Gradual Decline in Morale," released on July 14, 2023, features 20 tracks, including previously released singles. Throughout his career, Kim Dracula has collaborated with notable artists such as Jonathan Davis of Korn on "Seventy Thorns," Tech N9ne on "W H A T (We're Hungry and Thirsty)," and In This Moment on "Heretic." His dynamic performances have led to tours with bands like Avenged Sevenfold and Ice Nine Kills, solidifying his reputation as a rising star in the music industry.

bands.name: Trollfest
bands.description: TrollfesT is a Norwegian folk metal band formed in 2003, known for their energetic performances and unique blend of metal with Balkan and traditional Norwegian music. Their lyrics are predominantly written in 'Trollspråk,' a fictional language combining Norwegian and German. The band released their debut album, 'Willkommen Folk Tell Drekka Fest!' in 2005, followed by 'Brakebein' in 2006. Over the years, they've performed at various festivals, including the Barther Metal Openair in 2007 and the Ragnarök Festival in 2008. In 2012, they toured with Wintersun, Korpiklaani, Krampus, and Varg for the Heidenfest tour. Their seventh studio album, 'Helluva,' was released in 2017. In January 2022, they competed in the Norwegian Melodi Grand Prix with the song 'Dance Like a Pink Flamingo.'

bands.name: Converge
bands.description: Converge is an American metalcore band formed in 1990 in Salem, Massachusetts, by vocalist Jacob Bannon and guitarist Kurt Ballou. They are pioneers of the metalcore and mathcore genres, known for their aggressive and boundary-pushing sound that blends hardcore punk and heavy metal. The band's lineup has remained consistent since 2001, featuring Bannon, Ballou, bassist Nate Newton, and drummer Ben Koller. Their 2001 album "Jane Doe" is highly acclaimed, with Rolling Stone ranking it as the 61st-best metal album of all time. Other notable releases include "You Fail Me" (2004), "Axe to Fall" (2009), and "The Dusk in Us" (2017). In 2021, they collaborated with Chelsea Wolfe on "Bloodmoon: I," showcasing their versatility and continued relevance in the metal scene.

bands.name: Der Weg Einer Freiheit
bands.description: Der Weg Einer Freiheit is a German extreme metal band from Würzburg, formed in 2009 by guitarist and principal songwriter Nikita Kamprad and vocalist Tobias Jaschinsky. The duo initially released a self-titled debut album in 2009, which was reissued in 2010 with live drums replacing the original drum programming. In 2012, Jaschinsky departed, and Kamprad assumed vocal duties, leading to the release of 'Unstille' in the same year. The band's subsequent albums include 'Stellar' (2015), 'Finisterre' (2017), 'Noktvrn' (2021), and 'Innern' (2025). Their music blends black metal intensity with post-metal atmospheres, exploring themes of despair, memories, and the darker aspects of human society. They have toured extensively, sharing stages with bands like Wolves in the Throne Room, The Ocean, and Heaven Shall Burn. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Der_Weg_einer_Freiheit))

bands.name: Three Days Grace
bands.description: Three Days Grace is a Canadian rock band formed in 1992 in Norwood, Ontario, originally as Groundswell. The group disbanded in 1995 but reunited in 1997 under the name Three Days Grace. The original lineup consisted of lead vocalist and guitarist Adam Gontier, drummer and backing vocalist Neil Sanderson, and bassist Brad Walst. They were later joined by lead guitarist Barry Stock in 2003 and co-vocalist Matt Walst in 2014. The band's music spans post-grunge, hard rock, alternative rock, and alternative metal genres. Their debut album, "Three Days Grace," released in 2003, achieved commercial success, peaking at number 9 on the Canadian Albums Chart and number 69 on the Billboard 200. The album received a Gold certification in New Zealand, a Platinum in Canada, and double-Platinum status in the United States. Over the years, Three Days Grace has released multiple albums, including "One-X" (2006), "Life Starts Now" (2009), "Transit of Venus" (2012), "Human" (2015), "Outsider" (2018), and "Explosions" (2022). In 2024, Adam Gontier returned to the band, reuniting with Matt Walst as co-vocalists. The band released their eighth studio album, "Alienation," on August 22, 2025, marking the first album with both Gontier and Walst sharing vocal duties. The album features singles like "Mayday," "Apologies," "Dominate," and "Kill Me Fast." The current lineup includes Adam Gontier (vocals, guitar), Matt Walst (vocals, guitar), Neil Sanderson (drums, keyboards, percussion, backing vocals), Brad Walst (bass, backing vocals), and Barry Stock (guitar).

bands.name: Kissin' Dynamite
bands.description: Kissin' Dynamite is a German hard rock and heavy metal band formed in 2007 in Reutlingen, Germany. The band originated from the school group Blues Kids, founded by brothers Hannes and Ande Braun in 2002. They began sending demo recordings to various music labels in 2007, leading to a contract with Capitol Records/EMI. Their debut album, "Steel of Swabia," was released in 2008, followed by "Addicted to Metal" in 2010, which featured a guest appearance by Udo Dirkschneider of U.D.O. Their third album, "Money, Sex and Power," was released in 2012. In 2014, they released "Megalomania," followed by "Generation Goodbye" in 2016. In 2018, "Ecstasy" broke into the top ten on the German charts for the first time. Their 2022 album, "Not the End of the Road," debuted at number two on the German charts. In 2024, they released "Back with a Bang!" which topped the German charts at number one. The band's music is characterized by energetic performances and a blend of hard rock and heavy metal influences. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kissin%27_Dynamite))

bands.name: Orbit Culture
bands.description: Orbit Culture is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in 2013 in Eksjö, a town situated between Gothenburg and Stockholm. The band was founded by vocalist and rhythm guitarist Niklas Karlsson and lead guitarist Maximilian Zinsmeister, who met through mutual friends at the age of 17. They began by renting a small rehearsal space in an old power station, where they were later joined by drummer Markus Bladh and bassist Christoffer Olsson. Their debut EP, "Odyssey," was released in 2013, followed by their first full-length album, "In Medias Res," in 2014. In 2016, Zinsmeister departed to focus on his studies, leading to the addition of lead guitarist Richard Hansson and bassist Fredrik Lennartsson. The band released "Rasen" in 2016, which included the popular track "Sun of All." In 2018, they released the EP "Redfog," featuring singles like "Saw" and "See Through Me." Their 2020 album "Nija" received critical acclaim, with Karlsson describing it as "a fist on your skull that forces you to the ground and exhausts you to ask for more." The band continued to evolve with the release of "Shaman" in 2021 and "Descent" in 2023, the latter being described as "a live-friendly album" that turned into "a big-ass darker monster." In 2024, Orbit Culture signed with Century Media Records and released their fifth studio album, "Death Above Life," on October 3, 2025. The current lineup consists of Niklas Karlsson (vocals, rhythm guitar), Richard Hansson (lead guitar), Fredrik Lennartsson (bass), and Christopher Wallerstedt (drums). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbit_Culture))

bands.name: Samael
bands.description: Samael is a Swiss metal band formed in Sion in 1987, known for their innovative fusion of black metal, industrial, and symphonic elements. The band was founded by brothers Michael "Vorph" Locher (vocals, guitar) and Alexandre "Xy" Locher (drums, keyboards). They began by releasing a 7-inch EP featuring original songs "Into the Pentagram" and "The Dark," along with a cover of Hellhammer's "The Third of the Storm." Their debut album, "Worship Him," released in 1991, established their presence in the metal scene. In 1996, they released "Passage," which marked a significant shift towards industrial sounds, incorporating drum machines and keyboards, and moving away from traditional black metal themes. This album broadened their international appeal. Their 2004 album, "Reign of Light," continued this trend, blending industrial and symphonic elements. In 2011, "Lux Mundi" was released, further solidifying their reputation for experimental metal. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Vorph, Xy, guitarist Drop, and bassist Ales. Samael's music is characterized by atmospheric compositions, blending heavy metal with electronic and symphonic influences, creating a unique and evolving sound.

bands.name: Bleed From Within
bands.description: Bleed From Within is a Scottish metalcore band formed in Glasgow in 2005. Initially, they gained recognition with their debut album, "Humanity," released in 2009, which showcased their deathcore influences. Their second album, "Empire," released in 2010, emphasized groove metal and melodic death metal elements. In 2012, they signed with Century Media Records and released "Uprising," marking a shift towards a more refined metalcore sound. Their fourth album, "Era," released in 2018, continued this evolution, blending metalcore with groove metal and melodic death metal. In 2020, they released "Fracture," which received critical acclaim and was named the 40th best metal album of 2020 by Metal Hammer. Their sixth album, "Shrine," released in 2022, further solidified their position in the metal scene. Their latest album, "Zenith," was released in April 2025 through Nuclear Blast. The current lineup consists of lead vocalist Scott Kennedy, drummer Ali Richardson, bassist Davie Provan, lead guitarist Craig Gowans, and rhythm guitarist Steven Jones. Their music is characterized by deep heavy breakdowns, growling vocals, and groove-infused riffs, blending metalcore, melodic death metal, and groove metal influences. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bleed_from_Within))

bands.name: Papa Roach
bands.description:
Papa Roach is an American rock band formed in 1993 in Vacaville, California. The original lineup consisted of lead vocalist Jacoby Shaddix, guitarist Jerry Horton, bassist Will James, drummer Dave Buckner, and trombonist Ben Luther. After releasing two independent EPs, the band signed with DreamWorks Records in 1999, leading to the release of their major-label debut, "Infest," in 2000. The album achieved triple-platinum status, propelled by the success of the single "Last Resort," which topped the Billboard Modern Rock Tracks chart for seven weeks. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papa_Roach))

Musically, Papa Roach began with a hardcore punk style, evolving into nu metal and rap metal on their early major-label releases. Over time, they transitioned towards alternative rock and hard rock sounds. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Lovehatetragedy" (2002), "Getting Away with Murder" (2004), and "The Paramour Sessions" (2006). In 2025, they celebrated the 25th anniversary of "Infest" with the "Rise of the Roach" tour, raising $230,000 for the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. ([afsp.org](https://afsp.org/story/papa-roach-celebrates-completion-of-u-s-leg-of-25th-anniversary-rise-of-the-roach))

The band's current lineup features Jacoby Shaddix (vocals), Jerry Horton (guitar), Tobin Esperance (bass), and Tony Palermo (drums). They continue to release music and tour, maintaining a significant presence in the rock music scene.

bands.name: Iron Maiden
bands.description: Iron Maiden is a seminal English heavy metal band formed in 1975 by bassist and primary songwriter Steve Harris. Emerging from the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM) movement, the band quickly gained prominence with their self-titled debut album released in 1980. The lineup has seen changes over the years, but the core members have remained consistent, featuring Harris, lead vocalist Bruce Dickinson, drummers Nicko McBrain and Simon Dawson, and guitarists Dave Murray, Adrian Smith, and Janick Gers. Their music is characterized by galloping bass lines, intricate guitar harmonies, and thematic lyrics often exploring history, mythology, and literature. Notable albums include "The Number of the Beast" (1982), "Powerslave" (1984), and "Seventh Son of a Seventh Son" (1988). The band has maintained a dedicated fan base worldwide, known for their energetic live performances and the iconic mascot, Eddie. In 2025, they embarked on the "Run For Your Lives" World Tour, celebrating their 50th anniversary, with performances across Europe and North America. The tour is set to conclude in 2026, marking another milestone in their enduring legacy.

bands.name: Deicide
bands.description: Deicide is an American death metal band formed in Tampa, Florida, in 1987. Initially known as Carnage, the group changed its name to Amon before settling on Deicide in 1989. The lineup consisted of drummer Steve Asheim, guitarist brothers Eric and Brian Hoffman, and bassist/vocalist Glen Benton. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1990, established their presence in the death metal scene. The 1992 album "Legion" propelled them to mainstream success, solidifying their reputation as one of the genre's leading acts. Over the years, Deicide has released numerous albums, including "Serpents of the Light" (1997), "The Stench of Redemption" (2006), and "Banished by Sin" (2024). Known for their aggressive sound and controversial themes, Deicide remains a significant influence in the death metal community.

bands.name: Alice Cooper
bands.description: Alice Cooper, born Vincent Damon Furnier on February 4, 1948, in Detroit, Michigan, is a pioneering figure in rock music, renowned for his theatrical stage performances and distinctive raspy voice. He began his career in 1964 with the band The Spiders, which later evolved into the Alice Cooper Group in 1968. The band gained prominence in the early 1970s with albums like "Love It to Death" (1971) and "Billion Dollar Babies" (1973), blending hard rock with shock rock elements. In 1975, Furnier adopted the name Alice Cooper as his legal surname and embarked on a solo career, releasing albums such as "Welcome to My Nightmare" (1975) and "Trash" (1989). His music spans genres including hard rock, heavy metal, and glam rock, with themes often exploring horror and the macabre. The original Alice Cooper Band reunited in 2025 to release "The Revenge of Alice Cooper," their first studio album in over five decades. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_Cooper_%28band%29))

bands.name: Curse Of Cain
bands.description: Formed in 2000 by bassist Jonas Asplind, known as The Pirate, Curse Of Cain is a Swedish metal collective that blends modern metal with theatrical storytelling, creating a unique subgenre they term "Movie Metal." Their self-titled debut album, released on May 12, 2023, follows the ecclesiastical and bloodthirsty tale of Cain, son of Adam and Eve, exploring his immortality in a crumbling world. The album features tracks like "The Mark," "Alive," and "Blame," with guest contributions from Ken Kängström (Follow The Cipher) and Tommy Johansson (Sabaton, Majestica). The band is set to release their sophomore album, "Achtung!" on September 26, 2025, through ROAR, with singles such as "Feel The Pain" and "Candy Cain Murder" already available. ([metal-connect.com](https://www.metal-connect.com/p/curse-of-cain-announces-new-studio))

bands.name: Carpenter Brut
bands.description: Carpenter Brut is the stage name of Franck Hueso, a French musician from Poitiers, France, known for his darksynth and synthwave music. He began his musical journey in 2012, releasing his first EP, "EP I," followed by "EP II" in 2013, and "EP III" in 2015. These three EPs were later compiled into the album "Trilogy" in 2015. In 2018, Carpenter Brut released his first full-length album, "Leather Teeth," which incorporated 1980s metal and glam rock influences. This was followed by "Blood Machines OST" in 2020 and "Leather Terror" in 2022. In 2024, he contributed the track "Death Racer" to the official soundtrack of the video game "The Crew Motorfest." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carpenter_Brut))

bands.name: Nothing But Thieves
bands.description: Nothing But Thieves is an English alternative rock band formed in 2012 in Southend-on-Sea, Essex. The lineup consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Conor Mason, guitarist Joe Langridge-Brown, guitarist and keyboardist Dominic Craik, bassist Philip Blake, and drummer James Price. In 2014, they signed with RCA Records, leading to the release of their self-titled debut album in October 2015. The album received positive reviews and peaked at No. 7 on the UK Albums Chart. Their second album, "Broken Machine," released in September 2017, reached No. 2 on the UK Albums Chart and was certified Gold by the BPI. In October 2020, they released "Moral Panic," which debuted at No. 3 on the UK Albums Chart. The band continued to build on this success with the release of "Moral Panic II" in July 2021 and their fourth studio album, "Dead Club City," in June 2023, which became their first UK No. 1 album. Their music has been compared to artists like Jeff Buckley, Foals, Civil Twilight, Queens of the Stone Age, Royal Blood, and Muse. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nothing_but_Thieves))

bands.name: Blood Incantation
bands.description: Blood Incantation is an American progressive death metal band from Denver, Colorado, formed in 2011. The lineup consists of guitarist and vocalist Paul Riedl, drummer Isaac Faulk, guitarist Morris Kolontyrsky, and bassist Jeff Barrett. Their debut album, "Starspawn," released in 2016, received critical acclaim for its blend of technicality and atmosphere. The band's sound features a psychedelic take on classic death metal, blending technicality with tectonic riffs, cavernous vocals, and eerie moments of caustic stillness. Their lyrics primarily explore themes of space and death. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_Incantation)) In 2019, they released "Hidden History of the Human Race," which delved into topics such as humanity, enlightenment, mysticism, and ancient aliens. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Blood_Incantation/3540368063)) Their 2022 album, "Timewave Zero," marked a departure from their typical death metal sound, embracing ambient and space music elements. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timewave_Zero_%28Blood_Incantation_album%29)) Their most recent release, "Absolute Elsewhere," came out in October 2024, continuing their exploration of progressive death metal and progressive rock. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absolute_Elsewhere))

bands.name: Captain Black Beard
bands.description:
Captain Black Beard is a Swedish melodic rock band formed in Stockholm on October 31, 2009. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with each new vocalist bringing a fresh energy to their sound. Their music is characterized by hard rock riffs and synth layers, reminiscent of 1980s arena rock bands like Survivor and Europe. They have shared studios and stages with members of KISS, Deep Purple, and Queensrÿche. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/captain-black-beard/430261875))

Their discography includes:

- **Captain Black Beard** (2011): Their self-titled debut album, released on May 28, 2011. ([captainblackbeard.bandcamp.com](https://captainblackbeard.bandcamp.com/album/captain-black-beard))

- **Sonic Forces** (2018): Celebrating their 10th anniversary, this album was produced by Jona Tee of H.E.A.T. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/review/captain-black-beard-sonic-forces-2/))

- **Struck by Lightning** (2018): Released on June 7, 2018, this album features 10 tracks, including "All The Pain" and "Perfect Little Clue." ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/review/captain-black-beard-struck-by-lightning/))

- **Chasing Danger** (2025): Their latest album, released on April 4, 2025, includes tracks like "When It's Over" and "AI Lover." ([metalshockfinland.com](https://metalshockfinland.com/2025/04/05/captain-black-beards-new-album-chasing-danger-out-now/))

Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/captain-black-beard/430261875))

The current lineup includes:

- Fredrik Vahlgren – Lead Vocals

- Robert Majd – Bass

- Daniel Krakowski – Guitar

- Oscar Bromwall – Guitar

- John Lönnmyr – Keyboard

For more information, visit their official website.

bands.name: Kataklysm
bands.description: Kataklysm is a Canadian death metal band formed in Montreal, Quebec, in 1991. Initially recognized for their rapid and technical style, they coined the term "Northern Hyperblast" to describe their unique sound, characterized by extremely fast blast beats. Their debut demo, "The Death Gate Cycle of Reincarnation," released in 1992, garnered significant acclaim in the underground metal scene. In 1994, they signed with Nuclear Blast Records, leading to the release of their first EP, "The Mystical Gate of Reincarnation," followed by their debut album, "Sorcery," in 1995. The band's lineup underwent a significant change after the release of their second full-length album, "Temple of Knowledge," in 1996, when founding member and lead vocalist Sylvain Houde departed. Bassist Maurizio Iacono assumed vocal duties, with Stéphane Barbe replacing him on bass. This shift marked a new era for Kataklysm, blending elements of melodic death metal and groove metal into their sound. Over the years, they have released several acclaimed albums, including "Shadows & Dust" (2002), "Serenity in Fire" (2004), "Prevail" (2008), "Heaven's Venom" (2010), "Waiting for the End to Come" (2013), "Of Ghosts and Gods" (2015), "Meditations" (2018), "Unconquered" (2020), and "Goliath" (2023). Their 2015 album, "Of Ghosts and Gods," earned them a Juno Award for Best Heavy Metal Album.
