Known for their energetic live performances, Kataklysm continues to be a prominent force in the death metal scene.

bands.name: Triumph Of Death (Plays Hellhammer)
bands.description: Triumph Of Death is a Swiss metal band formed in 2019 by Tom Gabriel Warrior, the founder of Hellhammer and Celtic Frost. The band serves as a tribute to Hellhammer's legacy, performing their music live. The lineup includes Mia Wallace on bass, Michael Zech on guitar and vocals, and Alessandro Commerio on drums. In 2023, they released their debut live album, "Resurrection Of The Flesh," capturing performances from festivals in Houston, Munich, and Portugal. The album showcases the raw and heavy essence of Hellhammer's music, highlighting its enduring influence on the metal genre. ([metal-rules.com](https://www.metal-rules.com/2023/09/20/triumph-of-death-announce-their-debut-live-album-performing-hellhammers-resurrection-of-the-flesh/))

bands.name: Crucified Barbara
bands.description:
Crucified Barbara is an all-female Swedish hard rock and heavy metal band formed in Stockholm in 1998. Initially starting as a punk rock ensemble, they swiftly transitioned to a heavier sound, blending elements of hard rock and heavy metal. The band comprises Mia Coldheart (guitar and vocals), Klara Force (guitar and backing vocals), Ida Evileye (bass), and Nicki Wicked (drums and backing vocals). Their music is characterized by a fusion of classic heavy metal and hard rock, reminiscent of the glam metal and sleaze rock eras. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crucified_Barbara))

Their debut album, "In Distortion We Trust," was released in 2005, recorded at Pama Studios/Blakk Records in Kristianopel, Sweden, with producer Mankan Sedenberg. The album features the single "Losing the Game," which achieved notable success in Sweden. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_Distortion_We_Trust)) Following this, they released "'Til Death Do Us Party" in 2009, "The Midnight Chase" in 2012, and "In the Red" in 2014. In 2016, the band announced their disbandment, citing a loss of joy in playing together. However, in October 2024, they reunited and announced their first show in nearly a decade, scheduled for the Sweden Rock Festival in June 2025. ([metalinjection.net](https://metalinjection.net/news/reunited/crucified-barbara-reunites-first-show-in-roughly-10-years-booked-for-2025))

Crucified Barbara's music is available on various platforms, including their official website and Bandcamp. ([crucifiedbarbara.com](https://crucifiedbarbara.com/))

bands.name: Coroner
bands.description: Coroner is a Swiss thrash metal band formed in Zürich in 1983. Initially serving as roadies for Celtic Frost, they began creating their own music, releasing their debut album, "R.I.P.", in 1987. Their sound evolved over the years, incorporating elements of progressive, avant-garde, and industrial metal. Notable albums include "Punishment for Decadence" (1988), "No More Color" (1989), "Mental Vortex" (1991), and "Grin" (1993). After a hiatus, they reunited in 2010 and released their first studio album in over three decades, "Dissonance Theory", on October 17, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissonance_Theory_%28album%29))

bands.name: Megadeth
bands.description: Megadeth is an American thrash metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1983 by vocalist and guitarist Dave Mustaine. After his departure from Metallica, Mustaine established Megadeth, aiming to create a faster and more aggressive sound. The band quickly rose to prominence, becoming one of the "big four" of American thrash metal alongside Metallica, Slayer, and Anthrax. Known for their technically complex guitar work and politically charged lyrics, Megadeth has released numerous influential albums, including "Peace Sells... but Who's Buying?" (1986), "Rust in Peace" (1990), and "Countdown to Extinction" (1992). Their 2022 album, "The Sick, the Dying... and the Dead!", marked a return to their thrash roots and was praised for its energy and craftsmanship. In August 2025, Megadeth announced their forthcoming album, set to be their final release, accompanied by a farewell tour in 2026. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/a750ed8043c0fdbc472b472e604f4446)) The current lineup includes Dave Mustaine (vocals, guitar), James LoMenzo (bass), Dirk Verbeuren (drums), and Teemu Mäntysaari (guitar). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/megadeth/138))

bands.name: Feuerschwanz
bands.description: Feuerschwanz is a German medieval metal band formed in 2004 in Erlangen, Bavaria. Initially conceived as a comedic medieval folk rock ensemble, the band has evolved over the years into a serious heavy metal act. Their early music was characterized by humorous lyrics and brash language, often incorporating innuendo. In 2020, after signing with Napalm Records, Feuerschwanz shifted towards a more serious heavy metal style with the release of "Das elfte Gebot." This marked a significant change in their musical direction, moving away from their comedic roots. The band's lineup includes Hauptmann Feuerschwanz (vocals, guitar, lute), Johanna von der Vögelweide (violin, hurdy-gurdy), and Prinz R. Hodenherz "Hodi" III (vocals, guitar, flute, mandolin, Irish bouzouki, bagpipes, various whistles). Other members include Hela (dance, animations), Jan Jamaszyk (bass, vocals), Rollo H. Schönhaar (drums), and Jenny Diehl (dance, animations). Feuerschwanz has released several studio albums, with "Fegefeuer" (2023) reaching number one on the official German charts. Their twelfth studio album, "Knightclub," was released on August 22, 2025, continuing their journey in the folk metal genre.

members.name: Prinz R. Hodenherz "Hodi" III
members.role: Vocals, Guitar, Flute, Mandolin, Irish Bouzouki, Bagpipes, Various Whistles

bands.name: Arthur Brown
bands.description: Arthur Brown is an English singer and songwriter, renowned for his flamboyant and theatrical performances, eclectic musical style, and powerful, wide-ranging operatic voice. Born on June 24, 1942, in Whitby, North Yorkshire, England, he first gained prominence in the late 1960s as the frontman of The Crazy World of Arthur Brown. The band's 1968 debut album, 'The Crazy World of Arthur Brown,' featured the hit single 'Fire,' which reached number one in the UK and Canada and number two in the United States. This track sold over one million copies and was awarded a gold disc. Brown's music encompasses psychedelic soul, soul, blues, British rhythm and blues, pop, acid rock, psychedelia, psychedelic rock, progressive rock, shock rock, and experimental music. His theatrical stage presence, including face paint and a flaming helmet, influenced artists like Alice Cooper, David Bowie, and Marilyn Manson. Over the years, Brown has released several solo albums and collaborated with various artists, including Hawkwind and Klaus Schulze. In 2022, he released 'Long Long Road' on his 80th birthday, followed by 'Monster's Ball' later that year. In 2025, he announced a UK and European tour, continuing to captivate audiences with his unique blend of music and performance art.

bands.name: Subway To Sally
bands.description: Subway To Sally is a German folk metal band formed in Potsdam in 1990. Their music blends medieval and folk influences with metal elements, incorporating instruments like bagpipes, hurdy-gurdy, shawm, violin, lute, mandolin, and flutes. Over the years, they've released 12 studio albums, including 'Album 1994', 'MCMXCV' (1995), 'Foppt den Dämon!' (1996), 'Bannkreis' (1997), 'Hochzeit' (1999), 'Schrei!' (2000), 'Herzblut' (2001), 'Engelskrieger' (2004), 'Bastard' (2007), 'Schlachthof' (2008), 'Kreuzfeuer' (2009), 'Schwarz in Schwarz' (2010), 'Hey!' (2019), 'Himmelfahrt' (2023), and 'Post Mortem' (2024). Their 2024 album 'Post Mortem' was released via Napalm Records. ([label.napalmrecords.com](https://label.napalmrecords.com/subway-to-sally))

bands.name: Black Label Society
bands.description: Black Label Society is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1998 by guitarist and vocalist Zakk Wylde. The band emerged after Wylde's solo project, Pride & Glory, disbanded in 1994. Initially named Hell's Kitchen, they changed their name to Black Label Society due to trademark issues. Their debut album, "Sonic Brew," released in 1999, showcased a blend of heavy metal and southern rock influences. Over the years, the band has released numerous albums, including "1919 Eternal" (2002), "The Blessed Hellride" (2003), and "Catacombs of the Black Vatican" (2014). Their music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, soulful melodies, and themes of rebellion and freedom. The current lineup includes Zakk Wylde (vocals, lead guitar, piano), John DeServio (bass, backing vocals), Dario Lorina (rhythm guitar, backing vocals), and Jeff Fabb (drums). They continue to tour and release new material, maintaining a dedicated fan base worldwide.

bands.name: The Ocean
bands.description: The Ocean is a German post-metal band formed in 2000 by guitarist Robin Staps. Known for their atmospheric and experimental sound, they have explored various subgenres, including progressive metal, sludge metal, and avant-garde metal. Over the years, the band has undergone several lineup changes, with Staps remaining the constant member. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Fluxion" (2004), "Aeolian" (2006), "Precambrian" (2007), "Heliocentric" and "Anthropocentric" (2010), "Pelagial" (2013), "Phanerozoic I: Palaeozoic" (2018), "Phanerozoic II: Mesozoic / Cenozoic" (2020), and "Holocene" (2023). In 2025, significant departures occurred, including vocalist Loïc Rossetti, guitarist David Ramis Åhfeldt, and drummer Paul Seidel. Despite these changes, the band announced plans for a new album in 2026, signaling their commitment to continue creating music.

bands.name: Municipal Waste
bands.description: Municipal Waste is an American crossover thrash band from Richmond, Virginia, formed in 2000. Known for their high-energy performances and humorous lyrics, they have been a significant force in the revival of thrash metal. Their music is characterized by fast-paced riffs, aggressive drumming, and themes of partying, politics, and societal issues. The band has released seven studio albums, including "Waste 'Em All" (2003), "Hazardous Mutation" (2005), "The Art of Partying" (2007), "Massive Aggressive" (2009), "The Fatal Feast" (2012), "Slime and Punishment" (2017), and "Electrified Brain" (2022). They have also produced three EPs and four split albums. Their 2007 album, "The Art of Partying," was particularly influential, being named one of the "50 Greatest Thrash Metal Albums Ever" by Metal Hammer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Municipal_Waste_%28band%29)) The current lineup consists of Tony Foresta (vocals), Ryan Waste (guitar), Philip "Land Phil" Hall (bass), Dave Witte (drums), and Nick "Nikropolis" Poulos (lead guitar). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Municipal_Waste_%28band%29))

bands.name: Crippling Alcoholism
bands.description: Crippling Alcoholism is a gothic noise rock band from New England, formed in 2022 by vocalist Tony Castrati and drummer Danny Sher. Their music blends abrasive noise textures with a suffocating gothic atmosphere, creating a unique and unrelenting sound. The band's debut album, "When the Drugs that Made You Sick are the Drugs that Make You Better," released in 2022, circulated through niche music boards, earning a cult following. In 2024, the band expanded into a six-piece with the addition of guitarist Alyce, guitarist Stefan, bassist Peter, and synthesist Jonathan, evolving their sonic palette into something broader and more unhinged. Their third album, "Camgirl," released on September 12, 2025, tells the tragic tale of "Bella Pink," an online performer whose story unfolds through the eyes of those who consume her: lovers, relatives, business partners, and stalkers. Musically, the album embraces dance music, party pop, and synthetic ecstasy, while lyrically exploring themes of lust, power, exploitation, and disintegration. The current lineup includes Tony Castrati (vocals), Danny Sher (drums), Alyce (guitar), Stefan (guitar), Peter (bass), and Jonathan (synthesizer).

bands.name: Wargasm
bands.description: Wargasm is a British electronic rock duo from London, formed in 2018 by Sam Matlock and Milkie Way. Matlock, previously part of Dead!, and Way, a former concert photographer, bonded over a shared love of nu metal acts like Limp Bizkit. Initially writing pop-punk songs, they shifted towards a fusion of rap and nu metal, leading to the formation of Wargasm in August 2019. The band's music is characterized by a blend of electro-punk, digital hardcore, nu metal, and post-hardcore elements. Their debut mixtape, "Explicit: The Mixxxtape," released in September 2022, charted at No. 19 on the UK Rock & Metal Albums Chart. In October 2023, they released their first full-length album, "Venom," which peaked at No. 88 on the UK Albums Chart. The duo has been recognized with several accolades, including the New Noise Award at the 2022 Kerrang! Awards and Best UK Breakthrough Band at the 2021 Heavy Music Awards. Their energetic performances and distinctive sound have established them as a prominent act in the modern rock scene.

bands.name: Knorkator
bands.description:
Knorkator is a German band from Berlin, formed in 1994, known for blending heavy metal with comedic elements. They humorously describe themselves as "Germany's most beloved band in the world." The name "Knorkator" is derived from "knorke," a Berlin dialect term meaning "great" or "fabulous." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

The band's music is characterized by industrial metal influences, akin to White Zombie and Ministry, infused with satirical and explicit lyrics. Their performances are renowned for their wild stage shows, featuring antics like smashing TV sets and throwing toast at the audience. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

Knorkator gained national attention in 2000 with their song "Ick wer zun Schwein," which led to their participation in the German national qualification for the Eurovision Song Contest. Despite announcing their breakup in 2008, they reunited in 2011, releasing the album "Es werde Nicht" and embarking on a tour. Their latest album, "Weltherrschaft für alle," was released in September 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knorkator))

The current lineup includes:

- **Gero Ivers** (Stumpen) – vocals
- **Alexander Thomas** (Alf Ator) – keyboards, vocals
- **Sebastian Baur** (Buzz Dee) – guitars
- **Rajko Gohlke** – bass
- **Philipp Schwab** – drums

Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/knorkator/84630084))

For more information, visit their official website at [knorkator.de](https://www.knorkator.de/).

bands.name: Future Palace
bands.description: Future Palace is a German post-hardcore and alternative rock band formed in Berlin in 2018. The lineup consists of vocalist Maria Lessing, guitarist Manuel Kohlert, and drummer Johannes Früchtenicht. The band signed with Arising Empire in 2020 and released their debut album, "Escape," on September 18, 2020. Their second album, "Run," followed on June 10, 2022, and their third album, "Distortion," was released on September 6, 2024. In September 2025, Future Palace signed with Century Media Records and released the single "Cyclone." Their music blends post-hardcore and alternative rock with influences from 80s synth-pop and electronica. Lyrically, they explore themes of personal experiences, depression, inner conflicts, and toxic relationships. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Future_Palace))

bands.name: Static-X
bands.description: Static-X is an American industrial metal band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1994. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Wayne Static and drummer Ken Jay. Over the years, Static-X has been known for its unique "Evil Disco" style, blending heavy metal with electronic elements. Their debut album, "Wisconsin Death Trip," released in 1999, achieved platinum status and featured the hit single "Push It." The band's discography includes several albums, such as "Machine" (2001), "Shadow Zone" (2003), "Start a War" (2005), "Cannibal" (2007), and "Cult of Static" (2009). After Wayne Static's passing in 2014, the surviving members reunited in 2018 with a new vocalist, Xer0, to honor his legacy and continue the band's musical journey. In 2020, they released "Project Regeneration Vol. 1," featuring previously unreleased tracks with Wayne Static's vocals. The follow-up, "Project Regeneration Vol. 2," was released in 2023, further solidifying Static-X's enduring presence in the metal scene.

bands.name: Enslaved
bands.description: Enslaved is a Norwegian extreme metal band formed in 1991 by Ivar Bjørnson and Grutle Kjellson in Haugesund. Initially rooted in black metal, they have evolved into a progressive black and Viking metal sound, drawing heavily on Norse mythology and Viking heritage. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Vikingligr Veldi" (1994), "Frost" (1994), "Eld" (1997), "Vertebrae" (2008), and "Heimdal" (2023). The current lineup features Ivar Bjørnson (guitar, keyboards), Grutle Kjellson (vocals, bass), Arve Isdal (guitar), Håkon Vinje (keyboard, vocals), and Iver Sandøy (drums).

bands.name: Uuhai
bands.description: Uuhai is a Mongolian folk metal band formed in 2020, known for blending traditional Mongolian instruments and throat singing with modern metal elements. The band's name, "Uuhai," translates to "hoo-rah," a chant historically used by heroic men to unite their voices in battle, symbolizing strength and unity. This cultural heritage is reflected in their music, which incorporates instruments like the Morin Khuur (horsehead fiddle) and the Tovshuur, alongside modern metal instrumentation. Their vocal style features Khoomei, a form of throat singing, adding a unique depth to their sound. Uuhai's discography includes singles such as "Secret History of the Mongols," released in 2022, showcasing their ability to tell tales from Mongolian mythology and history through music. The band has gained international recognition, performing at festivals like Hornerfest, Leyendas del Rock, and Bloodstock Open Air, captivating audiences with their distinctive fusion of traditional and modern sounds. Their performances often feature traditional Mongolian garments and instruments, creating an immersive cultural experience for listeners.

bands.name: Stam1na
bands.description: Stam1na is a Finnish metal band formed in 1996 in Lemi, South Karelia. Initially a trio, the lineup expanded over the years to include bassist Kai-Pekka "Kaikka" Kangasmäki in 2005 and keyboardist Emil "Hippi" Lähteenmäki in 2009. Their music is characterized by a blend of thrash metal with progressive, death, alternative, and punk influences, all performed in Finnish. The band is known for using seven-string guitars on most albums, with some tracks composed for eight-string guitars on their eighth album, "Taival". Their self-titled debut album, released in 2005, reached No. 13 on the Finnish album charts. Subsequent albums, such as "Uudet kymmenen käskyä" (2006) and "Raja" (2008), achieved even greater success, topping the charts in Finland. In 2012, "Nocebo" topped the Finnish album chart and was certified gold on the day of its release. Their sixth album, "SLK", was released in February 2014. In 2016, they released "Elokuutio", followed by "Taival" in 2018. Their eighth studio album, "Taival", was released in 2018. The band has also toured internationally, including performances on the 70,000 Tons of Metal cruise in 2017 and as part of the "Arctic Circle Alliance" with Skálmöld and Omnium Gatherum (2017-2018).

bands.name: From Fall To Spring
bands.description: From Fall To Spring is a German metalcore band formed in 2008 in Neunkirchen, Saarland. Initially known as Basement Project, the group began with brothers Philip and Lukas Wilhelm, along with Benedikt Veith, Matthias Hansen, and Marius Meinecke. They released two self-produced EPs, 'A Better Tomorrow' in 2017 and 'Disconnected' in 2019, amassing over one million streams. Their debut album, 'RISE,' released in April 2023 under Arising Empire, charted at #73 on the German Albums Chart and garnered over 20 million streams. The band's style blends metalcore with elements of nu-metal and post-hardcore, drawing comparisons to acts like Bring Me the Horizon and Architects. In 2025, they released their second album, 'ENTRY WOUNDS,' showcasing a more introspective sound. The current lineup includes twin brothers Philip and Lukas Wilhelm (vocals and guitar), Simon Triem (keyboard), Sebastian Monzel (guitar), León Arend (bass), and Benedikt Veith (drums). ([fromfalltospring.de](https://fromfalltospring.de/))

bands.name: Marduk
bands.description: Marduk is a Swedish black metal band formed in Norrköping in 1990. The band's name is derived from the Babylonian storm god Marduk, chosen to convey a blasphemous irony, as the deity represents light, contrasting with the band's dark themes. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/review/marduk-memento-mori/)) Their debut album, "Dark Endless," released in 1992, combined black metal with death metal elements. Subsequent albums like "Those of the Unlight" (1993) and "Opus Nocturne" (1994) showcased a more melodic black metal approach, with "Opus Nocturne" introducing faster blast beats. The 1996 album "Heaven Shall Burn... When We Are Gathered" marked a shift towards hyper-blast beats and raw vocals, solidifying their reputation for intensity. Throughout their career, Marduk has been known for their aggressive style and controversial themes, often exploring topics like war, death, and Satanism. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Nightwing" (1998), "Panzer Division Marduk" (1999), and "Frontschwein" (2015). The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with guitarist Morgan Steinmeyer Håkansson being the consistent member. As of 2025, the current lineup includes vocalist Mortuus, guitarist Morgan Steinmeyer Håkansson, bassist Simon, and drummer Bloodhammer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marduk_%28band%29))

bands.name: Nevermore
bands.description: Nevermore is an American heavy metal band from Seattle, Washington, formed in 1992. The band was established by vocalist Warrel Dane, bassist Jim Sheppard, and guitarist Jeff Loomis after their previous band, Sanctuary, disbanded. They were later joined by drummer Van Williams in 1994. Nevermore's music is characterized by a fusion of progressive metal, thrash metal, power metal, and classic heavy metal, often incorporating elements of death metal. Their debut album, "Nevermore," was released in 1995, followed by "The Politics of Ecstasy" in 1996. The band underwent several lineup changes over the years, with notable members including guitarist Pat O'Brien and drummer Tim Calvert. After a hiatus in 2011, the band reunited in 2024, with Loomis and Williams announcing plans for a new lineup and performances in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevermore))

bands.name: Thy Art Is Murder
bands.description:
Thy Art Is Murder is an Australian deathcore band formed in 2006 in Blacktown, New South Wales. The band has released six studio albums:

- **The Adversary** (2010): Debut album featuring vocalist Chris "CJ" McMahon, guitarist Sean Delander, bassist Mick Low, and drummer Lee Stanton. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Adversary_%28Thy_Art_Is_Murder_album%29))

- **Hate** (2012): The band's second album, which debuted at No. 35 on the ARIA Charts, making them the first extreme metal band to break the top 40. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_%28Thy_Art_Is_Murder_album%29))

- **Holy War** (2015): Released on 26 June 2015, it debuted at No. 7 in Australia and No. 82 in the U.S. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_War_%28%C3%A1lbum_de_Thy_Art_Is_Murder%29))

- **Dear Desolation** (2017): Released on 18 August 2017 by Nuclear Blast. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dear_Desolation))

- **Human Target** (2019): Released on 26 July 2019 through Nuclear Blast Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thy_Art_Is_Murder))

- **Godlike** (2023): Released on 22 September 2023. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Thy_Art_Is_Murder/Godlike/1136799))

The band's music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, intricate drum patterns, and guttural vocals, blending elements of death metal with hardcore influences. Their lyrics often delve into dark and personal topics, appealing to fans who appreciate raw emotion in music.

The current lineup includes vocalist Tyler Miller, guitarists Sean Delander and Andy Marsh, bassist Kevin Butler, and drummer Jesse Beahler. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thy_Art_Is_Murder))

([thyartismurder.net](https://www.thyartismurder.net/))

bands.name: President
bands.description: President (stylized as PRESIDENT) is an anonymous English metal band formed in 2025. The band emerged with a mysterious image, featuring a frontman known as The President, who is described as having silver hair and wearing an eerie, lifelike mask. The lineup includes Heist (guitarist), Protest (bassist), and Vice (drummer). Their debut single, "In the Name of the Father," was released on May 15, 2025, followed by "Fearless" on June 5, 2025. The band's debut EP, "King of Terrors," was released on September 26, 2025, showcasing their blend of alternative metal with electronic and cinematic elements. The EP includes tracks like "Rage," which is described as a "swirling, synth-laden cut," and "Destroy Me," released on September 4, 2025. The band has been praised for their theatrical live performances, including their debut at the Download Festival in June 2025. They are set to headline the TakeDown Festival 2026 in April 2026.

bands.name: Beyond The Black
bands.description: Beyond the Black is a German symphonic metal band formed in Mannheim in 2014. Their debut album, "Songs of Love and Death," released in 2015, achieved immediate success, entering the German and Austrian music charts. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with vocalist Jennifer Haben being the consistent member. Their music is characterized by powerful vocals, orchestral elements, and a blend of metal subgenres. They have released several albums, including "Lost in Forever" (2016), "Heart of the Hurricane" (2018), "Hørizøns" (2020), and their self-titled album "Beyond the Black" (2023). The band has toured extensively, performing at major European festivals and supporting acts like Aerosmith, Korn, and Within Temptation. In 2024, they embarked on their most successful European headline tour to date, "Dancing in the Dark," and announced their upcoming "Rising High" tour set to begin in January 2026. ([beyond-the-black.com](https://beyond-the-black.com/))

bands.name: Linkin Park
bands.description:
Linkin Park is an American rock band formed in Agoura Hills, California, in 1996. The band's current lineup consists of vocalist/rhythm guitarist/keyboardist Mike Shinoda, lead guitarist Brad Delson, DJ/turntablist Joe Hahn, bassist Dave Farrell, vocalist Emily Armstrong, and drummer Colin Brittain. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linkin_Park))

The band rose to prominence with their debut album, "Hybrid Theory" (2000), which blended alternative rock, nu metal, and electronic elements, earning them a global fanbase. They followed up with "Meteora" (2003), solidifying their status in the rock scene. After the tragic death of lead vocalist Chester Bennington in 2017, the band went on hiatus. In 2024, they returned with "From Zero," featuring Armstrong as the new vocalist, marking a new chapter in their musical journey. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/61e0de30548b90932fe1d4102a07641d))

"From Zero" debuted at number one in 14 countries and includes the hit single "The Emptiness Machine," which became the most-streamed rock song of 2024. The band embarked on the "From Zero World Tour" in 2025, performing in North America, Latin America, Oceania, and Europe. ([linkinparktour.org](https://www.linkinparktour.org/))

Linkin Park's music is characterized by a fusion of heavy guitar riffs, hip-hop rhythms, and electronic textures, creating anthemic, high-energy sound that has reshaped modern rock. ([linkinparktour.org](https://www.linkinparktour.org/))

For more information, visit their official website: https://www.linkinpark.com/

bands.name: Inhuman Nature
bands.description: Formed in 2017 in London, Inhuman Nature is a dynamic crossover thrash metal band that seamlessly blends the raw energy of hardcore punk with the aggressive riffage of thrash metal. Drawing inspiration from 1980s legends like D.R.I. and Cryptic Slaughter, they have rapidly established themselves as a formidable force in the UK metal scene. Their debut EP, "Under the Boot," released in 2019 via Clobber Records, showcased their relentless energy and set the stage for their self-titled debut album in 2023. Building on this momentum, they released "Greater Than Death" in April 2025 through Church Road Records. This sophomore album captures the band's live fury with a mix that is crisp, raw, and crushing, featuring tracks like "Possessed to Die" and "Servants of Annihilation." Known for their electrifying live performances, Inhuman Nature has toured extensively across the UK and Europe, sharing stages with acts such as Crowbar, High Command, Heriot, and Grove Street. Their music is characterized by fast, relentless tempos and anthemic choruses, making them a staple in the crossover thrash genre.

bands.name: Draconian
bands.description: Draconian is a Swedish gothic metal and death-doom band formed in 1994 in Säffle. Initially known as Kerberos, the band underwent a lineup change when vocalist and lyricist Anders Jacobsson joined, leading to the name change to Draconian. Their first demo, "Shades of a Lost Moon," was recorded in 1995 but did not secure a recording contract. In 2002, they released "Dark Oceans We Cry," featuring vocalist Lisa Johansson, which garnered positive reviews and led to a deal with Napalm Records. Their debut album, "Where Lovers Mourn," was released in 2003, followed by "Arcane Rain Fell" in 2005. In 2011, "A Rose for the Apocalypse" was released, and in 2015, "Sovran" introduced vocalist Heike Langhans. "Under a Godless Veil," released in 2020, marked the band's return with Johansson after Langhans's departure. The band's music is characterized by a melancholic atmosphere, blending heavy doom riffs with orchestral arrangements and contrasting deep growls with clean vocals.

bands.name: Predatory Void
bands.description: Predatory Void is a Belgian metal band formed in 2022 in Ghent, Belgium. The band emerged from the 'Church of Ra' collective, which includes members from Amenra and Oathbreaker. The formation began when Lennart Bossu, known for his work with Amenra and Oathbreaker, started composing material that didn't align with his primary bands. Seeking a new musical outlet, he gathered vocalist Lina R, guitarist Thijs de Cloedt, bassist Tim De Gieter, and drummer Vincent Verstrepen to bring this project to life. Their music blends elements of black, sludge, and death metal, characterized by heavy, distorted guitar riffs, deep basslines, and atmospheric vocals. Lyrically, they explore themes of depression, anger, and anxiety, delving into the darker aspects of human existence. In April 2023, they released their debut album, "Seven Keys to the Discomfort of Being," via Century Media Records. The album features tracks like "Grovel," "*(struggling..)," and "Endless Return to the Kingdom of Sleep." The band has performed at notable festivals such as Soulcrusher and Roadburn, gaining recognition for their intense live performances. In November 2023, bassist Tim De Gieter left the band to focus on other projects, and Kris Auman joined as the new bassist.

bands.name: The Offspring
bands.description: The Offspring is an American rock band formed in Garden Grove, California, in 1984. Originally known as Manic Subsidal, the band consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Bryan "Dexter" Holland, lead guitarist Kevin "Noodles" Wasserman, bassist Todd Morse, multi-instrumentalist Jonah Nimoy, and drummer Brandon Pertzborn. They are recognized for their energetic performances and catchy tunes, contributing significantly to the mainstream popularity of punk rock in the 1990s. Their 1994 album "Smash" sold over 11 million copies worldwide, making it one of the best-selling independent albums of all time. In 2024, they released their eleventh studio album, "Supercharged," featuring singles like "Make It All Right" and "Light It Up." The band is currently on the "Supercharged Worldwide in '25 Tour," performing across North America, Europe, and Australia. ([superchargedworldwidein25.com](https://superchargedworldwidein25.com/))

bands.name: Motorjesus
bands.description: Motorjesus is a German hard rock band formed in 1990 in Mönchengladbach, originally under the name The Shitheadz. They changed their name to Motorjesus in 2006, inspired by a track from their debut album. The band's music blends heavy metal and hard rock, characterized by powerful riffs and energetic performances. Their discography includes several albums, such as "Dirty Pounding Gasoline" (2011), "Race to Resurrection" (2018), and "Hellbreaker" (2021). In 2025, they released "Streets of Fire," featuring tracks like "Somewhere from Beyond" and "New Messiah of Steel." The current lineup consists of vocalist Chris Birx, guitarist Andreas Peters, guitarist Patrick Wassenberg, bassist Dominik Kwasny, and drummer Adam Borosch.

bands.name: Electric Callboy
bands.description: Electric Callboy, formerly known as Eskimo Callboy, is a German electronicore band formed in Castrop-Rauxel in 2010. They are renowned for blending metalcore with electronic elements, creating a distinctive sound characterized by energetic performances and humorous videos. The band's early releases include their self-titled EP in 2010 and their debut album, "Bury Me in Vegas," released in 2012. In 2014, they released "We Are the Mess," which peaked at number 8 on the German charts. The 2017 album "The Scene" featured the popular single "MC Thunder." In 2019, they released "Rehab," followed by the EP "MMXX" in 2020. A significant turning point came in 2020 with the release of "Hypa Hypa," which achieved gold certification and marked the band's rebranding to Electric Callboy. Their 2022 album "Tekkno" debuted at number 1 on the German charts. In 2024, they collaborated with Japanese metal band BABYMETAL on the single "RATATATA," which gained international attention. In 2025, they released singles "Elevator Operator" and "Revery," showcasing their evolving musical style.

bands.name: Excrementory Grindfuckers
bands.description: Excrementory Grindfuckers are a German grindcore band from Hanover, formed on May 22, 2001, by Rob and Him as a recording project. They gained popularity by blending grindcore with catchy pop, rock, and schlager melodies, creating a unique sound that resonated within the extreme metal scene. Their debut album, "Guts, Gore & Grind," released in 2001, featured both original compositions and satirical covers of well-known songs. Over the years, the band has released several albums, including "Fertig machen, Szene putzen!" (2004), "Bitte nicht vor den Gästen" (2007), "Headliner der Herzen" (2010), "Aus Liebe zum Geld" (2012), "Ohne kostet extra" (2013), "Rampampampamm! – Weihnachten mit den Grindfuckers" (2014), "Vorsprung durch Hektik" (2016), "Musik zum Kopfschütteln" (2019), and their latest EP, "Die Rückkehr der fleischgewordenen Schnapsidee" (2023). Known for their energetic live performances, they have played at major metal festivals such as Wacken Open Air and Summer Breeze. Their music is characterized by a mix of grindcore, fun metal, and humorous elements, often parodying popular songs and themes. The current lineup includes Rob (vocals, guitar), Christus (drums), Kai (vocals), Mike (vocals, keyboard), ND (bass), and Piggy (guitar).

bands.name: Funeral
bands.description: Funeral is a Norwegian doom metal band formed in 1991 in Drammen, Norway. They are considered pioneers of the funeral doom genre, known for their slow tempos, melancholic melodies, and atmospheric compositions. The band's early style was characterized by funeral doom and death/doom metal elements, evolving into gothic/doom metal in later years. Their music often explores themes of loneliness, sadness, doom, and yearning. Funeral's discography includes several albums, with their most recent release being "To Mourn Is a Virtue" in 2011. The band has experienced lineup changes over the years, with notable members including Thomas Angell, Anders Eek, Einar André Frederiksen, and Christian Loos. Tragically, vocalist Sindre Nedland passed away from cancer on March 2, 2025.

bands.name: Rectal Smegma
bands.description: Rectal Smegma is a Dutch band formed in 2003 in Naaldwijk, South Holland, known for their brutal goregrind sound infused with groove, blastbeats, and a humorous party vibe. Over the years, the band has undergone lineup changes, particularly in guitar and bass positions, but since 2015, they have been stronger—and drunker—than ever. Their music has evolved from primitive porn goregrind to a fast, aggressive mix of blasting goregrind, groovy death metal, and even some punk influences. With six full-length albums and several split releases, Rectal Smegma has toured extensively across Europe, Mexico, Japan, and South America, playing major festivals like Wacken Open Air, Hellfest, Summer Breeze, PartySan, and Obscene Extreme. In 2024, they released their highly anticipated sixth studio album, "To Serve and Protect," marking a new milestone in their career. The album was met with enthusiastic responses from fans and critics alike, delivering a relentless barrage of grooves, blastbeats, and filthy riffs. The band is set to embark on a tour through Asia and participate in major festivals throughout the summer of 2025, with new material in the works and an insatiable hunger for the stage.

bands.name: Mütterlein
bands.description:
Mütterlein is a French solo project founded in 2014 by Marion Leclercq, formerly of the post-hardcore band Overmars. The project emerged from Leclercq's desire to explore darker musical territories, blending elements of dark wave, gothic rock, and dark folk. The name 'Mütterlein' is a reference to Nico's song from the album 'Desertshore,' which deals with the impossible mourning of the maternal bond. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BCtterlein?utm_source=openai))

In 2016, Mütterlein released its debut EP, 'Orphans of the Black Sun,' through Sundust Records, a label co-founded by Vindsval of Blut Aus Nord and Phil of Debemur Morti Productions. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BCtterlein?utm_source=openai)) The EP showcased a minimalist and ritualistic approach, combining post-punk savagery with doom and noise influences.

The project's second album, 'Bring Down the Flags,' was released in late 2021 by Debemur Morti Productions. This album delved deeper into dark, haunting, and immediate soundscapes, incorporating electronic sounds and blackened industrial atmospheres. ([debemur-morti.com](https://www.debemur-morti.com/en/news/654_muetterlein-disclose-album-details.html?utm_source=openai))

In early 2025, Mütterlein announced its third album, 'Amidst the Flames, May Our Organs Resound,' set for release on May 9, 2025. The album explores the profound scars left by oppression throughout history, featuring an abrasive and darkly cinematic industrial soundscape. ([debemur-morti.com](https://www.debemur-morti.com/en/286-mutterlein?utm_source=openai))

Throughout its evolution, Mütterlein has collaborated with artists such as TREHA SEKTORI and LIMBES, further expanding its experimental and avant-garde approach to metal music.

bands.name: The Spirit
bands.description: Formed in 2015 in Saarbrücken, Germany, The Spirit is a black/death metal band known for their cosmic and misanthropic themes. Their music blends black and death metal elements, characterized by intricate guitar riffs and melodies. Lyrically, they explore cosmic motifs, misanthropy, and the human mind, encouraging listeners to view human existence within the vast universe. In 2017, they self-released their debut album, "Sounds from the Vortex," through their own label, Eternal Echoes. The album received critical acclaim, leading to a re-release via Nuclear Blast in 2018. The band toured extensively in 2018, performing at festivals like Party.San and Summer Breeze, and joined Hypocrisy on a European tour. Their second album, "Cosmic Terror," was released in 2020, entering the German album charts at #40. Their third album, "Of Clarity and Galactic Structures," released in 2022, peaked at #19 on the German charts. In 2024, they released "Songs Against Humanity," showcasing a more straightforward and catchy approach while maintaining their aggressive and melodic style. The current lineup consists of Matthias Trautes (vocals, guitars, bass) and Manuel Steitz (drums), with live performances featuring Stanley Robertson (guitar) and Kevin Schautzer (bass).

bands.name: Castle Rat
bands.description:
Castle Rat is a medieval fantasy doom metal band from Brooklyn, New York City, formed in 2019. The band is led by "The Rat Queen," Riley Pinkerton, who serves as the lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist. Joining her are "The Count," Franco Vittore, on lead guitar and backing vocals; "The Plague Doctor," Charley Ruddell, on bass; and "The All-Seeing Druid," Joshua Strmic, on drums. Together, they embark on a mission to expand and defend "The Realm" from those who seek to destroy it, facing the relentless wrath of their arch-nemesis: "The Rat Reaperess." ([soundofliberation.com](https://www.soundofliberation.com/artists/castle-rat?utm_source=openai))

Since their inception, Castle Rat has been known for their theatrical live performances, complete with choreographed battle scenes and a strong emphasis on fantasy themes. They have shared stages with bands like Monolord, Acid King, and Green Lung, and have appeared at festivals such as Desertfest NYC, RPM Fest, and Hopsmoker. ([secretservicepr.com](https://www.secretservicepr.com/epk/castlerat?utm_source=openai))

In April 2024, they released their debut album, "Into The Realm," which garnered over one million Spotify streams and topped the Bandcamp charts as the #1 Best-Selling Hard Rock/All Rock Album upon its release. ([ghostcultmag.com](https://ghostcultmag.com/castle-rat-releases-their-debut-album-into-the-realm/?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, "The Bestiary," was released on September 19, 2025, through King Volume Records in the United States and Blues Funeral Recordings in the U.K. and Europe. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Castle_Rat/The_Bestiary/1348206?utm_source=openai))

Castle Rat's music is characterized by heavy, sludgy riffs and a strong emphasis on fantasy storytelling, drawing comparisons to bands like Black Sabbath and Electric Wizard. Their live shows are a blend of music and theatrical performance, appealing to fans of both heavy metal and fantasy genres. ([revolvermag.com](https://www.revolvermag.com/feature/how-castle-rat-turn-high-fantasy-into-heavy-metal-reality/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Abbath
bands.description: Abbath is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2015 by former Immortal guitarist and vocalist Abbath Doom Occulta (Olve Eikemo) after his departure from Immortal earlier that year. The band made its live debut at the Tuska Open Air festival in Finland in June 2015, performing a mix of Immortal classics and new material. Their self-titled debut album was released on January 22, 2016, through Season of Mist, featuring tracks that Abbath had originally prepared for the next Immortal album. The lineup for this album included Abbath on vocals, guitars, and bass, Creature on drums, and King Ov Hell on bass. In 2019, Abbath released their second album, "Outstrider," which showcased a new lineup and continued their exploration of black metal with elements of speed and traditional metal. The band's third album, "Dread Reaver," was released on March 25, 2022, further solidifying Abbath's position in the black metal scene. The current lineup consists of Abbath on vocals and guitars, Ukri Suvilehto on drums, and Raud on lead and acoustic guitars. Abbath's music is characterized by blistering speed metal, traditional metal influences, and a touch of cold black metal, creating a sound that is distinctly his own.

bands.name: Wheel
bands.description: Wheel is a Finnish progressive metal band formed in 2015 in Helsinki. The band was established when UK-born vocalist and guitarist James Lascelles relocated to Finland and connected with local musicians. Their music is characterized by intricate time signatures, bass-driven polyrhythms, and post-punk interludes, drawing influences from bands like Tool, Karnivool, Meshuggah, Radiohead, and The Mars Volta. Wheel's discography includes their debut single "The Path" (2017), the four-track EP "The Divide" (2018), and their first full-length album "Moving Backwards" (2019). In 2021, they released "Resident Human," which received critical acclaim for its sonic evolution and dystopian themes. Their latest album, "Charismatic Leaders," was released in 2024, featuring the single "Porcelain." The current lineup consists of James Lascelles (vocals, guitar), Santeri Saksala (drums), Jussi Turunen (lead guitar), and Jere Lehto (bass).

bands.name: Destruction
bands.description: Destruction is a German thrash metal band formed in 1982 in Weil am Rhein, Germany. They are often credited as one of the "Big Four" of the German thrash metal scene, alongside Kreator, Sodom, and Tankard. The band was part of the second wave of thrash metal in the mid-to-late 1980s, alongside U.S. bands like Testament, Sacred Reich, Death Angel, and Dark Angel. Destruction's music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, rapid drumming, and politically charged lyrics. Their early work, such as the 1984 EP "Sentence of Death," is noted for its black metal influences, a style sometimes referred to as "black thrash." Over the years, Destruction has released numerous albums, including "Infernal Overkill" (1985), "Eternal Devastation" (1986), and "Born to Perish" (2019). Their 2022 album "Diabolical" and the 2024 release "Birth of Malice" continue to showcase their raw and brutal thrash sound. The current lineup consists of Marcel "Schmier" Schirmer on vocals and bass, Martin Furia and Damir Eskić on guitars, and Randy Black on drums. Destruction remains a significant influence in the thrash metal genre, known for their energetic performances and enduring presence in the metal community.

bands.name: Coffin Feeder
bands.description: Coffin Feeder is a Belgian deathcore band formed in 2021, uniting veterans from the metal and hardcore scenes. The lineup includes vocalist Sven De Caluwé (Aborted, Fetal Blood Eagle, ex-Leng Tch'e), guitarists and vocalists Jeroen Camerlynck and Bart Govers (Fleddy Melculy), bassist Jan Hallaert (Leng Tch'e), and drummer Siebe Hermans. Their music blends groove-laden death metal, grind, and hardcore, drawing inspiration from 1980s and 1990s action movies. Their debut EP, "Stereo Homicide," released in January 2022, features tracks like "Plug It In," which delves into the stories of serial killers Henry Lee Lucas and Otis Toole. In April 2025, they released their full-length album, "Big Trouble," produced by Dave Otero, paying homage to films such as "Big Trouble in Little China," "Predator," and "Die Hard." ([metalinjection.net](https://metalinjection.net/new-music/coffin-feeder-aborted-unleashes-brutality-with-new-song-plug-it-in?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Thrown
bands.description: Thrown is a Swedish metalcore band formed in 2019 in Stockholm. The lineup consists of vocalist Marcus Lundqvist, guitarists Johan Liljeblad and Andreas Malm, and drummer/producer Buster Odeholm, known for his work with Humanity's Last Breath and Vildhjärta. The band blends elements of metalcore, nu-metal, and beatdown hardcore, creating a sound characterized by intense aggression and raw energy. In 2022, Thrown released their debut EP, "Extended Pain," which gained significant attention, amassing over 50 million streams on Spotify and remaining on the Top 200 Global Metal Chart for nearly a year. This success led to extensive touring with bands like Counterparts, Fit for a King, and Spite. On August 30, 2024, they released their debut album, "Excessive Guilt," featuring 11 tracks totaling just over 20 minutes. The album debuted at #3 on the Swedish Hard Rock Albums Chart and received praise for its suffocating brevity and nu-metalcore bite. Thrown's dynamic performances and unique sound have solidified their position as a rising force in the metal scene.

bands.name: Luna Kills
bands.description: Luna Kills is a Finnish alternative metal band formed in 2019, known for their dynamic fusion of alternative and nu-metal elements, complemented by electronic influences reminiscent of video game soundtracks. Fronted by vocalist Lotta Ruutiainen, who brings a unique blend of jazz-influenced clean vocals and powerful fry screams, the band delivers an intense and emotionally charged musical experience. Their debut album, "DEATHMATCH," released on April 4, 2025, via SharpTone Records, showcases their raw energy and unflinching honesty. The album features tracks like "love u," "LEECH," "SADIST," "sugar rush," "slay ur enemies," "hallucinate," "WAVES," "get mad," "burn the world with me," and "fever dream," each delving into themes of mental health, self-doubt, and the pursuit of happiness. Prior to the album's release, Luna Kills garnered attention with singles such as "slay ur enemies," "sugar rush," "LEECH," and "WAVES," each accompanied by compelling music videos that highlight the band's evolving sound and thematic depth. Their music has also been featured in the popular mobile app Beatstar, indicating a growing presence in the gaming community. Luna Kills has embarked on several European tours and festival appearances, including performances in Finland, the Netherlands, and Poland, sharing stages with acts like Blind Channel and Warmen. Their live shows are characterized by high energy and audience engagement, solidifying their reputation as a rising force in the modern metal scene.

bands.name: Wednesday 13
bands.description: Wednesday 13, born Joseph Michael Poole on August 12, 1976, in Lexington, North Carolina, is an American singer and musician renowned for his contributions to the horror punk and heavy metal genres. He began his musical career in 1992 with the band Mizery, which later became Psycho Opera. In 1996, he formed Frankenstein Drag Queens from Planet 13, a band that blended punk influences with theatrical elements. In 2002, Poole joined Murderdolls, a horror punk band formed by Joey Jordison of Slipknot, where he served as the lead vocalist and bassist. After Murderdolls went on hiatus in 2004, Poole embarked on a solo career under the moniker Wednesday 13, releasing his debut album, "Transylvania 90210: Songs of Death, Dying, and the Dead," in 2005. His music is characterized by a fusion of horror punk, heavy metal, and gothic metal, often drawing inspiration from classic horror films and B-movies. Over the years, Wednesday 13 has released several albums, including "Fang Bang" (2006), "Skeletons" (2008), "Calling All Corpses" (2011), "The Dixie Dead" (2013), "Condolences" (2017), "Necrophaze" (2019), and "Horrifier" (2022). In 2025, he announced his tenth studio album, "Mid Death Crisis," set for release on April 25, 2025, via Napalm Records. The album is described as a sleaze-fueled goth rock gorefest, featuring music written entirely by Poole and produced by guitarist Alex Kane. The current lineup includes Wednesday 13 on lead vocals and guitar, Jack Tankersley on guitar, Troy Doebbler on bass, Mike Dupke on drums, and Ashes on lead guitar. The band's official website is [officialwednesday13.com](https://officialwednesday13.com/).

bands.name: Scour
bands.description: Scour is an American black metal supergroup formed in 2015, featuring vocalist Phil Anselmo (Pantera, Down), guitarists Derek Engemann (ex-Cattle Decapitation) and Mark Kloeppel (Misery Index), bassist John Jarvis (Agoraphobic Nosebleed), and drummer Adam Jarvis (Pig Destroyer, Misery Index). The band debuted with the single "Dispatched" in 2016, followed by their first EP, "The Grey EP," released through Anselmo's Housecore Records. Their second EP, "The Red EP," came in 2017, and in 2020, they released "The Black EP," featuring guest appearances from Erik Rutan (Hate Eternal, Cannibal Corpse), Pat O'Brien (ex-Cannibal Corpse), and actor Jason Momoa. In 2025, Scour released their first full-length album, "Gold," which includes a guest solo by Gary Holt (Slayer, Exodus) on the track "Coin." The band's sound is a modern reimagining of black metal, mixed with elements of grindcore, punk, and thrash, creating a punishing minimalism that pays homage to the genre's roots while reimagining its lineage. Scour has performed at major metal festivals such as Roskilde, Hellfest, Tecate Metal Fest, and Maryland Deathfest.

bands.name: Combichrist
bands.description: Combichrist is an American industrial metal band formed in 2003 by Norwegian vocalist Andy LaPlegua, who also founded Icon of Coil, Panzer AG, Scandinavian Cock, and Scandy. Initially based in Atlanta, Georgia, the band has undergone several lineup changes over the years. LaPlegua serves as the primary member in the studio, with a rotating cast of live performers. The band's music has evolved from its early aggressive electronic roots to incorporate heavier metal elements, appealing to both industrial and metal audiences. Combichrist's discography includes notable albums such as "The Joy of Gunz" (2003), "Everybody Hates You" (2005), "What the Fuck Is Wrong with You People?" (2007), "Today We Are All Demons" (2009), "We Love You" (2014), "This Is Where Death Begins" (2016), "One Fire" (2019), "CMBCRST" (2024), and the single "Desolation" (2025). The band's energetic live performances have garnered them a dedicated fan base worldwide.

bands.name: Múr
bands.description: Múr is an Icelandic metal band formed in 2018, originating from Reykjavík. Their musical style is characterized by a blend of progressive metal and post-metal, creating atmospheric and cinematic soundscapes. The band was formed by vocalist and keyboardist Kári Haraldsson, who, along with guitarists Hilmir Árnason and Jón Ísak Ragnarsson, had been friends since school. They initially played cover versions of their favorite songs in a garage setting. Later, they attended a music school where they studied jazz music and met future members: drummer Árni Jökull Guðbjartsson and bassist Ívar Andri Klausen. In 2021, Múr participated in the Wacken Metal Battle, securing first place in Iceland and fourth place internationally. This achievement led to increased recognition and opportunities within the metal community. On September 18, 2024, Múr released their debut single, "Heimsslit," followed by "Frelsari" in October. In November 2024, they released their self-titled debut album, "Múr," under Century Media Records. The album features tracks like "Eldhaf," "Múr," "Frelsari," "Vitrun," "Messa," "Heimsslit," and "Holskefla," showcasing their dynamic range and depth. The band's music is noted for its introspective and emotionally charged compositions, often described as a "sonic wall" of raw intensity. Their sound has drawn comparisons to genre-benders like Cult of Luna and Sólstafir. Múr continues to gain traction in the metal scene, with their innovative approach and compelling performances.

bands.name: Hierophant
bands.description: Formed in 2009 in Ravenna, Italy, Hierophant is a black/death metal band known for their relentless and furious approach to extreme metal. Their discography includes albums such as "Mass Grave" (2016) and "Death Siege" (2022), both released on Season of Mist. In 2024, they released their first live album, "Gateway to the Abyss," recorded at Hellfest. In 2025, Hierophant signed with Agonia Records for their sixth studio album, expected in 2026. Their music is characterized by themes of anti-religion and misanthropy.

bands.name: Evil Scarecrow
bands.description: Evil Scarecrow is a British metal band formed in Nottingham, England, in 2002. Known for their unique blend of black and thrash metal, they infuse their music with humor and parody, creating a distinctive and entertaining sound. The band has released several albums, including "Crowcifiction" (2006), "Chapter IV: Antartarctica" (2018), and "Silicon Tea" (2025). Their energetic live performances are celebrated for their theatrical elements and audience engagement, making them a standout act in the metal scene.

bands.name: Cavern Deep
bands.description: Cavern Deep is a Swedish doom metal trio formed in 2019 in Umeå, Västerbotten. The band comprises Max Malmer (bass, vocals), Dennis Sjödin (drums, vocals, keyboards), and Kenny Oswald Dufvenberg (vocals, guitars). They are known for their atmospheric and heavy sound, blending elements of doom and psychedelic rock. Their debut self-titled album was released on July 23, 2021, through Interstellar Smoke Records, featuring tracks like "Staring Down" and "Abandoned Quarters." ([doomed-nation.com](https://doomed-nation.com/cavern-deep-releases-their-self-titled-debut-album-available-now-on-all-digital-platforms-and-on-vinyl-via-interstellar-smoke-records/?utm_source=openai)) In 2023, they released "Part II – Breach," continuing their conceptual trilogy. ([progrockjournal.com](https://progrockjournal.com/news-cavern-deep-published-the-full-album-music-video-for-their-new-concept-album-part-ii-breach/?utm_source=openai)) The final installment, "Part III – The Bodiless," was announced for release on May 9, 2025, via Bonebag Records and Majestic Mountain Records. ([decibelmagazine.com](https://www.decibelmagazine.com/2025/02/27/video-premiere-cavern-deep-queen-womb/?utm_source=openai)) The band has also unveiled a haunting video for the single "Queen Womb," showcasing their evolving sound. ([decibelmagazine.com](https://www.decibelmagazine.com/2025/02/27/video-premiere-cavern-deep-queen-womb/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bölzer
bands.description: Bölzer is a Swiss extreme metal duo formed in Zürich in 2008, consisting of Okoi Thierry "KzR" Jones on vocals and guitar, and Fabian "HzR" Wyrsch on drums. The band's name, "Bölzer," is derived from a colloquial German term meaning "a powerful force or blow or strike that has no regard for the consequences or the repercussions." Initially, the duo sought to include a bassist but eventually decided to proceed without one, creating a distinctive sound characterized by a ten-string guitar played by Jones and a powerful drum performance by Wyrsch. Their music blends elements of black and death metal, resulting in a raw, atmospheric sound that has garnered critical acclaim. In 2012, they released their first demo, "Roman Acupuncture," followed by the EP "Aura" in 2013, which received significant praise from music critics and metal fans. Their debut full-length album, "Hero," was released in 2016, showcasing their evolving musical style. Lyrically, the band draws on mythological themes, ancient cultures, folklore, Nietzsche, and paganism, with Jones citing psychedelics as an influence on their music. They have gained a reputation for their powerful live performances, often described as an "atavistic vortex," delivering a chaotic, spiritual experience that captivates audiences. As of October 2025, Bölzer continues to be active, with recent performances including a tour with Australian band Portal in August 2025 and scheduled appearances at the Mystic Festival in Gdańsk, Poland, in 2026.

bands.name: Soulbound
bands.description:
Soulbound is a German metal band formed in Bielefeld in 2009. They are known for their unique blend of alternative metal, nu metal, and metalcore, creating a distinctive sound that resonates with fans of the Neue Deutsche Härte movement. Their music combines catchy melodies with dystopian and socially critical lyrics, featuring a mix of pounding rhythms, heavy guitars, and aggressive synths. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soulbound?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut album, "Towards the Sun," in March 2012 under Deafground Records. They followed up with "Myllennium" in 2016 and "Addicted to Hell" in 2020, both under Metalville Records. In 2024, they released "obsYdian," continuing their evolution in the metal scene. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soulbound?utm_source=openai))

Soulbound's lineup includes Johannes "Johnny" Stecker on vocals and shouting, Felix Klemisch on guitar, Patrick Winzler on keyboard, Jonas Langer on bass, and Mario Krause on drums. They have been active in the metal community, performing at various festivals and tours, and have a dedicated fan base. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soulbound?utm_source=openai))

Their official website is [www.soulbound.de](https://www.soulbound.de/), where fans can find more information about their music, merchandise, and upcoming events.

bands.name: Abbath Doom Occulta
bands.description: Abbath Doom Occulta, born Olve Eikemo on June 27, 1973, in Bergen, Norway, is a renowned Norwegian musician celebrated for his significant contributions to the black metal genre. He first gained prominence as a founding member of the influential band Immortal, formed in 1990 alongside Demonaz. Immortal's early works, such as "Diabolical Fullmoon Mysticism" (1992) and "Pure Holocaust" (1993), established them as pioneers in the black metal scene. Abbath's versatility is evident in his roles as vocalist, guitarist, bassist, and drummer during his tenure with Immortal. In 2015, following his departure from Immortal, Abbath embarked on a solo career, releasing his self-titled debut album "Abbath" in 2016. This was followed by "Outstrider" in 2019 and "Dread Reaver" in 2022. In 2024, Abbath announced the "Return to the Raven Realms" tour, revisiting material from his Immortal years, showcasing his enduring influence in the metal community.

bands.name: Hyro The Hero
bands.description: Hyro The Hero, born Hyron Louis Fenton Jr. on July 18, 1987, in Houston, Texas, is an American musician known for his unique fusion of hip-hop, punk, and heavy rock elements. After relocating to Los Angeles in 2007, he released his first mixtape, "Gangsta Rock," followed by "Rock & Roll Gangsta" in 2008, and "Belo Horizonte" in 2009. His debut album, "Birth, School, Work, Death," released in 2011, showcased his distinctive style. In 2012, he embarked on his first UK and Ireland tour, performing at the Download Festival and collaborating with Welsh post-hardcore band The Blackout on their single "Higher & Higher." In 2018, he released "Flagged Channel," featuring the single "Bullet," which charted at number 30 on the Mainstream Rock Songs chart. In 2020, he collaborated with David Draiman of Disturbed on the single "We Believe." His third album, "Bound For Glory," released in 2023, featured collaborations with artists like Corey Taylor of Slipknot and David Draiman. In August 2024, he began recording his fourth album in London with members of Asking Alexandria. In August 2025, he released the single "Black Rambo." Hyro The Hero continues to blend genres, creating a sound that resonates with a diverse audience.

bands.name: Hällas
bands.description: Hällas is a Swedish rock band formed in 2011 in Jönköping, Småland, by bassist/vocalist Tommy Alexandersson, drummer Kasper Eriksson, and guitarist Jesper Nodbrant. Initially a blues rock trio, they soon incorporated elements of 1980s heavy metal and adopted a more progressive approach to songwriting. After relocating to Linköping, they met guitarists Marcus Petersson and Alexander Moraitis. Their music blends progressive rock, hard rock, and heavy metal, resulting in a genre they call "adventure rock." They cite 1970s progressive rock bands as influences, including Genesis, Uriah Heep, Cherry Five, Wishbone Ash, Camel, Nektar, Rush, Banco del Mutuo Soccorso, and Kebnekajse. Their discography includes: "Excerpts from a Future Past" (2017), "Conundrum" (2020), "Isle of Wisdom" (2022), and "Panorama" (2026).

bands.name: Septicflesh
bands.description: Septicflesh, formerly known as Septic Flesh, is a Greek death metal band formed in Athens in 1990. The original lineup consisted of Sotiris Vayenas (guitar), Spiros Antoniou (bass and vocals), and Christos Antoniou (guitars). They released their debut EP, "Temple of the Lost Race," in December 1991. Their first full-length album, "Mystic Places of Dawn," was recorded in April 1994 at Storm Studios and co-produced by Magus Wampyr Daoloth, who had previously been the keyboardist for Rotting Christ. In 1995, they released "Esoptron," produced by the band and George Zacharopoulos, recorded and mixed at Storm Studios. In 1997, they introduced female soprano vocalist Natalie Rassoulis on "The Ophidian Wheel," marking a shift towards a more symphonic style. This direction continued with "A Fallen Temple" in 1998. After releasing "Revolution DNA" in 1999 and "Sumerian Daemons" in 2003, the band disbanded in October 2003. Members pursued other projects, with Christos Antoniou continuing his involvement with Chaostar, which he formed in 1998. The band reunited in 2007 and released "Communion" in 2008, produced by Fredrik Nordström. In 2011, they released "The Great Mass," recorded between July and September 2010 at Devasoundz Studios in Greece and The Abyss in Sweden, produced by Peter Tägtgren. The orchestration was written by Christos Antoniou and recorded by the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra. In 2025, they surprise-released a new EP titled "Amphibians," featuring four songs, including the title track, which was accompanied by an animated music video.

bands.name: Anthrax
bands.description: Anthrax is an American heavy metal band formed in 1981 in Queens, New York City, by rhythm guitarist Scott Ian and bassist Dan Lilker. They are recognized as one of the "Big Four" thrash metal bands, alongside Metallica, Megadeth, and Slayer. The band's music is characterized by a blend of thrash metal and groove metal, often incorporating elements of hardcore punk and alternative music. Anthrax's early works, such as their debut album "Fistful of Metal" (1984) and the critically acclaimed "Among the Living" (1987), solidified their reputation in the metal scene. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with Scott Ian and drummer Charlie Benante being the consistent members. Other notable members include bassist Frank Bello, vocalist Joey Belladonna, and lead guitarist Jonathan Donais. Anthrax has released 11 studio albums, with their most recent, "For All Kings," released in 2016. They are set to release their twelfth studio album in 2026. The band has been nominated for multiple Grammy Awards and has sold over 10 million records worldwide.

bands.name: Die Habenichtse
bands.description: Die Habenichtse is a German folk-rock band formed in 2012, originating from Hannover, Mönchengladbach, and Wermelskirchen. The band presents itself as a concept group under the motto "Celebrate life, take what you can, and wander through life," incorporating both lighthearted and deeper lyrical themes. They portray beggars who do not take themselves too seriously. Initially consisting of three musicians and one female vocalist, Die Habenichtse has undergone several lineup changes, stabilizing in 2020. They primarily perform at folk and rock festivals, including the SKH-Spectaculum series, Sündenfrei medieval markets, and the Schlosshof Festival. Their debut album, "Kupfer ist das neue Gold," was released in 2013, produced in a small private studio. The second album, "Trinkpause!" came out in 2017 via Timezone, produced at DocMaKlang studio in Osnabrück. The third album, "Heckenpennerutopie," introduced drums as a permanent element in their sound. The fourth album, "Schmierentheater," was also produced at DocMaKlang and features guest appearances from Mr. Hurley of Mr. Hurley & die Pulveraffen (on "Taverne, Taverne") and Die Streuner (on "Spelunkenvagabunden").

bands.name: The Hu
bands.description: The Hu is a Mongolian folk metal band formed in 2016 in Ulaanbaatar. They blend traditional Mongolian instruments, such as the morin khuur (horsehead fiddle), tovshuur (Mongolian guitar), and throat singing, with heavy metal elements, creating a unique genre they call "Hunnu Rock." The band's name, "The Hu," translates to "human being" in Mongolian. Their debut album, "The Gereg," released in September 2019, features songs inspired by Mongolian history and folklore. In 2022, they released their second album, "Rumble of Thunder," followed by a live album, "Live at Glastonbury," in 2024. The Hu has gained international recognition, performing at major festivals like Coachella, Lollapalooza, and Download Festival. In 2022, they became the first-ever rock/metal band to receive the UNESCO "Artist of Peace" designation.

members.name: Galbadrakh "Gala" Tsendbaatar
members.role: Lead Throat Singer And Morin Khuur

members.name: Enkhsaikhan "Enkush" Batjargal
members.role: Lead Morin Khuur And Throat Singer

members.name: Nyamjantsan "Jaya" Galsanjamts
members.role: Tumur Khuur, Tsuur, Flute, And Throat Singer

bands.name: Running Wild
bands.description: Running Wild is a German heavy metal band formed in Hamburg in 1976. Initially known as Granite Heart, they adopted the name Running Wild in 1979, inspired by the Judas Priest song of the same name. The band recorded their first demo in 1981, featuring tracks like "Hallow the Hell" and "War Child." Their debut album, "Gates to Purgatory," released in 1984, showcased their early satanic themes. In 1987, they shifted to pirate and historical themes with "Under Jolly Roger," influencing the pirate metal subgenre. Over the years, Running Wild has released 17 studio albums, including "Port Royal" (1988), "Death or Glory" (1989), and "Blood on Blood" (2021). The band disbanded in 2009 but reunited in 2012 and continues to perform and record new material.

bands.name: H.e.a.t
bands.description: H.E.A.T is a Swedish hard rock band formed in Upplands Väsby in 2007, originating from the merging of the bands Dream and Trading Fate. The lineup consists of lead vocalist Kenny Leckremo, guitarist Dave Dalone, keyboardist Jona Tee, bassist Jimmy Jay, and drummer Don Crash. Their music is heavily influenced by classic melodic rock groups like Whitesnake, characterized by dynamic melodies and energetic performances. The band has released several studio albums, including their self-titled debut in 2008, 'Freedom Rock' in 2010, 'Address the Nation' in 2012, 'Tearing Down the Walls' in 2014, 'Into the Great Unknown' in 2017, 'H.E.A.T II' in 2020, and 'Force Majeure' in 2022. In 2025, they released their eighth studio album, 'Welcome to the Future', featuring singles like 'Disaster', 'Bad Time for Love', and 'Running to You'. The album has been praised as their strongest to date, showcasing their innovative and dynamic sound.

bands.name: Death To All
bands.description: Death To All is a U.S. tribute project honoring the legacy of Chuck Schuldiner and his pioneering band, Death. Formed in 2012, the ensemble features former members of Death, including drummer Gene Hoglan, bassist Steve Di Giorgio, guitarist Bobby Koelble, and guitarist/vocalist Max Phelps. The band performs technical death metal classics such as "Crystal Mountain" and "Symbolic" to keep the music alive for fans. In 2025, Death To All embarked on the "Symbolic Healing" tour, celebrating the 30th anniversary of Death's "Symbolic" and the 35th anniversary of "Spiritual Healing," with special guests Gorguts and Phobophilic. ([deathtoalltour.com](https://deathtoalltour.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Butcher Sisters
bands.description: The Butcher Sisters, formed in Mannheim, Germany, in 2011, are a dynamic band that seamlessly blends beatdown hardcore, German hip-hop, and heavy metal elements. The group was established by guitarists David Schneider and Manuel Renner, alongside vocalist Alexander Bechtel. In 2013, they released their self-titled EP, which led to a record deal with Bleeding Nose Records. Their debut album, "Respekt und Robustheit," released on October 28, 2016, marked their breakthrough, showcasing their aggressive and energetic style. In 2018, they released "68 Undercover," an EP featuring cover versions of various artists, including Toni D, KIZ, Haftbefehl, Marteria, and Pol1Z1Stens0Hn. Their second album, "Alpha & Opfah," came out in 2019, further solidifying their presence in the German music scene. In 2024, they signed with Arising Empire and released the single "Sonnenbrille," followed by their third album, "Das Weiße Album," on January 17, 2025. Known for their energetic live performances, The Butcher Sisters have played at festivals such as Full Force, Summerbreeze, and Reload. Their music is characterized by a fusion of heavy metal riffs, aggressive rap vocals, and catchy hooks, addressing themes of resilience, societal discord, and personal struggles. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Butcher_Sisters?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Hevn Iii
bands.description: Hevn III is a Norwegian black metal trio formed in Oslo in 2020. The band emerged from the shadows of Norway’s underground scene, delivering a relentless sonic assault that channels raw, primal aggression. Their music delves into themes of hatred, magic, misanthropy, and the philosophical musings of Blake, Nietzsche, and Crowley, crafting a soundscape that is both chaotic and deeply unsettling. Hevn III's debut album, "Hevn III," was released on November 22, 2024, under Polypus Records. The album plunges listeners into a world where dissonance reigns, with every riff resonating with venomous intent. The band's live performances are noted for their sheer intensity, harking back to an era when black metal was raw, dissonant, and unfiltered. The current lineup consists of Likrøyk on bass, Orkan on drums, and Sortblot on guitar and vocals. Hevn III is currently signed to Polypus Records.

bands.name: P.o.d.
bands.description: P.O.D. (Payable on Death) is an American Christian nu metal band formed in 1992 in San Diego, California. The band consists of vocalist Sonny Sandoval, bassist Traa Daniels, lead guitarist Marcos Curiel, and drummer Noah "Wuv" Bernardo. They have sold over 12 million records worldwide and have been nominated for three Grammy Awards. Their music blends elements of nu metal, alternative metal, and rap metal, often incorporating themes of faith and spirituality. Their third studio album, "The Fundamental Elements of Southtown," released in 1999, achieved platinum certification by the RIAA. Their fourth album, "Satellite," released in 2001, continued their success with hits like "Alive" and "Youth of the Nation," which contributed to the album's triple platinum status. In 2024, they released their eleventh studio album, "Veritas," marking the first album without drummer Wuv Bernardo, who went on hiatus in 2021. The album features guest appearances from Randy Blythe, Tatiana Shmayluk, and Cove Reber.

bands.name: Nite
bands.description: Nite is a blackened heavy metal band from San Francisco, California, formed in 2018. The band was founded by guitarist Van Labrakis (Satan’s Wrath, Mencea) and guitarist Scott Hoffman (Dawnbringer, High Spirits), who were later joined by drummer Patrick Crawford (Serpents of Dawn, Older Sun) and bassist Avinash Mittur (Vorlust, Wretched Stench). ([nitemetal.com](https://nitemetal.com/bio.html?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by galloping riffs and harmonies reminiscent of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (N.W.O.B.H.M.), combined with blackened vocals that evoke the classic sounds of the 70s and 80s. ([sentientruin.com](https://sentientruin.com/nite?utm_source=openai)) Nite's debut album, "Darkness Silence Mirror Flame," was released in March 2020 to critical acclaim. Their third full-length album, "Cult of the Serpent Sun," was released on March 14, 2025, via Season of Mist. ([metalshockfinland.com](https://metalshockfinland.com/2025/03/15/nite-premiere-cult-of-the-serpent-sun-album-out-now/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Ho99o9
bands.description: Ho99o9 (pronounced "Horror") is an American punk rap duo formed in 2012 in Newark, New Jersey, by theOGM and Yeti Bones (also known as Eaddy). The duo relocated to Los Angeles in 2014. Their music is a fusion of punk rock, industrial hip hop, and horrorcore, creating a unique sound that has been described as a "seething collision of anarchic hardcore punk rock and industrial-charged death rap." They have released multiple EPs and three full-length albums: "United States of Horror" (2017), "Skin" (2022), and "Tomorrow We Escape" (2025). Notable collaborations include tracks with The Prodigy, 3Teeth, and N8NOFACE. The band has performed at major festivals such as Afropunk, SXSW, and Primavera Sound, and has toured with acts like Three Days Grace, Prophets of Rage, Avenged Sevenfold, Korn, Alice in Chains, and Underoath. In 2020, their track "Pig Dinner," created in collaboration with N8NOFACE, was featured in the video game Cyberpunk 2077. In 2025, they signed with Last Gang Records and released new music, including the single "A Machine of."

bands.name: Djerv
bands.description: Djerv is a Norwegian rock band formed in early 2010 by former members of Animal Alpha and Stonegard. The lineup consists of vocalist Agnete Kjølsrud, guitarist Stian Kårstad, and drummer Erlend Gjerde. Their music blends elements of rock, heavy metal, and black metal, creating an aggressive yet catchy sound. In 2011, they released their self-titled debut album, which received critical acclaim and charted at number 8 on the official Norwegian sales charts. The album was engineered by Daniel Bergstrand and mixed by Matt Hyde. In 2013, Kjølsrud collaborated with Riot Games to record "Get Jinxed" for the video game League of Legends, a track that garnered over 100 million views on YouTube. After a hiatus, Djerv returned in 2019, releasing new music in 2020. In 2024, they contributed "Rebel Heart" to the soundtrack of the Netflix series Arcane. Their music continues to evolve, blending aggressive rock with metal influences.

bands.name: Hanabie.
bands.description: Hanabie. is a Japanese metalcore band from Tokyo, formed in 2015. The band consists of vocalist Yukina, guitarist/vocalist Matsuri, bassist Hettsu, and drummer Chika. Their music blends metalcore, nu metal, and electronicore with influences from J-pop and contemporary Harajuku culture, a style they describe as "Harajuku-core." The band was formed by four high school friends who shared an admiration for Maximum the Hormone.
