The band was established to perform songs from Udo's time with Accept, offering fans a unique opportunity to experience these classics live. The lineup includes Udo Dirkschneider on vocals, his son Sven Dirkschneider on drums, guitarist Andrey Smirnov, bassist Fitty Wienhold, and guitarist Niuton Rodrigues Filho (also known as Bill Hudson). In 2023, former Accept bassist Peter Baltes joined the band as a permanent member, replacing Tilen Hudrap. Dirkschneider's music is characterized by powerful vocals, heavy guitar riffs, and energetic performances, staying true to the classic heavy metal sound that has influenced generations of fans. The band has released several singles and an EP titled "Arising" in 2021, featuring tracks like "Where The Angels Fly," "Face Of A Stranger," and "Every Heart Is Burning." Their most recent single, "Hellbreaker," was released in June 2025, showcasing their continued commitment to producing high-quality heavy metal music.

bands.name: Mayhem
bands.description: Mayhem is a pioneering Norwegian black metal band formed in Oslo in 1984. They are renowned for their intense and controversial performances, as well as their profound influence on the black metal genre. The original lineup included guitarist Øystein "Euronymous" Aarseth, bassist Jørn "Necrobutcher" Stubberud, and drummer Kjetil "Manheim" Haraldsson. The band's early music was heavily influenced by bands like Venom, Motörhead, Black Sabbath, Slayer, Bathory, and Celtic Frost. Their debut EP, "Deathcrush," released in 1987, is considered a seminal work in black metal. In 1988, Swedish vocalist Per "Dead" Ohlin joined the band, bringing a distinctive stage presence and contributing to the band's notoriety. Dead's performances were marked by the use of "corpse paint" and often involved self-mutilation, adding to the band's dark and theatrical image. The band's history is marked by tragedy, including the suicide of Dead in 1991 and the murder of Euronymous in 1993 by former bassist Varg Vikernes. Despite these events, Mayhem continued to evolve, releasing albums like "Grand Declaration of War" in 2000, which showcased a more avant-garde and progressive approach to black metal. Their 2004 album "Chimera" featured vocalist Maniac and continued to push the boundaries of the genre. In 2021, Mayhem celebrated their 40th anniversary with a special North American tour, featuring a setlist that spanned their illustrious career. The band's current lineup includes Necrobutcher (bass), Hellhammer (drums), Attila Csihar (vocals), Teloch (guitars), and Ghul (guitars). Mayhem remains a significant and influential force in the black metal scene, known for their uncompromising music and live performances.

bands.name: Harakiri For The Sky
bands.description:
Harakiri For The Sky is an Austrian post-black metal band formed in 2011 in Vienna and Salzburg by vocalist Michael "V. Wahntraum" Kogler (JJ) and multi-instrumentalist Matthias Sollak (M.S.). The duo, formerly of the black metal band Bifröst, established the band to explore a more atmospheric and emotionally charged sound. Their music is characterized by melancholic melodies, intense guitar riffs, and deeply emotional lyrics, blending elements of black metal, post-hardcore, and post-metal. The band has released six studio albums:

- "Harakiri for the Sky" (2012)
- "Aokigahara" (2014)
- "III: Trauma" (2016)
- "Arson" (2018)
- "Mӕre" (2021)
- "Scorched Earth" (2025)

Their 2014 album, "Aokigahara," is named after the Japanese forest known for its association with suicide, reflecting the band's exploration of dark and introspective themes. The album received critical acclaim, with a 90% rating on Metal Archives. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Harakiri_for_the_Sky/Aokigahara/405255?utm_source=openai)) In 2025, they released "Scorched Earth," continuing their tradition of blending atmospheric black metal with post-hardcore elements. The band has toured extensively, including a notable tour with Der Weg einer Freiheit and The Great Old Ones in 2016, and has been nominated for an Amadeus Austrian Music Award. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harakiri_for_the_Sky?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Overkill
bands.description: Overkill is an American thrash metal band formed in 1980 in New Jersey. They are known for their aggressive sound and energetic performances, contributing significantly to the thrash metal scene. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with bassist D.D. Verni and lead vocalist Bobby "Blitz" Ellsworth being the only original members remaining. The current lineup includes Verni, Ellsworth, lead guitarist Dave Linsk, rhythm guitarist Derek "The Skull" Tailer, and drummer Jeramie Kling. Overkill's discography includes notable albums such as "Feel the Fire" (1985), "The Years of Decay" (1989), and "Ironbound" (2010). Their music is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and themes exploring death, violence, rebellion, and society. Overkill has maintained a dedicated fan base and continues to tour and release new material, solidifying their status as a cornerstone in the thrash metal genre.

bands.name: Lord Of The Lost
bands.description: Lord of the Lost is a German dark rock band from Hamburg, formed in 2007 by singer and frontman Chris Harms. Initially a solo project, Harms expanded the lineup to create a full band, releasing their debut single "Dry the Rain" in 2009 and their first album "Fears" in 2010 under the independent label Out of Line. Their music spans genres including gothic metal, industrial metal, gothic rock, industrial rock, and glam rock. The band has been influenced by artists such as Rammstein, Nine Inch Nails, Marilyn Manson, and Lady Gaga. In 2023, they represented Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "Blood & Glitter." Their discography includes albums like "Antagony" (2011), "Die Tomorrow" (2012), "From the Flame Into the Fire" (2014), "Empyrean" (2016), "Thornstar" (2018), "Judas" (2021), "Blood & Glitter" (2022), "Weapons of Mass Seduction" (2023), "Opvs Noir Vol. 1" (2025), and "Opvs Noir Vol. 2" (2025). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lord_of_the_Lost?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Filth
bands.description: Formed in 2022 in Gothenburg, Sweden, Filth is a death metal band that delves into themes of human decay and death. The lineup comprises Per on drums and vocals, Sebastian on lead guitar and bass, and Ismael on rhythm guitar. Their music is characterized by aggressive riffs and guttural vocals, embodying the raw intensity of death metal. As of October 2025, Filth has been active for three years, contributing to the Swedish death metal scene with their uncompromising sound.

bands.name: Unprocessed
bands.description: Unprocessed is a German progressive metalcore band from Wiesbaden, formed in 2013. The band was established by guitarist and vocalist Manuel Gardner Fernandes and drummer Jan Aimène. They released their debut studio album, "In Concretion," in 2014, followed by the EP "Perception" in 2016. The latter marked the last release with original members Simon Lorenz and Jan Aimène. In 2018, bassist David John Levy and drummer Leon Pfeifer joined the band, leading to the release of their second studio album, "Covenant." Their third album, "Artificial Void," was released in 2019, featuring the last appearance of guitarist Christopher Talosi. In early 2020, Unprocessed toured Europe with Polyphia, resulting in the collaborative single "Real," featuring Tim Henson and Clay Gober of Polyphia. The band's fourth album, "Gold," was released in August 2022, followed by their fifth album, "...And Everything in Between," in December 2023. Their latest album, "Angel," was released on October 31, 2025. Unprocessed is known for their precise musicianship, blending technical guitar work with elements of metalcore, djent, and electronic influences. Their music is characterized by genre-defying soundscapes, balancing brutal technicality with emotional depth. The current lineup includes Manuel Gardner Fernandes (vocals, guitar), David John Levy (bass, synthesizer), Christoph Schultz (guitar), and Leon Pfeifer (drums).

bands.name: Rioter
bands.description: Rioter is a Norwegian thrash metal band formed in 2019 in Haugesund, Rogaland. The band delivers old-school, hard-hitting thrash metal inspired by acts like Toxik, Megadeth, and Forbidden. Their music blends traditional thrash elements with modern, progressive touches. Rioter has quickly gained recognition in the metal community, earning the title "Månedens Norske Thrash" (Norwegian Thrash of the Month) in Scream Magazine. They have performed at events such as Karmøygeddon MetalFestival's "Kickoff" and Heavy Nights festival. The current lineup includes Martin Pedersen (lead guitar, vocals), Odin Wåge (lead guitar, vocals), Olaf Petelicki (bass), and Florian Bratberg (drums). Their upcoming album, "Another Marionette," is highly anticipated.

bands.name: Before The Dawn
bands.description: Before The Dawn is a Finnish melodic death metal band formed in 1999 by multi-instrumentalist Tuomas Saukkonen. Initially a solo project, Saukkonen played and recorded all instruments for the band's first demo, "To Desire Part 1," in 2000. The band's lineup evolved over the years, leading to the release of their first full-length album, "My Darkness," in 2003. This was followed by "4:17 a.m." in 2004, "The Ghost" in 2006, and "Deadlight" in 2007. In 2011, they released "Deathstar Rising," which peaked at number eight on the Finnish charts. Their 2012 album, "Rise of the Phoenix," marked their last release before a hiatus in 2013. After a decade-long break, Before The Dawn returned in 2023 with "Stormbringers," showcasing their enduring presence in the metal scene. In 2024, they released the EP "Archaic Flame," and in 2025, they unveiled their latest album, "Cold Flare Eternal," continuing to captivate audiences with their blend of melancholic melodies and powerful metal riffs.

bands.name: Wolfheart
bands.description:
Wolfheart is a Finnish melodic death metal band formed in 2013 in Lahti, Finland. The band was founded by Tuomas Saukkonen, who previously led bands such as Before the Dawn and Black Sun Aeon. Initially conceived as a solo project, Saukkonen performed all instruments on their debut album, "Winterborn," released in 2013. The album received critical acclaim, peaking at number seven on the Finnish charts and being voted debut of the year by Levykauppa Äxä. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winterborn_%28album%29?utm_source=openai))

In 2014, Wolfheart expanded into a full band, signing with Spinefarm Records. Their second album, "Shadow World," released in 2015, continued their success, reaching number six on the Finnish Official Albums Chart. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadow_World_%28album%29?utm_source=openai)) The band's music is characterized by a blend of melodic death metal with atmospheric elements, often drawing inspiration from Finnish nature and history.

Over the years, Wolfheart has released several albums, including "Tyhjyys" (2017), "Constellation of the Black Light" (2018), "Wolves of Karelia" (2020), "King of the North" (2022), and "Draconian Darkness" (2024). The 2024 album, "Draconian Darkness," features tracks like "Ancient Cold" and "Evenfall." ([metalbite.com](https://metalbite.com/album/58605/wolfheart-draconian-darkness?utm_source=openai)) In November 2024, they became the first European heavy metal band to perform live in Saudi Arabia. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfheart_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Wolfheart's lineup consists of Tuomas Saukkonen (vocals, guitar), Lauri Silvonen (bass, backing vocals), Joonas Kauppinen (drums), and Vagelis Karzis (guitar, clean vocals). Their music is available on various streaming platforms, including Spotify. ([wolfheartmetal.com](https://www.wolfheartmetal.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Vintersorg
bands.description: Vintersorg is a Swedish metal band from Skellefteå, formed in 1994 under the name Vargatron. The band's music spans various heavy metal genres, including black metal, folk metal, progressive metal, and avant-garde metal. Lyrically, they explore themes such as fantasy, mythology, nature, the cosmos, and metaphysics. The name "Vintersorg," meaning "Winter Sorrow," was inspired by the character Vintersorg from Margit Sandemo's "The Legend of the Ice People" series, who is the son of a great pagan leader. Initially, the band aimed to push the boundaries of black metal by incorporating clean vocals and acoustic guitars alongside heavy riffs. Over time, their sound evolved, with earlier works like "Till Fjälls" (1998) and "Ödemarkens Son" (1999) showcasing a strong folk influence. The 2000 album "Cosmic Genesis" marked a shift towards more progressive and experimental elements, delving into themes of astronomy and cosmology. This progression continued with albums like "Visions from the Spiral Generator" (2002) and "The Focusing Blur" (2004), which further embraced avant-garde metal styles. In 2017, they returned to their folk roots with "Till Fjälls, del II," focusing on nature-inspired mysticism and Nordic folklore. The band's lineup has remained consistent, with Andreas "Vintersorg" Hedlund as the primary member, supported by guitarist Mattias Marklund and bassist Simon Lundström. Vintersorg's discography includes notable albums such as "Till Fjälls" (1998), "Ödemarkens Son" (1999), "Cosmic Genesis" (2000), "Visions from the Spiral Generator" (2002), "The Focusing Blur" (2004), "Solens Rötter" (2007), "Jordpuls" (2011), "Orkan" (2012), "Naturbål" (2014), "Till Fjälls, del II" (2017), and "Vattenkrafternas Spel" (2025).

bands.name: Embryonic Autopsy
bands.description: Embryonic Autopsy is an American death metal band from Chicago, Illinois, formed in 2021. The band is known for its brutal and old-school death metal style, reminiscent of early 1990s death metal. Their music features blazing guitars, guttural vocals, and lightning-fast drumming. In 2022, they released their debut album, "Prophecies of the Conjoined," through Massacre Records. The album includes tracks like "Regurgitated and Reprocessed" and "Cauterized Womb Impalement," the latter featuring a solo by renowned death metal guitarist James Murphy. In 2024, they released their sophomore album, "Origins of the Deformed," continuing their exploration of grotesque and horror-inspired themes. The album includes tracks such as "Dripping in the Vaginal Nectar" and "Orgies of the Inseminated." The band's lineup includes vocalist Tim King, guitarist Scott Roberts, bassist Xenxi, and drummer Marco Fimbres. Embryonic Autopsy continues to contribute to the death metal scene with their raw and powerful sound.

bands.name: Employed To Serve
bands.description: Employed To Serve is a British metalcore band from Woking, England, formed in 2011 by vocalist Justine Jones and guitarist Sammy Urwin. Initially a grindcore duo, they expanded their lineup in 2012 to include guitarist James Jackson, bassist Jamie Venning, and drummer Robbie Black. The band quickly gained attention for their chaotic live performances, leading to a contract with Holy Roar Records and the release of their debut album, "Greyer Than You Remember," in 2015. Their second album, "The Warmth of a Dying Sun," was released in 2017, followed by "Eternal Forward Motion" in 2019, and "Conquering" in 2021. In January 2025, they released "Atonement," the first single from their upcoming album, "Fallen Star," featuring guest vocalist Will Ramos. The band's music is characterized by a blend of metalcore, mathcore, hardcore punk, post-hardcore, and death metal influences. They have cited Machine Head, Testament, and Exodus as inspirations for "Conquering." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Employed_to_Serve?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Rise Of The Northstar
bands.description: Rise Of The Northstar is a French heavy metal band from Paris, formed in 2008. The band blends heavy metal, hip-hop, and hardcore punk with Japanese pop culture influences, a style they refer to as "crossover." Their music is inspired by metal groups such as Rage Against the Machine, Slayer, Suicidal Tendencies, Machine Head, Pantera, and Biohazard, along with hip-hop acts Wu-Tang Clan, Onyx, and Mobb Deep. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rise_of_the_Northstar?utm_source=openai)) The original lineup consisted of vocalist Vithia, lead guitarist Nicolas "Diego" Leroy, rhythm guitarist Loïc "Bboy" Ghanem, bassist Lucas, and drummer Max V. In 2010, Nicolas "Diego" Leroy and Max V left the band and were replaced by Eva-B and Hokuto no Kev, respectively. The band has released two EPs: "Tokyo Assault" (2010) and "Demonstrating My Saiya Style" (2012), and three full-length albums: "Welcame" (2014), "The Legacy of Shi" (2018), and "Showdown" (2023). In 2022, following allegations against bassist Fabien Lahaye, the band went on hiatus but returned in December 2022 with a new lineup, including bassist Alexis "Yoru" Lieu and drummer Kevin "Phantom" Foley. Their fourth studio album, "Chapter 4: Red Falcon Super Battle! Neo Paris War!!," is set to be released on November 14, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rise_of_the_Northstar?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Broken By The Scream
bands.description: Broken By The Scream is a Japanese idol-metalcore group formed in Tokyo in October 2016. The band debuted in January 2017, blending high-pitched screams, low-pitched growls, and clean vocals to create a unique fusion of metalcore and J-pop. Their music incorporates elements such as metalcore and djent, earning them international acclaim. The group released their debut album, "An Alien's Portrait," in 2018, followed by "Noisy Night Fever" in 2019. In 2022, they released "Rise Into Chaos," and in August 2025, they released their fourth studio album, "Solar Strain." The band has toured Europe multiple times, including performances at the Motocultor Festival in France and the Resurrection Fest in Spain. They are set to perform at Wacken Open Air in 2026.

bands.name: Blood Vulture
bands.description: Blood Vulture is a gothic sludge metal band formed in New York City in 2025. The band was conceived by Jordan Olds, known for his work as Gwarsenio Hall on the internet show "Two Minutes to Late Night." Blood Vulture's music is characterized by a fusion of gothic romanticism, heavy metallic vibes, and a sense of brutal reckoning. Their debut album, "Die Close," was released on June 27, 2025, through Pure Noise Records. The album features a blend of dark, atmospheric elements with heavy riffs, creating a unique sound within the metal genre. The track "A Dream About Starving To Death" delves into the narrative of a vampire witnessing the impending end of the world, reflecting the band's thematic focus on vampirism, despair, and transformation. The music video for this track was inspired by the "Freddy coming through the wall" scene from "A Nightmare On Elm Street," incorporating elements of sleep paralysis and gothic horror. The album also includes collaborations with artists such as Jade Puget of AFI and Kristin Hayter, adding depth and variety to the band's sound. Blood Vulture's music is available on various streaming platforms, and they continue to engage with their growing fanbase through live performances and online content.

members.name: Jordan Olds
members.role: Vocals, Guitars, Bass, Synthesizers, Songwriting, Lyrics

bands.name: President
bands.description: President is an anonymous English metal band formed in 2025, known for their enigmatic presence and politically charged themes. The band's lineup consists of The President (vocals), Heist (guitarist), Protest (bassist), and Vice (drummer). Their frontman, The President, is described as having silver hair and wearing an eerie, not-quite-lifelike mask etched with deep wrinkles, radiating a wax-figure unease. The band's musical style blends elements of alternative metal, heavy metal, metalcore, and hard rock, often incorporating electronic music, particularly minimal house. Their debut EP, "King of Terrors," released on September 26, 2025, features singles like "In the Name of the Father," "Fearless," "Rage," and "Destroy Me." The band has been described as "splicing metal with elements of electronic music, particularly minimal house." Their work often explores themes of religion, mortality, and existential fear. The band's frontman has described the project as rooted in a personal crisis shaped by religion and loss, aiming to create a feeling of discomfort akin to "The Shining," making it "beautiful but unsettling." The band incorporates political campaign themes into its public image, presenting live performances as "rallies," promotional materials as "endorsements," and music videos as "broadcasts," encouraging audience members to "join the campaign" for updates. Despite speculation linking the frontman to known artists like Charlie Simpson, the band has denied such claims and emphasized their grassroots, independent origins without major industry backing.

bands.name: Textures
bands.description: Textures is a Dutch progressive metalcore band formed in 2001 in Tilburg, Netherlands. The band's lineup initially consisted of founding members Jochem Jacobs (guitar), Stef Broks (drums), Bart Hennephof (guitar), and vocalist Pieter Verpaalen. They were later joined by bassist Remko Tielemans in 2007, and in 2010, vocalist Daniël de Jongh and keyboardist Uri Dijk became part of the ensemble. Textures is renowned for their complex and innovative style, blending elements of progressive metal, metalcore, technical death metal, and groove metal. They are also known for incorporating melodic interludes and experimenting with a wide variety of electronic atmospherics. Their debut album, "Polars," released in 2003, showcased their unique sound and received critical acclaim. This was followed by "Drawing Circles" in 2006, which marked the first album to feature vocalist Eric Kalsbeek. In 2008, "Silhouettes" was released, introducing bassist Remko Tielemans. The band signed with Nuclear Blast Records for their fourth album, "Dualism," released in 2011, featuring vocalist Daniël de Jongh and keyboardist Uri Dijk. Their fifth album, "Phenotype," was released in 2016. After a hiatus, Textures reunited in 2023, signing with Kscope and releasing the single "Closer to the Unknown."

bands.name: Imminence
bands.description:
Imminence is a Swedish metalcore band formed in 2009 in Trelleborg. The group consists of vocalist and violinist Eddie Berg, rhythm guitarist Harald Barrett, lead guitarist Alex Arnoldsson, bassist Christian Höijer, and drummer Mikael Norén. Their musical style blends metalcore with elements of symphonic metalcore, atmospheric metalcore, melodic metalcore, alternative rock, and post-hardcore, often incorporating violin melodies into their compositions, a style referred to as "violincore." Influences include In Flames, Linkin Park, August Burns Red, Bon Iver, and Sigur Rós.

The band released their debut EP, "Born of Sirius," in 2012, followed by "Return for Helios" in 2013. Their first full-length album, "I," was released in 2014, produced by Christian Svedin. In 2015, they signed with Arising Empire and released the single "The Sickness," marking a significant point in their career. Their fourth album, "Heaven in Hiding," was released in 2021. In 2024, they self-released "The Black," produced by Eddie Berg, Harald Barrett, and Henrik Udd. The album was followed by an extended edition, "The Return of The Black," in 2025, featuring new tracks and remixes. In September 2025, drummer Peter Hanström departed, and Mikael Norén joined as the new drummer. The band has toured extensively, including a North American headline tour in 2025.

bands.name: Monkey3
bands.description: Monkey3 is an instrumental rock band from Lausanne, Switzerland, formed in 2001. Initially a jam band, the group solidified its lineup with Walter on drums, Boris on guitar, Kevin on bass, and dB on keyboards. Their debut album, "Monkey3," released in 2004, received acclaim across Europe, establishing them in the stoner and progressive rock scenes. Over the years, Monkey3 has released several albums, including "39 Laps" (2006), "Beyond the Black Sky" (2011), "The 5th Sun" (2013), "Astra Symmetry" (2016), "Live at Freak Valley" (2017), "Sphere" (2019), and "Welcome to the Machine" (2024). Their music is characterized by a blend of psychedelic, stoner, and space rock influences, often drawing comparisons to bands like Pink Floyd and Porcupine Tree. The 2024 album "Welcome to the Machine" is inspired by science fiction films such as "2001: A Space Odyssey," "The Matrix," "Sunshine," "Solaris," and "1984," exploring themes of humanity versus machines. ([monkey3official.com](https://monkey3official.com/welcome-to-the-machine-2024/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Martyrdöd
bands.description: Martyrdöd is a Swedish crust punk and d-beat band formed in Gothenburg in 2001. The group was initially composed of Mikael Kjellman (guitar, vocals), Anton Grönholm (bass), Jens Bäckelin (drums), and Pontus Redig (guitar). Grönholm departed shortly after formation, leading to several lineup changes over the years. Their self-titled debut album was released in 2003, followed by a split EP with Sunday Morning Einsteins in 2004. In 2005, they released "In Extremis," which received acclaim across Europe. The 2009 album "Sekt" marked their first release on both sides of the Atlantic. "Paranoia," released in 2012 on Southern Lord, showcased an expanded sound with dynamic guitar leads and harmonic dissonances. In 2014, bassist Fredrik Reinedahl joined the band for the album "Elddop." Their 2016 album "List" continued to evolve their sound, intertwining more wicked melodies into their metal-induced crust songs. In 2017, Martyrdöd signed with Century Media Records and began recording their seventh album, "Hexhammaren," which was released in 2019. The band's music is influenced by acts like Wolfpack, At The Gates, Anti Cimex, Totalitär, and Bathory, blending crust roots with blackened riff attacks and sinister soundscapes. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/martyrdod-begins-recording-seventh-album?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Evergrey
bands.description: Evergrey is a Swedish progressive metal band formed in Gothenburg in 1993 by vocalist and guitarist Tom S. Englund and guitarist Dan Bronell. The band is known for its dark, introspective lyrics and complex musical compositions, blending elements of progressive and power metal. Their debut album, "The Dark Discovery," was released in 1998, followed by "Solitude, Dominance, Tragedy" in 1999. In 2001, they released "In Search of Truth," their first concept album, exploring themes of alien abduction. The 2004 album "The Inner Circle" delved into topics such as cults, religion, and child abuse. Their 2022 album, "A Heartless Portrait (The Orphéan Testament)," continued their tradition of dark, melodic metal. In 2023, they celebrated their 30th anniversary with the compilation album "From Dark Discoveries to Heartless Portraits." Their 2024 album, "Theories of Emptiness," was released on June 7, 2024, via Napalm Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evergrey?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Seven Spires
bands.description: Seven Spires is an American symphonic metal band formed in 2013 in Boston, Massachusetts. The band was founded by guitarist Jack Kosto and vocalist Adrienne Cowan, who are the primary songwriters. They debuted with the EP "The Cabaret of Dreams" in 2014, followed by their first full-length album, "Solveig," in 2017. Their music blends elements of symphonic, power, and extreme metal, often exploring dark fantasy themes. In 2020, they released "Emerald Seas," and in 2021, "Gods of Debauchery." Their fourth studio album, "A Fortress Called Home," was released on June 21, 2024, via Frontiers Music srl. The album was produced, mixed, and mastered by guitarist Jack Kosto. The current lineup includes Jack Kosto (guitars), Adrienne Cowan (vocals, keyboards), Peter de Reyna (bass), and Dylan Gowan (drums), who joined in 2024. ([sevenspiresband.com](https://www.sevenspiresband.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Kvaen
bands.description: Kvaen is an extreme metal band from Northern Sweden, formed in 2019 and led by guitarist and vocalist Jacob Björnfot. The band's music is characterized by a fusion of traditional speed metal, folk influences, death metal, and relentless black metal, creating a distinctive and powerful sound. Their debut album, "The Funeral Pyre," was released in early 2020 through Black Lion Records, receiving stellar reviews and establishing the band on stages across Europe. In 2022, Kvaen released their second album, "The Great Below," featuring guest appearances from Jeff Loomis (Arch Enemy, Nevermore), Mike Wead (Mercyful Fate, King Diamond), and Vreth (Finntroll). This album further solidified their reputation, leading to tours in Sweden and Denmark, as well as festival appearances at Summer Breeze, Gefle Metal, Tolminator, Dark Easter Metal Meeting, and Nordfest Metal Festival. In March 2024, Kvaen signed a worldwide deal with Metal Blade Records and announced their third studio album, "The Formless Fires," released on June 21, 2024. The album continues their tradition of blending various metal subgenres, showcasing their evolution and commitment to pushing musical boundaries. The current lineup includes Jacob Björnfot on vocals and guitars, and Tommi Tuhkala on drums.

bands.name: Throne Of Katarsis
bands.description: Throne Of Katarsis is a Norwegian black metal duo formed in 2002 in Kopervik, Rogaland. The band was established by Grimnisse (vocals, guitars, bass, keyboards) and Vardalv (drums), aiming to craft atmospheric and occult black metal reminiscent of early 1990s Norwegian black metal. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/throne-of-katarsis-signs-with-candlelight-records?utm_source=openai)) Their debut demo, "Unholy Holocaustwinds," was released in 2004, followed by their first full-length album, "An Eternal Dark Horizon," in 2007 under Candlelight Records. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Throne_of_Katarsis/An_Eternal_Dark_Horizon/139768?utm_source=openai)) The album features tracks like "Funeral Moonlight" and "Symbols of Winter," showcasing their commitment to the black metal genre. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/album/an-eternal-dark-horizon/1660176338?utm_source=openai)) In 2009, they released "Helvete - Det iskalde mørket," continuing their exploration of dark and atmospheric themes. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/review/throne-of-katarsis-det-iskalde-morket/?utm_source=openai)) The band's music delves into themes of Satanism, blasphemy, death, and nature, reflecting their dedication to the black metal ethos. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Throne_of_Katarsis/29291?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Hell
bands.description: Formed in 2013 in Belgrade, Serbia, The Hell is a death metal band known for their aggressive sound and intense performances. They have been active since their formation and are currently signed to Satanath Records. The band's music is characterized by fast tempos, heavy guitar riffs, and guttural vocals, typical of the death metal genre. Their lyrics often explore themes of darkness and despair, resonating with fans of the genre. The Hell has been part of the Serbian metal scene, contributing to its growth and recognition. They have performed at various venues and festivals, gaining a reputation for their energetic live shows. The band's discography includes several releases that showcase their evolution and commitment to the death metal style. Their music is available on various streaming platforms, allowing listeners worldwide to experience their sound.

bands.name: Graphic Nature
bands.description: Graphic Nature is a British nu metalcore band formed in 2018 in Kent, England. The band blends elements of nu metal and metalcore with electronic music influences, creating a raw and aggressive sound. Their lyrics often explore themes of mental health, addressing topics such as anxiety, depression, and isolation. The band released their debut single, "Grit," in 2019, followed by singles like "Mortal Fear" and "De[in]fect" in 2020. In 2021, they signed with Rude Records, which reissued their earlier singles and released their debut EP, "New Skin," in February 2022. Their first full-length album, "A Mind Waiting to Die," was released on February 17, 2023, receiving critical acclaim and winning the Heavy Music Award for Best Breakthrough Album. The album features tracks like "Killing Floor" and "Headstone," which delve into personal struggles and mental health issues. In 2024, the band released their second album, "Who Are You When No One Is Watching?" on July 12, continuing to explore themes of trauma and identity. The lineup consists of Harvey Freeman (vocals), Pete Woolven (guitar), Matas Michaliovskis (guitar), Charlie Smith (bass), and Jack Bowdery (drums).

bands.name: Sellsword
bands.description: Sellsword is a British power metal band from York, England, formed in 2013. Known for their "mercenary" style, they blend epic heavy and power metal with themes of fantasy, bravery, and historical battles. Their music often draws inspiration from Viking lore and tales of King Arthur, creating a distinctive sound that resonates with fans of bands like Iron Maiden, Sabaton, and Dio. Since their formation, Sellsword has been active in the UK metal scene, performing at various venues and festivals. They have shared stages with notable acts such as Unleash the Archers, Blaze Bayley, Moonsorrow, and Nanowar of Steel. Their live performances are characterized by energetic shows featuring banners, shields, and even a microphone stand made from a real sword, reflecting their thematic focus. In 2016, they released their debut album, "...And Now We Ride," a 13-track epic that showcases their blend of classic heavy metal and symphonic power metal. The album received positive reviews for its grandiose and melodic approach, drawing comparisons to bands like Blind Guardian and Grave Digger. In 2019, they followed up with "...Unto the Breach," an album that continues their exploration of epic themes with tracks like "Pendragon" and "Blackened Sky." In 2024, Sellsword released "Saxon Steel," an anthemic single that encapsulates their style, depicting an Anglo-Saxon warrior preparing for battle. The track was accompanied by a music video filmed in their Yorkshire homeland, highlighting the band's connection to their roots. As of 2025, Sellsword remains active, with plans for more singles and a third full-length album of battle anthems. Their music is available on platforms like SoundCloud, where they describe themselves as "the world famous Mercenary Metal band! Seriously unserious Power/Heavy Metal from the barren plains of Yorkshire."

bands.name: Front Line Assembly
bands.description: Front Line Assembly (FLA) is a Canadian electro-industrial band formed in 1986 by Bill Leeb, who had previously been a member of Skinny Puppy. The band is known for its innovative fusion of electronic body music (EBM) and industrial sounds, creating a distinctive style that has influenced the genre. Over the years, FLA's lineup has seen several changes, with notable members including Rhys Fulber, Michael Balch, Chris Peterson, Jeremy Inkel, and Jared Slingerland. The band's early releases, such as "The Initial Command" (1987) and "Gashed Senses & Crossfire" (1989), established their presence in the industrial music scene. In 1990, Rhys Fulber joined the band, contributing to the production of "Caustic Grip," which further solidified FLA's reputation. The 1994 album "Millennium" marked a significant evolution in their sound, incorporating industrial metal elements alongside their electronic roots. In 2012, FLA returned to their electronic roots with the release of "AirMech," a soundtrack album for the video game of the same name. This was followed by "Echogenetic" in 2013, which received critical acclaim for its dubstep influences and charted in both the United States and Germany. The band's 17th studio album, "Wake Up the Coma," was released in February 2019, continuing their exploration of electronic and industrial music. FLA's discography includes over a dozen studio albums and EPs, many of which have charted on Billboard's Top Dance/Electronic Albums chart. Their music is characterized by dark synth atmospherics, aggressive sampling, and a blend of electronic and industrial elements.

bands.name: Automaton
bands.description: Automaton is a psychedelic doom band from Athens, Greece, formed in 2011. They have been performing live since mid-2012, sharing stages with bands like Pentagram, YOB, and Pallbearer. Their music blends heavy riffs, repetitive minimalistic patterns, and psychedelia, creating a loud and heavy doom sound. Their debut EP, "Echoes of Mount Ida," was released on October 25, 2013, receiving positive reviews from Greek and international webzines. In 2015, the EP was re-released as a full-length LP with an additional track and collaboration with Dr. Space of Øresund Space Collective. Their second full-length album, "Talos," released in November 2018, is a concept album about the mythical metal giant Talos awakening in the modern era to fight injustice and protect the innocent. The album spans 48 minutes and was recorded at Electric Zen Studios in Athens, engineered and mixed by George Leodis, produced by Automaton and Mike Kavvadias, and mastered by Brad Boatwright at Audiosiege Studio. The artwork was created by Viral Graphics.

bands.name: Carach Angren
bands.description:
Carach Angren is a Dutch symphonic black metal band formed in 2003 in Landgraaf, Limburg. The band's name, "Carach Angren," translates to "Iron Jaws" in Sindarin, a language from J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. Their music is characterized by orchestral arrangements, black metal vocals, and guitar riffs, often exploring themes of ghosts, horror stories, legends, and hauntings. Their discography includes several concept albums:

- **Ethereal Veiled Existence** (2005): An EP based on the haunting of the Brown Lady of Raynham Hall. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethereal_Veiled_Existence?utm_source=openai))

- **Lammendam** (2008): A full-length album centered around the ghost story of the haunted Lammendam. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Carach_Angren/Lammendam/157821?utm_source=openai))

- **Where the Corpses Sink Forever** (2012): This album delves into themes of war, referencing World Wars I and II, as well as the Vietnam War. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Where_the_Corpses_Sink_Forever?utm_source=openai))

- **This Is No Fairytale** (2015): A modern interpretation of the Hansel and Gretel fairy tale, addressing themes such as domestic abuse, drug addiction, and cannibalism. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/This_Is_No_Fairytale?utm_source=openai))

- **Dance and Laugh Amongst the Rotten** (2017): A concept album featuring visitations from multiple ghosts, including the "Blood Queen" and Charles Francis Coghlan. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dance_and_Laugh_Amongst_the_Rotten?utm_source=openai))

- **Franckensteina Strataemontanus** (2020): Inspired by the life of Johann Konrad Dippel, this album continues the band's tradition of thematic storytelling. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carach_Angren?utm_source=openai))

In February 2020, drummer Ivo "Namtar" Wijers departed from the band, leaving Dennis "Seregor" Droomers and Clemens "Ardek" Wijers as the current members. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carach_Angren?utm_source=openai))

The band's official website is [carach-angren.nl](https://www.carach-angren.nl/), where fans can find more information and updates.

bands.name: Skynd
bands.description: Skynd is an Australian industrial rock band formed in 2017, consisting of lead vocalist Skynd and multi-instrumentalist Father. Their music delves into the grim aesthetics of true crime, with songs inspired by notorious figures and tragic events. Notable tracks include "Elisa Lam," "Gary Heidnik" featuring Jonathan Davis of Korn, and "Jonestown," which references the mass suicide in Jonestown. Skynd's performances are marked by a distinctive visual style, often incorporating corpse paint and Victorian-inspired attire. In 2019, they headlined at Electrowerkz in London, further solidifying their unique presence in the industrial rock scene. Their discography includes two EPs: "Chapter I" (2018) and "Chapter II" (2019), along with singles such as "Richard Ramirez" (2018) and "Tyler Hadley" (2019). Their music is available on platforms like Bandcamp and Spotify.

bands.name: Vacuous
bands.description: Vacuous is a death metal band from London, England, formed in late 2019 by guitarist Michael Brodsky and vocalist Jo Chen. Initially a trio, the lineup expanded to a five-piece during the COVID-19 pandemic to achieve a fuller sound. The current members include Brodsky (guitar), Chen (vocals), Max Southall (drums), Ezra Harkin (guitar), and Zak Mullard (bass). The band's music is characterized by unhinged aggression and harrowing atmosphere, drawing influences from bands like Autopsy and Incantation. Their debut album, "Dreams of Dysphoria," was released in 2022 through Dark Descent Records and Me Saco un Ojo Records. In 2023, they released the "Katabasis" EP via Sentient Ruin Laboratories. In early 2025, Vacuous signed with Relapse Records and released their sophomore full-length album, "In His Blood," on February 28, 2025. The album continues their exploration of dark, brooding, and dissonant death metal, creating an oppressive and anguished atmosphere. Lyrically, the band addresses themes of mental health, grief, and other real-life experiences. Vacuous has shared the stage with notable bands such as Wormrot, Obliteration, and Undergang, establishing themselves as a feral and pulverizing live act within the UK underground scene.

bands.name: Nailbomb
bands.description: Nailbomb is a heavy metal band formed in 1993 as a side project by Brazilian musician Max Cavalera, then the frontman of Sepultura, and British musician Alex Newport of Fudge Tunnel. The band is known for its fusion of industrial metal and thrash metal, creating a raw and aggressive sound. They released one studio album, "Point Blank," in 1994, which featured guest appearances from notable musicians such as Dino Cazares of Fear Factory and D.H. Peligro of Dead Kennedys. The band performed live only once, at the 1995 Dynamo Open Air Festival in the Netherlands, after which they disbanded. In August 2024, Cavalera announced the reunion of Nailbomb for a special performance at the Marquee Theatre in Tempe, Arizona, marking their first show in 29 years. The lineup for this performance included Max Cavalera, his son Igor Cavalera Jr., Travis Stone, Johny Chow, Alex Cha, and Adam Jarvis. Following this reunion, Nailbomb embarked on a European tour in August 2025, performing at festivals such as Wacken Open Air in Germany and Bloodstock Open Air in England. The band's discography includes the studio album "Point Blank," the live album "Proud to Commit Commercial Suicide," and the video album "Live at Dynamo."

bands.name: Fleshgod Apocalypse
bands.description: Fleshgod Apocalypse is an Italian symphonic death metal band formed in April 2007 in Perugia. The band was established by Francesco Paoli, who previously fronted Hour of Penance. They recorded their first demo, "Promo '07," at 16th Cellar Studio in Rome, which led to a European tour supporting bands like Behemoth, Origin, Dying Fetus, Hate Eternal, Suffocation, and Napalm Death. In May 2008, they recorded their debut full-length album, "Oracles," released in 2009 through Willowtip Records. The album showcased a technical death metal style, differing from their later symphonic approach. In 2010, they released the "Mafia" EP, featuring new tracks and a cover of At the Gates' "Blinded by Fear." The band signed with Nuclear Blast Records in 2011 and released "Agony" in 2012, followed by "Labyrinth" in 2013. "Labyrinth" was a concept album based on the labyrinth of Knossos and related myths. In 2016, they released "King," which continued their symphonic death metal style. In 2019, they released "Veleno," accompanied by music videos for "Sugar" and "Monnalisa." In 2020, Eugene Ryabchenko joined as the live drummer. In 2024, they released "Opera," featuring singles like "Pendulum" and "Bloodclock." The band's music blends technical death metal with symphonic elements, creating a unique and theatrical sound.

bands.name: Vader
bands.description: Vader is a Polish death metal band formed in 1983 in Olsztyn, Poland. Founded by bassist Piotr "Peter" Wiwczarek and guitarist Zbigniew "Vika" Wróblewski, the band initially played traditional heavy metal before evolving into thrash and eventually death metal. Their debut album, "The Ultimate Incantation," was released in 1992, followed by "De Profundis" in 1995. Over the years, Vader has released numerous albums, including "Black to the Blind" (1997), "Litany" (2000), and "XXV" (2008), a 25th-anniversary album featuring re-recorded songs. The band's music is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and dark, horror-themed lyrics. Lyrical themes often include stories by H.P. Lovecraft, World War II, horror, and science fiction. As of 2025, the lineup consists of Piotr Wiwczarek (vocals, lead guitar), Marek "Spider" Pająk (rhythm guitar), Tomasz "Hal" Halicki (bass), and Michał Andrzejczyk (drums).

bands.name: Lamp Of Murmuur
bands.description: Lamp Of Murmuur is an American black metal project formed in 2019 by M., who handles all instruments and vocals. Initially based in Olympia, Washington, the project later relocated to Los Angeles, California. Lamp Of Murmuur's music is characterized by a raw, lo-fi approach reminiscent of early Scandinavian black metal, blending elements of gothic rock, new wave, and post-punk. The project has released multiple demos, EPs, and full-length albums, including "Heir of Ecliptical Romanticism" (2020), "Submission and Slavery" (2021), and "Saturnian Bloodstorm" (2023). The upcoming album, "The Dreaming Prince In Ecstasy," is scheduled for release on November 14, 2025, via Wolves of Hades. Lamp Of Murmuur has performed live with session musicians and has appeared at festivals such as Brutal Assault, Incineration Fest, and Roadburn.

bands.name: Arctis
bands.description: Arctis is a Finnish modern metal band that emerged in 2024, blending heavy riffs with pop-driven melodies and cinematic atmospheres. Their self-titled debut album, produced by Jimmy Westerlund and released on November 1, 2024, showcases their unique fusion of metal intensity and accessible pop hooks. The album includes tracks like "I'll Give You Hell" and a cover of Lambretta's "Bimbo," which has amassed over five million streams in its original form. In 2024, Arctis toured Europe with Apocalyptica, solidifying their presence in the metal scene. The band is currently working on their second album, "CyberLove," produced by Janne Hyöty and Christian Jansson, with mixing by Joel Wanasek. Their music is available on platforms like Spotify and Bandcamp.

bands.name: Disharmonic Orchestra
bands.description: Disharmonic Orchestra is an Austrian death metal and grindcore band formed in 1987 in Klagenfurt. Initially, their music was characterized by a blend of death metal and grindcore elements. Their early works, such as the 1988 demos "The Unequalled Visual Response Mechanism" and "Requiem for the Forest," showcased their unique approach to extreme metal. In 1989, they released a split LP with fellow Austrian band Pungent Stench, further solidifying their presence in the underground scene. Their 1990 debut album, "Expositionsprophylaxe," marked a significant evolution in their sound, incorporating progressive death metal and avant-garde influences. This trend continued with their 1992 album, "Not to Be Undimensional Conscious," which featured tracks like "Perishing Passion" and "A Mental Sequence." After a hiatus in 1994, the band returned in 2002 with "Ahead," followed by "Fear of Angst" in 2016. In 2023, they released "Repulsive Overtones? 1988-1989," a compilation of early demos and unreleased material, offering fans a glimpse into their formative years. Known for their experimental approach, Disharmonic Orchestra has been influential in the extreme metal genre, inspiring bands like Meshuggah and Ephel Duath. Their music is noted for its complex structures, dissonant riffs, and surrealistic themes, setting them apart from conventional metal acts.

bands.name: Dominum
bands.description: Dominum is a German power metal band from Nuremberg, formed in 2022. The band was founded by vocalist and producer Felix Heldt, known as Dr. Dead, who envisioned a zombie-themed group inspired by his love for "The Walking Dead" and "The Last of Us." The lineup includes guitarist Tommy Kemp, bassist Patient Zero, and drummer Victor Hiltop. Dominum's music blends energetic metal riffs with theatrical elements, creating a unique sound that combines the influences of bands like Ghost and Sabaton. Their debut album, "Hey Living People," was released on December 29, 2023, via Napalm Records, entering the top 20 of the German Album Charts. The album features tracks like "Immortalis Dominum" and "Danger Danger," showcasing the band's storytelling prowess and musical energy. In 2024, Dominum released their second album, "The Dead Don't Die," on December 27, continuing their exploration of horror-inspired themes with heavier metal influences. The band has toured extensively, supporting acts such as Bruce Dickinson, Avantasia, Feuerschwanz, and Peyton Parrish, and has performed at festivals like Graspop and Rock Harz. Their theatrical live shows, characterized by their undead personas, have captivated audiences across Europe.

bands.name: Wolvennest
bands.description: Wolvennest is a Belgian experimental psychedelic doom metal collective formed in 2015 by guitarists Michel Kirby (Arkangel), Corvus Von Burtle (Cult of Erinyes), and Marc De Backer (Mongolito). Known for their dark, hypnotic, and ritualistic sound blending elements of Krautrock, black metal, and ambient music with vocals by Shazzula and other guests, they create immersive "dark trips" through their music and live shows featuring surreal projections. Their debut album featured members of Der Blutharsch and was followed by several more albums, including their 2025 release Procession, with the band continuing to explore themes of occultism, death, and existence. ([consouling.be](https://consouling.be/artist/wolvennest?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Poodles
bands.description: The Poodles are a Swedish hard rock band formed in 2005, known for their energetic performances and melodic sound. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Jakob Samuel, guitarist Pontus Norgren, bassist Pontus Egberg, and drummer Christian Lundqvist. They gained national attention in 2006 by participating in the Swedish Melodifestivalen with their song "Night of Passion," finishing in fourth place. This exposure led to the release of their debut album, "Metal Will Stand Tall," which achieved significant success in Sweden and Europe. The album featured the hit single "Night of Passion," which went platinum, and "Metal Will Stand Tall," a duet with Tess Merkel from Alcazar, which was certified gold. In 2007, they released their second album, "Sweet Trade," which included the singles "Seven Seas," featuring actor Peter Stormare, and "Line of Fire," a collaboration with E-Type. The band's third album, "Clash of the Elements," was released in 2009, followed by "Performocracy" in 2011, "Tour De Force" in 2013, "Devil in the Details" in 2015, and "Prisma" in 2018. In 2018, The Poodles announced their disbandment due to other musical projects. However, in September 2025, they announced their reunion ahead of their 20th anniversary in 2026, with plans to perform live at festivals and stages across Sweden and Europe. ([poodles.se](https://www.poodles.se/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: As Everything Unfolds
bands.description:
As Everything Unfolds is a British rock band from High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, England, formed in 2013. Initially an acoustic duo comprising Alex Paton and guitarist Adam Kerr, they later expanded to a five-piece ensemble. Their musical style blends elements of post-hardcore, alternative rock, and progressive metal, with lead vocalist Charlie Rolfe's voice often compared to Hayley Williams, Amy Lee, and Becca Macintyre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/As_Everything_Unfolds?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut EP, "Jekyll & Hyde," in 2014, followed by "Collide" in 2017. Their third EP, "Closure," released in 2018, garnered over a million streams and led to a signing with Long Branch Records in 2020. Their first full-length album, "Within Each Lies The Other," was released on March 26, 2021. In January 2023, they announced their second album, "Ultraviolet," which was released on April 21, 2023, receiving generally positive reviews and a nomination for 'Best Album Of The Year 2023' by Metal Hammer magazine. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/As_Everything_Unfolds?utm_source=openai))

In June 2025, the band signed with Century Media Records and released the single "Set In Flow." In November 2025, they released "What You Wanted," featuring Dani Winter-Bates of Bury Tomorrow. ([slrmagazine.com](https://slrmagazine.com/2025/06/18/as-everything-unfolds-release-new-single-set-in-flow-and-announce-signing-to-century-media/?utm_source=openai))

Tragically, drummer Jamie Gowers passed away on August 26, 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/As_Everything_Unfolds?utm_source=openai))

As Everything Unfolds has toured extensively across the UK and Europe, performing at festivals such as Download Festival, Graspop, Rock For People, and Wacken Open Air. They have also supported bands like Enter Shikari, Skindred, and Bury Tomorrow. ([slrmagazine.com](https://slrmagazine.com/2025/06/18/as-everything-unfolds-release-new-single-set-in-flow-and-announce-signing-to-century-media/?utm_source=openai))

Their official website is [aseverythingunfolds.com](https://aseverythingunfolds.com).

bands.name: Hypocrisy
bands.description:
Hypocrisy is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in October 1991 in Ludvika by Peter Tägtgren. The band has released thirteen studio albums since their inception. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypocrisy_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Musically, the band started off with a traditional death metal sound on their early albums, but soon turned into a melodic death metal band. Their early lyrics – written by original vocalist Masse Broberg – dealt with anti-Christian themes and Satanism. The band later focused on themes such as the paranormal and extraterrestrials. Their tenth album, Virus, contains themes more typical of death metal such as violence, the horrors of reality, insanity, torture, war, drug addiction, and emotional strife. Their twelfth album, End of Disclosure, uses conspiracy and anti-Illuminati themes. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypocrisy_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's lineup has evolved over the years. As of 2025, the members include Peter Tägtgren (guitars, vocals), Mikael Hedlund (bass), Tomas Elofsson (session guitarist), and Henrik Axelsson (session drummer). ([shop.nuclearblast.com](https://shop.nuclearblast.com/collections/hypocrisy?utm_source=openai))

Hypocrisy's discography includes notable albums such as "Penetralia" (1992), "Osculum Obscenum" (1993), "The Fourth Dimension" (1994), "Abducted" (1996), "The Final Chapter" (1997), "Hypocrisy" (1999), "Into the Abyss" (2000), "Catch 22" (2002), "The Arrival" (2004), "Virus" (2005), "A Taste of Extreme Divinity" (2009), "End of Disclosure" (2013), and "Worship" (2021). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypocrisy_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's official website is [hypocrisyband.com](https://hypocrisyband.com/).

bands.name: Badflower
bands.description: Badflower is an American rock band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 2013. The group consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Josh Katz, lead guitarist Joey Morrow, bassist Alex Espiritu, and drummer Anthony Sonetti. Initially known as The Cartunes, Katz and Morrow began writing songs together in 2010. After releasing a self-produced EP in 2011, the band reformed as Badflower, recruiting Espiritu and Sonetti to complete the lineup. They gained attention with their debut single "Soap" in 2015 and their EP "Temper" in 2016, which led to a record deal with Big Machine/John Varvatos Records. Their debut studio album, "OK, I'm Sick," was released on February 22, 2019, featuring the hit single "Ghost," which topped rock radio charts and earned a Gold certification from the RIAA. Their second album, "This Is How the World Ends," was released on September 24, 2021. In 2024, they returned with the single "Teacher Has A Gun," followed by "Detroit" in July 2024, "Haunting You" in October 2024, and "London" in January 2025. Their third studio album, "No Place Like Home," was released on June 20, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Badflower?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Holywatr
bands.description:
Holywatr is an American alternative metal band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2020. Initially a solo project by frontman Holy, the band quickly expanded into a trio, gaining recognition for their unique blend of nu metal, emo, and hardcore influences. Their music draws inspiration from alt-rock and metal legends like Deftones, creating a sound that transcends genres and resonates with a diverse audience. ([vanswarpedtourdc.com](https://www.vanswarpedtourdc.com/lineup/holywatr?utm_source=openai))

In 2024, Holywatr released their debut album, "Psalms," followed by their second album, "Red Heifer," in 2025. The band has also announced a forthcoming album titled "Deo Gratiar," with the lead single "Give Me a Show" released in August 2025. ([lambgoat.com](https://lambgoat.com/news/48944/holywatr-announce-new-album-deo-gratiar-share-give-me-a-show-video/?utm_source=openai))

Holywatr has shared stages with prominent artists such as Architects and ERRA, showcasing their dynamic performances and solidifying their presence in the metal scene. ([hunnypotunlimited.com](https://www.hunnypotunlimited.com/hunnypot-does/item/4141-concert-review-architects-with-erra-and-holywatr-house-of-blues-anaheim-ca-08-01-25?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [holywatr.com](https://holywatr.com/).

bands.name: Gaddavír
bands.description: Gaddavír is an Icelandic metal band that emerged from the Músíktilraunir competition, a renowned annual battle of the bands in Iceland. Initially formed as a joke to participate in the competition, the band quickly gained recognition for their energetic performances and distinctive sound. Their music blends elements of heavy metal with a punk ethos, creating a unique and engaging listening experience. Over the years, Gaddavír has undergone several lineup changes, solidifying their presence in the Icelandic metal scene. Their participation in the Wacken Open Air festival, one of the world's largest heavy metal festivals, marked a significant milestone in their career, showcasing their growth and appeal beyond Iceland's borders.

bands.name: Mehnersmoos
bands.description: Mehnersmoos is a German hip-hop duo from Frankfurt am Main, consisting of rappers MadFred (Frederik Moos) and Maydn (Tobias Mehner). The duo's name is a combination of their surnames. Both members hail from southern Hesse and studied drums at the Dr. Hoch's Conservatory in Frankfurt. Between 2010 and 2022, they taught at the music school in Bad Nauheim. In December 2010, they released their first song, "Silvester." On October 11, 2013, they released the mixtape "Eier, Wurst und Saft" as a free download. On October 18, 2017, they released the EP "Frankfurt bleibt stabil." In 2020, they released "Alkonüme Hühner," a collaboration with the 257ers, and the song "Rossmann," featuring K.I.Z. Their debut album "Pennergang" was released on March 4, 2022, reaching number 2 on the German hip-hop charts and number 9 on the German album charts. In 2022, Mehnersmoos was the opening act on K.I.Z's "Rap über Hass" tour. Their second studio album, "Sexy," was released on February 17, 2023, featuring guest appearances from Money Boy, Karate Andi, and Nico K.I.Z., and reached number 7 on the German album charts. Their third studio album, "Neues von Mehnersmoos," was released on September 20, 2024, featuring a guest appearance from Bela B, and reached number 4 on the German album charts. At their open-air concert "Mehnersmoos and Friends" on August 2, 2025, in Frankfurt, they announced their candidacy for the satirical party Die PARTEI in the upcoming municipal elections in Hesse.

bands.name: Crazy Lixx
bands.description:
Crazy Lixx is a Swedish rock band formed in Malmö in 2002, known for their energetic performances and a sound reminiscent of 1980s glam metal. The band draws inspiration from iconic acts such as Guns N' Roses, Aerosmith, Kiss, Whitesnake, Alice Cooper, Def Leppard, and Mötley Crüe. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crazy_Lixx?utm_source=openai))

The group was founded by vocalist Danny Rexon and guitarist Vic Zino, with drummer Joél Cirera joining shortly after. They began by performing in local clubs and released their debut album, "Loud Minority," in 2007 under Swedmetal Records. The album received positive feedback, ranking third in Sleaze Rock's Reader's Top Twenty Albums of 2007. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crazy_Lixx?utm_source=openai))

In 2009, Crazy Lixx signed with Frontiers Records and released "New Religion," followed by "Riot Avenue" in 2012. The band's self-titled album, "Crazy Lixx," was released in 2014, showcasing their commitment to the glam metal genre. Their fifth studio album, "Ruff Justice," was released in 2017, featuring tracks that blend classic rock influences with modern production. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crazy_Lixx?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Danny Rexon (vocals, guitar), Jens Anderson (bass), Chrisse Olsson (guitar), Jens Lundgren (guitar), and Robin Nilsson (drums). Robin Nilsson joined the band in 2024, replacing Joél Cirera, who departed in March 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crazy_Lixx?utm_source=openai))

Crazy Lixx continues to captivate audiences with their dynamic performances and dedication to the glam metal tradition, solidifying their place in the Swedish rock scene.

bands.name: Zsk
bands.description: ZSK is a German punk rock band formed in Berlin in 1997. The band was initially composed of brothers Joshi (vocals/guitar) and Flori (drums), along with Niki (guitar), Beni (guitar), and Eike (bass). They began by performing in left-wing youth centers, squats, and at various skateboarding events, releasing their first demo, "Keep Skateboarding Punk Rock," which sold over 500 copies. In 2002, they released their debut album, "Riot Radio," followed by "From Protest to Resistance" in 2004. After a brief hiatus from 2007 to 2011, ZSK reunited with new drummer Matthias and released "Herz für die Sache" in 2013. Their music blends skate punk, political punk, punk rock, hardcore punk, and melodic hardcore, often addressing themes like xenophobia, police violence, social injustices, and environmental issues. They have been active in anti-fascist projects, including the "Kein Bock auf Nazis" initiative, which produced a DVD with information on right-wing structures in Germany. Their discography includes nine studio albums, two live albums, and several EPs and singles. Their latest album, "Feuer & Papier," was released in September 2025, followed by a tour across Germany, Austria, and Switzerland.

bands.name: Thornhill
bands.description: Thornhill is an Australian alternative metal band from Melbourne, formed in 2015. The current lineup consists of vocalist Jacob Charlton, guitarist Ethan McCann, drummer Ben Maida, and bassist Nick Sjogren. The band has released three studio albums: "The Dark Pool" (2019), "Heroine" (2022), and "Bodies" (2025), along with two EPs: "13" (2016) and "Butterfly" (2018). Their music blends elements of alternative metal, nu metal, and metalcore, drawing comparisons to bands like Architects, Northlane, and Polaris. Thornhill has gained recognition for their dynamic sound and energetic live performances, earning a nomination for "Best International Breakthrough Band" at the 2020 Heavy Music Awards. In 2025, "Bodies" was nominated for Australian Album of the Year at the J Awards. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornhill_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sleep Theory
bands.description: Sleep Theory is an American rock band from Memphis, Tennessee, formed in 2019. The group blends elements of heavy metal, R&B, and pop, creating a distinctive sound that resonates with a wide range of listeners. The band consists of vocalist Cullen Moore, guitarist Daniel Pruitt, bassist Paolo Vergara, and drummer Ben Pruitt. Cullen Moore, a U.S. Army veteran and son of an R&B musician, initially embarked on a solo project in 2019 to merge his love for hard rock, funk, and R&B. This solo endeavor eventually evolved into Sleep Theory when Moore teamed up with bassist Paolo Vergara, followed by the addition of the Pruitt brothers, Daniel and Ben, completing the lineup. In 2023, Sleep Theory released their debut EP, "Paper Hearts," which gained significant traction with tracks like "Another Way" and "Numb." The EP garnered over 33 million streams across various platforms, showcasing the band’s growing popularity. Their sound, driven by Moore’s powerful vocals, fuses influences from pop, R&B, and rock, earning them recognition for their genre-blending style. Looking ahead, Sleep Theory released their debut album, "Afterglow," on May 16, 2025. The album’s lead single, "Stuck in My Head," has already made waves, charting at number five on the U.S. Alternative Songs chart. With their innovative approach to music and their dynamic sound, Sleep Theory is quickly establishing itself as a fresh and exciting force in contemporary rock. ([traplyrics.com](https://www.traplyrics.com/artists/sleep-theory?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Last Train
bands.description: Last Train is a French rock band formed in 2007 in Altkirch, Alsace. The lineup consists of Jean-Noël Scherrer (vocals and guitar), Julien Peultier (guitar), Timothée Gerard (bass), and Antoine Baschung (drums). They began by performing original compositions in local bars, quickly gaining recognition for their energetic performances. In 2015, they released their debut EP, "The Holy Family," followed by their first full-length album, "Weathering," in 2017. Their music blends elements of rock, alternative, and progressive styles, drawing comparisons to bands like Muse and Placebo. Over the years, Last Train has toured extensively across Europe, Asia, and the United States, sharing stages with renowned artists such as Johnny Hallyday, Muse, and Placebo. In 2019, they released their second album, "The Big Picture," which received critical acclaim for its depth and complexity. In 2022, they unveiled "How Did We Get There?" a 20-minute single accompanied by a short film, showcasing their innovative approach to music and storytelling. Their discography also includes singles like "Heroin" and "Home," with their latest album, "III," released in 2025. The band manages their own production and concert promotion agency, Cold Fame, and organizes their own festival, La Messe de Minuit. Their official website is [https://www.lasttrain.fr/](https://www.lasttrain.fr/).

bands.name: Guiltera
bands.description: Guiltera is a female-fronted hard rock and alternative metal band from Cyprus, formed in 2024. The band consists of vocalist Vikki Arkharova, guitarist Alex Logvinov, bassist Sergei Kovalev, and drummer Viacheslav Karaganov. Their music blends elements of progressive rock and melodic metal, creating a sound that is both powerful and accessible. Guiltera's music videos are known for their expressiveness, scale, and vibrancy, leaving a strong emotional impact on viewers. In May 2025, they released their debut album, "Us," which features a mix of powerful riffs, emotional depth, and cinematic energy. The album is available on platforms like Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/cy/album/us/1808493554?utm_source=openai)) In June 2025, Guiltera organized and performed at GFEST, the first annual modern metal music festival in Cyprus, showcasing their commitment to the local music scene. ([gfest.live](https://gfest.live/?utm_source=openai)) In November 2025, they released their new single, "Far Away," from the upcoming album "They," set for release in 2026. This new album promises a heavier, darker, and more aggressive sound, featuring extreme vocals, complex rhythmic structures, and sharper guitars. ([mythofrock.gr](https://mythofrock.gr/guiltera-presents-new-single-far-away/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Black Star
bands.description: Black Star was a heavy metal band from Houston, Texas, active between 1982 and 1985. The group was known for their energetic performances and contributions to the local metal scene during the early 1980s. Despite their brief existence, Black Star left a lasting impression on fans and fellow musicians alike.

bands.name: Forsmán
bands.description: Forsmán is an Icelandic black metal band formed in 2019 in Kópavogur. The band debuted with the EP "Dönsum Í Logans Ljóma" in 2021, released through Ván Records. This EP received critical acclaim for its raw and atmospheric black metal sound, drawing comparisons to Icelandic contemporaries like Misþyrming and Svartidauði. ([voicesfromthedarkside.de](https://www.voicesfromthedarkside.de/review/forsman-donsum-i-logans-ljoma/?utm_source=openai)) The EP features four tracks: "Falsgod," "Milli Eilífdar Og Einskis," "Vonarglaeta," and "Hamfarir." ([forsman.bandcamp.com](https://forsman.bandcamp.com/album/d-nsum-logans-lj-ma?utm_source=openai)) In April 2026, Forsmán is scheduled to perform at the Inferno Metal Festival in Norway, marking their first appearance in the country. ([ghostcultmag.com](https://ghostcultmag.com/enslaved-samael-audn-morax-and-forsman-booked-for-inferno-metal-festival/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sweet Savage
bands.description: Sweet Savage is a heavy metal band from Belfast, Northern Ireland, formed in 1979. They are considered pioneers of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM), alongside bands like Iron Maiden, Saxon, and Def Leppard. The original lineup featured bassist and vocalist Ray Haller, guitarist Vivian Campbell (later of Dio and Def Leppard), guitarist Trev Fleming, and drummer David Bates. In 1981, they released their first single, "Take No Prisoners," which included the track "Killing Time." The band gained further recognition when Metallica covered "Killing Time" as a B-side to their single "The Unforgiven." Sweet Savage disbanded in 1983 but reformed in the 1990s, releasing two albums: "Killing Time" (1996) and "Rune" (1998). After another hiatus, they reformed in 2008, releasing "Regeneration" in 2011. In 2025, they released their fourth studio album, "Bang," through earMUSIC. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/vivian-campbells-pre-dio-band-sweet-savage-announces-new-album-bang?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Igorrr
bands.description: Igorrr is the musical alias of French multi-instrumentalist and producer Gautier Serre, known for blending diverse genres such as black metal, baroque music, breakcore, and trip hop into a unique and experimental sound. The project began in 2005 with Serre self-releasing demos like "Poisson Soluble" (2006) and "Moisissure" (2008), which garnered attention from the Berlin-based label Ad Noiseam. This led to the release of his debut album, "Nostril," in 2010, accompanied by the EP "Baroquecore." The second album, "Hallelujah," released in 2012, featured collaborations with Mayhem guitarist Teloch and classical singer Laure Le Prunenec. In 2017, Igorrr signed with Metal Blade Records, releasing "Savage Sinusoid," which received critical acclaim and marked a significant evolution in Serre's sound. The fourth album, "Spirituality and Distortion," released in 2020, continued to showcase Igorrr's innovative approach to music. The latest album, "Amen," was released in 2025. Throughout its evolution, Igorrr has been characterized by its eclectic style, combining elements from various musical genres to create a distinctive and intense listening experience. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Igorrr?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Omsorg
bands.description:
Omsorg is a post-hardcore trio from Aalborg, Denmark, known for their dynamic and emotionally charged music. Formed in 2019, the band comprises Jan Fenger Christensen (vocals and guitar), Trong Minh Le (bass), and Mads Skannerup Hansen (drums). Their sound is characterized by fluctuating tempos and rhythms, blending ambient elements with hardcore intensity. Lyrically, Omsorg delves into themes of vulnerability, identity, and the human condition, creating space for deep reflection while embracing catharsis. ([nastycutrecords.com](https://nastycutrecords.com/artists/omsorg/?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "Moments, Movements," released in 2022, received acclaim for its expansive soundscapes and visceral delivery. In 2024, they released the "Echoes" EP, which balances savagery and vulnerability through four songs that deliver highly personal songwriting driven by social indignation, a will to live, and an insistence on love and friendship despite existential suffering, self-destructiveness, and structural pressure. ([omsorg.bandcamp.com](https://omsorg.bandcamp.com/album/echoes-2?utm_source=openai))

Omsorg has toured extensively across Denmark and Northern Europe, performing at major underground festivals like Roskilde Festival (DK) and Manchester Punk Festival (UK). Their ability to combine sonic chaos with poetic depth makes them one of the most compelling bands in Denmark’s heavy music scene. ([nastycutrecords.com](https://nastycutrecords.com/artists/omsorg/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website: ([omsorg.bandcamp.com](https://omsorg.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Clawfinger
bands.description: Clawfinger is a Swedish rap metal band formed in Stockholm in 1989. They are considered pioneers of the rap metal genre, blending aggressive metal riffs with hip-hop elements. The band's lyrics often address political and social issues, including racism and war. Their debut album, "Deaf Dumb Blind," released in 1993, sold over 600,000 copies worldwide and received critical acclaim in Sweden. Clawfinger has released seven studio albums and sold over 1.5 million albums globally. After a brief disbandment in 2013, they reunited in 2017 and have since released new material, including singles like "Save Our Souls" (2017), "Tear You Down" (2019), and "Environmental Patients" (2022). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clawfinger?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Soulidium
bands.description: Soulidium is an American hard rock band formed in Tampa, Florida, in 2006. The band was founded by vocalist Michael McKnight, who sought to create a unique sound blending elements of alternative metal and hard rock. Their debut album, "Children of Chaos," was released in 2007 and featured the track "Trapped," which was included in the soundtrack for the film "Saw IV." After a period of inactivity, Soulidium returned in 2015 with their second album, "Awaken," showcasing their evolution and continued commitment to their craft. In 2022, the band reunited and began working on a new album titled "Revolution," with plans to release several singles and videos leading up to the album's debut in 2025.

bands.name: Immolation
bands.description: Immolation is an American death metal band from Yonkers, New York, formed in 1986. They are considered one of the leaders of the New York death metal scene, alongside bands like Incantation, Mortician, and Suffocation. The band's music is characterized by dissonant harmonic patterns, complex rhythms, and intricate guitar work. Their lyrics often explore themes of anti-religion, particularly anti-Christianity, and occasionally delve into political topics. Over the years, Immolation has released several influential albums, including "Dawn of Possession" (1991), "Here in After" (1996), "Failures for Gods" (1999), "Close to a World Below" (2000), "Unholy Cult" (2002), "Harnessing Ruin" (2005), "Shadows in the Light" (2007), "Majesty and Decay" (2010), "Kingdom of Conspiracy" (2013), "Atonement" (2017), and "Acts of God" (2022). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immolation_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Triskelión
bands.description: Triskelión is a metal band from Valparaíso, Chile, formed in the winter of 2021. Drawing inspiration from pre-Columbian themes, they describe their music as "Pétreo metal Akonkagua," blending elements of heavy metal with indigenous influences. In 2023, the band solidified its lineup and recorded the promotional song "Cvlto Pétreo." Later that year, they released their debut EP, "Bajo el signo del Triskel," through Cirar Metal Records and their own label, Saeta Distro. ([triskelionchile.bandcamp.com](https://triskelionchile.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Wings Of Steel
bands.description: Wings of Steel is a Los Angeles-based heavy metal band formed in 2019 by vocalist Leo Unnermark and guitarist Parker Halub. The band draws inspiration from classic 70s and 80s hard rock and heavy metal, blending bluesy vocals with dynamic guitar riffs to create a distinctive sound. Their debut EP, "Wings of Steel," was released in 2022, followed by their first full-length album, "Gates of Twilight," in 2023. In 2024, they embarked on their first European tour, receiving praise for their energetic live performances. In 2025, they released "Winds of Time," a 10-minute epic single accompanied by a music video, showcasing their unique position in the current heavy metal scene. ([rflmusicentertainment.com](https://www.rflmusicentertainment.com/wingsofsteel?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Finch
bands.description: Finch is an American rock band from Temecula, California, formed in 1999. Initially known as Numb, they changed their name to Finch after guitarist Randy "R2K" Strohmeyer joined the group. The band is best known for their 2002 debut album, "What It Is to Burn," which features the popular single of the same name. Their second album, "Say Hello to Sunshine," released in 2005, marked a shift towards a more experimental sound. After a hiatus, Finch reunited in 2012 to celebrate the 10th anniversary of "What It Is to Burn," and released their third album, "Back to Oblivion," in 2014.
