In 2022, they announced a 20th-anniversary tour for "What It Is to Burn," performing the album in its entirety.

bands.name: Don Broco
bands.description: Don Broco is a British rock band formed in Bedford, England, in 2008. The lineup consists of Rob Damiani (lead vocals and electronics), Simon Delaney (guitar), Tom Doyle (bass and programming), and Matt Donnelly (drums and backing vocals). They have released four studio albums: "Priorities" (2012), "Automatic" (2015), "Technology" (2018), and "Amazing Things" (2021). "Amazing Things" debuted at number one on the UK Albums Chart, marking their first chart-topping album. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Broco?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Rain City Drive
bands.description: Rain City Drive is an American rock band from Palm Coast, Florida, known for their vibrant and dynamic alternative rock sound with strong roots in the post-hardcore subculture. The band emerged from the evolution of the Sacramento-based band Slaves, featuring The Voice runner-up Matt McAndrew on lead vocals. The group's name is inspired by Manchester, England, often referred to as the "rainy city," where the five members initially met. Their music bridges heavy riffs with soaring, intimate pop melodies, creating arena-ready anthems suitable for various settings, from long drives to massive festivals. Over 1 million fans worldwide listen to the band on Spotify each month, with songs like "Talk to a Friend" and "Heavier" from their 2020 album "To Better Days" accounting for over 100 million streams. In 2022, they released their self-titled album, "Rain City Drive," which quickly cracked the Top 5 on SiriusXM radio’s Octane upon release. The band's spirit of resilience resonates deeply with fans, connecting with all who struggle and find the will to push forward.

bands.name: Tribulation
bands.description: Tribulation is a Swedish heavy metal band formed in 2004 in Arvika, Sweden. Initially known as Hazard, they changed their name to Tribulation in 2004. The band released their debut album, "The Horror," in 2009, followed by "The Formulas of Death" in 2013. Their 2015 album, "Children of the Night," marked a departure from their earlier death metal sound, incorporating elements of traditional heavy metal, black metal, and gothic rock, with themes of the occult and supernatural mythology. In 2021, they released "Where the Gloom Becomes Sound," and in 2024, "Sub Rosa In Æternum." ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/tribulation-announces-sub-rosa-in-aeternum-album?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Set It Off
bands.description: Set It Off is an American rock band formed in 2008 in Tampa, Florida. The group consists of lead vocalist Cody Carson, guitarist and bassist Zach DeWall, and drummer Maxx Danziger. Initially gaining attention through Carson's YouTube channel, they signed with Equal Vision Records after releasing several successful EPs. Their debut full-length album, "Cinematics," was released in 2012, followed by "Duality" in 2014, "Upside Down" in 2016, and "Midnight" in 2019. In 2022, they released their fifth studio album, "Elsewhere," and in 2023, they announced their departure from Fearless Records to become an independent band. They introduced their new era, "Dopamine," with the single "Punching Bag" in March 2023. The band's musical style has evolved over the years, incorporating elements of pop rock, pop-punk, and alternative rock, with influences from Fall Out Boy, Panic! at the Disco, My Chemical Romance, and New Found Glory. They have toured extensively, including performances at major festivals like Rock am Ring in 2023. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Set_It_Off_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Cody Carson
members.role: Lead Vocals, Keyboards, Piano, Guitar, Clarinet, Alto Saxophone

bands.name: Feeder
bands.description: Feeder is a Welsh alternative rock band formed in 1994 in Newport, Wales. The group consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Grant Nicholas, bassist Taka Hirose, and drummer Karl Brazil. Initially known as Reel, the band changed their name to Feeder after recruiting Hirose in 1994. They signed with The Echo Label and released their debut EP, "Two Colours," in 1995. Their first full-length album, "Polythene," followed in 1997, receiving critical acclaim and establishing them as a prominent act in the UK rock scene. The band's style blends elements of Britpop, alternative rock, and post-grunge, characterized by energetic guitar riffs and introspective lyrics. Over the years, Feeder has released several successful albums, including "Comfort in Sound" (2002), which topped the UK Independent Albums Chart, and "Tallulah" (2019), which reached number four on the UK Albums Chart. Their most recent release, "Black/Red," a double album, came out in April 2024. Feeder has been recognized with multiple awards, including two Kerrang! Awards in 2001 and 2003, and were inducted into the Kerrang! Radio Hall of Fame in 2019. They have also been involved in charitable activities, supporting organizations like War Child and Oxfam. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feeder_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Witch Club Satan
bands.description: Witch Club Satan is an all-female Norwegian black metal band formed in early 2022. The trio met at theatre school and, after two years of lockdown, decided to channel their energy into black metal, teaching themselves to play instruments to bring their musical vision to life. ([loudersound.com](https://www.loudersound.com/features/witch-club-satan-interview-2024?utm_source=openai)) Their music is heavily influenced by legendary Norwegian black metal bands like Mayhem, Darkthrone, Emperor, and Satyricon. ([alcatraz.be](https://www.alcatraz.be/en/bands/witch-club-satan?utm_source=openai)) The band's self-titled debut album was released on March 8, 2024, coinciding with International Women's Day. The album features tracks like "Birth," "Reverse This Fuck," and "Black Metal Is Krig," embodying their tempestuous cauldron of blastbeats, scything riffs, and reverb-drenched vocals. ([witchclubsatan.bandcamp.com](https://witchclubsatan.bandcamp.com/album/witch-club-satan?utm_source=openai)) In June 2025, they released the single "You Wildflower," showcasing a slightly gentler, more vulnerable tone while maintaining their distinct convection of feminine rage. ([revolvermag.com](https://www.revolvermag.com/music/rising-black-metal-trio-witch-club-satan-channel-female-rage-on-new-song-you-wildflower/?utm_source=openai)) Their live shows and music videos often incorporate nudity, gore, and occult symbols, reflecting their commitment to feminist and sociopolitical themes. ([louderthanwar.com](https://louderthanwar.com/witch-club-satan/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bride
bands.description: "Knife Bride" does not appear to be an active metal band. The closest match is "Bride," an American Christian metal band formed in 1983 in Louisville, Kentucky, by brothers Dale and Troy Thompson. Initially known as Matrix, they changed their name to Bride in 1986 and released their debut album, "Show No Mercy," that same year. Over the years, the band has explored various musical styles, including heavy metal, hard rock, and Christian rock. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Live to Die" (1988), "Silence Is Madness" (1989), and "Snakes in the Playground" (1992). Despite lineup changes, the Thompson brothers have remained central to the band's identity. As of 2025, Bride continues to perform and release music, with their latest album, "Vipers and Shadows," self-released in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bride_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Waldgeflüster
bands.description: Waldgeflüster is a German black metal band formed in 2005 by multi-instrumentalist Jan "Winterherz" van Berlekom. Initially a solo project, it evolved into a full band in 2014. The band's music blends atmospheric black metal with melancholic and nature-inspired themes, often drawing from Germanic mythology. Their discography includes several albums and EPs, with their latest release, "Knochengesänge I & II," announced for November 7, 2025. ([metalinjection.net](https://metalinjection.net/new-music/german-black-metal-unit-waldgefluster-announces-double-album-streams-first-single?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mammoth
bands.description:
Mammoth, formerly known as Mammoth WVH, is an American rock band formed in 2015 and fronted by Wolfgang Van Halen, the son of the legendary Eddie Van Halen. Initially conceived as a solo project, Mammoth evolved into a full-fledged band following the disbandment of Van Halen in 2020 due to Eddie's passing. The band's name pays homage to one of Van Halen's early band names, reflecting a deep connection to his musical roots. Mammoth's musical style is a blend of hard rock, alternative rock, and post-grunge, characterized by powerful guitar riffs, dynamic rhythms, and introspective lyrics.

The debut album, "Mammoth WVH," released on June 11, 2021, received positive reviews for its distinct sound and technical proficiency. The album's lead single, "Distance," garnered significant attention and was nominated for Best Rock Song at the 2022 Grammy Awards. In August 2023, the band released their second album, "Mammoth II," which continued to showcase their evolving sound and musical depth. In May 2025, the band released "The End," their third studio album, marking a new chapter in their musical journey.

The current lineup of Mammoth includes Wolfgang Van Halen on vocals, guitar, bass, and drums; Frank Sidoris on guitar; Jon Jourdan on guitar; Ronnie Ficarro on bass; and Garrett Whitlock on drums. The band's official website is [mammoth.band](https://mammoth.band).

bands.name: Kanonenfieber
bands.description: Kanonenfieber is an anonymous German blackened death metal band from Bamberg, Bavaria, formed in 2020. The band's sole member, known as "Noise," is a multi-instrumentalist who records all studio material solo, while live performances feature guest musicians. The band's thematic focus centers on World War I, with lyrics drawn from original letters and documents from the era. Their debut album, "Menschenmühle," released in February 2021, was recorded between September and November 2020 at Noisebringer Studio. The album's cover art is an anti-war poster by Mihály Biró, considered the founder of political poster art. In September 2024, Kanonenfieber released their second album, "Die Urkatastrophe," through Century Media Records. The album delves into the catastrophic impact of World War I, delivering a fusion of black and death metal with historical storytelling. The release was preceded by the single "Waffenbrüder," accompanied by a cinematic video produced by Grupa13. The track features a guest guitar solo by Maik Weichert of Heaven Shall Burn and recounts the true story of two childhood friends who joined the Bavarian army in 1916, only for one to be killed in a shell attack. The surviving friend's grief inspired a laurel, a poem of mourning, which is included in printed form in both artbook editions of the album. Kanonenfieber's music is characterized by blackened death metal vocals, interwoven with harsh blackened death metal that ramps up the pace and adds intensity to tracks. The band's style has been compared to acts like 1914, Minenwerfer, and Bolt Thrower. Their live performances are noted for their authenticity, with the band wearing German World War I uniforms and covering their faces with black full-face masks, paying homage to all soldiers who died, often unknown, victims of war.

bands.name: Wargasm
bands.description:
Wargasm is a British electronic rock duo from London, formed in 2018 by Sam Matlock and Milkie Way. Matlock, previously part of Dead!, and Way, a former concert photographer, bonded over a shared love for nu-metal acts like Limp Bizkit. Initially, they composed pop-punk songs and recorded an EP titled "Sadgasm," which they chose not to release. Their musical style evolved into a fusion of rap and nu-metal, leading to the formation of Wargasm in August 2019. The band's name is inspired by the L7 song of the same name, symbolizing a blend of "angry, visceral red energy" and the euphoria derived from powerful music. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wargasm?utm_source=openai))

In April 2020, Wargasm released "Your Patron Saints," a track addressing themes of loneliness and isolation. This was followed by "Pyro Pyro" in June. The duo performed at the 2021 Download Festival Pilot and supported Neck Deep on their UK tour in early 2022. In May 2022, they signed with Slowplay and Republic Records, releasing the single "D.R.I.L.D.O." and their mixtape "Explicit: The Mixxxtape," which charted at No. 19 on the UK Rock & Metal Albums Chart. Their 2023 album "Venom" peaked at No. 88 on the UK Albums Chart. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wargasm?utm_source=openai))

Critics often categorize Wargasm's music as electro-punk, nu-metal, and riot grrrl. They have been nominated for various awards at the Heavy Music Awards and won the New Noise Award at the 2022 Kerrang! Awards. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wargasm?utm_source=openai))

In April 2025, Wargasm released "Vigilantes," marking their return as independent artists. They also announced their first North American headlining tour, scheduled for late summer and fall 2025. ([theprp.com](https://www.theprp.com/2025/04/23/news/wargasm-debut-vigilantes-music-video-announce-their-first-ever-north-american-headlining-tour/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Tom Morello
bands.description: Tom Morello is an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter renowned for his innovative and politically charged music. Born on May 30, 1964, in Harlem, New York City, he was raised in Libertyville, Illinois. Morello's musical journey began in the mid-1980s with the band Lock Up, which released their debut album, "Something Bitchin' This Way Comes," in 1989. In 1991, he co-founded Rage Against the Machine, a band that fused rap and metal, achieving significant success with albums like "Evil Empire" (1996) and "The Battle of Los Angeles" (1999). After Rage Against the Machine disbanded in 2000, Morello formed Audioslave with former Soundgarden vocalist Chris Cornell, releasing three albums between 2002 and 2005. In 2006, he collaborated with Boots Riley to form Street Sweeper Social Club, blending rock and hip-hop influences. Morello's solo work under the moniker The Nightwatchman showcases his acoustic and folk music, reflecting his political activism. He has also been involved in supergroups like Prophets of Rage (2016–2019), which combined members from Rage Against the Machine, Public Enemy, and Cypress Hill. Throughout his career, Morello has been recognized for his distinctive guitar style and his commitment to social and political causes.

bands.name: Return To Dust
bands.description: Return to Dust is an American rock band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2022. The quartet comprises Matty Bielawski (guitar, vocals), Graham Stanush (bass, vocals), Sebastian Gonzalez (guitar), and London Hudson (drums). Heavily influenced by Alice in Chains, their music blends grunge, alternative metal, hard rock, and alternative rock elements. In July 2023, they released their debut EP, "Black Road," followed by their self-titled full-length album, "Return to Dust," in May 2024. The album features the single "Belly Up," which gained significant traction on the Active Rock chart. In August 2025, they released the EP "Speak Like the Dead," with the single "Bored" climbing the Active Rock chart. The band has toured with acts like Sevendust and participated in major festivals such as Inkarceration, Welcome To Rockville, and Sonic Temple. ([lavarecords.com](https://www.lavarecords.com/artists/return-to-dust/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Hulder
bands.description:
Hulder is a one-woman black metal project from Portland, Oregon, founded in 2018 by Marliese Beeuwsaert. The project channels the raw spirit of early black metal, blending atmospheric and melodic elements to create a sound that is both aggressive and otherworldly. Hulder's music is inspired by medieval lore, mysticism, folklore, and dark fantasy, drawing listeners into a mystical, shadowy realm where ferocity and beauty coexist. ([personal-records.com](https://www.personal-records.com/artists/hulder/?utm_source=openai))

In 2021, Hulder released her debut full-length album, "Godslastering: Hymns of a Forlorn Peasantry," which introduced her medieval-inspired black metal to the world. Tracks like "Upon Frigid Winds" and "De Dijle" showcased her ability to blend raw aggression with atmospheric beauty. ([personal-records.com](https://www.personal-records.com/artists/hulder/?utm_source=openai)) The following year, she released "The Eternal Fanfare," a five-song mini-album that marked a new phase in the project's rapid development. ([doomstarbookings.com](https://doomstarbookings.com/artists/hulder/?utm_source=openai)) In 2024, Hulder released her sophomore album, "Verses In Oath," which was mixed and mastered by Ahti Kortelainen at Tico Tico Studio in Finland. ([metallian.com](https://metallian.com/hulder.php?utm_source=openai))

Hulder's music has been compared to bands like Darkthrone, Ulver, and Satanic Warmaster, offering a journey into a mystical, shadowy realm where ferocity and beauty coexist. ([personal-records.com](https://www.personal-records.com/artists/hulder/?utm_source=openai))

As of November 2025, Hulder continues to captivate listeners with her evocative compositions and haunting presence, solidifying her place in the modern black metal landscape.

bands.name: Only Human
bands.description: Only Human is a progressive metal band based in Copenhagen, Denmark. Formed in 2023, the band has quickly established itself within the Danish progressive metal scene. Their music is characterized by a fusion of heavy, atmospheric riffs, thunderous drums, and dark synth layers, creating a soundscape that portrays a future on the brink of collapse. In May 2024, they released their debut single, "Steep Descent," which delves into themes of humanity's relationship with progress and technological development. The track is available for streaming and download on Bandcamp. The current lineup includes Patrick Groenbaech Christensen on vocals, Martin Hastrup and Jens-Christian "JaCK" Kijne on guitars, Guillaume Blanjean on bass, and Andreas Butow Proll on drums. The band is currently unsigned and continues to develop its unique sound within the progressive metal genre.

bands.name: Bush
bands.description: Bush is a British rock band formed in London in 1992. The lineup consists of lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist Gavin Rossdale, lead guitarist Chris Traynor, bassist Corey Britz, and drummer Nik Hughes. The band achieved significant success in the 1990s with their debut album, "Sixteen Stone," which was certified six times multi-platinum by the RIAA. They have sold over ten million records in the United States and 20 million records worldwide. Bush's musical style encompasses post-grunge, grunge, and alternative rock. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Razorblade Suitcase" (1996), "The Science of Things" (1999), "Golden State" (2001), "The Sea of Memories" (2011), "Man on the Run" (2014), "Black and White Rainbows" (2017), "The Kingdom" (2020), "The Art of Survival" (2022), and "I Beat Loneliness" (2025). In November 2023, they released "Loaded: The Greatest Hits 1994-2023," a 21-song collection featuring classics like "Glycerine," "Machinehead," "Comedown," and "Everything Zen." ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/d874250600b9d4b388746f1ae3efbe72?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Scene Queen
bands.description: Scene Queen is the stage name of Hannah Rose Collins, an American singer and songwriter known for pioneering the "bimbocore" genre—a fusion of metalcore with hyperfeminine aesthetics and feminist themes. Born on May 6, 1997, in New York, she grew up listening to emo bands like My Chemical Romance and Brand New. Initially active as RØSÉ, she rebranded as Scene Queen in 2020, gaining prominence on TikTok with over 618,000 followers by September 2023. Her debut EP, "Bimbocore," was released in April 2022, followed by "Bimbocore Vol. 2" in November 2022. Her debut studio album, "Hot Singles in Your Area," came out on June 28, 2024, featuring collaborations with artists like Wargasm, 6arelyhuman, and The Ready Set. The album blends metalcore with hyperpop elements, addressing themes such as sexual empowerment and challenging industry norms. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scene_Queen?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Flayed Disciple
bands.description:
Flayed Disciple is a British death metal and thrash metal band from Taunton, Somerset, formed in 2008. Their music blends elements of Bay Area thrash with extreme death metal, drawing influences from bands like Slayer, Metallica, Megadeth, Cannibal Corpse, Demolition Hammer, Napalm Death, and Deicide. Lyrically, they often explore themes of violence, serial killers, murder, and atheism. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flayed_Disciple?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut EP, "Drawn Viscera," in 2008, followed by "Ejaculate While Killing" in 2010. In 2010, they won the Bournemouth leg of the Bloodstock Open Air "Metal 2 the Masses" competition, earning a slot on the New Blood Stage at Bloodstock. Their debut album, "Death Hammer," was released on 28 May 2012 through Grindscene Records, receiving attention in the UK metal press. They have since toured in the UK and internationally, including appearances at major metal festivals and tours with bands like Vader. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flayed_Disciple?utm_source=openai))

After an eight-year hiatus, Flayed Disciple returned in 2022 with the EP "A Hell in Living Flesh," featuring tracks like "Warmaster," "The Dark Other," and "I Am Leviathan." In 2025, they released another EP titled "Blistering Autolysis," recorded at Muddy Road Studios in Somerset and mastered at Parlour Studios. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/news/flayed-disciple-return-with-a-hell-in-living-flesh-a-brand-new-ep-of-coruscating-death-thrash-fury/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes guitarist Thurston Howe, guitarist Jon Whitfield, drummer Phil Tolfree, bassist Paul Williams, and vocalist Merv Hembrough. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flayed_Disciple?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Oranssi Pazuzu
bands.description:
Oranssi Pazuzu is a Finnish psychedelic black metal band formed in 2007 in Tampere. The band's name combines "oranssi," the Finnish word for "orange," and "Pazuzu," a wind demon from Babylonian mythology. The original lineup consisted of vocalist and guitarist Juho "Jun-His" Vanhanen, drummer Jarkko "Korjak" Salo, guitarist Moit, keyboardist and percussionist Ville "Evil" Leppilahti, and bassist Toni "Ontto" Hietamäki. Moit departed in 2016 and was replaced by Niko "Ikon" Lehdontie of Kairon; IRSE!. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oranssi_Pazuzu?utm_source=openai))

The band's music is characterized by a fusion of black metal with elements of psychedelic rock, space rock, and progressive metal. Their debut album, "Muukalainen puhuu," was recorded in 2008 and released in 2009. This was followed by "Kosmonument" in 2011, "Valonielu" in 2013, "Värähtelijä" in 2016, "Mestarin kynsi" in 2020, and "Muuntautuja" in 2024. The band has also released EPs such as "Kevät / Värimyrsky" in 2017. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oranssi_Pazuzu?utm_source=openai))

Oranssi Pazuzu's innovative approach has earned them recognition as one of the most distinctive and fearless groups in the black metal genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oranssi_Pazuzu?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sinsaenum
bands.description:
Sinsaenum is a multinational blackened death metal supergroup formed in 2016. The band was initiated by French guitarist Frédéric Leclercq, known for his work with DragonForce, who began composing death metal material as early as 1998. He was joined by fellow French guitarist Stéphane Buriez of Loudblast, and American drummer Joey Jordison, formerly of Slipknot and Murderdolls. The lineup was completed with Hungarian vocalist Attila Csihar of Mayhem, American vocalist Sean Zatorsky of Dååth, and French bassist Heimoth of Seth. The band's name, "Sinsaenum," is a portmanteau of "sin" and "insane," coined by Jordison. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinsaenum?utm_source=openai))

Sinsaenum released their self-titled debut EP on June 6, 2016, featuring the track "Death Is the Beginning." Their first full-length album, "Echoes of the Tortured," followed on July 29, 2016, showcasing a blend of blackened death metal with groove elements. In 2017, they released the "Ashes" EP, which included new music and remixed tracks. Their second album, "Repulsion for Humanity," was released in 2018, continuing their exploration of aggressive and atmospheric metal. In 2021, the band faced the loss of drummer Joey Jordison, who passed away in July. Despite this, Sinsaenum announced their third album, "In Devastation," set for release on August 8, 2025, with André Joyzi joining as the new drummer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinsaenum?utm_source=openai))

Musically, Sinsaenum is characterized by a fusion of blackened death metal and groove metal, delivering intense and atmospheric compositions. Their lyrics often explore themes of blasphemy and chaos. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Sinsaenum/3540412683?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Firespawn
bands.description: Firespawn is a Swedish death metal band from Stockholm, formed in 2012. Initially named Fireborn, the group changed their name to Firespawn to avoid confusion with an American band of the same name. The lineup includes Alex Impaler (bass), Victor Brandt (guitar), Fredrik Folkare (guitar), and Matte Modin (drums). They released their debut single, "Lucifer Has Spoken," in August 2015, followed by their first full-length album, "Shadow Realms," in November 2015. Their second album, "The Reprobate," was released in April 2017, and their third album, "Abominate," came out in June 2019. After the passing of vocalist Lars-Göran "L.G." Petrov in March 2021, Firespawn reunited in July 2025 with Jörgen Sandström as the new vocalist, aiming to honor Petrov's legacy. The band is known for their aggressive and fast-paced death metal style, drawing influences from bands like Morbid Angel, Cannibal Corpse, and Behemoth.

bands.name: Saurom
bands.description:
Saurom is a Spanish folk metal band formed in 1996 in San Fernando, Andalusia. Their music, often referred to as "juglar metal," blends elements of heavy metal, folk, and Celtic music, with lyrics inspired by legends, poems, and traditional tales. Notably, some of their songs draw from literary works like "The Lord of the Rings" and "A Song of Ice and Fire." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saurom?utm_source=openai))

The band has released several studio albums, including "El guardián de las melodías perdidas" (2001), "Sombras del Este" (2002), "Legado de juglares" (2004), "JuglarMetal" (2006), "Once romances desde al-Ándalus" (2008), "Maryam" (2010), "Vida" (2012), "Sueños" (2015), "La Magia de la Luna" (2017), "Música" (2020), "El Pájaro Fantasma" (2023), and "El Principito" (2025). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saurom?utm_source=openai))

Their lyrics often explore themes from literature, Spanish history, and legends, with a focus on cultural and social issues. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Saurom/75099?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Miguel Ángel Franco (vocals), Antonio Ruiz (drums), Raúl Rueda (guitar), José Gallardo (bass), Santiago Carrasco (keyboard), and Narci Lara (guitar, violin, flute, bagpipes). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Saurom/75099?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [saurom.com](https://saurom.com).

bands.name: Soulfly
bands.description: Soulfly is an American heavy metal band formed in 1997 by former Sepultura frontman Max Cavalera. The band's music blends elements of thrash metal, groove metal, and world music, creating a distinctive sound that has evolved over the years. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1998, introduced this unique fusion, featuring tracks like "Eye for an Eye" and "No Hope = No Fear." Over the years, Soulfly has released several albums, including "Primitive" (2000), "Dark Ages" (2005), and "Ritual" (2018), each showcasing the band's growth and experimentation with different musical styles. The lineup has seen changes, but Max Cavalera remains the constant driving force behind the band's creative direction.

bands.name: Darvaza
bands.description:
Darvaza is a black metal band formed in 2015 by Omega (all instruments) and Wraath (vocals). Originating from Italy and Norway, the duo's music delves into themes of Satanism and occultism. Their discography includes:

- **"The Silver Chalice"** (2016): A limited edition release that marked their debut.

- **"Darkness in Turmoil"** (2018): An EP that further solidified their presence in the black metal scene.

- **"The Downward Descent"** (2019): Another EP showcasing their evolving sound.

- **"Ascending into Perdition"** (2022): A full-length album that received critical acclaim.

- **"We Are Him"** (2025): Their latest full-length album, released on December 5, 2025, under Terratur Possessions. The album features tracks like "Holy Blood," "A Last Prayer in Gethsemane," and "Chaos.Fire.Devotion." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Darvaza/We_Are_Him/1374936?utm_source=openai))

Darvaza's music is characterized by its intense and atmospheric black metal style, appealing to fans of the genre.

([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Darvaza/3540405209?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Foreigner
bands.description: Foreigner is a British-American rock band formed in New York City in 1976. The original lineup included vocalist Lou Gramm, guitarist Mick Jones, bassist Ed Gagliardi, drummer Dennis Elliott, keyboardist Al Greenwood, and multi-instrumentalist Ian McDonald. The band's name reflects its international composition, with members from both the UK and the US. Foreigner achieved significant commercial success, selling over 80 million records worldwide, including 38 million in the United States. Their music blends hard rock, soft rock, and arena rock elements, characterized by powerful vocals and memorable melodies. Notable hits include "Cold as Ice," "Hot Blooded," "Waiting for a Girl Like You," and "I Want to Know What Love Is." The band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2024, recognizing their enduring impact on the rock genre. Despite lineup changes over the years, Foreigner continues to tour and perform, maintaining a dedicated fan base.

members.name: Mick Jones
members.role: Lead And Rhythm Guitars, Keyboards, Backing And Lead Vocals

members.name: Bruce Watson
members.role: Lead And Rhythm Guitars, Backing Vocals

members.name: Luis Maldonado
members.role: Rhythm And Lead Guitars, Backing Vocals, Bass (2021–2025); Lead Vocals (2025–Present)

members.name: John Roth
members.role: Rhythm And Lead Guitars, Bass, Backing Vocals (2025–Present)

bands.name: Blood Countess
bands.description: Blood Countess is a black metal band formed in 2018 in York, North Yorkshire, England. The band draws inspiration from the historical figure Elizabeth Bathory, often referred to as the "Blood Countess," whose notorious legacy influences their thematic content. Their music is characterized by atmospheric and aggressive elements, blending traditional black metal with symphonic undertones. In 2019, they released a self-titled demo cassette, which was followed by their debut full-length album, "Occulta Tenebris," in 2022. The album features tracks such as "Storms over Carpathia" and "Ad Altare Sanguinem," showcasing the band's evolving sound. In 2025, they released a live recording titled "Live in York MMXXIV," capturing the intensity of their live performances. Blood Countess continues to explore dark and atmospheric themes, contributing to the rich tapestry of the UK's black metal scene.

bands.name: Uma
bands.description: UMA, formerly known as Uma Thurman, is a Croatian stoner band from Rijeka, formed in 2014. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with the current members being Neno (guitar), Matej (bass), Ivan (guitar), and Vinko (drums). UMA's music is characterized by instrumental outbursts and a trippy flair, blending elements of stoner rock with fierce riffs and noise. Their sound requires deep relaxation of the mind, occasionally exploding with emotion. The band has released two albums: "Uma Thurman" and "I Am The High Fucking Priestess," and their third album, "Black Mamba," was released on July 23, 2022. The album was recorded at Studio Palach and produced by Davor Delić. The first single from the album, "Black Mamba," showcases the band's evolution towards a more doom-influenced sound. UMA has performed at various stages, receiving excellent critiques from the audience for their unique and immersive musical style.

bands.name: Nytt Land
bands.description: Nytt Land is a Nordic folk duo from Kalachinsk, Siberia, Russia, formed in 2013 by husband and wife Anatoly and Natalya Pakhalenko. The band is known for their unique blend of traditional Nordic folk music with ambient elements, creating a sound that is both haunting and evocative. They utilize handcrafted instruments such as the tagelharpa, shaman drum, kravik lyre, jew-harp, and incorporate traditional throat singing into their performances. Their lyrics are often sung in Old Norse, drawing inspiration from Norse mythology and historical texts like the Poetic Edda. Since their formation, Nytt Land has released several albums, including "Fimbulvinter" (2017), "Oðal" (2018), "CVLT" (2020), "Ballads of Lost Times" (2020), "Ritual" (2021), and "Torem" (2023). They have toured with Wardruna in Russia and performed at various Viking, folk, and metal festivals across Europe. Their music has been compared to that of Wardruna and Danheim, with added traditional throat singing and handmade instruments. The band has stated they are inspired by the sounds of Siberian nature, and their records have included live recordings of raven calls and other forest sounds.

bands.name: Heleven
bands.description:
Heleven is a progressive metal band from Granada, Spain, formed in September 2016 by vocalist and guitarist Higinio Ruiz and guitarist Álvaro Castilla. The lineup was solidified with the addition of bassist Kike Martín and drummer Matías Famá, allowing the band to explore new musical horizons. ([metalfamily.es](https://metalfamily.es/js_artist/heleven/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a blend of raw progressive metal and grunge-influenced vocals, creating a sound that is both melancholic and heavy. ([heleven.bandcamp.com](https://heleven.bandcamp.com/music?utm_source=openai))

Heleven's discography includes several notable releases:

- **Medusa's Love Story** (2019): Their debut album, which introduced their unique sound to the metal scene.

- **Into the Oceans** (2021): The sophomore album that further established their presence in the progressive metal genre.

- **New Horizons Pt. 1** (2023) and **New Horizons Pt. 2** (2024): These two-part albums showcase the band's evolution, incorporating darker and more intense elements into their music. ([artgatesrecords.com](https://artgatesrecords.com/artists/heleven?utm_source=openai))

The band's themes often delve into mental health, environmental, and social issues, reflecting their commitment to addressing meaningful topics through their music. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Heleven/3540520417?utm_source=openai))

Heleven is currently signed to Art Gates Records and continues to captivate audiences with their innovative approach to progressive metal.

bands.name: Abhorration
bands.description: Abhorration is a Norwegian death metal band formed in Oslo in 2020. The lineup consists of Magnus on vocals and guitar, Aril on guitar, Andreas on bass, and Øyvind Kvam on drums. The band released their debut EP, "After Winter Comes War," in 2021, followed by their first full-length album, "Demonolatry," in 2024, both through Invictus Productions. ([nattskog.wordpress.com](https://nattskog.wordpress.com/2025/11/06/interview-abhorration/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by fast, aggressive, and evil death metal, staying true to the roots of the genre. ([nattskog.wordpress.com](https://nattskog.wordpress.com/2025/11/06/interview-abhorration/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Funeral Portrait
bands.description: The Funeral Portrait is an American rock band from Atlanta, Georgia, formed in 2014. Originally known as Cosmoscope, they released a cover of NSYNC's "It's Gonna Be Me" in 2013 and an album titled "Hero or Menace" the same year. After rebranding to The Funeral Portrait, they released their first EP, "For the Dearly Departed," in late 2014, followed by their debut album, "A Moment of Silence," in 2016. In 2023, they signed with Better Noise Music and released the EP "Sounds from Beyond the Abyss, Vol. 1," featuring covers of "Mad World" by Gary Jules and "Creep" by Radiohead. Their 2024 album, "Greetings from Suffocate City," includes collaborations with Bert McCracken of The Used and Spencer Charnas of Ice Nine Kills. The band's music blends emotional hardcore, punk rock, and theatrical elements, drawing comparisons to bands like My Chemical Romance, Ghost, and Motionless In White. Their lyrics address themes such as mental health, depression, love, and anger. The Funeral Portrait has toured extensively, opening for acts like Shinedown, Underoath, Skillet, and Ice Nine Kills. They are known for their energetic live performances, incorporating elaborate stage designs and characters known as "The Icons." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Funeral_Portrait?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Røry
bands.description: RØRY is the stage name of Roxanne Emery, an English singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist born on October 4, 1984, in Southampton, England. She is the sister of DJ and producer Gareth Emery. RØRY began her music career in 2011 with the release of her debut EP, "An Introduction to Roxanne Emery," which charted at number 54 on iTunes. Her 2011 acoustic recording of "LATE" went viral on YouTube, amassing over 400 million streams. Over the years, she has collaborated with various artists, including K-391, Trivecta, MitiS, and SLANDER, contributing vocals to tracks that have garnered significant attention. In 2021, she introduced her anthemic mix of metal, punk, and pop to the British rock scene with singles like "f*ck fame," "Psychological War," and "My Chemical Romance." This was followed by her debut EP, "Family Drama," in 2023. Her debut full-length album, "RESTORATION," was released on January 31, 2025, via Sadcøre Records. The album received critical acclaim, with Rachel Roberts of Kerrang! awarding it 4 out of 5 stars, highlighting RØRY's unique blend of guitars, vocals, and rap elements. Ed Walton of Distorted Sound rated the album 9/10, describing it as "a tour de force of defiance, maturity, vulnerability, and triumph." The album's tracklist includes "if pain could talk, what would it say?" and "WOLVES." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Restoration_%28R%C3%B8ry_album%29?utm_source=openai)) RØRY's music is characterized by its raw emotion and genre-blending style, resonating with a diverse audience. She has built a substantial fan base, amassing over 30 million streams and selling out two UK tours. Her authenticity and storytelling have earned her support from major outlets like Kerrang!, Rock Sound, and BBC Radio 1. ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2025/02/rory-shares-brand-new-video-for-wolves/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Pussy Regurgitation
bands.description: Pussy Regurgitation is a Finnish brutal death metal band formed in 2012 in the Helsinki/Espoo area. Known for their intense and aggressive sound, they explore themes of gore, sex, and dark humor in their music. The band has been active since their formation, with a brief hiatus between 2016 and 2025, after which they resumed their activities. Their discography includes several releases that showcase their commitment to the brutal death metal genre.

bands.name: Wolves In The Throne Room
bands.description:
Wolves in the Throne Room is an American black metal band formed in 2002 in Olympia, Washington, by brothers Aaron and Nathan Weaver. The band is renowned for their atmospheric black metal style, often referred to as "Cascadian black metal," which emphasizes themes of nature, mysticism, and the Pacific Northwest's landscape. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolves_in_the_Throne_Room?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "Diadem of 12 Stars," released in 2006, received critical acclaim for its unique blend of black metal and ambient elements. The album was recorded with a budget of $1,100 at Louder Studios in San Francisco, with the band borrowing equipment from local band Ludicra. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolves_in_the_Throne_Room?utm_source=openai))

Following their debut, the band released several albums, including "Two Hunters" (2007), "Black Cascade" (2009), "Celestial Lineage" (2011), "Celestite" (2014), "Thrice Woven" (2017), and "Primordial Arcana" (2021). Their music is characterized by a blend of traditional black metal elements—such as tremolo-picked guitar riffs, harsh vocals, and blast beat drumming—interwoven with atmospheric layers and folk influences. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolves_in_the_Throne_Room?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of brothers Nathan Weaver (vocals, guitar) and Aaron Weaver (drums, other instruments). Over the years, the band has collaborated with various artists, including Persian classical singer Jessika Kenney, who performed vocals on the songs "Cleansing" and "I Will Lay Down My Bones Among the Rocks and Roots." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolves_in_the_Throne_Room?utm_source=openai))

Wolves in the Throne Room has not incorporated most of the traditional traits of black metal, such as corpse paint, the use of pseudonyms, and Satanic imagery. Instead, they focus on themes of nature, mysticism, and the Pacific Northwest's landscape. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolves_in_the_Throne_Room?utm_source=openai))

Their official website is [wittr.com](https://wittr.com/), where fans can find more information about the band, their discography, and upcoming events.

bands.name: Eihwar
bands.description: Eihwar is a French metal duo formed in 2019, consisting of Mark and Asrunn. Their music is characterized by rhythmic drums and a variety of vocal styles, creating a unique blend of metal and traditional influences. In 2024, they released their debut album, "Ragnarok," which features ten tracks that showcase their distinctive sound. The album has been described as "Viking War Trance," highlighting its focus on percussion and ritualistic vocals. Notable tracks include "Ragnar's Last Raid," "Ragnarok," and "The Forge." Their music has been compared to that of The Hu, due to its emphasis on percussion as the lead instrument. Eihwar's innovative approach offers a fresh and engaging listening experience.

bands.name: Ecca Vandal
bands.description: Ecca Vandal is an Australian singer-songwriter and rapper known for her genre-defying sound that blends elements of punk, hip-hop, jazz, soul, and electronic music. Born in Louis Trichardt, South Africa, to Sri Lankan Tamil refugee parents, she moved to Melbourne, Australia, during her childhood. Ecca's musical journey began with a foundation in jazz, which later evolved as she embraced the raw energy of punk and the improvisational aspects of hip-hop. Her debut EP, "End of Time," released in January 2016, showcased her unique style and set the stage for her self-titled debut album in October 2017. The album received critical acclaim for its vibrant and diverse tracks, featuring collaborations with artists like Dennis Lyxzén of Refused and Jason Aalon Butler of Letlive. Ecca's dynamic performances have led her to tour alongside renowned acts such as Queens of the Stone Age, Incubus, and The Prodigy, and to appear at major festivals including Download, Reading and Leeds, and Afropunk. In recent years, she has continued to evolve her sound, releasing singles like "Bleed But Never Die" in August 2024 and "Cruising to Self Soothe" in February 2025. Her music is available on platforms like Bandcamp and Spotify.

bands.name: Hagane
bands.description: Hagane is a Japanese power metal band formed in Tokyo in June 2018. The group was established by bassist Sayaka, who had recently graduated from high school. The original lineup included vocalist Chiemi, guitarists Sakura and Mayto, bassist Sayaka, and drummer Kanako Takahashi. In 2019, Chiemi departed, and Uyu joined as the new vocalist. The band's musical style is characterized by melodic power metal, drawing influences from bands like Helloween, Rhapsody of Fire, and Dragonforce. Their lyrics are predominantly in Japanese, with some songs featuring English lyrics. Hagane's discography includes two demo CDs released in 2018 and 2020, two live DVDs, an EP, and singles. Their debut full-length album, "Code;9021," was released in 2022, followed by the EP "Life Goes On!" in 2024. In April 2025, they released their second full-length album, "Top of the Tower." ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hagane_%28Band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Avulsed
bands.description:
Avulsed is a Spanish death metal band formed in August 1991 in Madrid by vocalist Dave Rotten. Over the years, they have become a prominent name in the death metal scene, known for their intense and aggressive musical style. Their lyrics often explore themes of death, gore, mutilation, and perversion. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avulsed?utm_source=openai))

The band's discography includes several full-length albums, such as "Eminence in Putrescence" (1996), "Stabwound Orgasm" (1999), "Yearning for the Grotesque" (2003), "Gorespattered Suicide" (2005), "Nullo (The Pleasure of Self-Mutilation)" (2009), and "Ritual Zombi" (2013). In 2025, they released their eighth studio album, "Phoenix Cryptobiosis," marking their first collection of original material in 12 years. ([elevarmagazine.com](https://www.elevarmagazine.com/music/avulsed-rising-from-the-gore-soaked-earth?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of vocalist Dave Rotten, guitarist Cabra, guitarist Juancar, bassist Tana, and drummer Santiago Arroyo "Gog." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avulsed?utm_source=openai))

For more information, you can visit their official website at [www.avulsed.com](http://www.avulsed.com).

bands.name: Blodknoke
bands.description: Blodknoke is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2021. The band is known for its raw and atmospheric sound, blending traditional black metal elements with modern influences. Their music often explores themes of darkness, nature, and the occult, creating an immersive experience for listeners. Blodknoke's discography includes several singles and EPs, with their 2024 release, "Daemon Vult," receiving critical acclaim for its intensity and depth. The band has performed live in Norway, captivating audiences with their powerful stage presence and dedication to the black metal tradition.

bands.name: High Vis
bands.description:
High Vis is an English rock band formed in London in 2016, emerging from the city's vibrant hardcore punk scene. The band was established by vocalist Graham Sayle, guitarist Rob Hammeren, drummer Edward "Ski" Harper, and bassist Rob Moss, with guitarist Romain Bruneau joining shortly after. The name "High Vis" is derived from the colloquial term for high-visibility clothing, symbolizing the band's working-class roots and their desire to stand out in the music scene. Their sound is a dynamic fusion of hardcore punk, post-punk, indie rock, and elements of Britpop, creating a unique and energetic musical style.

Their debut album, "No Sense No Feeling," was released on December 7, 2019, showcasing their raw energy and lyrical depth. The band continued to evolve with the release of "Blending" in 2022, which featured singles like "Talk For Hours" and "Fever Dream," further solidifying their presence in the post-punk and indie rock landscapes. In 2024, High Vis released their third album, "Guided Tour," on October 18, 2024, which received critical acclaim for its innovative approach to blending genres and its introspective lyrics. The album includes singles such as "Mob DLA," "Mind's a Lie," and "Drop Me Out," each reflecting the band's commitment to addressing social issues and personal experiences through their music.

High Vis has been recognized for their passionate performances and their ability to blend various musical styles, making them a significant presence in the UK music scene. Their music often addresses themes of class struggle, personal growth, and societal challenges, resonating with a wide audience. The band's lineup has seen some changes over the years, with guitarist Martin MacNamara joining in 2018 and bassist Jack Muncaster in 2024, but their core sound and message remain consistent.

For more information and to explore their discography, visit their official website at https://highvisuk.com/.

bands.name: Viking Skull
bands.description:
Viking Skull is a British heavy metal band formed in 2002 in Corby, Northamptonshire. Initially conceived as a semi-comedic support act for Raging Speedhorn, the lineup included vocalist and guitarist Frank Regan, guitarist Darren Smith, bassist Kevin "Waldie" James, and drummer Gordon Morrison. Their debut EP, "Chapter One," released in 2003, received critical acclaim, with Metal Hammer awarding it an unprecedented 11 out of 10. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_Skull?utm_source=openai))

In 2005, Viking Skull released their first full-length album, "Born in Hell," which showcased their heavy metal and hard rock influences. The album received mixed reviews, with some critics praising its energy and others criticizing its predictability. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Born_in_Hell?utm_source=openai))

The band underwent several lineup changes over the years. In 2006, Smith and Morrison departed, leading to the addition of guitarist Julian "Jules" Cooper and drummer Jess Margera. This lineup produced "Chapter Two" in 2007. Later, guitarist Rich Vose and guitarist Dom Wallace joined, resulting in the 2008 release "Doom, Gloom, Heartache & Whiskey." After a brief hiatus, Regan returned in 2012 for "Cursed by the Sword." The band reformed in 2015, leading to the release of their self-titled album in 2016. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_Skull?utm_source=openai))

Musically, Viking Skull blends heavy metal, stoner metal, and hard rock, drawing influences from bands like Black Sabbath, AC/DC, and Motörhead. Their sound is characterized by heavy riffs, energetic performances, and a raw, unpolished aesthetic. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viking_Skull?utm_source=openai))

As of 2023, the current lineup includes vocalist and guitarist Frank Regan, guitarist Dom Wallace, guitarist Az Hastings, bassist Larry Connolly, and drummer Gordon Morrison. The band continues to perform and record, maintaining a dedicated fan base in the heavy metal community.

bands.name: Feversea
bands.description:
Feversea is a post-metal band from Oslo, Norway, formed in 2020. Initially starting as a post-punk project, they evolved into a distinctive post-metal sound, incorporating elements of black metal, sludge metal, shoegaze, and neofolk. Their music lies at the intersection where the ferocity of black metal meets ritualistic and ethereal soundscapes. ([karismarecords.no](https://www.karismarecords.no/blog/post-metallers-feversea-set-to-join-dark-essence-records/?utm_source=openai))

In May 2025, Feversea released their debut album, "Man Under Erasure," through Dark Essence Records. The album features eight tracks, including "Sunkindling," which was released as a single prior to the album's debut. ([metalshockfinland.com](https://metalshockfinland.com/2025/04/06/feversea-announce-debut-album-man-under-erasure-release-first-single-sunkindling/?utm_source=openai)) The band's lineup consists of Ada Lønne Emberland on vocals, Isak Lønne Emberland on guitars and synthesizers, Alexander Fossen Lange on guitars, Aleksander Johnsen Solberg on bass guitar, and Jeremie Malezieux on drums. ([karismarecords.no](https://www.karismarecords.no/blog/post-metallers-feversea-set-to-join-dark-essence-records/?utm_source=openai))

"Man Under Erasure" has been praised for its atmospheric and varied post-metal direction, with reviewers highlighting its melancholic, despairing, and cathartic nature. The album is available for streaming and download on Bandcamp. ([feverseaband.bandcamp.com](https://feverseaband.bandcamp.com/album/man-under-erasure?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Atlas
bands.description: ATLAS is a Finnish metal band from Tampere, Finland, known for their unique 'Northcore' sound that blends heavy-hitting riffs with immersive soundscapes inspired by Finnish mythology and poetry. Formed in 2016, the band released their debut EP, "Northern Lights," in 2016, followed by their first full-length album, "Primitive," in 2018. Their second album, "UKKO," released in December 2021, received critical acclaim, with numerous 5/5 reviews worldwide. The album explores themes of death, healing, rebirth, and faith, honoring the band's late father and the Finnish pre-Christian god of the sky, thunder, weather, and harvest. ([atlasnorthcore.bandcamp.com](https://atlasnorthcore.bandcamp.com/album/ukko?utm_source=openai)) The current lineup includes Patrik Nuorteva (vocals), Leevi Luoto (vocals and bass), Tuomas Kurikka (guitars), Aleksi Viinikka (guitars), and Aku Karjalainen (drums). ([holdtight.co](https://www.holdtight.co/news/2019/8/9/modern-metalcore-band-atlas-release-new-single-veli?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Frog Leap
bands.description: Frog Leap is a Norwegian metal band led by multi-instrumentalist Leo Moracchioli, renowned for his metal renditions of popular songs on his YouTube channel, Frog Leap Studios. Formed in 2018, the band has gained international acclaim for their energetic live performances and innovative covers. The current lineup includes Leo Moracchioli (vocals and guitar), Hannah Boulton (female vocals), Rabea Massaad (guitar), Erik Torp (bass), and Truls Haugen (vocals and drums). In August 2019, they performed at the 30th Anniversary of Wacken Open Air, showcasing their unique style to a global audience. Their music spans genres such as heavy metal, groove metal, metalcore, and alternative metal. Frog Leap's official website is [frogleapstudios.com](https://www.frogleapstudios.com/).

bands.name: Halestorm
bands.description:
Halestorm is an American rock band from Red Lion, Pennsylvania, formed in 1997 by siblings Lzzy and Arejay Hale. The group also includes guitarist Joe Hottinger and bassist Josh Smith. Known for their energetic performances and powerful vocals, Halestorm has been a prominent act in the hard rock and heavy metal scenes.

Their self-titled debut album was released in 2009 through Atlantic Records, featuring tracks that showcased their raw energy and musical prowess. The band's second album, "The Strange Case Of..." (2012), included the Grammy Award-winning single "Love Bites (So Do I)". Their third album, "Into the Wild Life" (2015), marked a departure from their earlier sound, incorporating more diverse musical influences. "Vicious" (2018) continued their evolution, blending hard rock with elements of alternative metal. In 2022, they released "Back from the Dead", further solidifying their place in the rock genre. In August 2025, they released their sixth album, "Everest".

Halestorm is renowned for their relentless touring schedule, often performing up to 250 shows a year. They have shared stages with numerous hard rock and heavy metal acts, including Alter Bridge, Chevelle, Seether, Staind, Papa Roach, Trapt, Three Days Grace, Theory of a Deadman, Buckcherry, In This Moment, Disturbed, Shinedown, Avenged Sevenfold, Stone Sour, Hellyeah, Heaven & Hell, Evanescence, The Pretty Reckless, Starset, Sevendust, Dorothy, Lita Ford, Bullet for My Valentine, New Years Day, Stitched Up Heart, and The Warning. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halestorm?utm_source=openai))

The band's lineup consists of:

- Lzzy Hale – lead vocals, rhythm guitar, keyboards
- Arejay Hale – drums, percussion, backing vocals
- Joe Hottinger – lead guitar, backing vocals
- Josh Smith – bass, keyboards, backing vocals

For more information, visit their official website at [www.halestormrocks.com](https://www.halestormrocks.com/).

bands.name: Saratoga
bands.description: Saratoga is a Spanish heavy metal band formed in Madrid in 1992 by bassist Niko del Hierro and guitarist Jero Ramiro. They were soon joined by drummer Marcos Parra and vocalist Tony Dominguez. The band's self-titled debut album was released in 1995, followed by a covers album, "Tributo," in 1996. In 1997, they released "Mi Ciudad," showcasing a heavier sound and gaining success in European countries. The addition of vocalist Leo Jiménez in 1998 marked a significant period, leading to the release of "Vientos de Guerra" in 1999. The 2000s saw the release of "Agotarás" (2002) and "El Clan de la Lucha" (2004), with the band achieving greater international recognition, particularly in Latin America. After a brief hiatus, Saratoga returned in 2014 with vocalist Tete Novoa and drummer Dani Pérez, releasing "Morir en el Bien, Vivir en el Mal" in 2016. The band celebrated their 25th anniversary in 2017 with a special tour. In 2018, they released "Aeternus," followed by "XXX" in 2021, commemorating their 30th anniversary. In October 2025, guitarist Jero Ramiro announced his departure from the band, with Charlie Parra joining as his replacement. ([los40.com](https://los40.com/2025/10/08/saratoga-anuncia-un-importante-cambio-en-el-grupo-que-no-todos-acaban-de-ver-con-buenos-ojos/?utm_source=openai)) Saratoga's music blends heavy metal, power metal, and speed metal, with lyrics addressing social and personal issues. They have released fourteen studio albums, five live records, and four compilations, along with numerous singles.

bands.name: The Plot In You
bands.description: The Plot in You is an American metalcore band formed in Hancock County, Ohio, in 2010. Initially a side project of former Before Their Eyes member Landon Tewers, the group has evolved into a prominent act in the metalcore scene. The current lineup includes Tewers (vocals, guitars, keyboards, programming), Ethan Yoder (bass), Josh Childress (guitars), and Michael Cooper (drums). The band's discography comprises five studio albums: 'First Born' (2011), 'Could You Watch Your Children Burn' (2013), 'Happiness in Self Destruction' (2015), 'Dispose' (2018), and 'Swan Song' (2021). In 2022, they began releasing a series of EPs titled 'Vol. 1,' 'Vol. 2,' and 'Vol. 3,' with 'Vol. 4' announced in September 2025. Their music is characterized by a blend of metalcore, post-hardcore, and alternative rock elements, featuring heavy, down-tuned riffs, cinematic electronics, and deeply confessional lyrics. The band has toured extensively, including headlining tours and festival appearances, and is set to return to Australia in January 2026. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Plot_in_You?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Cypress Hill
bands.description: Cypress Hill is an American hip-hop group formed in 1988 in South Gate, California. They are one of the first Latin American groups to gain mainstream recognition in hip-hop, selling over 20 million albums worldwide. The group is known for their unique blend of hip-hop and rock elements, often incorporating rap metal into their music. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1991, featured the hit single "How I Could Just Kill a Man," which received heavy airplay on urban and college radio. Their second album, "Black Sunday," released in 1993, debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and was certified triple platinum in the U.S. The album included the iconic track "Insane in the Brain." In 2024, Cypress Hill performed alongside the London Symphony Orchestra at the Royal Albert Hall, celebrating the 30th anniversary of "Black Sunday." ([cypresshillroyalalberthall.com](https://www.cypresshillroyalalberthall.com/about/?utm_source=openai)) The current lineup includes B-Real, Sen Dog, DJ Muggs, and Eric Bobo. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cypress_Hill?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Dying Wish
bands.description: Dying Wish is an American metalcore band from Portland, Oregon, formed in 2016. The lineup consists of vocalist Emma Boster, guitarists Sam Reynolds and Pedro Carrillo, drummer Jeff Yambra, and bassist Jon Mackey. Initially known as Trust Issues, the band released their debut EP, "Finding Peace in the Darkness," in 2017. They changed their name to Dying Wish in 2018, releasing a self-titled demo that year. In 2019, they collaborated with Bryan Garris of Knocked Loose on the track "Enemies in Red." The band signed with SharpTone Records in 2020 and released "Innate Thirst." Their debut album, "Fragments of a Bitter Memory," came out on October 1, 2021. In 2023, they released "Symptoms of Survival," followed by their third album, "Flesh Stays Together," on September 26, 2025. The band has toured extensively, including headlining the "Come and Be Killed by Dying Wish" tour in 2023 and co-headlining with Pain of Truth in 2024. They also supported Spiritbox on their Tsunami Sea tour in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dying_Wish_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Grave
bands.description: Grave is a pioneering Swedish death metal band formed in 1988 in Visby, Gotland. Initially known as Corpse, they changed their name to Grave in 1988. The original lineup consisted of vocalist and guitarist Ola Lindgren, bassist and vocalist Jörgen Sandström, guitarist Jonas Torndal, and drummer Jens "Jensa" Paulsson. Grave gained prominence in the early 1990s with their debut album, "Into the Grave" (1991), followed by "You'll Never See..." (1992), "Soulless" (1994), and "Hating Life" (1996), solidifying their reputation in the death metal scene. After a hiatus in 1997, the band reunited in 1999 and has since released several more albums, including "Back from the Grave" (2002), "Fiendish Regression" (2004), "As Rapture Comes" (2006), "Dominion VIII" (2008), "Burial Ground" (2010), "Endless Procession of Souls" (2012), and "Out of Respect for the Dead" (2015). In August 2024, the original 1991 lineup announced a reunion to perform material from their first three albums in 2025, with the first confirmed performance at the Party.San Metal Open Air festival in Germany. ([arrowlordsofmetal.nl](https://arrowlordsofmetal.nl/grave-1991-no-tour-or-new-music/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Erdling
bands.description:
Erdling is a German metal band formed in 2014 by former members of the Neue Deutsche Härte group Stahlmann. The band was established by guitarist Neill Freiwald and drummer Niklas Kahl, who departed Stahlmann due to time constraints and creative differences, respectively. They were joined by guitarist Neno Knuckle and bassist Marco Politi, leading to the creation of Erdling. The band's name, "Erdling," translates to "Earthling" in English, reflecting their grounded and humanistic approach to music.

Musically, Erdling is known for their dark rock and Neue Deutsche Härte style, characterized by heavy guitar riffs, electronic elements, and German lyrics. Their sound has evolved over the years, incorporating more metal influences, especially with their 2020 album "Yggdrasil," which introduced a faster and more metal-heavy style. Lyrically, Erdling explores themes of Nordic mythology, personal experiences, and societal issues, offering a blend of introspection and commentary.

Erdling's discography includes several studio albums, EPs, and singles. Their debut album, "Aus den Tiefen," was released in 2016, followed by "Supernova" in 2017, "Dämon" in 2018, "Yggdrasil" in 2020, "Helheim" in 2021, and "Bestia" in 2023. The band has also released singles such as "Blitz und Donner," "Mein Element," "Tieftaucher," "Wir sind Midgard," "Im Namen der Krähe," "Wölfe der Nacht," "Am heiligen Hain," "Fimbulwinter," "Rabenherz," "Götterdämmerung," and "DEUS." Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music and Spotify.

Erdling has performed at various festivals, including the Amphi Festival, M'era Luna, and Summer Breeze, gaining a reputation for their energetic live performances. In 2024, they celebrated their 10th anniversary with a tour that set new audience records. The band's lineup has seen changes over the years, with members like bassist Pierre Anders and drummer Christian Eichlinger departing, and new members such as guitarist Valeria "Valy" Ereth and guitarist Max Nash joining in 2021. However, both Ereth and Nash left the band in October 2024 due to time constraints with their other project, Böse Fuchs. As of November 2025, Erdling continues to be active, with plans for a new album and tour in the near future.

bands.name: Dumdum Boys
bands.description: DumDum Boys is a renowned Norwegian rock band from Trondheim, formed in 1979. Originally known as Wannskrækk, they transitioned to DumDum Boys in 1985, adopting a more mainstream rock sound inspired by Iggy Pop's song "Dum Dum Boys." The band's debut album, "Blodig Alvor (NaNaNaNaNa)," released in 1988, is considered a classic in Norwegian rock. Their follow-up album, "Splitter Pine" (1989), achieved significant commercial success, solidifying their status in the Norwegian music scene. Over the years, DumDum Boys have released several albums, including "Pstereo" (1990), "Transit" (1992), "Ludium" (1994), "Sus" (1996), "Totem" (1998), "Gravitasjon" (2006), "Tidsmaskin" (2009), "Ti Liv" (2012), and "Armer og Bein" (2018). The band's music is characterized by energetic rock melodies and Norwegian lyrics, with themes ranging from personal experiences to social commentary. The current lineup includes Per Øivind "Prepple" Houmb (vocals), Kjartan Kristiansen (guitar), Aslak Dørum (bass), and Sola Jonsen (drums). DumDum Boys continue to be a significant presence in the Norwegian rock scene, known for their dynamic performances and enduring popularity.

bands.name: Iné Kafe
bands.description: Iné Kafe is a Slovak punk rock band formed in 1995 in Bratislava. The group was initially established by guitarist and vocalist Vratko Rohoň and guitarist Majo Chromý. They were later joined by bassist Richard Barger and drummer Noro Komada. In 1996, the lineup expanded with the addition of drummer Jozef "Dodo" Praženec and bassist Mário "Wayo" Praženec, leading to the release of their first demo, "Kachny." The band's debut album, "Vitaj!" (1998), marked their entry into the Slovak music scene. Their 2000 album, "Je Tu Niekto?" achieved Platinum status in Slovakia, selling over 20,000 copies. In 2006, the band disbanded following Rohoň's departure. However, under fan pressure, they reunited in 2010, releasing the album "Právo na šťastie" in 2011. In 2020, they celebrated their 25th anniversary with a symphonic concert in Bratislava. In 2023, they released "Made in Czechoslovakia," an album featuring pop-punk renditions of classic Slovak and Czech songs from the 1980s. The current lineup includes Vratko Rohoň (vocals, guitar), Jozef "Dodo" Praženec (drums), and Vlado Bis (bass, backing vocals). ([musicreport.cz](https://www.musicreport.cz/single-post/inekafe-made-in-czechoslovakia-tiskovka?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Morild
bands.description: Morild is a Danish black metal band formed in Copenhagen in January 2016. The name 'Morild' translates to 'phosphorescence' in Danish, referring to the natural phenomenon of bioluminescent plankton. ([morild.bandcamp.com](https://morild.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai)) The band released their debut EP, 'VI,' in September 2017, followed by their first full-length album, 'Så kom mørket og tog mig på ordet en sort sky af minder i afgørende stunder frosset fast i mit indre jeg håber det forsvinder med lyset at dø eller blive fri,' in February 2019. ([sentineldaily.com.au](https://sentineldaily.com.au/out-today-morild/?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, 'Disse fugle får ingen at se,' was released on September 5, 2025, featuring four tracks over 45 minutes. ([dinintunerec.com](https://dinintunerec.com/2025/09/08/morild-dropped-new-album/?utm_source=openai)) The band's music is characterized by atmospheric black metal elements, creating a dark and immersive soundscape. They have performed at venues such as the National Danish Aquarium, showcasing their unique blend of music and setting. ([metal-temple.com](https://metal-temple.com/news/morild-to-release-debut-album-and-play-release-show-at-the-national-danish-aquarium/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Devastatiön
bands.description: Devastatiön is a Belgian black/thrash metal band formed in 2006 in the Meetjesland region of East Flanders. Originally known as Black Fuel, the band changed its name to Devastatiön in 2006. They are recognized for their aggressive and raw musical style, blending elements of black and thrash metal. Their lyrics often explore themes such as anti-government sentiments, anti-religion, alcoholism, and death. Devastatiön is signed to Empire Records.

bands.name: Bloed
bands.description: Bloed is a Dutch metal band from Amsterdam, known for their aggressive and experimental approach to black and death metal. Formed in 2023, the band comprises two brothers, Toon and Tuur Soete, and their sister Fieke Soete. Their music is characterized by intense industrial metal elements, drawing comparisons to bands like Godflesh. Lyrically, Bloed explores themes of blasphemy, death, and blood, with song titles such as "Neus" (Nose), "Doop" (Baptism), "Rijk" (Rich), "Broeder" (Brother), and "Druk" (Pressure). In 2023, they won the Sound Track competition, a notable achievement in the Belgian music scene. Their debut EP, "'t Regent," released on July 4, 2025, showcases their raw and uncompromising sound, blending black and death metal with industrial influences. The EP is available on Bandcamp. Their debut album, "Tranen," released on October 24, 2025, continues their exploration of intense and experimental metal, further establishing their presence in the underground scene.

bands.name: Acid Throne
bands.description:
Acid Throne is a British doom metal band from Norwich, Norfolk, England, formed in October 2021. The band was founded by drummer-vocalist Chris Farrar and guitarist-vocalist Matt Stembrowicz, who were later joined by guitarist Craig Smith and vocalist-guitarist Chris Kemp. Their music is characterized by a blend of doom metal, stoner rock, and experimental metal, drawing influences from classic rock, hardcore punk, and black metal. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_Throne?utm_source=openai))

In April 2022, Acid Throne released their debut EP, "The Demo," which showcased their heavy, riff-driven sound. The following year, they recorded their first full-length album, "Kingdom's Death," at Foel Studio in Wales. Released in September 2023, the album received positive reviews, entering the UK Doom Charts at #32. The lead single, "War Torn," was accompanied by a music video directed by Scott Jarvis and premiered with Decibel Magazine. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_Throne?utm_source=openai))

Acid Throne has actively toured the UK, sharing stages with bands like Tooms and Cancer Bats. In January 2024, they embarked on a UK tour as Bat Sabbath, performing alongside Cancer Bats. Their live performances have been praised for their caustic and claustrophobic doom stomp, delivering heavy riffs that resonate with audiences. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_Throne?utm_source=openai))

In 2024, guitarist-vocalist Chris Kemp departed from the band, and guitarist-vocalist and bass player Tom Clutterbuck joined as a temporary member from February to September 2025. Following Clutterbuck's departure, guitarist-vocalist Jack Andrews became a permanent member in October 2025, solidifying the current lineup. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid_Throne?utm_source=openai))

Acid Throne's music is available on various streaming platforms, including Spotify, and their official website provides updates on upcoming shows and releases.

bands.name: Wucan
bands.description: Wucan is a German rock band from Dresden, formed in 2011. The group was established when vocalist Francis Tobolsky placed an advertisement in a student magazine seeking band members. Guitarist Tim George and drummer Pätz joined her, and bassist Patrik completed the lineup in November 2012. In 2013, Wucan began composing and recording, releasing their first demos on YouTube. Their debut EP, "Vikarma," was recorded in March 2014 and released in November of the same year. The band's music is characterized by heavy 1970s-influenced folk rock, incorporating elements of stoner and doom rock. Their sound has drawn comparisons to Jethro Tull due to the prominent use of flute, and to Black Sabbath for its heavy riffs. Wucan's discography includes their debut album "Sow the Wind" (2015), followed by "Reap the Storm" (2017), "Heretic Tongues" (2022), and "Axioms" (2025). In September 2023, they signed a worldwide record deal with Long Branch Records, marking a significant step in their international presence. ([metal.radio.fm](https://metal.radio.fm/news/2023-09-12_00-27_german-hard-rockers-wucan-sign-to-long-branch-records?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: 4 Under Zero
bands.description: "4 Under Zero" is a metal band hailing from the United States. Unfortunately, there is no available information about this band in the provided sources. It's possible that they are an emerging act or have limited online presence. For the most accurate and up-to-date details, I recommend visiting their official website or checking music streaming platforms like Spotify.

bands.name: Loathe
bands.description: Loathe is an English metalcore band from Liverpool, England, formed in 2014. The band consists of lead vocalist Kadeem France, guitarist and second vocalist Erik Bickerstaffe, drummer Sean Radcliffe, and bassist Feisal El-Khazragi. Their music blends elements of metalcore and nu metal with experimental aspects from genres like shoegaze, progressive metal, and industrial music. Loathe has released two EPs and three studio albums: "Prepare Consume Proceed" (2015), "The Cold Sun" (2017), "I Let It In and It Took Everything" (2020), "The Things They Believe" (2021), and "From Nothing" (2023). They have been nominated for the Heavy Music Awards' Best UK Breakthrough Band and the Metal Hammer Golden Gods Awards' Best New Band in 2018. In a 2020 poll by Revolver magazine, they were voted the third most likely contemporary band to break through into the mainstream.

bands.name: Zatokrev
bands.description: Zatokrev is a Swiss post-metal and sludge band formed in Basel in 2002. The group was established by Frederyk Rotter (vocals, guitar), Silvio Spadino (drums), and Marco Grementieri (bass, vocals, sampling). They debuted with a self-titled album in 2004, released by Codebreaker Records, followed by 'Bury the Ashes' in 2006 through their own label, Czar of Crickets. In 2012, they signed with Candlelight Records and released 'The Bat, the Wheel and a Long Road to Nowhere,' which received critical acclaim. Their 2015 album, 'Silk Spiders Underwater...,' continued their exploration of heavy, atmospheric soundscapes. In 2018, they collaborated with Minsk on a split release titled 'Bigod.' After a period of inactivity, Zatokrev announced their new album, 'Bring Mirrors To The Surface,' set for release on August 29, 2025, via Pelagic Records. The album features collaborations with artists such as BÖLZER, SCHAMMASCH, INEZONA, and MINSK. ([distortedsoundmag.com](https://distortedsoundmag.com/zatokrev-announce-new-album-bring-mirrors-to-the-surface/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a blend of sludge, doom, post-hardcore, and cosmic psychedelia, creating a unique and immersive listening experience. ([distortedsoundmag.com](https://distortedsoundmag.com/album-review-bring-mirrors-to-the-surface-zatokrev/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Jools
bands.description:
Jools is a British rock band from Leicester, England, formed in 2019. The band comprises Mitchell Gordon and Kate Price on vocals, Chris Johnston and Callum Connachie on guitar, Joe Dodd on bass, and Chelsea Wrones on drums. Their music is characterized by a fusion of post-punk, noise rock, and garage punk, drawing influences from bands like The Cure, Pixies, and The Streets. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jools_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

In November 2019, Jools released their debut single, "Hysterical Starving Naked," which received positive reviews for its gritty punk vocals and energetic instrumentation. This was followed by "Spineless" in March 2020, noted for its pro-socialist lyrics. Their single "How Can Some Experience What Pride Is Without Liberation for All" was featured as "Rockest Record" on BBC Radio One's Rock Show in September 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jools_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

After tours supporting Black Foxxes and Boston Manor, Jools signed with Raw Power Management in April 2022 and participated in The National Lottery’s "Revive Live" tour in September 2022. In March 2024, they signed with Hassle Records and released "97%" in April 2024, which was also featured as "Tune of the Week" on BBC Radio One's Rock Show. Their debut album, "Violent Delights," was released in 2025, showcasing their dynamic sound and solidifying their presence in the UK rock scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jools_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Jools is known for their chaotic and unpredictable live performances, blending elements of punk, metal, rap, and post-hardcore to create a unique and exhilarating experience. ([punkinfocus.com](https://punkinfocus.com/violent-delights-marks-jools-defiant-arrival/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Defecto
bands.description:
Defecto is a Danish progressive metal band formed in Copenhagen in 2011 by guitarist/vocalist Nicklas Sonne, guitarist Frederik Møller, and bassist Thomas Bartholin. The band is renowned for their fusion of technical precision, melodic strength, and emotional intensity, establishing themselves as a prominent act in the modern Danish metal scene.
