Their music often delves into personal and philosophical themes, creating a unique blend of progressive and cinematic metal.

Their debut EP, "Defecto," released in 2012, garnered significant attention, earning them the title of "Best Metal Band 2012" at the Underground Music Awards. This success paved the way for their first full-length album, "Excluded," in 2016, which received widespread acclaim and led to performances at prestigious festivals like Copenhell. In 2017, they supported Metallica and Rammstein on their European tours, further solidifying their reputation.

In 2017, they released their sophomore album, "Nemesis," followed by "Duality" in 2020. Their latest album, "Echoes of Isolation," was released on October 31, 2025, via Frontiers Music Srl. This concept album explores the haunting landscape of mental illness and psychological struggles, with each song representing a different psychological challenge, such as insomnia, schizophrenia, OCD, PTSD, paranoia, dissociation, and trauma. The album aims to turn pain into power, connecting deeply with listeners who have felt broken, isolated, or misunderstood. ([cgcmrockradio.com](https://cgcmrockradio.com/defecto-echoes-of-isolation-october-31-2025/?utm_source=openai))

Defecto's lineup has evolved over the years. As of 2025, the members are:

- Nicklas Sonne – Vocals, Guitars
- Frederik Møller – Guitars, Backing Vocals
- Thomas Bartholin – Bass, Backing Vocals
- Mikkel Christensen – Drums (2018–present) ([nordicmetal.net](https://www.nordicmetal.net/band/defecto/?utm_source=openai))

Their official website is [defecto.dk](https://defecto.dk/).

bands.name: Bacht'n De Vulle Moane
bands.description: Bacht'n de Vulle Moane is a Belgian metal band formed in 2024 in Kortrijk, West Flanders. The band is known for its raw black metal and ambient style, exploring themes related to society and humanity. Their music is characterized by atmospheric soundscapes and intense, raw black metal elements. As of October 2025, Bacht'n de Vulle Moane remains active and is signed to Haunted by Ill Angels. The current lineup consists of A.A.K., who handles all aspects of the band's music, and Scum, who also manages all musical elements. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Bacht%27n_de_Vulle_Moane/3540556319?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Hives
bands.description: The Hives are a Swedish garage rock band formed in Fagersta in 1993. Known for their energetic live performances and matching black-and-white tuxedos, they gained international acclaim with their 2000 album "Veni Vidi Vicious," featuring the hit single "Hate to Say I Told You So." Their discography includes seven studio albums: "Barely Legal" (1997), "Veni Vidi Vicious" (2000), "Tyrannosaurus Hives" (2004), "The Black and White Album" (2007), "Lex Hives" (2012), "The Death of Randy Fitzsimmons" (2023), and "The Hives Forever Forever the Hives" (2025). The band is also known for their energetic live performances and matching black-and-white tuxedos. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hives?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Rivetskull
bands.description:
RivetSkull is an American heavy metal and hard rock band formed in Seattle, Washington, in 2014. The band is known for its powerful sound and introspective themes, exploring spirituality, personal feelings, and inner struggles. Since their formation, RivetSkull has been an independent act, releasing music without a major label.

**Current Lineup:**

- **Mark Hopkins** – Bass
- **Michael Robson** – Drums
- **Mark X. Plog** – Guitars
- **Chad McMurray** – Vocals, Keyboards

**Discography:**

- **Trail of Souls: Samsara** (2022) – This album showcases the band's heavy rock style, with tracks like "Not Gonna Run" and "My Darkest Hour," highlighting Chad McMurray's emotive vocals. ([transcending-the-mundane.com](https://transcending-the-mundane.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/TTM-38-Rev3.pdf?utm_source=openai))

- **Haunted** (2025) – A single released on September 10, 2025, continuing the band's exploration of deep, introspective themes. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/RivetSkull/Haunted/1368458?utm_source=openai))

**Genres:**

- Heavy Metal
- Hard Rock

**Website:**

For more information and updates, visit RivetSkull's official website.

**Members:**

- **Mark Hopkins** – Bass
- **Michael Robson** – Drums
- **Mark X. Plog** – Guitars
- **Chad McMurray** – Vocals, Keyboards

RivetSkull continues to captivate audiences with their authentic sound and heartfelt lyrics, solidifying their place in the American heavy metal scene.

bands.name: Sondaschule
bands.description:
Sondaschule is a German ska-punk band formed in 1999 in Mülheim an der Ruhr and Oberhausen. The name "Sondaschule" refers to the "style debate between Old School and New School" in the music scene. The founding members include vocalist Tim Kleinrensing ("Costa Cannabis"), guitarist Mirko Klautmann ("Chemokeule"), bassist Marc Böhle ("Böhle 77"), and the brass section from the former band "The Project," featuring Carmelo Parello (trumpet) and Andreas von Schroeter-Kiwitt (trombone).

The band gained recognition with their debut album "Klasse 1A," released in 2002, which led to an extensive tour of over 200 concerts. In 2005, after Böhle's departure, Tobias Rauch joined as the new bassist. The following year, they released their second album "Rambazamba," accompanied by a tour that spanned Germany, the Netherlands, Austria, and Italy. During this period, trombonist Christopher Altmann replaced trumpeter Carmelo Parello, resulting in a lineup with two trombonists.

Sondaschule's musical style blends elements of ska and punk, characterized by energetic rhythms, catchy melodies, and humorous, self-ironic lyrics. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Von A bis B" (2010), which entered the German Alternative and Trend Charts at number 9, and "Lass es uns tun" (2012), marking their first entry into the general German album charts. In 2015, "Schön kaputt" reached number 8 on the German album charts, and in 2017, "Schere, Stein, Papier" peaked at number 7. The band faced a significant loss with the unexpected passing of guitarist Daniel "Blubbi" Junker in June 2021. Despite this, they continued their musical journey, releasing "Unbesiegbar" in February 2022, which debuted at number 2 on the German album charts. Their latest album, "Wir bleiben wach," was released on September 26, 2025, showcasing their resilience and commitment to their craft.

Sondaschule has shared stages with bands like Anti-Flag and Ska-P, and their energetic performances have earned them a dedicated fan base. Their music continues to resonate with audiences, reflecting the band's evolution and enduring presence in the German music scene.

bands.name: Bilmuri
bands.description: Bilmuri is the solo project of Johnny Franck, an American singer-songwriter and producer born on June 8, 1990, in Columbus, Ohio. Franck first gained prominence as the clean vocalist and rhythm guitarist for the metalcore band Attack Attack!, contributing to their albums "Someday Came Suddenly" (2008) and "Attack Attack!" (2010). In 2010, he departed from Attack Attack! to focus on his Christian faith and personal projects. In 2016, Franck launched Bilmuri, a name inspired by actor Bill Murray, marking a shift towards a more experimental and diverse musical style. Bilmuri's sound blends elements of post-hardcore, neon pop-punk, hardcore, and emo, incorporating lo-fi and indie-pop influences. The project has released numerous albums, including "Jaguar Shark" (2016), "Bilmuri" (2016), "Frame" (2017), "Banana" (2017), "Taco" (2018), "Rich Sips" (2019), "Eggy Pocket" (2020), "Goblin Hours" (2022), and "American Motor Sports" (2024). In 2024, Bilmuri signed with Columbia Records, further expanding its reach in the music industry. The project has also featured collaborations with artists like Jon Mess of Dance Gavin Dance and Dayseeker. Bilmuri's dynamic and evolving sound continues to resonate with a diverse audience, reflecting Franck's growth as an artist and his commitment to exploring new musical territories.

bands.name: Split Chain
bands.description: Split Chain is a British nu metal band from Bristol, formed in 2023. The lineup consists of vocalist Bert Martínez-Cowles, bassist Tom Davies, drummer Aaron Black, and guitarists Oli Bowles and Jake Reid. The band emerged from the remnants of local groups such as Pushing Daisies, Ursus, and Roads to Nowhere. They debuted with the single "Get Inside" on April 14, 2023, followed by three more singles that year. In 2024, they released three additional singles, including a reworked version of "Extract" featuring Softcult, renamed "(Re)-Extract," and a cover of Type O Negative's "I Don't Wanna Be Me." After signing with Epitaph Records in 2024, they announced their debut studio album, "Motionblur," released on July 11, 2025. The band has toured extensively across the UK, Europe, and the United States, including a debut headline tour in the US. They have performed at festivals such as Mystic Festival and Download Festival, and have opened for acts including A Day To Remember, Superheaven, Trophy Eyes, Boston Manor, and Thursday. Musically, Split Chain is known for their combination of nu metal and shoegaze, incorporating elements of grunge and post-hardcore, a style they refer to as "Dreamo." They draw inspiration from artists like Deftones, Superheaven, and Narrow Head. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Split_Chain?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Nihilvm
bands.description: Nihilvm is a Polish black/death metal band formed in 2020, known for their atmospheric and intense soundscapes. Their debut full-length album, "Ancient Cosmic Emanation," released on July 29, 2025, features eight tracks that delve into themes of cosmic death, darkness, and astral realms. The album was produced by M. of No Solace/Mgła and showcases the band's commitment to creating immersive and haunting music. The cover artwork was crafted by KATARAXIA, adding a visual depth to their sonic exploration. The album is available through Malignant Voices and Terratur Possessions, with worldwide distribution by Ván Records. The tracklist includes: 1. Arcy triumf śmierci 2. Transcendencja 3. Srebrzyste ostrza gwiazd 4. Reticulum 5. Wejście 6. Zjadacze światów 7. Nihilizm ostateczny (zawiła droga ku boskości) 8. Koniuracja. The band's lineup consists of L. Verewolf on guitars and vocals, Jeff Bass on bass, Shitala on drums, and Defekator on guitars. Their music is characterized by a fusion of black and death metal elements, creating a hypnotic ritual fused with relentless Black Cosmic Death. For more information and to listen to their music, visit their Bandcamp page: https://malignantvoices.bandcamp.com/album/ancient-cosmic-emanation.

bands.name: The Halo Effect
bands.description:
The Halo Effect is a Swedish melodic death metal band formed in 2019 by former members of In Flames, including guitarist Jesper Strömblad, vocalist Mikael Stanne, guitarist Niclas Engelin, bassist Peter Iwers, and drummer Daniel Svensson. Their formation aimed to return to the roots of the 1990s "Gothenburg sound" that pioneered the melodic death metal genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Halo_Effect_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's debut single, "Shadowminds," was released on November 9, 2021, followed by their first album, "Days of the Lost," on August 12, 2022. The album debuted at number one on the Swedish Albums Chart, marking it as the first debut album by a metal band to achieve this feat. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Days_of_the_Lost?utm_source=openai)) In 2024, they released their second studio album, "March of the Unheard," which continued to showcase their commitment to the classic melodic death metal sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/March_of_the_Unheard?utm_source=openai))

The Halo Effect has been recognized for their contributions to the genre, winning the Rising Star award at the 2024 Metal Hammer Awards. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Halo_Effect?utm_source=openai)) They have toured extensively, including European tours with Meshuggah and North American tours with Unearth and High Command. ([loudersound.com](https://www.loudersound.com/news/melodeath-supergroup-the-halo-effect-ex-in-flames-dark-tranquillity-announce-headline-european-tour?utm_source=openai))

Their music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, melodic leads, and powerful vocals, staying true to the essence of the Gothenburg sound.

bands.name: Captein Black Beard
bands.description:
"Captein Black Beard" is a metal band from the United States, known for their unique blend of heavy metal and pirate-themed music. Formed in the early 2010s, the band has gained recognition for their energetic performances and distinctive sound. Their music often features themes of adventure, the sea, and pirate lore, setting them apart in the metal scene. Over the years, they have released several albums, each showcasing their evolving style and commitment to their nautical-inspired concept. Their discography includes:

- "Pirate's Life" (2014)
- "Sea of Steel" (2016)
- "Blackbeard's Revenge" (2019)
- "Legends of the Deep" (2022)

These albums have been well-received by fans and critics alike, solidifying "Captein Black Beard" as a notable act in the metal community.

bands.name: Slay Squad
bands.description:
Slay Squad is a dynamic collective from San Bernardino County, California, known for their unique fusion of hip-hop and metal, a style they term "ghetto metal." Formed by a group of teenagers with shared interests in hip-hop, metal, photography, and skating, the band has maintained a strong DIY ethos throughout their career. ([live-metal.com](https://live-metal.com/2021/10/22/slay-squad-drops-new-track-seishin/?utm_source=openai))

Their music seamlessly blends heavy metalcore riffs with modern rap and trap elements, creating a sound that is both aggressive and rhythmically complex. This innovative approach has garnered them a dedicated following in the Southern California underground music scene. ([nocovershow.com](https://www.nocovershow.com/bands/slaysquad?utm_source=openai))

In 2016, Slay Squad released two significant projects: "Souls for the Feast" and "Stick to the Plan," which showcased their evolving sound and solidified their presence in the music community. ([fandefest.com](https://fandefest.com/artiste/slay-squad/1zi4bswn8gdaoyfwekqfqe?utm_source=openai)) They continued to build on this momentum with the release of "Seishin" in 2021, a track that exemplifies their unique style and thematic depth. ([live-metal.com](https://live-metal.com/2021/10/22/slay-squad-drops-new-track-seishin/?utm_source=openai)) In 2023, they premiered "X," produced by Morgoth Beatz, further demonstrating their commitment to pushing musical boundaries. ([theprp.com](https://www.theprp.com/2023/01/27/news/slay-squad-premiere-music-video-for-new-song-x/?utm_source=openai)) Their most recent release, "GUMBO," came out in May 2025, accompanied by a music video that continues to showcase their innovative approach to music. ([theprp.com](https://www.theprp.com/2025/05/16/news/slay-squad-premiere-gumbo-music-video/?utm_source=openai))

Slay Squad's energetic live performances have earned them spots on notable tours, including the "Chaos & Carnage" tour in 2023, where they shared the stage with bands like Dying Fetus and Suicide Silence. ([lambgoat.com](https://lambgoat.com/news/37949/slay-squad-release-video-for-x/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is available on various platforms, including SoundCloud, Apple Music, and their official website. ([soundcloud.com](https://soundcloud.com/slaysquad111?utm_source=openai))

For the most current information on their music and upcoming events, visit their official website at [www.slay111.com](http://www.slay111.com).

bands.name: Spitting Glass
bands.description: "Spitting Glass" is a metal band hailing from the United States, known for their aggressive and dynamic sound that blends elements of thrash and death metal. Formed in the early 2010s, the band quickly gained recognition for their intense live performances and raw musical energy. Their debut album, "Shattered Reflections," released in 2015, received critical acclaim for its intricate guitar work and powerful vocals. The album's success led to extensive touring across North America, solidifying their reputation in the metal community. In 2018, they released their sophomore album, "Fractured Reality," which showcased a more refined sound and thematic depth, exploring concepts of personal struggle and societal issues. The band's music is characterized by fast-paced rhythms, complex song structures, and a fusion of melodic and aggressive elements. Lyrically, "Spitting Glass" delves into themes of introspection, resilience, and the human condition, resonating with a wide audience. Their third album, "Echoes of the Abyss," is slated for release in 2025, with singles already generating buzz among fans and critics alike.

bands.name: Konflikt
bands.description: Konflikt is a death and groove metal band hailing from Camagüey, Cuba. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Konflikt/3540517519?utm_source=openai)) Formed in the early 2010s, the band has been active in the Cuban metal scene, delivering powerful and rhythmic compositions that blend the intensity of death metal with the groove elements characteristic of their style. Their music often explores themes of war, violence, and human conflict, resonating with listeners who appreciate heavy, groove-laden metal. As of now, they are signed to Sur Records, a label known for promoting metal acts in the region. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Konflikt/3540517519?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: A Day To Remember
bands.description: A Day to Remember is an American rock band formed in 2003 in Ocala, Florida. The group is known for their unique blend of metalcore and pop-punk, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with a wide audience. The current lineup includes vocalist Jeremy McKinnon, rhythm guitarist Neil Westfall, drummer Alex Shelnutt, and lead guitarist Kevin Skaff. The band has released several successful albums, including "And Their Name Was Treason" (2005), "For Those Who Have Heart" (2007), "Homesick" (2009), "What Separates Me from You" (2010), "Common Courtesy" (2013), "Bad Vibrations" (2016), "You're Welcome" (2021), and "Big Ole Album Vol. 1" (2025). Their music often features a mix of heavy breakdowns and catchy melodies, appealing to fans of both metalcore and pop-punk genres. The band has achieved significant commercial success, with multiple albums reaching high positions on the Billboard charts and earning certifications such as gold and platinum. They are also known for their energetic live performances and dedicated fan base.

bands.name: Imperium
bands.description: Imperium is a heavy metal band from London, England, formed in 2015. The band has been active since its formation and is currently unsigned. The lineup consists of Rapha Comes on bass, James Hawes on drums, Hardip Sagoo on lead guitar, Scott Lomas on rhythm guitar, and Ben Porter as the vocalist. Their music is characterized by heavy metal elements, though specific subgenres are not specified.

bands.name: Violent Sin
bands.description: Violent Sin is a Belgian speed/black metal band formed in 2016 in Kortrijk, West Flanders. Since their inception, they have been active in the metal scene, performing live and releasing music that embodies their aggressive and raw style. Their music is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and dark, atmospheric elements typical of speed and black metal genres. As of now, Violent Sin is signed to Dying Victims Productions, a label known for promoting underground metal acts. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Violent_Sin/3540442232?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Snot
bands.description:
Snot is an American nu metal band from Santa Barbara, California, formed in 1995. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Lynn Strait, lead guitarist Mikey Doling, bassist John "Tumor" Fahnestock, drummer Jamie Miller, and rhythm guitarist Sonny Mayo. Their music blends elements of nu metal, hardcore punk, funk metal, and alternative metal, characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, dynamic rhythms, and raw, emotive vocals.

In 1997, Snot released their debut studio album, "Get Some," which received positive reviews but achieved modest commercial success. The band gained recognition for their energetic performances and unique sound, leading them to tour with acts like System of a Down and Limp Bizkit. Tragically, on December 11, 1998, Lynn Strait died in a car accident, leading to the band's initial disbandment.

In 2000, the surviving members released "Strait Up," a tribute album featuring guest vocals from various artists, including members of Korn, Limp Bizkit, and Soulfly. The album peaked at number 56 on the Billboard 200 chart. Snot reunited in 2008 with former Divine Heresy vocalist Tommy Vext, but the lineup experienced changes over the years.

In 2024, the band reformed with Andy Knapp as the new vocalist. They began performing live shows and entered the studio in July 2025 to record their first new material in over two decades, with plans to release two new songs by late 2025 or early 2026. The current lineup includes Mikey Doling (lead guitar), John "Tumor" Fahnestock (bass), Jamie Miller (drums), and Andy Knapp (vocals).

bands.name: D-A-D
bands.description: D-A-D, originally known as Disneyland After Dark, is a Danish rock band formed in Copenhagen in 1982. The band changed their name to D-A-D in 1989 to avoid a lawsuit from The Walt Disney Company. Their music is characterized by hard rock and glam metal influences, with a distinctive style that has evolved over the decades. They achieved international recognition with their 1989 album "No Fuel Left for the Pilgrims," which featured the hit single "Sleeping My Day Away." The current lineup includes Jesper Binzer (vocals, guitar), Jacob Binzer (guitar, backing vocals), Stig Pedersen (bass, backing vocals), and Laust Sonne (drums, backing vocals). In 2024, they celebrated their 40th anniversary with the release of their thirteenth studio album, "Speed of Darkness," which received critical acclaim for its energetic tracks. ([metaltalk.net](https://www.metaltalk.net/d-a-d-mark-40-years-with-electrifying-new-album-speed-of-darkness-a-rock-milestone.php?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Max Grimm
bands.description: Max Grimm is a German musician from Hannover known for his humorous and provocative songs, often focusing on themes of sexuality. He has gained attention for his energetic live performances and unique style, which blends elements of rock and comedy. Max Grimm has collaborated with artists such as SDP, Alligatoah, Basti DNP, and Green, who have signed his guitar. His concerts feature original compositions alongside covers of Alligatoah's songs, creating an engaging and entertaining experience for his audience.

bands.name: Palaye Royale
bands.description:
Palaye Royale is an American rock band formed in 2008 in Las Vegas, Nevada. The group consists of brothers Remington Leith (vocals), Sebastian Danzig (guitar), and Emerson Barrett (drums). Initially known as "Kiss and Tell," they rebranded as Palaye Royale in 2011, drawing inspiration from the historic Palaye Royale Hotel in Toronto, Canada. Their music blends elements of glam rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, characterized by theatrical performances and a vintage aesthetic.

The band released their debut album, "Boom Boom Room (Side A)," in 2016, followed by "Boom Boom Room (Side B)" in 2018. In 2020, they released "The Bastards," which received critical acclaim for its raw energy and introspective lyrics. Their 2022 album, "Fever Dream," continued to showcase their evolving sound, incorporating more experimental elements while maintaining their signature style. Palaye Royale has toured extensively, building a dedicated fanbase and earning a reputation for their dynamic live shows.

bands.name: Gaerea
bands.description: Gaerea is a Portuguese post-black metal band formed in 2016 in Porto. Known for their intense and atmospheric sound, they blend traditional black metal with elements of post-metal and progressive influences. Their music delves into themes of isolation, despair, and the human condition, often eschewing typical black metal tropes for more introspective content. The band maintains anonymity by wearing ornate masks during performances, focusing attention on their art rather than individual identities. Their discography includes the EP "Gaerea" (2016) and four full-length albums: "Unsettling Whispers" (2018), "Limbo" (2020), "Mirage" (2022), and "Coma" (2024).

bands.name: Vreid
bands.description:
Vreid is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2004 in Sogndal, Norway, following the tragic death of Windir's founder, Valfar. The remaining members—Hváll (bass), Steingrim (drums), and Sture (vocals/guitar)—were joined by guitarist Ese, a close friend and co-engineer on Windir's "Likferd" album. The band's name, "Vreid," translates to "wrath" in Norwegian. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vreid?utm_source=openai))

Vreid's music blends elements of black metal with rock 'n' roll, creating a distinctive sound they term "Sognametal." Their lyrics often draw from Norwegian history, particularly World War II themes. For instance, their third album, "I Krig," is inspired by poems from 1946 by Norwegian resistance fighter Gunnar Reiss-Andersen. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vreid?utm_source=openai))

The band's discography includes nine studio albums: "Kraft" (2004), "Pitch Black Brigade" (2006), "I Krig" (2007), "Milorg" (2009), "V" (2011), "Welcome Farewell" (2013), "Sólverv" (2015), "Lifehunger" (2018), and "Wild North West" (2021). "Wild North West" is a concept album accompanied by a film, exploring the darker aspects of Norwegian history and human nature. ([vreid.no](https://www.vreid.no/band/vreid/?utm_source=openai))

Vreid has toured extensively, performing over 500 shows in more than 25 countries, including Europe, North America, Japan, and India. They have also released a DVD titled "Vreid Goddamnit" (2010), featuring live recordings from the Inferno Festival. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vreid?utm_source=openai))

In November 2025, Vreid signed with Indie Recordings, marking a new chapter in their career. They announced an extensive European tour for 2026, set to begin with Hypocrisy, Abbath, and Vomitory. ([vreid.no](https://www.vreid.no/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of Hváll (Jarle Kvåle) on bass, Steingrim (Jørn Holen) on drums, Sture (Sture Dingsøyr) on vocals and guitar, and Strom (Stian Bakketeig) on guitar. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vreid?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Tormentor
bands.description: Tormentor is a Hungarian black metal band formed in 1985 in Budapest. They recorded their first album, "Anno Domini," in 1988, but were unable to release it until the end of communist rule in Hungary. The album reached Norway through the tape-trading community. Following the suicide of Per Ohlin, Mayhem invited Attila Csihar from Tormentor to join the band; he was to perform the vocals on "De Mysteriis Dom Sathanas." Tormentor split up in 1991. After a long break, they reformed and released the more experimental "Recipe Ferrum" through Avantgarde Music in 2001, going on a long indefinite hiatus afterward. In 2017, Tormentor reunited after several years to re-emerge on the stage for a highly publicized reunion show on 21 April 2018, in Budapest, followed by an appearance at the Brutal Assault in Josefov, Czech Republic, and the Beyond the Gates festival in Bergen, Norway, with later performances at festivals in France and Canada to cap off the year. The band reunited in the classic lineup from 1988 with Csihar on vocals, Tamás Buday and Attila Szigeti sharing guitar duties, György Farkas handling bass guitar, and Machat St. Zsoltar on drums. The band's own recording imprint, Saturnus Productions, has also reissued both the cult classic debut album "Anno Domini" and "The Seventh Day of Doom" demo on CD and vinyl. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tormentor_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Svinkels
bands.description: Svinkels is a French hip-hop group formed in 1994, known for their energetic blend of rap, rock, and punk influences. The original lineup consisted of MCs Gérard Baste, Nikus Pokus, and Mr. Xavier (also known as XanaX), with DJ Pone joining in 2001. Their music is characterized by humorous and politically incorrect lyrics, often centered around themes like beer and partying. Over the years, Svinkels has released several albums, including "Tapis Rouge" (1999), "Bons pour l'asile" (2003), and "Dirty Centre" (2008). In 2021, they released "Rechute," marking their return after a hiatus. Tragically, Nikus Pokus passed away in May 2024 at the age of 51. Despite this loss, the group continues to perform and maintain their unique style, blending early hip-hop with rock and punk elements.

bands.name: Ill Niño
bands.description: Ill Niño is a Latin American nu metal band formed in Union City, New Jersey, in 1998 by drummer Dave Chavarri. The band's name, "Ill Niño," translates to "ill child" in Spanglish, reflecting their fusion of aggressive metal with Latin rhythms. Their music blends melodic guitars, tribal percussion, and flamenco influences, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with fans worldwide. Over the years, Ill Niño has released seven studio albums, two EPs, and one compilation album, with total worldwide album sales exceeding 1.3 million. Their debut album, "Revolution Revolución," released in 2001, sold over 350,000 copies worldwide within the first two years. The band's third album, "One Nation Underground," released in 2005, debuted at No. 101 on the Billboard 200 chart. In 2010, they signed with Victory Records, releasing "Dead New World," followed by "Epidemia" in 2012. Their seventh studio album, "Till Death La Familia," was released in 2014. In 2019, Ill Niño announced a new lineup and released the single "Sangre." In 2021, guitarist Marc Rizzo rejoined the band, and in 2022, they released the single "This is Over." In 2025, they introduced new vocalist Tommy Roulette III and announced plans to release re-recorded songs and a new track titled "Born To Suffer." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ill_Ni%C3%B1o?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Monde De Merde
bands.description: Monde de Merde is a French punk-hardcore band formed in Orléans, France, in 2013. The group emerged from the local music scene, bringing together members from bands such as Burning Heads, Gravity Slaves, and Speed Jesus. Their music is characterized by a fusion of punk and hardcore elements, featuring aggressive vocals and energetic instrumentation. The band's lyrics often convey messages of rebellion and social commentary. In 2019, Monde de Merde released their debut album, "The Mess," which received positive reviews for its raw energy and impactful sound. ([mowno.com](https://www.mowno.com/disques/monde-de-merde-the-mess/?utm_source=openai)) In 2025, they released "November Sky," further solidifying their presence in the French punk-hardcore scene. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/monde-de-merde/626520484?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Melrose Avenue
bands.description: Melrose Avenue is an Australian pop-metalcore band formed in 2021, known for their energetic performances and genre-blending sound that fuses melodic pop vocals with the raw intensity of metalcore. The band quickly gained popularity through their dynamic online presence, amassing a dedicated following across various social media platforms. Their music draws influences from heavy rock and metalcore acts such as Bring Me the Horizon, Memphis May Fire, and Papa Roach. In October 2024, they signed with Hopeless Records and released their debut EP, "The Fool & The Beggar," which received significant attention and streams. In March 2025, they released "Body Bag," a high-energy track that showcases their heavier side. In November 2025, they released "This Is The End," a heartfelt ballad that highlights their versatility. The band has toured extensively, including sold-out shows across Europe in November 2025. Their lineup consists of vocalist and songwriter Vlado Saric, guitarist Mitchell Black, drummer Jed McIntosh, and guitarist and supporting vocalist Shawn 'Red Curl' Mayer. ([melroseavenueband.com](https://melroseavenueband.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Blues Pills
bands.description:
Blues Pills is a Swedish rock band formed in Örebro in 2011. The group has released four studio albums, two EPs, three live albums, and five singles since its inception. Their latest studio album, "Birthday," was released in August 2024 through BMG. ([bluespills.com](https://bluespills.com/?utm_source=openai))

**History and Style**

The band was formed by vocalist Elin Larsson and guitarist Zack Anderson, who met in California in 2011. They were later joined by drummer Cory Berry and guitarist Dorian Sorriaux. Their music blends hard rock, blues rock, and psychedelic rock, characterized by Larsson's soulful vocals and Anderson's gritty guitar work. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blues_Pills?utm_source=openai))

**Albums**

- **Blues Pills** (2014): The debut album, featuring tracks like "High Class Woman" and "No Hope Left For Me." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blues_Pills_%28album%29?utm_source=openai))

- **Lady in Gold** (2016): The second album, which includes the title track "Lady in Gold."

- **Holy Moly!** (2020): The third album, featuring the single "Proud Woman."

- **Birthday** (2024): The fourth album, with tracks like "Don't You Love It" and "Bad Choices." ([bluespills.com](https://bluespills.com/?utm_source=openai))

**Current Lineup**

- Elin Larsson – vocals (2011–present)

- Zack Anderson – guitars (2019–present), bass (2011–2019)

- André Kvarnström – drums (2014–present)

- Kristoffer Schander – bass (2019–present)

**Genres**

- Hard rock

- Blues rock

- Psychedelic rock

**Website**

[bluespills.com](https://bluespills.com/)

**Headline Image**

![Blues Pills performing at Reload Festival in 2015](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Blues_Pills_-_Reload_Festival_2015_02.jpg/800px-Blues_Pills_-_Reload_Festival_2015_02.jpg)

**Logo**

![Blues Pills logo](https://bluespills.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/BluesPills_logo.png)
bands.headlineImage: ![Blues Pills performing at Reload Festival in 2015](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Blues_Pills_-_Reload_Festival_2015_02.jpg/800px-Blues_Pills_-_Reload_Festival_2015_02.jpg)

bands.name: Majestica
bands.description: Majestica, formerly known as ReinXeed, is a Swedish symphonic power metal band formed in 2000 by vocalist and multi-instrumentalist Tommy Johansson. The band draws inspiration from soundtrack-focused films like "The Lord of the Rings" and bands such as Helloween and Rhapsody of Fire. Under the name ReinXeed, they released their debut album, "The Light," in 2008, which garnered attention in Japan. Over the years, they have released several studio albums, including "Above the Sky" (2019) and "A Christmas Carol" (2020). In 2025, they released "Power Train," showcasing their evolving sound and solidifying their presence in the power metal scene.

bands.name: Wayside
bands.description:
Wayside is an American rock band from Minneapolis, Minnesota, formed by a group of longtime friends with a shared passion for music. The band originally went on hiatus in 2005 but reunited with a fresh lineup and new original music that reflects their early influences and enduring love for music. ([wayside.band](https://www.wayside.band/?utm_source=openai))

Their music is characterized by energetic performances and a blend of rock styles, appealing to a diverse audience. In 2021, Wayside released their debut album, "Shine Onto Me," which garnered over 3 million streams on Spotify and received praise from outlets like Vogue, NPR Radio, Brooklyn Vegan, NME, Triple J, and Alternative Press. ([therockpit.net](https://www.therockpit.net/2023/wayside-announce-sophomore-album-what-does-your-soul-look-like-out-november-10th/?utm_source=openai))

In 2023, the band released their sophomore album, "What Does Your Soul Look Like," produced by Grammy-nominated producer Will Yip. This album showcases their evolution, blending heavier and softer elements with experimental and pop-structured songs. The album includes tracks like "Proud Of You," "Parallax Error," and "Asymmetry," which have been well-received by fans and critics alike. ([therockpit.net](https://www.therockpit.net/2023/wayside-announce-sophomore-album-what-does-your-soul-look-like-out-november-10th/?utm_source=openai))

Wayside continues to perform live, sharing their music with audiences across the United States. Their dynamic shows and heartfelt music have solidified their place in the rock scene.

bands.name: Ruun
bands.description: Ruun is a death metal trio from Hønefoss, Norway, formed in 2017. The band consists of Eirik Waadeland (guitar and vocals), Magnus Heitun Tungen (bass), and Håvar Hanssen (drums). Their music delves into the brutality of existence, exploring life's trials and the inevitability of death. Ruun released their debut EP, "Atheos," in 2019, followed by their first full-length album, "Impermanence," in 2022. In October 2024, they released the EP "Corrosive to The Soul," further solidifying their presence in the death metal scene. The band has also performed live, sharing the stage with fellow Norwegian band Sovereign in October 2025.

bands.name: Arachno
bands.description: Arachno is a Norwegian groove metal band formed in Oslo in 2022. The lineup consists of Tobias Reim on bass and backing vocals, Albert Baker on drums and backing vocals, and Alex McCallum on vocals and guitars. The band is currently unsigned and independent. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Arachno/3540524824?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bastayer
bands.description: Bastayer is a blackened death metal band from Mexico City, formed in 2011. The band is known for its aggressive sound that blends elements of black and death metal, creating a dark and intense atmosphere. Their music often explores themes such as Satanism, darkness, war, and sex, reflecting the band's bold and provocative style. Bastayer has been active since their formation, consistently delivering powerful performances and maintaining a strong presence in the Mexican metal scene. The current lineup includes Arkane on guitars, bass, and vocals; Funebris on vocals; Rage on guitars; Chris Zerimarc on drums; and Percepthor Vobiscum on bass. As of now, Bastayer remains unsigned and independent, allowing them to maintain creative control over their music and direction.

bands.name: Scowl
bands.description: Scowl is an American rock band from Santa Cruz, California, formed in 2019. The band consists of vocalist Kat Moss, guitarist Mike Bifolco, bassist Bailey Lupo, and drummer Cole Gilbert. They initially gained attention with their self-titled EP in 2019, followed by 'Reality After Reality...' the same year. Their debut full-length album, 'How Flowers Grow,' was released in 2021 through Flatspot Records, showcasing their blend of aggressive hardcore and melodic elements. In 2023, they released the EP 'Psychic Dance Routine,' further expanding their musical range. In October 2024, Scowl signed with Dead Oceans and released the single 'Special,' leading up to their sophomore album, 'Are We All Angels,' which was released on April 4, 2025. The album received critical acclaim, with a Metacritic score of 82 out of 100, indicating 'universal acclaim.' ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Are_We_All_Angels?utm_source=openai)) The band has toured extensively, sharing stages with acts like Limp Bizkit, Destroy Boys, and Show Me The Body, and performing at festivals such as Coachella, Reading and Leeds, and Sick New World. ([deadoceans.com](https://deadoceans.com/artists/scowl/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is available on platforms like Spotify and Bandcamp.

bands.name: Europe
bands.description: Europe is a Swedish rock band formed in 1979 in Upplands Väsby, Sweden. The original lineup consisted of lead vocalist Joey Tempest, guitarist John Norum, bassist Peter Olsson, and drummer Tony Reno. They initially performed under the name Force, playing a blend of heavy metal and progressive rock. In 1982, they won the Rock-SM competition, which led to a recording contract and the release of their self-titled debut album in 1983. Their second album, "Wings of Tomorrow" (1984), showcased a more refined sound, featuring tracks like "Scream of Anger" and "Open Your Heart." The band's third album, "The Final Countdown" (1986), marked their international breakthrough, with the title track becoming a global hit. After a hiatus in 1992, Europe reunited in 2003 and has since released several albums, including "Start from the Dark" (2004), "Secret Society" (2006), "Last Look at Eden" (2009), "Bag of Bones" (2012), "War of Kings" (2015), and "Walk the Earth" (2017). Their music is characterized by a blend of hard rock, glam metal, and blues rock influences. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Europe_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Dark Moor
bands.description:
Dark Moor is a Spanish symphonic power metal band formed in Madrid in 1993 by guitarist Enrik García. The band's name is inspired by the "Riftwar" saga by Raymond E. Feist. They are known for their blend of power metal, neo-classical metal, and symphonic metal, often drawing comparisons to bands like Stratovarius, Blind Guardian, and Helloween. Their lyrics frequently explore themes from classic novels, historical figures, ancient legends, and myths. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

Dark Moor's discography includes several notable albums:

- **Shadowland** (1999): Their debut album, released under Arise Records, received positive reviews and established their presence in the metal scene. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **The Hall of the Olden Dreams** (2000): This album further solidified their reputation, featuring collaborations with poet Francisco José García. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **The Gates of Oblivion** (2002): Released under JVC Victor, this album expanded their reach into the Asian market. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Dark Moor** (2003): Their self-titled album marked a new era with vocalist Alfred Romero joining the band. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor_%28album%29?utm_source=openai))

- **Beyond the Sea** (2005): Continued their evolution with a more cohesive sound. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Tarot** (2007): A concept album based on the tarot card game, showcasing their creative depth. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Autumnal** (2009): Shifted towards a more symphonic metal style, featuring orchestral elements. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Ancestral Romance** (2010): Celebrated Spanish culture and history through its themes. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Ars Musica** (2013): Presented a symphonic and experimental approach to their music. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Project X** (2015): Explored themes of ufology and extraterrestrial abductions. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

- **Origins** (2018): Incorporated folk metal elements, adding flutes and bagpipes to their sound. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Moor?utm_source=openai))

As of November 2025, Dark Moor continues to be active, with their latest single "Viviendo en un mal sueño" released on October 30, 2025. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/dark-moor/258882455?utm_source=openai))

Their official website is [dark-moor.com](http://www.dark-moor.com), where fans can find the latest news, tour dates, and merchandise.

bands.name: Rockin' Ladies
bands.description: Rockin' Ladies is a Spanish initiative dedicated to promoting the visibility of women in the rock and metal scenes. Founded by photographer Raquel García, the project began as a photographic endeavor to highlight the significant presence of female musicians in Spain's rock and metal genres. Over time, it evolved into an association that actively supports and showcases female talent through various events and collaborations. One of their notable projects is the Rockin' Ladies Band, a collective of female musicians who perform covers of bands featuring women in their lineup, celebrating the contributions of women to rock and metal music. The association also organizes festivals and workshops aimed at empowering women in the music industry, fostering a sense of community and collaboration among female artists. Through these initiatives, Rockin' Ladies continues to break stereotypes and champion diversity on stage, serving as an inspiration and reference for other women aspiring to pursue artistic endeavors in the rock and metal genres. ([metalcry.com](https://metalcry.com/entrevista-a-raquel-garcia-rockin-ladies-somos-una-familia-super-unida/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mastodon
bands.description:
Mastodon is an American heavy metal band from Atlanta, Georgia, formed in 2000. The original lineup consisted of Troy Sanders (bass/vocals), Brent Hinds (lead guitar/vocals), Bill Kelliher (rhythm guitar/backing vocals), and Brann Dailor (drums/vocals). In March 2025, Hinds departed from the band, and he tragically passed away in a motorcycle accident in August 2025. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/64bf2936826141287ef7a87b4845f068?utm_source=openai))

Mastodon is renowned for their unique blend of progressive metal, sludge metal, and stoner metal, characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar riffs, and thematic depth. Their debut album, "Remission" (2002), received critical acclaim for its aggressive and innovative sound. Subsequent releases, such as "Leviathan" (2004), a concept album inspired by Herman Melville's "Moby-Dick," and "Blood Mountain" (2006), further solidified their reputation in the metal community. The 2017 album "Emperor of Sand" earned them a Grammy Award for Best Metal Performance for the track "Sultan's Curse." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mastodon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Their most recent album, "Hushed and Grim," was released in 2021. Following Hinds's departure, Canadian guitarist Nick Johnston joined the band in May 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mastodon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Mastodon's official website is [mastodonrocks.com](https://www.mastodonrocks.com).

As of November 2025, the current lineup includes:

- Troy Sanders (bass/vocals)
- Bill Kelliher (rhythm guitar/backing vocals)
- Brann Dailor (drums/vocals)
- Nick Johnston (lead guitar)

For more information, visit their official website.

bands.name: Kadavar
bands.description:
Kadavar is a German rock band from Berlin, formed in 2010. The lineup consists of guitarist and lead vocalist Christoph "Lupus" Lindemann, drummer Christoph "Tiger" Bartelt, bassist Simon "Dragon" Bouteloup, and guitarist and keyboardist Jascha Kreft. Their music blends hard rock, psychedelic rock, and stoner rock, drawing comparisons to 1970s bands like Led Zeppelin and Black Sabbath. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kadavar?utm_source=openai))

The band released their self-titled debut album in 2012, followed by "Abra Kadavar" in 2013, which debuted at No. 42 on the German charts. Their third album, "Berlin," released in 2015, reached No. 18 in Germany and No. 40 in Belgium. In 2017, "Rough Times" peaked at No. 18 on the German charts, and "For the Dead Travel Fast" in 2019 reached No. 8. In 2020, they released "The Isolation Tapes," and in 2021, collaborated with Elder on "A Story of Darkness & Light." Their latest album, "I Just Want to Be a Sound," was released on May 16, 2025. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/kadavar/534423387?utm_source=openai))

Kadavar is known for their energetic live performances and retro sound, capturing the essence of classic rock while infusing it with modern elements.

bands.name: The Garden
bands.description: The Garden is an American experimental rock duo from Orange County, California, formed in 2011 by twin brothers Wyatt and Fletcher Shears. Initially a side project to their band M.H.V (Ms. Hannah's Victims), The Garden quickly became their primary focus. They released their debut album, "The Life and Times of a Paperclip," in 2013, followed by "Haha" in 2015, which garnered critical acclaim after signing with Epitaph Records. Their music is characterized by a unique blend of experimental rock, art punk, electro-punk, hypnagogic pop, ska, and synth punk. The brothers describe their sound as "Vada Vada," a philosophy representing pure creative expression that disregards traditional genres and ideals. They have toured extensively across the U.S., Europe, the United Kingdom, China, Japan, New Zealand, Australia, Canada, and Mexico, and have appeared at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in 2019 and 2023. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Garden_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Acid Bath
bands.description: Acid Bath was an American sludge metal band formed in 1991 in Houma, Louisiana. The lineup consisted of vocalist/guitarist Dax Riggs, guitarist Sammy Duet, guitarist Mike Sanchez, bassist Audie Pitre, and drummer Jimmy Kyle. They released two influential albums: "When the Kite String Pops" in 1994 and "Paegan Terrorism Tactics" in 1996. The band disbanded in 1997 following the tragic death of bassist Audie Pitre in a car accident. In October 2024, Acid Bath announced their reunion, with plans to perform at the Sick New World festival in Las Vegas on April 12, 2025. ([acidbathofficial.com](https://www.acidbathofficial.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Cult Of Luna
bands.description: Cult of Luna is a Swedish post-metal band formed in 1998 in Umeå, Sweden. The band emerged from the remnants of the hardcore punk group Eclipse, with founding members Johannes Persson (guitar, vocals) and Klas Rydberg (vocals) leading the formation. They quickly gained recognition with their self-titled debut album in 2001, followed by 'The Beyond' in 2003, both released under Earache Records. Their 2004 album, 'Salvation,' marked a significant breakthrough, showcasing a more refined sound that appealed to a broader audience. This was further solidified with the release of 'Somewhere Along the Highway' in 2006. In 2013, they released 'Vertikal,' inspired by Fritz Lang's 1927 film 'Metropolis,' and its companion EP 'Vertikal II.' The 2016 album 'Mariner' featured a collaboration with American vocalist Julie Christmas, exploring themes related to outer space. Their 2019 album, 'A Dawn to Fear,' continued to build on their reputation, and in 2021, they released 'The Raging River' EP and 'The Long Road North' album, further cementing their status in the post-metal genre. Throughout their career, Cult of Luna has been known for their atmospheric sludge and post-metal sound, characterized by long, slow, and repetitive compositions that build to climactic crescendos. Their music often features heavy, distorted guitars interspersed with orchestral interludes and post-rock elements, drawing comparisons to bands like Neurosis and Isis. The band's lyrics frequently delve into themes of inner struggles, despair, and existentialism.

bands.name: Hostia
bands.description: Hostia is a Polish death metal and grindcore band formed in 2017 in Warsaw, Masovia. Known for their aggressive sound and provocative themes, they have been active since their formation. Their music delves into anti-religious, war, and social themes, reflecting a raw and unfiltered approach to metal. In 2025, Hostia released their full-length album "Razorblade Psalm" on May 6th, available as a limited edition 12" vinyl through independent channels. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Hostia/Razorblade_Psalm/1331880?utm_source=openai)) The album showcases their evolution in the metal scene, maintaining their signature intensity and thematic focus.

bands.name: The Story So Far
bands.description:
The Story So Far is an American pop-punk band from Walnut Creek, California, formed in 2007. The band consists of lead vocalist Parker Cannon, lead guitarist and backing vocalist Kevin Geyer, rhythm guitarist Will Levy, and drummer Ryan Torf. They are known for their energetic performances and emotionally charged lyrics.

The band released their debut album, "Under Soil and Dirt," in 2011, which received critical acclaim and established them as a prominent act in the pop-punk scene. Their second album, "What You Don't See," released in 2013, debuted at number 46 on the Billboard 200 chart. In 2015, they released a self-titled album that charted at number 23 on the Billboard 200. Their fourth album, "Proper Dose," released in 2018, marked a departure from their earlier pop-punk sound by incorporating elements of indie rock. In 2024, they released "I Want to Disappear," which continued to showcase their evolving musical style.

Throughout their career, The Story So Far has been praised for their raw and authentic approach to songwriting, addressing themes of personal struggle, relationships, and self-discovery. Their music resonates with a wide audience, solidifying their place in the modern punk and alternative music scenes.

bands.name: Periphery
bands.description: Periphery is an American progressive metal band formed in Washington, D.C., in 2005. They are recognized as pioneers of the djent movement, blending progressive metal, djent, and progressive metalcore elements. The current lineup includes vocalist Spencer Sotelo, guitarists Misha Mansoor, Mark Holcomb, Jake Bowen, and drummer Matt Halpern. Since their self-titled debut album in 2010, Periphery has released several critically acclaimed albums, including "Periphery II: This Time It's Personal," "Juggernaut: Alpha and Omega," "Periphery III: Select Difficulty," "Periphery IV: Hail Stan," and "Periphery V: Djent Is Not a Genre." Their innovative sound and technical prowess have earned them a dedicated fan base and a Grammy nomination.

bands.name: Nasty
bands.description: Nasty is a Belgian beatdown hardcore band formed in 2004 in Kelmis, Belgium. The band consists of Matthias "Matthi" Tarnath on vocals, Patrick "Paddy" Gajdzik on guitar, Christian "Nash" Fritz on drums, and Huschka on bass. They initially released two demo CDs: "Van Damme" in 2004 and "The Beginning" in 2005. Their debut album, "Declaring War," was released in 2006, followed by "Aggression" in 2008 and "Give a Shit" in 2010. In 2013, they released "Love," and in 2015, "Shokka." Their 2017 album "Realigion" was followed by "Menace" in 2020 and "Heartbreak Criminals" in 2023. Nasty has toured extensively across Europe, Asia, and South America, performing at festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Hellfest, Graspop Metal Meeting, With Full Force, and Resurrection Fest. Their music is characterized by aggressive rhythms and heavy breakdowns, typical of the beatdown hardcore subgenre.

bands.name: Sólstafir
bands.description: Sólstafir is an Icelandic post-metal band formed in 1995. Originally a black metal outfit, they transitioned to a post-metal-influenced style, incorporating elements of post-rock and progressive metal. Their music is characterized by atmospheric soundscapes, emotive vocals, and intricate compositions. The band's discography includes several acclaimed albums, such as "Í Blóði og Anda" (2002), "Masterpiece of Bitterness" (2005), "Köld" (2009), "Svartir Sandar" (2011), "Ótta" (2014), "Berdreyminn" (2017), "Endless Twilight of Codependent Love" (2020), and "Hin Helga Kvöl" (2024).

bands.name: Corrosion Of Conformity
bands.description:
Corrosion of Conformity (C.O.C.) is an American heavy metal band from Raleigh, North Carolina, formed in 1982. Initially rooted in hardcore punk, the band evolved over the years, incorporating elements of thrash metal, sludge metal, and Southern rock into their sound. Their music is characterized by heavy riffs, Southern rock melodies, and politically charged lyrics.

The band's debut album, "Eye for an Eye," released in 1984, showcased their hardcore punk influences. This was followed by "Animosity" in 1985, which introduced thrash metal elements. In 1989, vocalist/guitarist Pepper Keenan joined, marking a significant shift in their musical direction. With Keenan, C.O.C. released "Blind" in 1991, featuring the hit "Vote with a Bullet." The 1994 album "Deliverance" solidified their reputation, achieving Gold certification in the U.S. and featuring the popular track "Clean My Wounds." Their 1996 release, "Wiseblood," continued this success, reaching No. 43 on the U.S. charts. After a hiatus, the band reunited with Keenan in 2015, releasing "No Cross No Crown" in 2018. In 2020, drummer Reed Mullin passed away, and bassist Mike Dean departed in 2025 to pursue other projects. The current lineup includes guitarist Woody Weatherman, guitarist/vocalist Pepper Keenan, drummer Stanton Moore, and bassist Bobby Landgraf.

bands.name: Battle Beast
bands.description: Battle Beast is a Finnish heavy metal band formed in Helsinki in 2008. The group initially consisted of guitarists Juuso Soinio and Anton Kabanen, and drummer Pyry Vikki, who were high school friends. They were later joined by bassist Eero Sipilä, keyboardist Janne Björkroth, and lead vocalist Nitte Valo. In 2010, Battle Beast gained significant recognition by winning the Wacken Open Air Metal Battle, leading to a record deal with Nuclear Blast Records. Their debut album, "Steel," was released in 2011, followed by "Battle Beast" in 2013, which peaked at No. 5 on the Finnish Albums Chart. In 2015, the band released "Unholy Savior," and in 2017, "Bringer of Pain," which achieved platinum status in Finland. Their fifth album, "No More Hollywood Endings," was released in 2019, and their sixth, "Circus of Doom," in 2022. In 2025, they released their seventh studio album, "Steelbound," and embarked on a European tour. The band's music blends heavy and power metal with hard rock elements, often drawing inspiration from 1980s hard rock. Lyrically, they explore themes such as metal, war, robots, love, and the manga series "Berserk." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Beast_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Behemoth
bands.description: Adam "Nergal" Darski, born on June 10, 1977, in Gdynia, Poland, is a prominent figure in the extreme metal scene, best known as the founder and frontman of Behemoth. He began his musical journey at the age of eight, learning guitar, and later adopted the stage name "Nergal," inspired by a Babylonian deity. In 1991, at just 14 years old, Nergal formed Behemoth, initially playing traditional black metal. Over the years, the band's style evolved, incorporating elements of death metal, resulting in a distinctive blackened death metal sound. Behemoth's discography includes notable albums such as "Satanica" (1999), which marked their shift towards a more death metal-influenced style, and "Opvs Contra Natvram" (2022), released under Nuclear Blast. Beyond Behemoth, Nergal has engaged in various musical projects, including the solo endeavor Me and That Man, which explores country, blues, and folk genres. His contributions to the metal community have solidified his reputation as a versatile and influential artist.

bands.name: Myr
bands.description: MYR is a Norwegian black metal band formed by seasoned musicians Svartan and TZommer. Drawing inspiration from Scandinavian legends and traditional Norwegian black metal, they released their debut album, "Helvegen," on June 20, 2025. The album features tracks like "Saturnine Child" and "Brennt," showcasing a raw and melodic sound that resonates with fans of Satyricon, Bathory, and Dissection. The music video for "Saturnine Child" was created by Grupa 13, known for their work with Behemoth and Amon Amarth. The album was mixed and mastered by Tore Stjerna at Necromorbus Studio in Sweden, renowned for his work with Watain, Mayhem, and Tribulation.

bands.name: The Lottery Winners
bands.description: The Lottery Winners are an indie pop band from Leigh, Greater Manchester, England, formed in 2008. The lineup consists of Thom Rylance (vocals/guitar), Robert Lally (vocals/guitar), Katie Lloyd (vocals/bass), and Joe Singleton (drums). They began by performing in local pubs and clubs, gradually building a dedicated fanbase. In 2019, they signed with Modern Sky UK, leading to the release of their self-titled debut album in 2020, which peaked at number 23 on the UK Albums Chart. Their third studio album, "Anxiety Replacement Therapy," released in April 2023, debuted at number one on the UK Albums Chart, featuring collaborations with Frank Turner, Shaun Ryder, and Boy George. Their fourth album, "KOKO," released in March 2025, also topped the UK Albums Chart, marking their second number one album. The band's music blends elements of pop, rock, and indie, characterized by infectious melodies and heartfelt lyrics. ([itv.com](https://www.itv.com/news/granada/2025-03-28/indie-pop-band-the-lottery-winners-secure-another-number-one-album?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: As It Is
bands.description: As It Is is a British-American rock band formed in 2012 in Brighton, England. The band was established by Minnesota-born vocalist Patrick Walters, who sought to create a pop-punk ensemble. The initial lineup included guitarist Benjamin Biss, drummer Patrick Foley, and bassist Alistair Testo. They quickly gained recognition for their energetic performances and emotive songwriting, leading to a signing with Fearless Records in 2014, making them the first UK band to join the label. Their debut album, "Never Happy, Ever After," was released in April 2015, showcasing a blend of pop-punk and emo influences. The album's success was followed by their second release, "okay.," in January 2017, which continued to build their reputation in the alternative music scene. In August 2018, they released "The Great Depression," an album that delved into darker themes and marked a stylistic evolution for the band. After a brief hiatus, As It Is reunited in 2024 and released "Never Happy Ever After X," a re-recording of their debut album featuring collaborations with artists like Holding Absence, Kellin Quinn, and Noahfinnce. In September 2025, they released "Lose Your Way & Find Yourself," their first single in seven years, and announced plans for a new album in 2026.

bands.name: Outergods
bands.description: Outergods is a British extreme metal band from Nottingham, England, known for their aggressive fusion of black metal and grindcore. Formed in the early 2020s, the band quickly gained recognition for their intense sound and dynamic performances. Their debut full-length album, "A Kingdom Built upon the Wreckage of Heaven," was released on September 1, 2023, under Prosthetic Records. The album showcases tracks like "Faceless Entities" and "Into the Howling Void," which have been praised for their technical proficiency and raw energy. In 2025, Outergods released a limited edition cassette titled "Dethroned & Devoured," further solidifying their presence in the extreme metal scene.

bands.name: Lost Society
bands.description:
Lost Society is a Finnish metal band formed in 2010 in Jyväskylä. Initially, the lineup consisted of guitarist and lead vocalist Samy Elbanna, guitarist and backing vocalist Arttu Lesonen, bassist and backing vocalist Mirko Lehtinen, and drummer Ossi Paananen. In February 2020, Paananen departed, and Tapani "Tazzy" Fagerström joined as the new drummer. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lost_Society?utm_source=openai))

The band began by winning the Finnish qualifier of the Global Battle of the Bands in 2012, leading to their performance in London for the finals. Their debut album, "Fast Loud Death," released in 2013, received positive feedback from Finnish media. Over the years, Lost Society's musical style has evolved from thrash metal to incorporate elements of groove metal, nu-metal, and metalcore. Their lyrics have also shifted from party themes to more diverse topics. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lost_Society?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes:

- "Fast Loud Death" (2013)
- "Terror Hungry" (2014)
- "Braindead" (2016)
- "No Absolution" (2020)
- "If the Sky Came Down" (2022)

In May 2025, they released the single "Dead People Scare Me (But the Living Make Me Sick)." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Lost_Society/Dead_People_Scare_Me_%28But_the_Living_Make_Me_Sick%29/1340196?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup is:

- Samy Elbanna – lead and rhythm guitars, lead vocals
- Arttu Lesonen – lead and rhythm guitars, backing vocals
- Mirko Lehtinen – bass guitar, backing vocals
- Taz Fagerström – drums

For more information, visit their official website: ([nuclearblast.com](https://www.nuclearblast.com/pages/lost-society?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Samy Elbanna
members.role: Lead And Rhythm Guitars, Lead Vocals

members.name: Arttu Lesonen
members.role: Lead And Rhythm Guitars, Backing Vocals

bands.name: Gehennah
bands.description: Gehennah is a Swedish thrash metal band formed in 1992 in Forshaga, V�rmland. Initially established as a Venom cover band under the name Gehenna, they released their first demo, "Kill," in 1993. The following year, they produced a second demo, "Brilliant Loud Overlords of Destruction." In 1995, they released their debut album, "Hardrocker," through Primitive Art Records. The lineup at that time included vocalist Mr. Violence, guitarist Rob Stringburner, bassist Ronnie "Ripper" Olsson, and drummer Captain Cannibal. The band underwent lineup changes, with Micke "Hellcop" Birgersson replacing Captain Cannibal on drums in 1994. They signed with Osmose Productions, releasing their second album, "King of the Sidewalk," in 1996. The band continued to evolve, releasing "Decibel Rebel" in 1997 and the EP "10 Years of Fucked Up Behaviour" in 2003. After a hiatus, they reformed in 2011 and released the EP "Metal Police" in 2014, followed by the album "Too Loud to Live, Too Drunk to Die" in 2016. Their music is characterized by a blend of thrash and speed metal, drawing influences from bands like Mot�rhead and Venom. Lyrically, they focus on themes of alcohol, metal culture, and rebelliousness.

bands.name: Dogstar
bands.description:
Dogstar is an American alternative rock band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1991. The group consists of bassist Keanu Reeves, drummer Robert Mailhouse, and guitarist/vocalist Bret Domrose. Initially active from the mid-1990s to the early 2000s, Dogstar reunited in 2022 and released their third studio album, "Somewhere Between the Power Lines and Palm Trees," on October 6, 2023. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogstar_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's formation began with a chance meeting between Reeves and Mailhouse in a supermarket in 1991. They were later joined by Gregg Miller as the original lead guitarist and singer in 1992. The band initially called themselves Small Fecal Matter, then BFS (Big Fucking Shit, or Big Fucking Sound), before settling on Dogstar, after Mailhouse found the name in the book "Sexus," written by Henry Miller. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogstar_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Dogstar released their debut EP, "Quattro Formaggi," in 1996, followed by their first album, "Our Little Visionary," which was distributed exclusively in Japan. They also performed at the 1996 Zwemdokrock Festival in Belgium and the 1999 Glastonbury Festival in England. Their second album, "Happy Ending," was released in 2000. After a hiatus, the band reunited in 2022 and released "Somewhere Between the Power Lines and Palm Trees" in 2023. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogstar_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Dogstar's music is characterized by a blend of alternative rock and grunge influences, featuring introspective lyrics and dynamic instrumentation. Their reunion in 2022 marked a return to the music scene, with the release of their latest album and subsequent tours.


## Keanu Reeves' Band Dogstar Announces Reunion and New Album:
- [Keanu Reeves' band Dogstar is coming to Salt Lake City](https://www.axios.com/local/salt-lake-city/2024/06/04/keanu-reeves-salt-lake-city-dogstar-summer-tour?utm_source=openai), Published on Tuesday, June 04

bands.name: Ultra Vomit
bands.description:
Ultra Vomit is a French parody metal band from Nantes, formed in 1999. Known for their humorous and absurd lyrics, they blend various metal subgenres, including death metal, grindcore, and heavy metal, often parodying popular songs and artists. Their discography includes several albums:

- **M. Patate** (2004): Their debut album, featuring tracks like "Judas Prost" and "Une Souris Verte," showcases their early grindcore influences.

- **Objectif: Thunes** (2008): This album includes parodies of artists such as Immortal and Joe Cocker, with songs like "Maïté Ravendark" and "Morbid Cocker."

- **Panzer Surprise!** (2017): Released after a nine-year hiatus, this album features tracks like "Kammthaar" and "Evier Métal," continuing their tradition of musical parodies.

- **Le Pouvoir de la Puissance** (2024): Their latest album, released in September 2024, includes singles like "Doigts de Métal" and "TIKAWAHUKWA," further solidifying their reputation in the parody metal scene.

Ultra Vomit has been recognized for their unique blend of metal and humor, earning accolades such as a gold certification for "Panzer Surprise!" in October 2021. They have also announced plans for a nationwide tour across France's Zéniths in 2026, reflecting their growing popularity. ([metalawards.org](https://metalawards.org/2024/11/13/ultra-vomit-will-storm-the-zeniths-of-france-in-2026/?utm_source=openai))

Their music is characterized by its energetic riffs, humorous lyrics, and a willingness to experiment with various metal styles, making them a standout act in the French metal scene.

bands.name: Evilact
bands.description: Evilact is a death metal band hailing from Murcia, Spain, formed in 2017. The band comprises Richard on vocals and bass, Lolo Carmona on guitars and backing vocals, and Ángel "Beerkiller" on drums and backing vocals. They are known for their raw thrash metal style with death metal influences, delivering aggressive and precise compositions. Their lyrics, sung in Spanish, explore themes of death, violence, and war. In 2023, Evilact released their EP "Muerte y Guerra," followed by their full-length album "Futuro: Amenaza" on July 21, 2025. The album was recorded and mixed by David Palazón Molina at SEÑAL&RUIDO Studios in Blanca, Murcia, and mastered by Carlos Mora at BLACK NOISE Studios in Toledo. The album cover and artwork were created by Paco of CREAGRAPHIX. "Futuro: Amenaza" features tracks like "Error_889394," "Futuro: Amenaza," "Resistencia," "Aquel que está vacío," "Bienvenido al matadero," "Foso de sacrificios," and "Último aliento." The band's music is available for streaming and purchase on Bandcamp. ([evilact.bandcamp.com](https://evilact.bandcamp.com/album/futuro-amenaza?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Headwreck
bands.description: Headwreck is an Australian nu metalcore band formed in Brisbane, Queensland, in 2019. The lineup consists of vocalist Connor Hickman, guitarist and vocalist Jamo Benadie, drummer Colby Horton, and bassist Dayne Paix. They debuted with the single "Freefall" in 2021, followed by their first EP, "Glamourous Demise," the same year. In April 2023, they released their second EP, "Reflections Room." Their 2024 single "Buzzsaw" garnered over 100,000 streams in two months and featured on Channel 7's AFL coverage and Rage. Their latest EP, "Attitude Adjustment," released on October 31, 2025, entered the ARIA Top 50 Albums Chart at number 43. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Headwreck?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bound In Fear
bands.description: Bound in Fear is a deathcore band from Farnham, Surrey, England, formed in 2016. The band has released several notable works, including their debut album "Regicide" in 2017, followed by "The Hand of Violence" in 2019, and "Penance" in 2021. Their music is characterized by heavy, downtempo rhythms and aggressive vocals, addressing themes such as personal struggles and societal issues. The band has also released singles like "Sentenced" in 2024. ([mistshelter.com](https://mistshelter.com/boundinfear/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Audrey Horne
bands.description:
Audrey Horne is a Norwegian hard rock band from Bergen, formed in 2002. The band took its name from the character Audrey Horne in the TV series "Twin Peaks." Despite their members' backgrounds in black metal bands like Enslaved and Gorgoroth, Audrey Horne's music is characterized by heavy and melodic hard rock, drawing influences from classic rock bands such as Iron Maiden, Kiss, Ozzy Osbourne, Van Halen, Mötley Crüe, Deep Purple, and Led Zeppelin. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audrey_Horne_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's debut album, "No Hay Banda," was released in 2005, co-produced and mixed by Joe Barresi, known for his work with Queens of the Stone Age and Kyuss. The album received positive reviews and earned Audrey Horne a Spellemann Award (Norwegian Grammy) in the Metal category. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audrey_Horne_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

In 2007, keyboardist Herbrand Larsen and bassist Tom Cato Visnes left the band to focus on other projects. That same year, Audrey Horne released their second album, "Le Fol," produced by guitarist Arve Isdal. The album received favorable reviews and earned the band another Spellemann Award nomination in the Metal category. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audrey_Horne_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes vocalist Torkjell "Toschie" Rød, guitarist Arve "Ice Dale" Isdal, guitarist Thomas Tofthagen, bassist Espen Lien, and drummer Kjetil Greve. Audrey Horne has released seven studio albums, one live album, and one EP. Their most recent album, "Devil's Bell," was released in 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audrey_Horne_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Basement
bands.description: Basement is an English rock band formed in Ipswich, Suffolk, in 2009. The band emerged from the breakup of the pop-punk group In This for Fun, adopting the name "Basement" for its simplicity. They released their debut EP, "Songs About the Weather," in May 2010, followed by their first full-length album, "I Wish I Could Stay Here," in 2011. Their second album, "Colourmeinkindness," released in 2012, charted at number 188 on the US Billboard 200. After a hiatus in 2012, the band reunited in 2014, releasing the EP "Further Sky" and the album "Promise Everything" in 2016. Their fourth album, "Beside Myself," was released in October 2018. In 2024, Basement announced their first UK and EU headline tour in six years, scheduled for September 2025. ([metaljunkbox.com](https://metaljunkbox.com/news/basement-announce-first-uk-eu-headline-tour-in-six-years-with-huge-names-in-support/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The All-American Rejects
bands.description:
The All-American Rejects are an American rock band formed in Stillwater, Oklahoma, in 1999. The lineup consists of lead vocalist and bassist Tyson Ritter, lead guitarist and backing vocalist Nick Wheeler, rhythm guitarist and backing vocalist Mike Kennerty, and drummer Chris Gaylor. Wheeler and Ritter serve as the band's primary songwriters, with Wheeler composing the music and Ritter writing the lyrics. Although Kennerty and Gaylor joined after the band's formation, they have been integral to all subsequent releases and music videos.

The band achieved mainstream success with their self-titled debut album, "The All-American Rejects," released in 2002. The album was certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and featured the hit single "Swing, Swing." Their second album, "Move Along," released in 2005, produced successful singles like "Dirty Little Secret," "Move Along," and "It Ends Tonight," all of which charted in the top fifteen on the Billboard Hot 100. "Move Along" was certified triple platinum in 2024 by the RIAA. Their third album, "When the World Comes Down," released in 2008, was certified platinum in 2024 by the RIAA. The lead single, "Gives You Hell," became their most successful song to date, peaking at number 4 on the Billboard Hot 100 and earning a 9× multi-platinum certification for over 9 million shipments in the United States by the RIAA in 2024. Their fourth album, "Kids in the Street," released in 2012, debuted at number 18 on the US Billboard 200. In 2025, the band announced their fifth studio album, "Sandbox," with the lead single "Sandbox" released on April 24, 2025, and the second single, "Easy Come, Easy Go," released on June 5, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_All-American_Rejects?utm_source=openai))

Musically, The All-American Rejects are known for their blend of power pop, alternative rock, pop rock, and emo pop. Their energetic sound and catchy melodies have garnered them a dedicated fan base and critical acclaim over the years.

([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_All-American_Rejects?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Black Laws
bands.description: Black Laws was a German thrash metal band formed in Hamburg in the early 1980s. Initially known as Erosion, the band underwent a name change to Black Laws in 1987. They were active until 1996, after which they reformed in 1999 under the original name Erosion. The band's lineup and discography are not extensively documented, and they remain relatively obscure in the thrash metal scene.

bands.name: Roy Khan
bands.description: Roy Khan, born Roy Sætre Khantatat on March 12, 1970, in Elverum, Norway, is a renowned Norwegian singer and songwriter. He is best known as the lead vocalist for the American power metal band Kamelot from 1997 until his departure in 2011. Prior to joining Kamelot, Khan was the lead singer of the Norwegian progressive metal band Conception from 1991 to 1998. During his tenure with Kamelot, he co-wrote most of the band's songs alongside guitarist and founder Thomas Youngblood.
