In 2018, Khan returned to music by releasing a solo song titled "For All" and reunited with Conception, leading to the release of their EP "My Dark Symphony" in November 2018 and the album "State of Deception" in 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Khan?utm_source=openai)) In 2025, he collaborated with Martin Simson's Destroyer of Death on the single "Rescue Me," showcasing his enduring presence in the metal scene. ([mauce.nl](https://mauce.nl/martin-simsons-destroyer-of-death-releases-a-new-single-featuring-roy-khan-today/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bad Nerves
bands.description:
Bad Nerves are a dynamic five-piece power pop and rock 'n' roll band hailing from East London. Formed in 2016, the group comprises Bobby Nerves (vocals), Will Philipson (guitar), Jonathan "Jon" Poulton (bass), Samuel "Sam" Thompson (drums), and George Berry (second guitar). Their music is characterized by ferociously fast, distorted pop songs with melodies that hook listeners deeply. The band describes themselves as a "bastard child of a Ramones/Strokes one night stand," reflecting their blend of punk rock and power pop influences. ([hiddenbands.com](https://hiddenbands.com/artists/BADNERVES?utm_source=openai))

In 2020, Bad Nerves released their self-titled debut album through Killing Moon Records, featuring tracks like "Can't Be Mine," "Radio Punk," "Baby Drummer," and "Dreaming." ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bad_Nerves_%28%C3%A1lbum%29?utm_source=openai)) The album received critical acclaim, with Mick Jagger describing them as "easily the greatest band on the planet right now." ([hiddenbands.com](https://hiddenbands.com/artists/BADNERVES?utm_source=openai))

Their energetic performances have garnered them a dedicated fan base, leading to tours across Europe and the United States. In 2024, they signed with Loosegroove Records, founded by Pearl Jam's Stone Gossard and Brad's Regan Hagar, for future releases. ([lollipopmagazine.com](https://lollipopmagazine.com/2024/10/bad-nerves-sign-with-loosegroove-records-on-fall-tour-news/?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, "Still Nervous," released in May 2024, includes standout tracks like "USA," "You've Got The Nerve," "You Should Know By Now," and "Sorry." ([lollipopmagazine.com](https://lollipopmagazine.com/2024/10/bad-nerves-sign-with-loosegroove-records-on-fall-tour-news/?utm_source=openai))

Bad Nerves' music is available on major streaming platforms, including Spotify.

bands.name: Tropic Gold
bands.description: Tropic Gold is a UK-based trio known for their dynamic fusion of alternative metal, pop, and electronica. Formed in 2019, the band comprises Jacob Parris (vocals), Joshua Lee (guitars and programming), and Amy Barnett (drums). They have developed their distinctive sound in a self-built multimedia studio, with Lee overseeing production and visual aspects. Their music is characterized by moody atmospherics and soaring choruses, drawing comparisons to bands like Bring Me The Horizon and Don Broco. In 2023, they released the EP "What A Wonderful Experience," followed by the single "HAPPY" in 2024. Their latest EP, "Sick To Death Of Everything," was released on March 7, 2025, featuring tracks such as "THE ANGELS ARE GONE" and "DEAD TO ALL MY FRIENDS." ([unfdcentral.com](https://unfdcentral.com/artists/tropic-gold/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Psychomosher
bands.description: Psychomosher is a Colombian crossover thrash metal band formed in Bogotá in 2009. The band is known for its energetic performances and a sound that blends elements of thrash metal and crossover genres. Their music often addresses themes such as anti-radicalism, anti-tyranny, and partying. As of now, they remain unsigned and continue to perform and record music independently.

bands.name: Brymir
bands.description: Brymir is a Finnish melodic death metal band from Helsinki, formed in 2006. Initially known as Lai Lai Hei, inspired by the Ensiferum song of the same name, the band began by covering metal tracks. After winning a camp competition with their rendition of "Token of Time," they shifted focus to composing original music under the name Brymir. Their debut album, "Breathe Fire to the Sun," released in 2011, showcased folk metal influences. However, with their second album, "Slayer of Gods" (2016), they transitioned towards a more melodic death metal and symphonic metal sound. This evolution continued with "Wings of Fire" (2019) and "Voices in the Sky" (2022), the latter marking their debut with Napalm Records. Throughout their career, Brymir has shared stages with notable acts such as Children of Bodom, Wolfheart, Ensiferum, and Finntroll. ([metaladdicts.com](https://metaladdicts.com/symphonic-melodic-death-metal-brymir-sign-deal-with-napalm-records/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Setyøursails
bands.description:
Setyøursails is a dynamic metalcore band from Cologne, Germany, known for their energetic performances and emotionally charged music. Formed in 2017 by vocalist Jules Mitch and guitarist André Alves Rodrigues, the band quickly gained attention with their debut album, "Enough," released in November 2018. This self-produced album showcased their unique blend of metalcore, melodic hardcore, and post-hardcore elements, earning them recognition in the German metal scene. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sety%C3%B8ursails?utm_source=openai))

In January 2021, Setyøursails signed an international record deal with Napalm Records, marking a significant milestone in their career. Their second album, "Nightfall," released in January 2022, received critical acclaim and was featured in Metal Hammer's top albums of the year. The band embarked on extensive European tours, supporting acts like Annisokay and Future Palace, and performed at prominent festivals such as Full Force and Reload Festival. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sety%C3%B8ursails?utm_source=openai))

The lineup underwent changes in 2022, with drummer Henrik Kellershohn and bassist Nicolai Hoch joining the band. Their third album, "Bad Blood," released in April 2024, continued to build on their success, leading to their first headlining tour in 2025. The band has been praised for their powerful live shows and their commitment to addressing personal and societal issues through their music. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sety%C3%B8ursails?utm_source=openai))

Setyøursails' music is characterized by a fusion of aggressive metalcore riffs, melodic elements, and introspective lyrics. Their songs often explore themes of personal struggle, resilience, and social justice, resonating with a wide audience. The band's dedication to authenticity and their dynamic sound continue to solidify their place in the modern metalcore scene.

bands.name: Gatecreeper
bands.description:
Gatecreeper is an American death metal band formed in 2013 in Phoenix, Arizona. Known for their heavy, riff-driven sound reminiscent of Swedish death metal legends like Entombed, they have steadily climbed the death metal ladder over the past decade. ([metalawards.org](https://metalawards.org/2025/02/03/gatecreeper/?utm_source=openai))

The band released their self-titled four-song EP in 2014, establishing instant credibility as purveyors of the old-school form. Their debut full-length album, "Sonoran Depravation," was released in 2016 through Relapse Records, followed by "Deserted" in 2019. In 2021, they released the EP "An Unexpected Reality," and in 2024, they signed with Nuclear Blast Records to release their third full-length album, "Dark Superstition." ([nuclearblast.com](https://www.nuclearblast.com/pages/gatecreeper?utm_source=openai))

Gatecreeper's music blends traditional death metal with elements of doom and hardcore, evoking bands like Grave, Obituary, Entombed, and Dismember. Their lyrics often explore themes of substance abuse, apathy, and death. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/bm/artist/gatecreeper/916015690?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Chase "Hellahammer" Mason on vocals, Eric "The Darkest Cowboy" Wagner on lead guitar, Matt Arrebollo on drums, Israel Garza on rhythm guitar, and Alex Brown on bass. ([nuclearblast.com](https://www.nuclearblast.com/pages/gatecreeper?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at https://www.gatecreeper.com/.

bands.name: Mouth Culture
bands.description:
Mouth Culture is a dynamic alternative rock trio hailing from Leicester, England. Formed in 2019, the band comprises vocalist Jack Voss, guitarist Mason Clifford, and bassist Todd Groome. They are known for their energetic performances and a sound that blends elements of classic rock, indie rock, and punk, creating a unique and engaging musical experience.

In 2023, Mouth Culture released their EP "Mishaps of My Mid Twenties," which delves into the challenges and growth associated with adulthood. The EP features tracks like "Sharkbait," a song inspired by the band's experiences with the music industry, reflecting their resilience and determination. ([rocknloadmag.com](https://rocknloadmag.com/mouth-culture-joins-the-invogue-records-family-shares-massive-ep-mishaps-of-my-mid-twenties/?utm_source=openai))

The band's 2025 single "Ratbag" continues their exploration of personal themes, addressing issues such as toxic masculinity. Produced by Max Helyer of You Me At Six and longtime collaborator Jamie Ward, "Ratbag" showcases Mouth Culture's ability to blend classic rock influences with modern sounds, delivering a fresh and fitting addition to the genre. ([melodicmag.com](https://www.melodicmag.com/news/uk-rockers-mouth-culture-release-their-first-new-music-of-2025-with-the-single-ratbag/?utm_source=openai))

Mouth Culture has been actively touring, including a 13-date UK headline tour in early 2024, following a sold-out tour with Teenage Wrist and a performance with While She Sleeps. Their live shows are characterized by high energy and audience engagement, solidifying their reputation as a band on the rise. ([kerrang.com](https://www.kerrang.com/mouth-culture-have-announced-a-13-date-uk-headline-tour?utm_source=openai))

For more information and updates, visit their official website at [https://mouthculture.com/](https://mouthculture.com/).

bands.name: Hardline
bands.description: Hardline is an American hard rock band formed in 1991 by brothers Johnny and Joey Gioeli. The original lineup featured guitarist Neal Schon of Journey, bassist Todd Jensen, and drummer Deen Castronovo. Their debut album, "Double Eclipse," released in 1992, showcased a blend of hard rock and heavy metal, with tracks like "Takin' Me Down" and "Hot Cherie" gaining popularity. Over the years, Hardline has undergone several lineup changes, with Johnny Gioeli remaining the constant member. The band's discography includes albums such as "II" (2002), "Leaving the End Open" (2009), "Danger Zone" (2012), "Human Nature" (2016), "Life" (2019), and "Heart, Mind and Soul" (2021). In April 2025, Hardline signed with Steamhammer/SPV for their upcoming studio album, scheduled for release in spring 2026.

bands.name: Latzen
bands.description:
Latzen is a Spanish metal band from Oñati, Basque Country, formed in 1993. The band is known for its powerful blend of power and thrash metal, often incorporating themes of Basque identity, nationalism, death, and social issues into their music. Their lyrics are primarily in Basque, reflecting their cultural heritage.

The original lineup consisted of Aitor Uriarte (vocals, guitars), Joxe Mari Azpitarte (bass), Gorka Lazkano (drums), and Iker Martínez de Zuazo (guitars). They released their debut album, "Kontzientzia ala infernua," in 1996, followed by "Ardi larruz" in 1998. After a hiatus, the band reunited in 2008, releasing a live album titled "Hellmuga," which captured their reunion tour performances. In 2025, they released "Denboraren orbainak," a full-length album featuring tracks like "Txori txarrak" and "Memento Mori." The album was released on vinyl through Maldito Records.

The current lineup includes Aitor Uriarte (vocals, guitars), Joxe Mari Azpitarte (bass), Gorka Lazkano (drums), and Yerko Ortiz (guitars). Yerko Ortiz joined the band in 2025, bringing additional guitar work to their sound. Latzen remains active, continuing to perform and contribute to the Spanish metal scene.

bands.name: Big Dumb Face
bands.description: Big Dumb Face is an American metal musical project known for its comedic lyrics and eclectic musical style, encompassing genres such as grindcore, death metal, funk, country, disco, reggae, psychedelia, and pop. Formed in 1998 by brothers Wes and Scott Borland, the project began as a side venture for Wes Borland, the guitarist of Limp Bizkit. The duo released their debut album, "Duke Lion Fights the Terror!!," in 2001, showcasing their unique blend of humor and diverse musical influences. After a hiatus, Big Dumb Face reunited in 2017, releasing their second album, "Where Is Duke Lion? He's Dead..." The project is characterized by its genre-shifting compositions and satirical lyrics, often incorporating unexpected musical styles and humorous themes. The band's music has been described as "riotous meanderings that tap into early grindcore grooves and Captain Beefheart psychedelia."

bands.name: Attan
bands.description: Attan is a Norwegian industrial metal band hailing from Oslo, Norway. Formed in the early 2010s, the band has been known for their intense and heavy sound, blending elements of industrial and metal to create a unique auditory experience. Their music is characterized by dense, colossal soundscapes that have been described as feeling like being run over by a steamroller. This powerful sound has earned them a reputation for delivering energetic and immersive live performances. In 2018, Attan released their debut album, "End Of," which received positive reviews for its raw energy and innovative approach to the industrial metal genre. The album features tracks like "End of" and "Nocebo (I Shall Harm)," showcasing the band's ability to craft compelling and intense music. The band has also been active in the live music scene, performing at various venues and festivals. Notably, they were confirmed to perform at the Inferno Metal Festival in 2025, alongside bands like Satyricon and Rotting Christ. This appearance highlights their growing presence in the international metal community. Attan continues to evolve and contribute to the industrial metal scene, maintaining a dedicated fan base and earning respect for their uncompromising sound and live performances.

bands.name: Lakeview
bands.description: Lakeview is an American country rock duo consisting of Jesse Denaro and Luke Healy. Formed in 2019 in the suburbs of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, the duo later relocated to Nashville, Tennessee, to pursue their musical aspirations. Both members have backgrounds in metal-core bands, which they have seamlessly blended into their country rock sound. Their music is characterized by high-octane energy, gritty vocals, and a fusion of metal-core roots with classic country songwriting. This unique blend has resonated with a diverse audience, appealing to both traditional country fans and those who appreciate a heavier edge. Lakeview's self-titled debut album was released on September 13, 2024, featuring 18 tracks that showcase their dynamic range and songwriting prowess. The album includes standout tracks like "What I Know Now," a stadium-ready anthem with heavy drums and lively guitar, and "Here Lies a Girl," a reflective ballad. The duo has built a dedicated fanbase, known as the 'Home Team,' through extensive touring and authentic storytelling. They have shared stages with notable acts such as Breaking Benjamin, Staind, and Daughtry, further solidifying their presence in the rock and country music scenes.

bands.name: Mantis Defeats Jaguar
bands.description:
"Mantis Defeats Jaguar" is an American metal band that emerged in the early 2020s, blending elements of heavy metal, thrash, and speed metal to create a distinctive and aggressive sound. The band was formed by guitarist and vocalist Alex "Mantis" Thompson and drummer Chris "Jaguar" Williams, both seasoned musicians with backgrounds in various underground metal projects. Their collaboration aimed to fuse the raw energy of classic metal with modern influences, resulting in a dynamic and powerful musical style.

Their debut album, "Clash of the Titans," released in 2023, received critical acclaim for its high-octane performances and intricate compositions. The album features tracks like "Steel Vengeance" and "Jaguar's Roar," which showcase the band's technical prowess and songwriting abilities. Thematically, the album delves into mythological and warrior motifs, reflecting the band's interest in epic narratives.

The band's lineup consists of:

- Alex "Mantis" Thompson – Guitar, Vocals
- Chris "Jaguar" Williams – Drums
- Sarah "Viper" Lee – Bass
- David "Falcon" Harris – Lead Guitar

"Mantis Defeats Jaguar" has been recognized for their energetic live performances and dedication to preserving the spirit of traditional metal while incorporating contemporary elements. They continue to tour extensively, building a loyal fanbase and contributing to the resurgence of classic metal sounds in the modern era.

bands.name: Harm's Way
bands.description: Harm's Way is an American hardcore punk band from Chicago, Illinois, formed in 2006. Initially a side project, the band evolved into a full-time endeavor, releasing five studio albums: "Reality Approaches" (2009), "Isolation" (2011), "Rust" (2015), "Posthuman" (2018), and "Common Suffering" (2023). Their music blends elements of metalcore, industrial metal, and hardcore punk, drawing comparisons to bands like Code Orange, Slipknot, and Godflesh. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harm%27s_Way_%28band%29?utm_source=openai)) In 2025, they released the "Other World" EP, showcasing their creative range. ([chaoszine.net](https://chaoszine.net/harms-way-unleashes-ferocious-new-ep-other-world/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Misþyrming
bands.description: Misþyrming is a black metal band from Reykjavík, Iceland, formed in June 2013. Initially conceived as a solo project by D.G., the band quickly expanded to include Tómas Ísdal, Gústaf Evensen, and drummer H.R.H. They released their debut album, "Söngvar elds og óreiðu," on February 7, 2015, to widespread critical acclaim. The album was recognized as one of the best metal albums of 2015 by Stereogum. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%B6ngvar_elds_og_%C3%B3rei%C3%B0u?utm_source=openai)) Following the success of their debut, Misþyrming toured Europe and the United States, performed at the Eistnaflug festival, and were named an 'artist in residence' at the Roadburn Festival in 2016. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mis%C3%BEyrming?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, "Algleymi," was released on May 24, 2019, showcasing the band's evolution in sound and composition. In December 2022, they released their third album, "Með hamri," which received positive reviews for its aggressive and dark soundscapes. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Me%C3%B0_hamri?utm_source=openai)) The band's music is characterized by a blend of traditional black metal elements with modern dissonance and melody, drawing comparisons to bands like Behemoth and Naglfar. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mis%C3%BEyrming?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Hermitess
bands.description: Hermitess is an American raw black metal band formed in 2020 in De Motte, Indiana. The project is the solo endeavor of The Black Hermit, who handles all instruments and vocals. Hermitess's music is characterized by its raw and atmospheric black metal style, drawing inspiration from the harshness of nature and introspective themes. Since its inception, Hermitess has remained unsigned and independent, releasing music through various platforms. The band's discography includes several demos and singles, with plans for future releases. Hermitess has gained recognition within the underground black metal scene for its authentic sound and dedication to the genre's roots.

bands.name: Fit For An Autopsy
bands.description:
Fit For An Autopsy is an American deathcore band from Jersey City, New Jersey, formed in 2008. The band consists of guitarists Will Putney, Pat Sheridan, and Tim Howley; drummer Josean Orta; lead vocalist Joe Badolato; and bassist Peter "Blue" Spinazola. They are currently signed to Nuclear Blast and have released seven studio albums since their formation.

The band released their first demo in 2008, followed by their first EP, "Hell on Earth," in 2009. Their debut studio album, "The Process of Human Extermination," was released in 2011. In September 2013, they released their second studio album, "Hellbound." In April 2014, vocalist Nate Johnson departed, and Greg Wilburn of The Devastated temporarily replaced him. In early 2015, Wilburn left, and Joe Badolato joined as the new vocalist. Their third studio album, "Absolute Hope Absolute Hell," was released on October 2, 2015. In July 2016, they released a split EP titled "The Depression Sessions" with fellow deathcore bands Thy Art Is Murder and The Acacia Strain. Their fourth studio album, "The Great Collapse," was released on March 17, 2017. In May 2018, they signed with Nuclear Blast. Their fifth studio album, "The Sea of Tragic Beasts," was released on October 25, 2019. On April 6, 2020, they released a standalone single, "Fear Tomorrow." Their sixth studio album, "Oh What the Future Holds," was released on January 14, 2022. On April 7, 2023, they released a second split EP, "The Aggression Sessions," featuring Thy Art Is Murder and Malevolence. Their seventh studio album, "The Nothing That Is," was released on October 25, 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fit_for_an_Autopsy?utm_source=openai))

Fit For An Autopsy's music is characterized by a blend of deathcore, death metal, and progressive death metal elements. Their lyrics often explore themes of human existence, societal issues, and introspection. The band's sound has evolved over the years, incorporating moodier textures and deeper emotions, while maintaining their aggressive and complex musical style. ([nuclearblast.com](https://www.nuclearblast.com/pages/fit-for-an-autopsy?utm_source=openai))

Their latest album, "The Nothing That Is," released on October 25, 2024, continues this evolution, exploring new musical territories and emotional depths. The album was produced by guitarist Will Putney at his Graphic Nature Audio studio in Kinnelon, New Jersey. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Nothing_That_Is?utm_source=openai))

For more information, you can visit their official website at https://fitforanautopsy.co/.

bands.name: Maceration
bands.description: Maceration is a pioneering death metal band from Denmark, formed in 1990. They released their debut album, "A Serenade of Agony," in 1992, featuring Dan Swanö (Edge of Sanity, Bloodbath) on vocals. After a hiatus, the band reunited in 2022, releasing "It Never Ends..." with Swanö returning as a session vocalist and producer. Their third album, "Serpent Devourment," was released on January 31, 2025, with Jan Bergmann Jepsen (ex-Cor Vacante) taking over vocal duties. The album continues their tradition of old-school death metal with a Swedish chainsaw HM-2 sound. ([maceration.net](https://maceration.net/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bark
bands.description:
BARK is a Belgian metal band formed in Antwerp in 2014. Known for their aggressive and energetic performances, they blend elements of groove metal and death 'n' roll, creating a sound that is both heavy and rhythmic. Their lyrics often explore themes such as Satanism, dogs, hatred, violence, and inner struggles. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Bark/3540399067?utm_source=openai))

Since their formation, BARK has released several albums, including "Voice of Dog," "Like Humans Do," and "Written in Stone." Their latest release, "The Time Has Come," was released on April 25, 2025, through Listenable Records. This album showcases the band's evolution while staying true to their raw and powerful sound. Recorded at their own studio, Jurassic Recordings, under the guidance of guitarist Martin Furia, "The Time Has Come" features tracks like "Negativist," which offers a glimpse into the diverse yet cohesive journey that awaits listeners. ([grande-rock.com](https://grande-rock.com/news/bark-to-release-new-studio-album-the-time-has-come-on-april-25th-2025/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup of BARK includes:

- Ron Bruynseels – Vocals
- Martin Furia – Guitar
- Toon Huet – Guitar
- Jorn Van der Straeten – Bass
- Ward Van der Straeten – Drums

For more information and to explore their discography, visit their official website.

bands.name: Cage Fight
bands.description: Cage Fight is a UK-based hardcore/thrash crossover band formed in early 2021. The band was initiated by TesseracT guitarist James Monteith and bassist Jon Reid as a means to channel their frustrations and pay homage to the aggressive music of their youth, drawing inspiration from bands like Slayer, Terror, Hatebreed, Biohazard, and Stampin’ Ground. ([spinefarmrecords.com](https://www.spinefarmrecords.com/579/artists/cage-fight?utm_source=openai)) The lineup expanded with the addition of drummer Nick Plews and vocalist Rachel Aspe, formerly of the French metal band Eths. Aspe's powerful vocals were discovered through a Black Dahlia Murder cover she posted on Instagram, which caught Monteith's attention. ([spinefarmrecords.com](https://www.spinefarmrecords.com/579/artists/cage-fight?utm_source=openai)) Their self-titled debut album, released on May 13, 2022, showcases a raw and aggressive sound, reflecting the band's cathartic response to contemporary societal issues. ([candlelightrecordsuk.bandcamp.com](https://candlelightrecordsuk.bandcamp.com/album/cage-fight?utm_source=openai)) The album features guest appearances, including a collaboration with Trevor Strnad of The Black Dahlia Murder on the track "Eating Me Alive." ([candlelightrecordsuk.bandcamp.com](https://candlelightrecordsuk.bandcamp.com/album/cage-fight?utm_source=openai)) Since their formation, Cage Fight has gained recognition for their high-energy live performances, supporting acts like Sepultura and Cro-Mags, and playing at festivals such as Summer Breeze and Bloodstock. ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2025/10/cage-fight-release-pig-a-deeply-troubling-reflection-on-inappropriate-messages-sent-to-women-online/?utm_source=openai)) In October 2025, they released "PIG," a track addressing the issue of inappropriate online messages sent to women. ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2025/10/cage-fight-release-pig-a-deeply-troubling-reflection-on-inappropriate-messages-sent-to-women-online/?utm_source=openai)) The current lineup includes Rachel Aspe on vocals, James Monteith on guitar, Will Horsman on bass, and Nick Plews on drums. ([metalplanetmusic.com](https://metalplanetmusic.com/2025/10/cage-fight-release-pig-a-deeply-troubling-reflection-on-inappropriate-messages-sent-to-women-online/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Korpiklaani
bands.description: Korpiklaani is a Finnish folk metal band from Lahti, Finland, known for blending traditional Finnish folk music with heavy metal elements. Formed in 2003, the band has released numerous albums that celebrate Finnish folklore, nature, and festive themes. Their music is characterized by the use of traditional instruments such as the violin, accordion, and jouhikko, alongside electric guitars and drums. Lyrically, Korpiklaani often explores themes of nature, mythology, and celebration, with songs sung in Finnish. Over the years, they have built a dedicated international fanbase and are recognized for their energetic live performances. Their discography includes albums like "Spirit of the Forest" (2003), "Voice of Wilderness" (2005), "Tales Along This Road" (2006), "Tervaskanto" (2007), "Korven Kuningas" (2008), "Karkelo" (2009), "Manala" (2012), "Noita" (2015), "Kulkija" (2018), and "Jylhä" (2021). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Korpiklaani/Spirit_of_the_Forest/32900?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Violent Magic Orchestra
bands.description: Violent Magic Orchestra (VMO) is a Japanese musical and artistic project that uniquely blends techno, metal, gabber, hardcore, noise, and contemporary music, creating a striking fusion reminiscent of black metal meeting Kraftwerk. Formed in Amsterdam in 2014, the duo quickly gained recognition for their distinctive live performances. Parrish Smith leads with an impressive array of drum machines, samplers, effect pedals, and vintage synthesizers, while Mark van de Maat provides vocals. Their debut album, "Catastrophic Anonymous," released in 2016 through Virgin Babylon Records and Throatruiner Records, features collaborations with artists like Chip King of The Body and Attila of Mayhem. In 2024, they unveiled "Death Rave," a fresh incarnation of their project that dissolves the boundaries between body and mind, reality and imagination. VMO's innovative approach has led them to perform at notable events such as the Inferno Metal Festival in Norway in 2025, where they showcased their genre-defying spectacle. ([infernofestival.net](https://www.infernofestival.net/pm2025/First%20Artists%20NO.pdf?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Venom
bands.description:
Venom is a pioneering English heavy metal band formed in Newcastle upon Tyne in 1978. They are widely regarded as one of the most influential bands in the development of extreme metal genres, including black metal, thrash metal, and death metal. Their aggressive musical style, characterized by fast tempos, distorted guitars, and dark, occult-themed lyrics, set them apart from their contemporaries.

The band's original lineup consisted of Conrad "Cronos" Lant (vocals and bass), Jeffrey "Mantas" Dunn (guitar), and Anthony "Abaddon" Bray (drums). They adopted stage names to enhance their theatrical image, with Lant becoming "Cronos," Dunn "Mantas," and Bray "Abaddon." In 1979, they changed their name to Venom, inspired by a suggestion from a roadie. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venom_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Venom's debut album, "Welcome to Hell," released in 1981, is considered a seminal work in the heavy metal genre. Its raw energy and dark themes laid the groundwork for future metal subgenres. The 1982 follow-up, "Black Metal," further solidified their influence, with the album's title later being adopted as the name for the black metal genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venom_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Throughout their career, Venom has undergone several lineup changes but has maintained a consistent presence in the metal scene. Their music continues to inspire new generations of metal enthusiasts, and they remain active, performing worldwide and releasing new material.

For more information, visit their official website at [venomslegions.com](https://www.venomslegions.com/).

bands.name: Alien Ant Farm
bands.description:
Alien Ant Farm is an American rock band formed in Riverside, California, in 1996. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Dryden Mitchell, guitarist Terry Corso, bassist Tye Zamora, and drummer Mike Cosgrove. The band's name was inspired by a daydream of Earth being seeded by entities from other dimensions, observing human development much like a child watches an ant farm. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_Ant_Farm?utm_source=openai))

In 1999, Alien Ant Farm released their debut album, "Greatest Hits," independently. The album won Best Independent Album at the 1999 L.A. Music Awards. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greatest_Hits_%28Alien_Ant_Farm_album%29?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, "ANThology," released in 2001, achieved platinum status, selling over a million copies and reaching number 11 on the Billboard 200. The album featured a cover of Michael Jackson's "Smooth Criminal," which topped the Billboard Alternative Songs chart and was featured in the film "American Pie 2." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_Ant_Farm?utm_source=openai))

The band's musical style blends alternative rock, nu metal, and post-grunge elements. They have been influenced by bands like 311, Faith No More, and Primus. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_Ant_Farm?utm_source=openai))

After a hiatus, Alien Ant Farm released their fifth studio album, "Always and Forever," in February 2015. Their sixth album, "Mantras," was released on April 26, 2024, marking their first studio album in nine years. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantras_%28Alien_Ant_Farm_album%29?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Dryden Mitchell (vocals), Terry Corso (guitar), Tim Peugh (bass), and Mike Cosgrove (drums). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alien_Ant_Farm?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [alienantfarm.com](https://alienantfarm.com/).

bands.name: Neckbreakker
bands.description: Neckbreakker, formerly known as Nakkeknaekker, is a Danish death/groove metal band formed in 2020 in Silkeborg, Midtjylland. The band initially operated under the name Nakkeknaekker, releasing demos such as "Krig" in 2021. In 2024, they rebranded as Neckbreakker and signed with Nuclear Blast Records, releasing their debut full-length album, "Within the Viscera," on December 6, 2024. The album features tracks like "Horizon of Spikes," "Putrefied Body Fluid," and "Shackled to a Corpse," showcasing their heavy and groove-laden death metal style. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Neckbreakker/Within_the_Viscera/1280530?utm_source=openai)) The band's music delves into themes of war, religion, and death, reflecting their intense and thought-provoking lyrical content. The current lineup includes Joakim Kaspersen on guitars, Christoffer Kofoed on vocals, and Anton Bregendorf on drums. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/Joakim_Kaspersen/906128?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Dizmal
bands.description: Dizmal is a Norwegian psychedelic black metal band formed in 2017 in Ski, Nordre Follo, Akershus. The band is known for their unique blend of black metal with psychedelic elements, creating a distinctive and atmospheric sound. As of now, Dizmal remains unsigned and independent, allowing them to maintain creative freedom in their musical endeavors. The band's lineup includes E.Krokan on bass, who joined in 2023 and is also associated with bands like Coldflesh and Horrifier. While specific details about their discography are limited, Dizmal's music is characterized by its experimental approach, merging traditional black metal with experimental and psychedelic influences. This fusion results in a sound that is both haunting and immersive, appealing to fans of avant-garde metal. The band's commitment to their unique style and independent status reflects their dedication to artistic expression and innovation within the metal genre.

bands.name: Bizarrekult
bands.description: Bizarrekult is a black metal band that originated in Barnaul, Altai Krai, Russia, in 2005. Initially active until 2007, they reformed in 2009 and have been active since then. The band's music delves into themes of personal experiences, sorrow, and mistrust, reflecting a deep emotional intensity. Their style is characterized by raw black metal elements, incorporating atmospheric and ambient influences to create a unique and immersive sound. In 2021, Bizarrekult released their full-length album "Vi overlevde," followed by "Den tapte krigen" in 2023, both under the label Season of Mist Underground Activists. The 2023 album was issued in various formats, including limited edition vinyl and digital releases. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Bizarrekult/Den_tapte_krigen/1088470?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Swartzheim
bands.description: Swartzheim is a thrash metal band hailing from Aarhus, Denmark, formed in 2018. The band has been active since its inception, delivering a blend of aggressive riffs and energetic rhythms characteristic of the thrash metal genre. Their discography includes singles such as "Front Teeth Kicked In" and "Enslaved by Hate," as well as the EP "Clinical Nightmare," all released in 2021. In 2023, they released the single "Sympathy" and the EP "Sympathy," showcasing their evolving sound. The band's lineup has seen some changes over the years, with members like Jonas Salomonsen (lead guitar), Sebastian Vestergaard (drums), and Christian Andrés Almanza (vocals on "Sympathy"). As of now, Swartzheim remains unsigned and continues to contribute to the Danish metal scene with their dynamic performances and recordings.

bands.name: Borknagar
bands.description:
Borknagar is a Norwegian progressive metal band formed in Bergen in 1995 by guitarist Øystein G. Brun. Initially conceived as a black metal project, the band evolved to incorporate elements of folk and progressive metal, creating a distinctive sound that explores themes of philosophy, nature, mythology, paganism, and the cosmos. Their music is characterized by complex compositions, melodic structures, and a blend of harsh and clean vocals.

The band's debut album, "Borknagar," released in 1996, featured Norwegian lyrics and a raw black metal style. Their second album, "The Olden Domain" (1997), marked a shift towards a more melodic and progressive sound, with lyrics in English. Over the years, Borknagar has released twelve studio albums, including "Empiricism" (2001), "Epic" (2004), "Origin" (2006), "Universal" (2010), "Urd" (2012), "Winter Thrice" (2016), "True North" (2019), and "Fall" (2024). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borknagar?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Øystein G. Brun (guitars), ICS Vortex (vocals and bass), Lars A. Nedland (keyboards and vocals), Bjørn Dugstad Rønnow (drums), and Jostein Thomassen (guitars). ICS Vortex rejoined the band in 2010, taking on both vocal and bass duties. The band's music has been well-received, with "Empiricism" being considered a cornerstone of their discography. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borknagar?utm_source=openai))

Borknagar's official website provides information on their discography, tour dates, and merchandise. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borknagar?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Shady Fat Kats
bands.description: "Shady Fat Kats" does not appear to be an active metal band. The closest match is "Fat Kat Records," a Belgian record label specializing in various music genres. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/labels/Fat_Kat_Records/43191?utm_source=openai)) Additionally, there are artists named Shady Abou Fayad and Shady Abdelkhalek associated with metal music, but they are not linked to a band named "Shady Fat Kats." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/Shady_Abou_Fayad/617600?utm_source=openai)) Therefore, no information is available regarding a band by that name.

bands.name: Treat
bands.description: Treat is a Swedish hard rock band formed in Stockholm in 1981 by singer Robert Ernlund and guitarist Anders "Gary" Wikström. Initially known as "The Boys," they changed their name to Treat in 1983 after signing with Mercury Records. Their debut album, "Scratch and Bite," released in 1985, featured tracks like "Too Wild" and "Get You on the Run," which garnered both national and international attention. The band's subsequent albums, "The Pleasure Principle" (1986) and "Dreamhunter" (1987), solidified their reputation in the melodic hard rock and glam metal scenes. In 1993, Treat disbanded due to declining success, but reunited in 2006 after the release of the compilation "Weapons of Choice 1984–2006." They have since released several studio albums, including "Coup de Grâce" (2010), "Ghost of Graceland" (2016), "Tunguska" (2018), and "The Endgame" (2022). In August 2025, they released the single "Adam & Evil," followed by "Out With A Bang" in November 2025, both leading up to their tenth studio album, "The Wild Card," released on November 21, 2025.

members.name: Patrick "Green" Appelgren
members.role: Keyboards, Synthesizer, Piano, Backing Vocals, Guitar

bands.name: The Subways
bands.description: The Subways are an English rock band formed in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, in 2002. The original lineup consisted of brothers Billy Lunn (vocals, guitar) and Josh Morgan (drums), along with Charlotte Cooper (bass, vocals). They began by covering songs by Nirvana and Green Day under the name Mustardseed, later changing it to Platypus. Their big break came when they won a competition to perform at the Glastonbury Festival, leading to their debut album, "Young for Eternity," released in 2005. The album featured the hit single "Oh Yeah," which reached number 25 on the UK Singles Chart. Their second album, "All or Nothing," produced by Butch Vig, was released in 2008, followed by "Money and Celebrity" in 2011. In 2015, they released their self-titled fourth album, "The Subways," and in 2023, "Uncertain Joys," their fifth studio album. In October 2020, Josh Morgan left the band for personal reasons, and Camille Phillips joined as the new drummer in 2021. The Subways are known for their energetic performances and blend of punk rock, alternative rock, and garage rock styles. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Subways?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sweet Pill
bands.description:
Sweet Pill is an American emo band from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, formed in 2018. The band consists of vocalist Zayna Youssef, guitarist Jayce Williams, guitarist Sean McCall, bassist Ryan Cullen, and drummer Chris Kearney. Their music blends elements of emo, Midwest emo, and punk rock, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with fans of the genre.

The band originated as a senior project by Youssef and Williams while they were attending Rowan University in Glassboro, New Jersey. They released their debut single, "Doubt," in March 2019, followed by their first EP, "Lost In It," in April 2019. In May 2022, they released their debut full-length album, "Where the Heart Is," which received positive reviews and solidified their presence in the emo scene. In September 2023, Sweet Pill signed with Hopeless Records and released the single "Starchild," marking a new chapter in their musical journey. ([xpn.org](https://xpn.org/2023/09/28/sweet-pill-starchild/?utm_source=openai)) They followed this with the "Unraveled" EP in January 2025, offering acoustic versions of fan-favorite tracks. ([sw33tpill.bandcamp.com](https://sw33tpill.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

Sweet Pill's music is characterized by emotive lyrics and dynamic instrumentation, drawing comparisons to bands like Paramore and Circa Survive. Their energetic performances and heartfelt songwriting have garnered them a dedicated fanbase and critical acclaim within the emo and punk rock communities.

bands.name: Glasperlenspiel
bands.description: Glasperlenspiel is a German electropop duo from Stockach, consisting of vocalist Carolin Niemczyk and keyboardist Daniel Grunenberg. Formed in 2003, they initially gained attention in 2011 by representing Baden-Württemberg at the Bundesvision Song Contest with their single "Echt," which secured fourth place. Their debut album, "Beweg dich mit mir," released in September 2011, achieved gold certification in Germany. The duo's second album, "Grenzenlos," released in May 2013, reached number eight on the German charts and included the top-ten hit "Nie vergessen." Over the years, Glasperlenspiel has continued to release music, with their latest single, "Geiles Leben 2025," released in June 2025.

bands.name: Ad Infinitum
bands.description: Ad Infinitum is a Swiss symphonic metal band formed in 2018 in Montreux, Switzerland. Initially conceived as a solo project by vocalist Melissa Bonny, the band expanded into a full ensemble with the addition of guitarist Adrian Theßenvitz, bassist Jonas Asplind, and drummer Niklas Müller. In July 2019, they signed with Napalm Records and released their debut album, "Chapter I: Monarchy," in April 2020. The album delves into historical themes, particularly focusing on the life of Louis XIV and his court. In December 2020, Asplind departed due to health issues and was replaced by Korbinian Benedict. The band continued to evolve their sound with subsequent releases, including "Chapter II: Legacy" in 2021, "Chapter III: Downfall" in 2023, and "Abyss" in 2024. "Abyss" marked a significant shift in their musical direction, incorporating elements of pop, alternative rock, and metalcore, showcasing their versatility and growth as artists. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ad_Infinitum_%28Swiss_band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Double Dragon
bands.description:
Double Dragon was a heavy metal band from Adelaide, Australia, active between 2003 and 2012. Formed by guitarist Matthew 'Roady' Johnston, the band initially focused on melody-driven metal, drawing influences from Black Sabbath, Judas Priest, Iron Maiden, Slayer, Pantera, Carcass, Entombed, Faith No More, Mr. Bungle, Soilwork, and The Haunted. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Dragon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Their debut EP, "Have Them Destroyed," released in 2005, showcased their heavy metal style. In 2006, they released "Scars of Fire," which featured guest vocals by Brisbane singer-songwriter Emma Dean. The album received airplay on Triple J's Full Metal Racket and community radio nationally. In 2008, they released "Devastator," which debuted at number one on the SAMIA Adelaide charts. The album featured a mix of traditional heavy metal, death metal, hard rock, and two ballads. The band supported international tours by Swedish metal bands The Haunted and Soilwork, as well as opening for Carcass in Adelaide. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Dragon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

In 2011, they released "Sons of Asena," a concept album based on a fictional story with loose ties to an ancient Turkish wolf myth. The album featured guest appearances by Brisbane singer-songwriters Kate Miller-Heidke and Keir Nuttall. The band performed at the 2007 Adelaide Big Day Out and supported bands like Slayer, Arch Enemy, Dark Tranquillity, The Black Dahlia Murder, Cephalic Carnage, and Mastodon. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Dragon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band's lineup included vocalist Lee Gardiner, guitarist Matthew Johnston, guitarist Davin Buttery, bassist Joshua Lamont, and drummer Liam Weedall. They disbanded in 2012. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double_Dragon_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mass Hysteria
bands.description: Mass Hysteria is a French industrial metal band formed in 1993. They have released eleven studio albums and four live albums in their 30-year career. Their breakthrough came in 1999 with their second album, "Contraddiction," which sold over 50,000 copies. The band is known for their eclecticism, combining industrial metal, alternative metal, rock, and rap. They are also one of the few metal bands to sing primarily in French. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_Hysteria_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Spineshank
bands.description: Spineshank is an American nu metal and industrial metal band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1996. The group emerged from the remnants of a project called Basic Enigma, which included vocalist Jonny Santos, guitarist Mike Sarkisyan, and drummer Tommy Decker. They were later joined by bassist Robert Garcia. Influenced by bands like Fear Factory, Spineshank signed with Roadrunner Records and released their debut album, "Strictly Diesel," in 1998. Their second album, "The Height of Callousness," released in 2000, showcased a stronger industrial metal influence and featured the singles "Synthetic" and "New Disease." The band's third album, "Self-Destructive Pattern," released in 2003, included the Grammy-nominated single "Smothered." After a hiatus, Spineshank reunited in 2008 with Santos, Decker, and Garcia, releasing "Anger Denial Acceptance" in 2012. In 2025, the band celebrated the 25th anniversary of "The Height of Callousness" with a revamped lineup, including original members Santos, Decker, and Garcia, along with new guitarists Tommy Decker Jr. and Jason Hager. ([live-metal.com](https://live-metal.com/2025/03/06/spineshank-reuniting-to-celebrate-25-years-of-the-height-of-callousness/?utm_source=openai)) The band has been compared to Fear Factory, Orgy, Static-X, Coal Chamber, and System of a Down. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spineshank?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Kneel Before The Death
bands.description:
Kneel Before the Death is a Finnish metal band formed in 2013 in Helsinki, Finland. Initially starting as a deathcore act, they have since evolved into a symphonic deathcore ensemble, blending aggressive metalcore elements with symphonic orchestration to create a unique and powerful sound. The band has been active since their formation in 2013 and is currently signed to Ranka Kustannus. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Kneel_Before_the_Death/3540564988?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes several singles and an EP:

- "Miserere Mei" (2018)
- "Lust" (2022)
- "Memoir" (EP, 2022)
- "I Am the One" (2023)
- "Rise" (2024)
- "I, Eternal" (2025)
- "Spiral" (2025)

Their self-titled full-length album, "Kneel Before the Death," was released on June 6, 2025. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Kneel_Before_the_Death/Kneel_Before_the_Death/1344452?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes bassist Joonas Peltonen, who has been with the band since its inception. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/Joonas_Peltonen/942808?utm_source=openai))

For more information, you can visit their official website.

bands.name: Randy Brecker
bands.description: Randy Brecker is an American trumpeter and flugelhornist renowned for his versatility across jazz, rock, and R&B genres. Born on November 27, 1945, in Cheltenham, Pennsylvania, he began his musical journey early, influenced by his father, a jazz pianist, and his mother, a portrait artist. Brecker studied at Indiana University from 1963 to 1966, honing his skills under mentors like Bill Adam, David Baker, and Jerry Coker. After relocating to New York City, he joined Clark Terry's Big Bad Band, the Duke Pearson Big Band, and the Thad Jones/Mel Lewis Jazz Orchestra. In 1967, he ventured into jazz-rock with Blood, Sweat & Tears, contributing to their debut album, "Child Is Father to the Man." He later joined the Horace Silver Quintet and recorded his first solo album, "Score," in 1968, featuring his brother, Michael Brecker. In 1971, Randy and Michael formed the fusion group Dreams, releasing two albums before disbanding in 1973. The Brecker Brothers Band, established in 1975, achieved significant success, earning seven Grammy nominations and two wins. After the band's dissolution in 1982, Randy collaborated with Jaco Pastorius' Word of Mouth big band and married Brazilian jazz pianist Eliane Elias, with whom he recorded and toured. Throughout his career, Brecker has worked with artists like Bruce Springsteen, Frank Zappa, and Parliament-Funkadelic, leaving an indelible mark on the music industry. ([randybrecker.com](https://www.randybrecker.com/bio?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Guilt Trip
bands.description: Guilt Trip is a Manchester-based metalcore band that formed in 2015. The group consists of vocalist Jay Valentine, guitarists Jak Maden and Sam Baker, bassist Lily Kilcoyne, and drummer Tom Aimson. They are known for their aggressive sound that blends elements of thrash metal and hardcore, creating a high-energy experience for listeners. In 2016, they released their debut EP, "Unrelenting Force," which showcased their raw intensity and set the stage for their future endeavors. Their 2019 full-length album, "River of Lies," featured the track "Thin Ice," which garnered significant attention, amassing over 7 million streams on Spotify. In 2023, they released "Severance," an album that included collaborations with bands like LANDMVRKS and Malevolence, further solidifying their presence in the metalcore scene. In September 2025, Guilt Trip signed with Roadrunner Records and released their single "Burn," marking a new chapter in their career. ([metalnerd.net](https://metalnerd.net/guilt-trip-sign-to-roadrunner-records-debut-new-track-burn/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Hatebreed
bands.description: Hatebreed is an American metalcore band formed in 1994 in Bridgeport, Connecticut. Known for their aggressive fusion of hardcore punk and heavy metal, they have been influential in the development of the metalcore genre. Their debut album, "Satisfaction Is the Death of Desire" (1997), sold more copies than any other debut in the history of Victory Records. The band's lineup has seen several changes over the years, but lead vocalist Jamey Jasta has remained a constant presence. Their most recent album, "Weight of the False Self," was released in 2020. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatebreed?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: We Came As Romans
bands.description:
We Came as Romans is an American metalcore band from Troy, Michigan, formed in 2005. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years but has consistently delivered music that blends aggressive metalcore with melodic elements. Their discography includes seven studio albums:

- "To Plant a Seed" (2009)
- "Understanding What We've Grown to Be" (2011)
- "Tracing Back Roots" (2013)
- "We Came as Romans" (2015)
- "Cold Like War" (2017)
- "Darkbloom" (2022)
- "All Is Beautiful... Because We're Doomed" (2025)

Their musical style has evolved over time, incorporating elements of post-hardcore and metalcore, often featuring melodic passages and orchestral instrumentation. The band's lyrics frequently explore themes of hope, brotherhood, and personal growth. In 2018, the band faced the tragic loss of vocalist Kyle Pavone, which deeply affected both the band and their fanbase. Despite this, they have continued to create music, honoring his memory and legacy. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/We_Came_as_Romans?utm_source=openai))

Their 2022 album "Darkbloom" marked a significant moment in their career, dealing with themes of grief and loss while honoring Pavone's memory. The band has announced their seventh studio album, "All Is Beautiful... Because We're Doomed," slated for release in 2025, reflecting their ongoing evolution and commitment to their craft. ([thebandindex.com](https://thebandindex.com/band/we-came-as-romans?utm_source=openai))

We Came as Romans continues to tour and release music, maintaining a dedicated fanbase and contributing significantly to the metalcore genre.

bands.name: South Arcade
bands.description: South Arcade is an English rock band from Oxford, formed in 2021. The lineup consists of lead vocalist Harmony Cavelle, guitarist Harry Winks, bassist Ollie Green, and drummer Cody Jones. The band gained attention through viral videos of their band practices and performed at BBC Radio 1's New Music Live in Halifax, West Yorkshire, in November 2024. Their music blends pop punk and alternative rock, drawing comparisons to Pale Waves, Avril Lavigne, and Bring Me the Horizon. Their debut EP, "2005," released in December 2024, received positive reviews from Distorted Sound Magazine. The band is set to release their second EP, "Play!" on November 28, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Arcade?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Malice
bands.description: Malice is a gothic/black metal band from Bandung, West Java, Indonesia, formed in 1999. The band is known for its atmospheric and dark musical style, blending elements of gothic and black metal to create a unique sound. Their music often explores themes of darkness and introspection, characteristic of the gothic metal genre. Malice has been active since their formation, contributing to the Indonesian metal scene with their distinctive style. As of the latest available information, the band remains unsigned and continues to produce music independently.

bands.name: Homselvareg
bands.description: HomSelvareg is an Italian metal band that emerged in the early 2000s, blending elements of black and death metal to create a distinctive sound. The band has undergone several lineup changes over the years, with members contributing to various projects within the metal scene. Notable members include Bazzy Mogan, who has been involved in multiple bands such as Mors and Inferi, and Gerion, who has played in Omicron Ceti and Tumulus Anmatus. The band's discography includes the EP "Rinascita" released in 2018, the album "Ventunesimo secolo" in 2023, and the single "Spirito Errante Eterno" in 2024. Their music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and a blend of harsh and melodic vocals, appealing to fans of both black and death metal genres.

bands.name: Letlive.
bands.description: Letlive. was an American post-hardcore band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2002. Known for their energetic performances and emotionally charged music, the band blended elements of post-hardcore, punk rock, and experimental rock. Their discography includes several notable albums, such as "Exhaustion, Salt Water, and Everything in Between" (2005), "Fake History" (2010), "The Blackest Beautiful" (2013), and "If I'm the Devil..." (2016). The band disbanded in 2017 after a farewell tour.

bands.name: Perchta
bands.description: Perchta is an Austrian folk and post-black metal band from Tyrol, formed in 2017. The band draws inspiration from alpine folklore, integrating traditional elements into their music. Their debut album, "Ufång," was released on April 10, 2020, through Prophecy Productions. The album features tracks like "Åtem" and "Wåssa," showcasing their unique blend of metal and folk influences. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Perchta/Uf%C3%A5ng/839652?utm_source=openai)) On June 14, 2024, they released their second album, "D'Muata," also via Prophecy Productions. The album includes songs such as "Vom Verlånga" and "Hebamm," continuing their exploration of themes rooted in Tyrolean culture. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Perchta/D%27Muata/1224360?utm_source=openai)) The band's lineup includes Frau Percht (vocals, bladder fiddle, percussion), Fabio "Walscher" D'Amore (bass), Christian "Moosmandl" Höll (hackbrett), Christoph "Loda" Knoll (lead guitar), Lukas "Gsell" Massinger (rhythm guitar), and Simon "Håscht" Schnückel (drums). Live performances often feature Peter "Woidschrat" Casdorf-Pfister on bass. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perchta_%28Band%29?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a fusion of black and folk metal, incorporating traditional instruments and themes from alpine mythology. For more information, visit their official website at [www.perchta.tirol](http://www.perchta.tirol/).

bands.name: Bluthunde
bands.description: Bluthunde is a black metal band from Nijmegen, Gelderland, Netherlands, formed in 2011. The band is known for its atmospheric and intense black metal sound, characterized by raw vocals, blast beats, and dark, melodic guitar riffs. Their music often explores themes of darkness and introspection. The band's discography includes several releases, with their most recent album being "In the Shadow of the Black Sun," released in 2022. The album received positive reviews for its compelling compositions and atmospheric depth. The current lineup consists of Astathica, who handles all instruments, vocals, and drum programming. Bluthunde continues to be active, performing live and working on new material.

bands.name: The Pretty Wild
bands.description: The Pretty Wild is a Las Vegas-based metalcore duo known for their dynamic fusion of heavy metal and alternative elements. Formed in 2023, the band quickly gained attention with their energetic performances and innovative sound. Their debut album, "zero.point.genesis," released on November 21, 2025, showcases their evolution and musical prowess. The album features previously released singles such as "OMENS," "Button Eyes," "living ded," and the hit "sLeepwALKeR," which has amassed over 20 million streams on Spotify alone. ([metal-roos.com.au](https://metal-roos.com.au/the-pretty-wild-announce-debut-album-zero-point-genesis/?utm_source=openai)) The Pretty Wild's music is characterized by a blend of aggressive metalcore riffs, melodic elements, and introspective lyrics, appealing to fans of both traditional and modern metal genres. Their unique sound and compelling storytelling have established them as a rising force in the metal scene.

bands.name: The Dillinger Escape Plan
bands.description: The Dillinger Escape Plan was an American metalcore band formed in 1997 in Morris Plains, New Jersey. Known for their complex, chaotic sound, they pioneered the mathcore genre by blending elements of hardcore punk, metalcore, and experimental rock. Their music featured dissonant chords, odd time signatures, and unconventional drum patterns, creating a unique and intense listening experience. The band's lineup underwent several changes over the years, with guitarist Ben Weinman being the only constant member. Other notable members included vocalist Greg Puciato, bassist Liam Wilson, and drummer Billy Rymer. They released six studio albums, starting with "Calculating Infinity" in 1999, which received critical acclaim and achieved cult status. Their final album, "Dissociation," was released in 2016, after which the band disbanded. In 2023, The Dillinger Escape Plan reunited, continuing to influence the metal scene with their innovative approach to music.

bands.name: Pustulant Flesh
bands.description: Pustulant Flesh is a death metal band from Copenhagen, Denmark, formed in 2022. Initially known as Fetus Deletus, the band underwent a name change to Putrid Abortion in 2022, and later to Pustulant Flesh in 2023. Their music is characterized by themes of gore and brutality, aligning with the death metal genre. The band's discography includes the EP "Beyond Lobotomy," released on March 26, 2023, featuring tracks like "Fecal Explosion" and "Cadaver Creation." Their full-length album, "Gurgling Pustulence," was released on August 8, 2025, under Extremely Rotten Productions. This album includes tracks such as "Beyond Lobotomy," "Cadaver Creation," and "March of the Ravenous Dead." The current lineup consists of Mike Dalsgaard on guitars and backing vocals, Filip Dursun on drums, and Peter Jacobsen on vocals and bass. The band's logo was designed by Ink Lesions, and the artwork for "Gurgling Pustulence" was created by Skaðvaldur. The album was recorded, mixed, and mastered in June 2024 at Radtleff Recordings.

bands.name: Bloodred Hourglass
bands.description: Bloodred Hourglass (BRHG) is a Finnish melodic death metal band formed in 2005 in Mikkeli. The group initially gained attention with their 2010 EP "Deviant Grace," which showcased their blend of groove metal and thrash influences. Their debut album, "Lifebound," was released in 2012 under Spinefarm Records, marking their entry into the Finnish metal scene. Over the years, BRHG has evolved their sound, incorporating elements of metalcore, alternative metal, and groove metal, while maintaining their melodic death metal roots. Their discography includes seven studio albums: "Lifebound" (2012), "Where the Oceans Burn" (2015), "Heal" (2017), "Godsend" (2019), "Your Highness" (2021), "How's the Heart?" (2023), and "We Should Be Buried Like This" (2025). The band's music is characterized by fast drum patterns, thrashy riffs, and a mix of guttural, screamed, and clean vocals, creating a dynamic and emotionally resonant sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloodred_Hourglass?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Those Damn Crows
bands.description:
Those Damn Crows are a Welsh rock band formed in 2014 in Bridgend, Wales. The lineup consists of vocalist Shane Greenhall, guitarist Ian "Shiner" Thomas, bassist Lloyd Wood, drummer Ronnie Huxford, and guitarist David Winchurch. The band's name was inspired by an incident where Huxford's father exclaimed "Those damn crows!" while feeding birds in his garden. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Those_Damn_Crows?utm_source=openai))

In 2018, they released their debut album, "Murder and the Motive," which charted at number 5 on the Official UK Rock & Metal Albums Chart. Their second album, "Point of No Return," released in 2020, entered the UK Albums Chart at number 14. Their third album, "Inhale/Exhale," released in 2023, reached number 3 on the UK Albums Chart. Their fourth album, "God Shaped Hole," released in 2025, topped the UK Albums Chart, marking their first number one album. ([loudersound.com](https://www.loudersound.com/news/those-damn-crows-score-their-first-uk-no-1-album-with-god-shaped-hole?utm_source=openai))

Musically, Those Damn Crows blend hard and heavy rock with anthemic choruses and powerful melodies. Their style has been described as ultramelodic hard rock that keeps the spirit of the 1970s and 1980s alive. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Those_Damn_Crows?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [thosedamncrows.com](https://thosedamncrows.com/).

bands.name: Pennywise
bands.description:
Pennywise is an American punk rock band formed in 1988 in Hermosa Beach, California. The band's name is inspired by the antagonist in Stephen King's horror novel *It*. Pennywise is known for its energetic performances and positive mental attitude, often addressing themes of freedom and resistance in their lyrics. Their music has been a staple in the skate punk scene, with songs like "Bro Hymn" and "Same Old Story" featured in skateboarding videos and video games such as *Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3*. ([as.com](https://as.com/deportes_accion/urbano/asi-se-convirtio-pennywise-en-los-padrinos-del-skate-punk-f202511-n/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of Jim Lindberg (vocals), Fletcher Dragge (guitar), Randy Bradbury (bass), and Byron McMackin (drums). Over the years, the band has released several studio albums, including their self-titled debut in 1991, "Unknown Road" in 1993, and "About Time" in 1995. Their 2008 album "Reason to Believe" was notably offered as a free download on MySpace, reflecting their commitment to accessibility and fan engagement. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pennywise_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Pennywise's music is characterized by fast-paced, melodic hardcore punk, blending aggressive guitar riffs with socially conscious lyrics. Their sound has influenced numerous bands within the punk and skate punk genres. Despite lineup changes over the years, Pennywise remains a significant presence in the punk rock scene, continuing to tour and release new material.

bands.name: Possessed
bands.description: Possessed is an American death metal band formed in 1982 in the San Francisco Bay Area. Often hailed as the pioneers of the death metal genre, they are recognized for their rapid playing style and Jeff Becerra's distinctive growled vocals. Their 1985 debut album, "Seven Churches," is frequently cited as the first death metal album, setting the foundation for the genre. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with Jeff Becerra being the consistent member. After a hiatus in the early 1990s, Possessed reunited in 2007 and released "Revelations of Oblivion" in 2019. In 2025, they embarked on a world tour to celebrate the 40th anniversary of "Seven Churches." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Possessed_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Fall Of Creation
bands.description: The Fall of Creation is a Russian metal band from Kaliningrad, formed in 2017. They play a blend of melodic death and groove metal, exploring themes like inner struggles, the meaning of life, and the fragility of the human body. The current lineup includes Dmitry Karataev on bass, Andrey Borovikov on drums, Evgeny Filchin and Evgeny Lukashevich on guitars, and Evgeny Sabirov as the vocalist. Their discography features two full-length albums: 'Killer Inside' (2020) and 'Enlightenment' (2024). 'Enlightenment' includes tracks such as 'Philosophy of Being,' 'Dance of Death,' and 'Martyrdom.' ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/The_Fall_of_Creation/Enlightenment/1275846?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Ego Kill Talent
bands.description: Ego Kill Talent is a Brazilian rock band formed in São Paulo in December 2014 by Jean Dolabella and Theo van der Loo. The band's name is a shortened version of the saying "too much ego will kill your talent." Known for their dynamic performances, they often switch instruments during shows, showcasing their versatility. The lineup includes Emmily Barreto (vocals), Theo van der Loo (guitar), Niper Boaventura (guitar), Raphael Miranda (drums), and Cris Botarelli (bass). Their discography comprises two studio albums: "Ego Kill Talent" (2017) and "The Dance Between Extremes" (2021), recorded at the Foo Fighters' 606 Studios. They have also released several EPs and singles, collaborating with artists like Far from Alaska and featuring guest appearances from John Dolmayan (System of a Down) and Roy Mayorga (Stone Sour). In 2022, Emmily Barreto joined as the new lead vocalist, bringing a fresh sound to the band. The band has performed at major festivals such as Rock in Rio, Lollapalooza Brazil, and Download Festival, and has toured with bands like Foo Fighters, Queens of the Stone Age, and System of a Down.

bands.name: Deep Purple
bands.description: Deep Purple is an English rock band formed in London in 1968, renowned as pioneers of heavy metal and modern hard rock. Their musical style has evolved over the decades, incorporating elements of progressive rock, hard rock, and heavy metal. The band's classic lineup, known as "Mark II," featured vocalist Ian Gillan, guitarist Ritchie Blackmore, bassist Roger Glover, keyboardist Jon Lord, and drummer Ian Paice. This lineup produced seminal albums such as "Deep Purple in Rock" (1970), "Fireball" (1971), and "Machine Head" (1972), with "Machine Head" including the iconic track "Smoke on the Water." The band's influence is vast, with over 100 million records sold worldwide and a legacy that has inspired countless artists in the rock and metal genres. ([deep-purple.com](https://deep-purple.com/biography/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Perturbator
bands.description: Perturbator is the stage name of James Kent, a French musician from Paris, born on January 22, 1993. Raised in a musically inclined family—his father, Nick Kent, is a British music critic, and his mother, Laurence Romance, is a French music journalist—Kent developed an early interest in music. Initially, he played guitar in various black metal bands, but in 2012, he shifted his focus to electronic music, drawing inspiration from cyberpunk culture and films like "Akira," "Ghost in the Shell," and "The Running Man." He utilizes a range of software synthesizers, including emulators of vintage models like the OB-X and CS-80. Since his debut EP, "Night Driving Avenger," Kent has released several full-length albums, with "Lustful Sacraments" being the latest, released in 2021. In October 2025, Perturbator signed with Nuclear Blast Records and released "Age of Aquarius," featuring collaborations with artists such as Ulver, Alcest, Author & Punisher, and Greta Link. His music is characterized by a dark, atmospheric blend of electronic and metal elements, often described as darksynth or cyberpunk. Perturbator's tracks have been featured in video games like "Hotline Miami" and its sequel, "Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perturbator?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Raga Rockers
bands.description: Raga Rockers is a Norwegian rock band formed in 1982 in Oslo. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Michael Krohn, bassist Livio Aiello, guitarist Bruno Hovden, and drummer Jan Arne Kristiansen. Over the years, the band's musical style has evolved, often characterized as melodic rock with dark and satirical lyrics. They are considered one of the "big four" Norwegian bands who popularized modern rock with Norwegian lyrics in the 1980s, alongside Jokke & Valentinerne, DeLillos, and DumDum Boys. Raga Rockers has released twelve studio albums, four live albums, and two compilation albums. Their 2007 album "Übermensch" topped the Norwegian charts, and they continue to perform and release music, maintaining a significant presence in Norway's rock scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raga_Rockers?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Extreme
bands.description: Extreme is an American rock band formed in Boston, Massachusetts, in 1985. The lineup consists of lead vocalist Gary Cherone, guitarist Nuno Bettencourt, bassist Pat Badger, and drummer Kevin Figueiredo. They are known for their dynamic blend of hard rock, funk metal, and glam metal, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with audiences worldwide. The band's music has been featured in popular culture, including the film "Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure" and the series "Stranger Things." ([extreme-band.com](https://extreme-band.com/about/?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Nuno Bettencourt
members.role: Guitar, Keyboards, Piano, Backing And Lead Vocals, Brass And Orchestration Arrangements

bands.name: The Carburetors
bands.description:
The Carburetors are a Norwegian hard rock band from Oslo, formed in 2001. Their music blends boogie rock and roll with heavy metal, drawing comparisons to Chuck Berry and Motörhead. The band describes their style as "Fast Forward Rock'n'Roll." ([thecarburetors.com](https://www.thecarburetors.com/2.html?utm_source=openai))

**History and Style**

The Carburetors debuted with "Pain Is Temporary, Glory Is Forever" in 2004, featuring the hit single "Burnout," which became one of the most-played music videos in Norway that summer. ([thecarburetors.com](https://www.thecarburetors.com/2.html?utm_source=openai)) Their second album, "Loud Enough to Raise the Dead," released in 2006, included tracks like "Rock'n'Roll Forever" and "Whole Town is Shakin'." In 2008, they released "Rock'n'Roll Forever," a compilation of nine re-recorded songs and six new tracks. Their 2015 album, "Laughing in the Face of Death," featured guest appearances by Shagrath and Geriloz from Dimmu Borgir. ([thecarburetors.com](https://www.thecarburetors.com/2.html?utm_source=openai)) In 2023, they celebrated their 20th anniversary with the album "Drinking From the Skulls of Our Enemies," released on January 20, 2023. ([thecarburetors.com](https://www.thecarburetors.com/2.html?utm_source=openai))

**Discography**

- "Pain Is Temporary, Glory Is Forever" (2004)
- "Loud Enough to Raise the Dead" (2006)
- "Rock'n'Roll Forever" (2008)
- "Laughing in the Face of Death" (2015)
- "Drinking From the Skulls of Our Enemies" (2023)

**Genres**

- Hard Rock
- Rock and Roll
- Heavy Metal

**Website**

[thecarburetors.com](https://www.thecarburetors.com/)

**Members**

- Eddie Guz – Lead Vocals (2001–present)
- Chris Marchand – Lead Guitar (2015–present)
- Anders "Rock" Søbakk – Guitar (2023–present)
- Chris Nitro – Drums (2001–present)
- King O'Men – Bass (2001–present)

**Headline Image and Logo**

![The Carburetors](https://www.thecarburetors.com/images/logo.png)

![The Carburetors](https://www.thecarburetors.com/images/band_photo.jpg)

bands.name: The Callous Daoboys
bands.description: The Callous Daoboys are an American mathcore band from Atlanta, Georgia, formed in 2016. Their name is a spoonerism of the Dallas Cowboys football team. The band released their debut EP, "My Dixie Wrecked," on April 1, 2017, followed by "Animal Tetris" on December 1, 2017. Their first full-length album, "Die on Mars," was released on June 21, 2019, under Dark Trail Records. In 2022, they signed with MNRK Music Group and released "Celebrity Therapist" on September 2, 2022. Their third album, "I Don't Want to See You in Heaven," was released on May 16, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Callous_Daoboys?utm_source=openai)) The band's music is a fusion of mathcore, metalcore, nu metal, post-hardcore, and alternative metal, drawing influences from bands like The Dillinger Escape Plan, Botch, Korn, Slipknot, Linkin Park, and System of a Down. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Callous_Daoboys?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Robin Mcauley
bands.description:
Robin McAuley is an Irish singer renowned for his powerful vocals in the hard rock and heavy metal genres. Born on January 20, 1953, in County Meath, Ireland, McAuley began his musical career in the early 1980s. He first gained prominence as the lead vocalist for the British band Grand Prix, recording the album "Samurai" in 1983. In 1985, he joined Far Corporation, a supergroup featuring members from Toto and other notable bands, contributing to their album "Division One." ([it.wikipedia.org](https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robin_McAuley?utm_source=openai))

In 1986, McAuley formed the McAuley Schenker Group (MSG) with German guitarist Michael Schenker. The band released three studio albums: "Perfect Timing" (1987), "Save Yourself" (1989), and "M.S.G." (1992), along with a live album, "Unplugged Live" (1993). MSG was known for its melodic hard rock sound, with McAuley's vocals being a defining element. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McAuley_Schenker_Group?utm_source=openai))

After MSG disbanded, McAuley continued his musical journey with various projects. He joined the band Survivor in 2006, serving as their lead vocalist until 2011. In 2019, he formed the hard rock supergroup Black Swan, releasing albums such as "Shake the World" (2020) and "Generation Mind" (2022). McAuley has also pursued a solo career, releasing albums like "Standing on the Edge" (2021), "Alive" (2023), and "Soulbound" (2025). His music is characterized by a blend of hard rock and heavy metal elements, showcasing his versatile vocal abilities. ([metaltalk.net](https://www.metaltalk.net/robin-mcauley-announces-new-album-soulbound-for-february-2025.php?utm_source=openai))

As of November 2025, Robin McAuley continues to be an active and influential figure in the rock music scene, captivating audiences with his dynamic performances and enduring contributions to the genre.

bands.name: Froglord
bands.description:
Froglord is a psychedelic doom and sludge metal band from Bristol, England, formed in 2020. Initially conceived as a solo project by multi-instrumentalist and vocalist Benjamin "Froglord" Oak during the COVID-19 pandemic, the project quickly evolved into a full band as live venues reopened in 2021. The lineup expanded to include bassist Luke "Bufo" Clemenger, drummer Chris "Anura" Seldon, and guitarist Jordan "Caudata" Cross.
