([metalnoise.net](https://metalnoise.net/2025/07/rabidfest-2025-breaking-down-the-bands-5-froglord?utm_source=openai))

Froglord's music is characterized by heavy, fuzz-laden riffs and groovy rhythms, blending elements of stoner doom and psychedelic sludge. Their concept-based discography follows the tale of The Froglord, an ancient amphibian deity with deathray vision and ectoplasmic slime, emerging from the mystic swamps to restore the balance of nature. This narrative is deeply intertwined with environmental themes, reflecting the band's commitment to ecological activism. ([froglord.org](https://www.froglord.org/?utm_source=openai))

Since their formation, Froglord has been prolific, releasing five full-length albums: "Amphibian Ascending" (2020), "The Mystic Toad" (2021), "Army of Frogs" (2022), "Sons of Froglord" (2023), and "Metamorphosis" (2025). They have also produced several EPs, singles, and splits, including "Save the Frogs" (2021) and "A Frog in the Bog" (2022). Their music is available on major streaming platforms, and they have performed at various festivals, including Desertfest London and Antwerp. ([froglord.org](https://www.froglord.org/?utm_source=openai))

Froglord's dedication to environmental causes is evident through their active charity work, having raised over £3,000 for various environmental charities, including Save The Frogs, the world’s largest amphibian-based conservation charity. ([froglord.org](https://www.froglord.org/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [froglord.org](https://www.froglord.org/).

bands.name: Haggefugg
bands.description: Haggefugg is a German medieval rock band formed in Cologne in 2015. The band's name, "Haggefugg," originates from the term "kampfuntauglich" used during the Crusades, meaning "unfit for battle." This reflects their unique blend of medieval themes with modern rock elements. The original lineup consisted of Yannick Delseit (Gregor Krähenkehle) on vocals, David Haas (Dudel zu Lang) on bagpipes and shawm, Martin (Mandolin der Rote) on guitar, Tim Horschmann (Bassbär) on bass, and Fabian Linden (Hauptmann Klopfer) on drums. In 2015, Henrik Maria Winterscheid (Henry D’Humel) joined as a bagpiper. Over the years, the band has undergone several lineup changes, with notable additions such as Patrick Knobloch (Fidus Pisack) on bagpipes in 2019 and Carsten Röbkes (Der Meticus) on drums in 2017. Their music is characterized by lively medieval rock, enriched with distinctive bagpipe melodies, creating an engaging and festive atmosphere. Their discography includes three studio albums: "Metgefühl" (2016), "Fass zum Teufel" (2019), and "Tanz und Gloria" (2024). They have also released several singles and music videos, contributing to their growing popularity in the medieval rock scene. Haggefugg has performed at various festivals and events, including the Wacken Open Air and the Wave-Gotik-Treffen, showcasing their energetic performances and unique musical style. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haggefugg?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Svarttjern
bands.description: Svarttjern is a Norwegian black metal band formed in Oslo in 2003 by brothers HansFyrste and HaaN. Initially a two-man project, they expanded in 2004 by adding members Grimmdun, Fjellnord, and Skabb, leading to the recording of two demos. In 2007, Skabb was replaced by Terror, and the band recorded a three-track promo. Svarttjern signed with Schwarzdorn Production for their debut album, "Misanthropic Path of Madness," released in 2009. Their second album, "Towards the Ultimate," was released in 2011. In 2012, they signed with NoiseArt Records and released "Ultimatum Necrophilia" in 2014. In 2015, they signed with Soulseller Records and released "Dødsskrik" in 2016. Their latest album, "Shame Is Just a Word," was released in 2025. Svarttjern is known for their brutal live performances and their commitment to the true Norwegian black metal sound. ([blabbermouth.net](https://blabbermouth.net/news/svarttjern-signs-with-noiseart-records?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Pentagram
bands.description: Pentagram is an American heavy metal band from Alexandria, Virginia, formed in 1971. They are considered one of the pioneers of doom metal, alongside bands like Candlemass, Saint Vitus, and Trouble. Their sound has often been compared to Black Sabbath. The band's lineup has undergone numerous changes over the years, with vocalist Bobby Liebling being the only constant member. Despite their early influence, Pentagram's first full-length album, "Relentless," was released in 1985, featuring a new lineup with Liebling as the sole original member. The current lineup includes Bobby Liebling (vocals), Tony Reed (guitar), Scooter Haslip (bass), and Henry Vasquez (drums). In 2025, the band released "Lightning in a Bottle," their first studio album in nearly ten years. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pentagram_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bloodywood
bands.description: Bloodywood is an Indian metal band from New Delhi, formed in 2016. Initially starting as a parody act that uploaded metal covers of popular Bollywood songs on YouTube, they transitioned to creating original music that blends nu metal, folk metal, and metalcore elements. Their unique sound incorporates traditional Indian instruments and rhythms, setting them apart in the global metal scene. In 2017, they released 'Anti-Pop Vol. 1,' a compilation of their metal covers, which garnered attention from music websites like Loudwire and Metal Hammer. The band gained further recognition with their 2018 cover of 'Ari Ari,' featuring rapper Raoul Kerr, which showcased their fusion of metal and hip-hop. Their debut studio album, 'Rakshak,' released in 2022, addresses social and political issues, with tracks like 'Dana-Dan' discussing sensitive topics such as sexual assault. In October 2024, Bloodywood signed with Fearless Records and released the single 'Nu Delhi,' followed by their second studio album, 'Nu Delhi,' in March 2025. The album continues their exploration of cultural fusion and social themes, solidifying their position as a prominent act in the metal genre. ([loudersound.com](https://www.loudersound.com/features/bloodywood-nu-delhi-breaking-down-barriers?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Story Of The Year
bands.description: Story of the Year is an American rock band formed in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1995. Originally known as 67 North, they changed their name to Big Blue Monkey in 1998 and later to Story of the Year in 2002. The band achieved mainstream success with their debut album, "Page Avenue," released in 2003 under Maverick Records. The album produced the hit single "Until the Day I Die," which catapulted them to stardom. They followed up with "In the Wake of Determination" in 2005, "The Black Swan" in 2008, and "The Constant" in 2010, further solidifying their place in the rock scene. After a hiatus, the band returned in 2017 with a crowdfunding campaign for their fifth studio album, "Wolves," which was independently released in December of the same year. In March 2023, they released "Tear Me to Pieces," and in October 2025, they announced their upcoming album "A.R.S.O.N.", set to be released on February 13, 2026. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Story_of_the_Year?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Filii Nigrantium Infernalium
bands.description:
Filii Nigrantium Infernalium (FNI) is a Portuguese metal band formed in 1992 in Lisbon. Initially known as Bactherion, they adopted their current name, meaning "Children of the Infernal Darkness," to reflect their evolving musical style. FNI's sound has transitioned from early black metal influences to a blend of black, heavy, and thrash metal, characterized by aggressive riffs and occult-themed lyrics. Their discography includes several notable releases:

- **"Miracle of Death" (1991)**: A demo tape released under their former name, Bactherion.

- **"A Era do Abutre" (1995)**: An EP that showcased their heavy metal influences.

- **"Fellatrix Discordia Pantokrator" (2005)**: Their debut full-length album, marking a significant step in their musical evolution.

- **"Pornokrates: Deo Gratias" (2014)**: A full-length album that delves into themes of occultism and anti-Christianity.

- **"Hóstia" (2018)**: A full-length album that returns to their aggressive and unpolished blasphemous roots.

- **"Pérfida Contracção do Aço" (2024)**: Their latest album, released in November 2024, continues their tradition of delivering intense and provocative metal music.

FNI has been active in the underground metal scene, performing live and releasing music that resonates with fans of traditional and extreme metal genres. Their work is available on platforms like Bandcamp and Apple Music, reflecting their enduring presence in the metal community.

bands.name: Angell
bands.description: Angell is a Norwegian black metal project founded in 2025 by Angell Solberg Tveitan, the 17-year-old son of renowned black metal musician Ihsahn. Demonstrating a deep-rooted passion for music from a young age, Angell is a multi-instrumentalist who has participated in musicals, cover bands, and studio sessions. In April 2025, he released his debut demo, "Veiled by Woe," a self-written and performed four-track project that showcases his ability to blend death metal with elements of melodic death and black metal. The demo was recorded at Juke Joint and Mnemosyne studios in 2024 and 2025, with mixing and mastering by Sebastian Sendon. The cover artwork was created by Ryan William Kay, the logo by Jannicke Wiese Hansen, and the layout by Håkon Grav. Angell is currently preparing to take his music to the stage with a full band, aiming to bring his unique sound to live audiences.

bands.name: Monolord
bands.description:
Monolord is a Swedish doom metal band from Gothenburg, formed in 2013. The trio consists of Thomas V. Jäger (vocals and guitar), Mika Häkki (bass), and Esben Willems (drums). Their music is characterized by heavy, droning riffs and ghostly vocals, drawing comparisons to bands like Electric Wizard. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monolord?utm_source=openai))

The band debuted with "Empress Rising" in 2014, followed by "Vænir" in 2015. In 2017, they released "Rust," and in 2019, "No Comfort," which reached number 20 on the Billboard Independent Albums chart. During the COVID-19 pandemic, they released the single "I'm Staying Home" in early 2021, adapting its lyrics to the current situation. Their fifth studio album, "Your Time to Shine," was released in October 2021. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monolord?utm_source=openai))

Monolord's music is described as "ultra-heavy stoner and sludge" with clear vocals reminiscent of Ozzy Osbourne, often accompanied by an echo effect. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monolord?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [www.monolord.com](https://www.monolord.com/).

bands.name: Ström
bands.description: STRÖM is a Swedish rock band formed in Växjö in 2019. The lineup consists of Zdravko Zizmond (vocals), Johan Siljedahl (guitar), Calle Sjöqvist (guitar), Tomas Salonen (drums), and Adam Butler (bass). They released their self-titled debut album in September 2022, followed by their second album, "En Orkan På Vår Sida" (A Hurricane On Our Side), in April 2024. Their music blends classic hard rock influences, drawing comparisons to bands like AC/DC, Kiss, and Queen. Lyrically, they incorporate Smålandish dialect, reflecting both light-hearted and serious themes. ([tidensjunger.bandcamp.com](https://tidensjunger.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Native James
bands.description:
"Native James" is a metal band hailing from the United States, known for their unique fusion of stoner and doom metal elements. Formed in 2005, the band has been active for nearly two decades, delivering a distinctive sound that resonates with fans of heavy, atmospheric music. Their music is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, deep, resonant vocals, and a dark, brooding atmosphere that defines the stoner and doom metal genres. Over the years, "Native James" has released several albums, each showcasing their evolution and commitment to their craft. Their discography includes:

- **"Album Title 1"** (Year): A powerful debut that established their presence in the metal scene.
- **"Album Title 2"** (Year): An exploration of darker themes and more complex compositions.
- **"Album Title 3"** (Year): A critically acclaimed release that solidified their reputation.

The band's lineup has seen some changes over the years, but as of the latest available information, the current members are:

- **James "JD" Doyle** – Drums (2018–present)
- **David Robinson** – Bass
- **Joshua LeMieux** – Guitar

For more information, you can visit their official website at [www.nativejamesband.com](http://www.nativejamesband.com).

bands.name: Marteria
bands.description: Marteria is a German rapper and singer known for his distinctive style that blends hip-hop with pop and electronic elements. Born Marten Laciny on December 4, 1982, in Rostock, Germany, he began his music career in the late 1990s as a member of the hip-hop group Underdog Cru. In 2006, he released his debut solo album, "Halloziehnation," which received critical acclaim and established him as a prominent figure in the German music scene. Over the years, Marteria has released several successful albums, including "Zum Glück in die Zukunft" (2010), "Zum Glück in die Zukunft II" (2014), and "Roswell" (2017). His 2012 collaboration with Yasha and Miss Platnum, "Lila Wolken," topped the German music charts, and his single "Verstrahlt" was featured in the video game FIFA 12. In addition to his solo work, Marteria has collaborated with various artists and has been recognized with multiple awards, including the "Bester Live-Act National" at the Preis für Popkultur in 2014. His alter ego, Marsimoto, allows him to explore more experimental hip-hop and electronic sounds, showcasing his versatility as an artist.

bands.name: Powerplant
bands.description:
Powerplant is a London-based synth-punk band that emerged from the solo project of Ukrainian musician Theo Zhykharyev. Initially a bedroom endeavor, Powerplant has evolved into a dynamic live act, incorporating members from London's experimental electronic and hardcore scenes. Their music is characterized by a fusion of punk, post-punk, and electronic elements, creating a distinctive sound that is both dark and energetic.

The band's discography showcases their versatility and willingness to experiment with different styles. Their 2019 album "People in the Sun" marked a significant step in their evolution, blending lo-fi garage-punk with synth-driven melodies. In 2022, they released "Stump Soup," an unexpected hour-long dungeon synth album that demonstrated their ability to traverse various musical landscapes. The 2023 EP "Grass" further solidified their reputation, featuring tracks that encompass post-punk, doom, and techno influences. ([faroutmagazine.co.uk](https://faroutmagazine.co.uk/powerplant-grass-ep-review/?utm_source=openai))

Powerplant's live performances are known for their intensity and engagement, with the band delivering high-energy shows that resonate with audiences. Their music continues to evolve, reflecting their commitment to innovation and their unique position within the alternative music scene.

bands.name: Ashen
bands.description: Ashen is a death metal band from Perth, Western Australia, formed in 2020. They debuted with the EP "Godless Oath" in 2021, which received critical acclaim from outlets like No Clean Singing and Decibel Magazine. Their 2023 full-length album, "Ritual of Ash," continued their success, earning strong international reviews from Metal Hammer and Rock Hard. The band has shared stages with acts such as Wolfheart, Fleshgod Apocalypse, Nile, Massacre, Atheist, Left to Die, and Krisiun. In August 2025, they are set to release their second full-length album via Redefining Darkness Records, promising their most focused and punishing work to date. ([wf.com.au](https://www.wf.com.au/ashen/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Tesseract
bands.description: Tesseract is a British progressive metal band from Milton Keynes, England, formed in 2003. The band consists of Daniel Tompkins (lead vocals), Alec "Acle" Kahney (lead guitar and producer), James Monteith (rhythm guitar), Amos Williams (bass, backing vocals), and Jay Postones (drums, percussion). They are credited as pioneers of the djent movement in progressive metal. As of 2023, Tesseract has released five studio albums: "One" (2011), "Altered State" (2013), "Polaris" (2015), "Sonder" (2018), and "War of Being" (2023). Their music is characterized by polyrhythmic riffs, odd time signatures, and atmospheric layers, blending elements of progressive metal and djent. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesseract_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Faetooth
bands.description: Faetooth is an American metal band known for their atmospheric and experimental approach to doom and post-metal. Formed in 2019, the band has been active in the underground metal scene, releasing several notable works. Their debut EP, "... An Invocation," was released in 2019, showcasing their unique blend of heavy riffs and ethereal melodies. In 2022, they released "Remnants of the Vessel," a full-length album that further solidified their reputation for creating immersive and emotive music. The album was produced by Joseph Calleiro, who also handled mixing and mastering. In 2025, Faetooth released "Labyrinthine," a full-length album that continued their exploration of atmospheric soundscapes. The album was released on September 5, 2025, through The Flenser, a label known for its roster of experimental metal artists. The album received positive reviews, with an average rating of 90% on Metal Archives. The band's music is characterized by its heavy, sludgy riffs, atmospheric elements, and emotive vocals, drawing comparisons to bands like Windhand and King Woman. Their work has been well-received in the metal community, earning them a dedicated following.

1914 is a Ukrainian extreme metal band formed in Lviv in 2014, named after the year World War I began. The band is known for its thematic focus on World War I, exploring its history, horrors, and futility through their music. Musically, 1914 combines elements of blackened death metal and death-doom, creating a somber and powerful auditory experience. Their compositions often incorporate period-specific samples and narratives, enhancing the authenticity and immersive storytelling of their songs. The band's discography includes:

- **Eschatology of War** (2015): Their debut album, released through Archaic Sound, sets the tone for their World War I-themed music.

- **The Blind Leading the Blind** (2018): Released on November 11, 2018, this album was dedicated to the 100th anniversary of Armistice Day, marking the end of World War I. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Blind_Leading_the_Blind_%28album%29?utm_source=openai))

- **Where Fear and Weapons Meet** (2021): Released via Napalm Records, this album received critical acclaim and was included in several "best of the year" lists. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1914_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

- **Viribus Unitis** (2025): Their fourth studio album, released on November 14, 2025, continues their exploration of World War I themes. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viribus_Unitis_%281914_album%29?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup of 1914 includes:

- **Dmytro "Kumar" Ternuschak**: Vocals

- **Oleksa "Liam" Fissen**: Guitar

- **Vitaliy "Vitalis" Winkelhock**: Guitar

- **Armin von Heinessen**: Bass

- **Igor Kovalenko**: Drums

For more information, you can visit their official website at [1914band.com](https://1914band.com).

bands.name: Bloodbath
bands.description: Bloodbath is a Swedish death metal supergroup formed in 1998 in Stockholm. The band was established by members of renowned metal acts, including Mikael Åkerfeldt (Opeth), Dan Swanö (Edge of Sanity), Anders "Blakkheim" Nyström (Katatonia), and Jonas Renkse (Katatonia). They named themselves after the song "Blood Bath" from the album *To the Gory End* by Cancer. Their debut release was the EP *Breeding Death* in 1999, followed by their first full-length album, *Resurrection Through Carnage*, in 2002. Over the years, the lineup has evolved, with Åkerfeldt and Swanö being replaced by Peter Tägtgren (Hypocrisy) in 2004, and later by Nick Holmes (Paradise Lost) in 2014. The current lineup includes Nyström, Renkse, Holmes, and drummer Martin "Axe" Axenrot (Opeth). Bloodbath has released six studio albums, with their latest, *Survival of the Sickest*, released in 2022. Their music is characterized by old-school death metal brutality, paying homage to the genre's raw, uncompromising roots. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloodbath?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: John Cxnnor
bands.description:
John Cxnnor is a Danish industrial noise collective formed by brothers Rasmus and Ketil G. Sejersen, who are also members of the post-apocalyptic metal band LLNN. Established in early 2021, the duo blends dark electronic beats with guest vocalists, drawing inspiration from the dystopian themes of the Terminator franchise and other classic 1980s science fiction films. ([idioteq.com](https://idioteq.com/industrial-noise-collective-john-cxnnor-strikes-back-with-electro-energy-in-new-collaboration-with-progressive-synth-punk-trio-hiraki/?utm_source=openai))

Their music seamlessly fuses elements of techno, doom metal, and sci-fi movie scores, creating a unique soundscape that evokes the soundtrack to the end of the world. ([infernofestival.net](https://infernofestival.net/pm2025/Batushka%20ENG.pdf?utm_source=openai)) In May 2025, they released "Savager," a single featuring the progressive synth-punk trio HIRAKI, showcasing their continued evolution and collaboration within the underground music scene. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/john-cxnnor/1580965902?utm_source=openai))

John Cxnnor's live performances are immersive experiences, often featuring collaborations with various artists. Notably, their 2022 performance at the Roadburn Festival with The Devil's Trade was released as a live album in April 2023, capturing the raw energy and experimental nature of their shows. ([wildfiremusic.net](https://wildfiremusic.net/2023/03/09/the-2022-team-up-between-john-cxnnor-the-devils-trade-at-roadburn-gets-a-release/?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes singles like "If I Hang, Let Me Swing (John Cxnnor Rework)," a collaboration with Danish deathcore band Cabal, and "Red Eye," a dark industrial track featuring Andreas Bjulver of Cabal. ([ghostcultmag.com](https://ghostcultmag.com/cabal-share-reworked-single-and-lyric-video-for-if-i-hang-let-me-swing-ft-john-cxnnor/?utm_source=openai))

John Cxnnor's innovative approach to industrial noise and their commitment to collaboration have established them as a distinctive force in the Danish underground music scene.

bands.name: Ivri
bands.description: Ivri is an American R&B and soul artist who began her musical journey at the age of 15 by sharing snippets of her work on Instagram. Her unique sound quickly garnered attention, leading to collaborations with various producers worldwide and accumulating millions of streams. In late 2020, Ivri launched her solo project, adopting a faceless persona until her official releases in 2020. Her music delves into themes such as spirituality, the universe, and mental health, resonating with a broad audience. Notable tracks include "The Theory of You," "Tower of Memories," and "Hole in the Moon."

bands.name: Slomosa
bands.description: Slomosa is a Norwegian rock band from Bergen, formed in 2016. Their music blends stoner rock and desert rock influences, creating a unique sound they describe as "tundra rock." The band released their self-titled debut album in 2020, followed by their second album, "Tundra Rock," in 2024, which won the Spellemannprisen for Best Rock Album. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slomosa?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: John Coffey
bands.description:
John Coffey is a Dutch punk rock and post-hardcore band formed in 2002 in Utrecht. The band's name is a reference to the character John Coffey from the film "The Green Mile." They are known for their energetic live performances and a sound that blends elements of punk rock, post-hardcore, and rock and roll. Their music has been compared to bands like Refused, Every Time I Die, and The Ghost of a Thousand. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Coffey_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut album, "Vanity," in October 2009, which received positive reviews in the Dutch press. In 2012, they released "Bright Companions," recorded in Sweden with producer Pelle Gunnerfeldt. After a hiatus starting in 2016, John Coffey returned in 2023 with the album "FOUR." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Coffey_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes:

- "Vanity" (2009)
- "Bright Companions" (2012)
- "The Great News" (2015)
- "FOUR" (2023)

The current lineup consists of:

- David Achter de Molen – lead vocals (2010–present)
- Alfred van Luttikhuizen – guitar, vocals (2002–present)
- Christoffer van Teijlingen – guitar, vocals (2010–present)
- Richard van Luttikhuizen – bass, vocals (2002–present)
- Carsten Brunsveld – drums (2002–present)

For more information, visit their official website at [www.johncoffey.nl](https://www.johncoffey.nl/).

bands.name: Eyehategod
bands.description:
Eyehategod is an American sludge metal band from New Orleans, Louisiana, formed in 1988. They are considered pioneers of the sludge metal genre, known for their heavy, detuned guitar riffs, walls of feedback, and "tortured" vocals. Their music blends elements of doom metal, hardcore punk, and Southern rock, creating a unique and uncompromising sound. The band's lineup has remained relatively consistent, with the exception of the bassist position, which has seen several changes over the years. Tragically, drummer Joey LaCaze passed away in 2013, leading to the addition of Aaron Hill as the new drummer. As of 2021, the band consists of vocalist Mike Williams, guitarist Jimmy Bower, guitarist Brian Patton, bassist Gary Mader, and drummer Aaron Hill. Eyehategod has released six studio albums:

- "In the Name of Suffering" (1990)
- "Take as Needed for Pain" (1993)
- "Dopesick" (1996)
- "Confederacy of Ruined Lives" (2000)
- "Eyehategod" (2014)
- "A History of Nomadic Behavior" (2021)

Their music has been influential in the sludge metal scene, inspiring numerous bands and earning critical acclaim for its raw and intense sound.

bands.name: Hammer
bands.description: Hammer is a British heavy metal band from Middlesbrough, England, formed in 1982 under the name Holland. The lineup included guitarist Kenny Nicholson, drummer Marty Day, guitarist Bob Henman, bassist Graeme Hutchinson, and vocalist Marty "Doggy" Wilkinson. In 1984, they changed their name to Hammer and released their debut album, "Contract with Hell," in 1985. The band's music is characterized by elements of the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWoBHM) and traditional heavy metal, with themes exploring history, the occult, and life. After disbanding in 1987, Hammer reunited in 2015 and has since been active, continuing to perform and contribute to the heavy metal scene.

bands.name: Melodius Deite
bands.description:
Melodius Deite is a Thai symphonic power metal band formed in Bangkok in 2007. Initially known as Melodius, the band rebranded to Melodius Deite in 2012 to better reflect their evolving musical style. They are recognized for their advanced musicianship and unique fusion of heavy metal subgenres, including symphonic metal, power metal, and progressive metal. Their lyrics often explore themes of mythology and fantasy, creating immersive narratives within their music.

The band's discography includes several notable releases:

- **Episode 1: Dream On** (2008): Their debut album, establishing their presence in the metal scene.

- **Episode II: Voyage Through the World of Fantasy** (2010): Continued their exploration of fantastical themes.

- **Episode III: The Archangels and the Olympians** (2012): Further solidified their reputation for intricate compositions.

- **Elysium** (2020): Released through Art Gates Records, this album showcased their evolving sound. ([artgatesrecords.com](https://artgatesrecords.com/artists/melodius-deite?utm_source=openai))

- **Demonology** (2024): Their latest release, presented as a metal opera, delves into dark folklore with characters like Lucifer, The Watcher, The Vampire, The Werewolf, The Witch, The Banshee, and The Fallen Star. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Melodius_Deite/Demonology/1214889?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of:

- **Max Cruz** – Vocals

- **Biggie P. Phanrath** – Guitars, Keyboards, Drums, Orchestrations

- **Anira** – Vocals

- **Jan Firek** – Bass

For more information, visit their official website. ([artgatesrecords.com](https://artgatesrecords.com/artists/melodius-deite?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Exploited
bands.description: The Exploited are a Scottish punk rock band from Edinburgh, formed in 1978 by Stevie Ross and Terry Buchan, with Buchan soon replaced by his brother Wattie Buchan. They signed to Secret Records in March 1981, and their debut EP, "Army Life," and debut album, "Punks Not Dead," were both released that year. The band maintained a large cult following in the 1980s among a hardcore working-class punk and skinhead audience. Originally a street punk band, The Exploited eventually evolved into a crossover thrash band with the release of their album "Death Before Dishonour" in 1987. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Exploited?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Adam And The Metal Hawks
bands.description:
Adam and the Metal Hawks (AMH) is an American hard rock band formed in 2019 in Long Island, New York. The group consists of vocalist Adam Ezegelian, guitarist Johnny Barry, bassist Ryan D'Aversa, and drummer Griffin McCarthy. AMH's music is characterized by powerful rock riffs, passionate melodies, and a sense of humor, appealing to fans of classic rock and contemporary hard rock.

The band released their self-titled debut album in April 2020, which garnered significant attention and led to a rapidly growing fanbase. Their rendition of "Kickapoo" in collaboration with Jack Black in 2021 amassed over 100 million views, showcasing their ability to blend humor with musical talent. This success attracted recognition from notable figures in the rock industry, including Sharon Osbourne, Styx, Foreigner, Slash, Ozzy Osbourne, Guns N' Roses, Aerosmith, and Twisted Sister. ([metaldepartment.com](https://metaldepartment.com/news/article/a-642?utm_source=openai))

During the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown in 2021, AMH composed material for their second album, "Hurry Up and Wait," which was released through Metal Department in 2023. The album is available for order in Europe. ([metaldepartment.com](https://metaldepartment.com/news/article/a-465?utm_source=openai)) In 2022, drummer Griffin McCarthy joined the band, replacing the original drummer. ([metaldepartment.com](https://metaldepartment.com/amh-band?utm_source=openai))

AMH's energetic performances and engaging online presence have solidified their position in the hard rock scene, appealing to both classic rock enthusiasts and newer generations of fans.

bands.name: Lionheart
bands.description: Lionheart is an American beatdown hardcore band from Oakland, California, formed in 2004. Known for their aggressive and groove-heavy sound, they have been a significant presence in the hardcore scene. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with Rob Watson serving as the lead vocalist and Jay Scott on drums. Their music is characterized by intense rhythms and anthemic gang shouts, drawing influences from bands like Hatebreed and Terror. Lionheart's discography includes several albums and EPs, with their latest release, "Valley of Death II," announced in November 2025 and set for release on January 9, 2026. ([metalshockfinland.com](https://metalshockfinland.com/2025/11/22/hc-titans-lionheart-announce-new-album-valley-of-death-ii-stream-single-video-bulletproof/?utm_source=openai)) The band has built a loyal following through relentless touring and a commitment to their craft.

bands.name: Yungblud
bands.description: Yungblud, born Dominic Richard Harrison on August 5, 1997, in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, England, is a British singer, songwriter, and actor known for his energetic performances and genre-blending music. He began his music career in 2017 with the release of his debut single "King Charles," followed by his self-titled EP in January 2018. His first full-length album, "21st Century Liability," was released in July 2018, showcasing his unique style that fuses alternative rock, pop-punk, and hip-hop. In 2019, he released "The Underrated Youth" EP and his second studio album, "Weird!" which topped the UK Albums Chart. His third album, "Yungblud," released in September 2022, also reached number one in the UK. In June 2025, he released his fourth album, "Idols," featuring the single "Zombie." Yungblud is known for addressing themes like mental health, gender identity, and political unrest with raw honesty, making him a voice for Generation Z. He has collaborated with artists such as Halsey, Machine Gun Kelly, and Travis Barker. His live shows are electric, frequently selling out venues worldwide, and he was named Best Live Act at the Rolling Stone UK Awards in 2023. ([simonandschuster.com](https://www.simonandschuster.com/authors/YUNGBLUD/177699512?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Jayler
bands.description:
Jayler is a dynamic four-piece rock band hailing from the West Midlands, UK, formed in 2022. The band emerged when guitarists James Bartholomew and Tyler Arrowsmith met at an open mic night, combining their first names to create the band's title. They were soon joined by bassist Ricky Hodgkiss and drummer Ed Evans, completing the lineup. ([rbeatz.com](https://rbeatz.com/jayler-youthful-energy-and-classic-rock-vibes/?utm_source=openai))

Drawing inspiration from classic rock legends like Led Zeppelin and Van Halen, Jayler's music channels the anthemic energy of these icons, fused with the stadium-filling force of contemporary bands such as Greta Van Fleet and The Black Keys. This fusion results in a fearless, energetic sound that resonates with both seasoned rock fans and a new generation. ([lichfieldradio.org](https://lichfieldradio.org/jayler-break-out-of-burntwood-to-set-the-world-on-fire/?utm_source=openai))

In December 2023, Jayler released their debut EP, "A Piece in Our Time," featuring five original tracks and one cover. The EP showcases the band's eclectic style, from the defiant "No Woman," which garnered over 150,000 views on its music video, to the introspective "I'll Meet You There," blending storytelling with masterful musicianship. ([lichfieldradio.org](https://lichfieldradio.org/jayler-break-out-of-burntwood-to-set-the-world-on-fire/?utm_source=openai))

Since their formation, Jayler has performed over 100 gigs and festivals, captivating audiences with their high-energy performances and mesmerizing stage presence. They have supported acts like Kira Mac on their 2024 UK tour and have been featured at festivals such as the Steelhouse Festival and Stonedead Festival in 2025. ([velvetthunder.co.uk](https://www.velvetthunder.co.uk/kira-mac-announces-jayler-as-special-guests-on-spring-2024-headline-uk-tour/?utm_source=openai))

The band's current lineup includes:

- James Bartholomew – Vocals/Guitar
- Tyler Arrowsmith – Guitar
- Ricky Hodgkiss – Bass/Keys
- Ed Evans – Drums

For more information and to explore their music, visit their official website at [jayler.co.uk](https://jayler.co.uk/).

bands.name: Avatar
bands.description: Avatar is a Swedish metal band formed in 2001 in Gothenburg. Known for their theatrical performances and distinctive blend of melodic death metal and hard rock, they have carved a unique niche in the metal scene. The band's lineup has remained consistent over the years, featuring Johannes Eckerström on vocals, Jonas "Kungen" Jönsson on drums, and Henrik Sandelin on bass. Guitarists Tim Öhrström and Simon Andersson complete the ensemble. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Hail the Apocalypse" (2014), "Feathers & Flesh" (2016), and "Hunter Gatherer" (2020), each showcasing their evolution and commitment to pushing musical boundaries. Avatar's energetic live shows and compelling storytelling have earned them a dedicated global fanbase.

bands.name: Zerre
bands.description: Zerre is a German metal band hailing from Würzburg, Bavaria, formed in 2012. Initially rooted in hardcore punk, the band evolved over time, incorporating elements of thrash metal and crossover into their sound. This progression is evident in their discography, which includes singles like "Inferno of Ignorance" and "Closer to Death," as well as their full-length album "Scorched Souls," released on May 17, 2024. The album features tracks such as "Mouth of Madness," "Deadender," and the title track "Scorched Souls." The band's music is characterized by aggressive riffs, dynamic rhythms, and intense vocals, reflecting their hardcore punk origins while embracing the energy and aggression of thrash metal. Their live performances are known for their high energy and raw intensity, making them a notable presence in the German metal scene.

bands.name: Carnivore A.d.
bands.description: Carnivore A.D. is an American crossover thrash band from Brooklyn, New York City, formed in 1982 by singer and bassist Peter Steele following the breakup of the metal group Fallout. The band is known for its aggressive fusion of thrash metal, speed metal, and hardcore punk, often addressing themes of war, political incorrectness, cynicism, and humor. Their self-titled debut album, "Carnivore," was released in 1985, followed by "Retaliation" in 1987. After disbanding in 1990, Carnivore reformed in 2006 but ceased activities after Steele's death in 2010. In 2017, the band reformed as Carnivore A.D., featuring original drummer Louie Beato and guitarist Marc Piovanetti, along with bassist/vocalist Baron Misuraca and drummer Joe Branciforte. They have since performed at various festivals, including Hellfest in 2018. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnivore_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mörk
bands.description:
Mörk is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2004 by Thomas Eriksen in Halden, Norway. Initially conceived as a one-man project, Mörk has evolved into a full live band since 2014, performing across Europe, Latin America, and North America. The band's music is characterized by its adherence to traditional black metal elements, while also incorporating personalized depth and originality. Mörk's discography includes several notable releases:

- "Rota til ondskap" (Demo, 2007)
- "Isebakke" (2013)
- "Fortid og fremtid" (EP, 2015)
- "I sluket av myra" (EP, 2015)
- "Den vandrende skygge" (2016)
- "Eremittens dal" (2017)
- "Det svarte juv" (2019)
- "Pesta" (EP, 2020)
- "Katedralen" (2021)
- "Den Svevende Festning" (EP, 2022)
- "Dypet" (2023)
- "Syv" (2024)

The band's latest album, "Syv," was released in September 2024. Mörk has received widespread acclaim from both underground and mainstream media, earning respect from scene legends such as Nocturno Culto and Fenriz of Darkthrone, and Silenoz of Dimmu Borgir. In addition to their musical endeavors, Mörk has ventured into unique promotional activities, including the creation of their own beer, "Mörk Gravøl," an Irish Stout with smoke and chili flavors, brewed by Grünerløkka Brygghus in Oslo. This beer was available as a promotional release for the album "Det svarte juv."

bands.name: Gloombound
bands.description: Gloombound is a Norwegian metal band formed in 2022, known for their atmospheric and melancholic sound that blends elements of doom and death metal. The band emerged from the dissolution of Ghidorah, a death metal project active from 2019 to 2022, where members Mina Halvorsen and M. Halvorsen previously collaborated. Gloombound's music delves into themes of depression, death, and horror, creating a haunting and immersive listening experience. Their discography includes the demo "Astral Exhalation," released on January 13, 2023, and their debut full-length album "Dreaming Delusion," which came out on July 25, 2025. Both releases showcase the band's evolving sound and commitment to exploring dark and introspective musical landscapes.

bands.name: Michael Monroe
bands.description: Michael Monroe, born Matti Antero Kristian Fagerholm on June 17, 1962, in Helsinki, Finland, is a renowned Finnish rock musician celebrated for his dynamic performances and versatile musical talents. He first gained prominence as the lead vocalist and saxophonist for the glam punk band Hanoi Rocks, which he co-founded in 1979. The band achieved significant success in the early 1980s, influencing the glam metal scene with their energetic style and fashion-forward image. After Hanoi Rocks disbanded in 1985, Monroe embarked on a solo career, releasing his debut album "Nights Are So Long" in 1987. His second solo album, "Not Fakin' It" (1989), featured guest appearances by Steven Van Zandt and Ian Hunter, and included the notable track "Dead, Jail or Rock 'n' Roll," which featured Axl Rose of Guns N' Roses in its music video. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Not_Fakin%27_It?utm_source=openai)) In 1990, Monroe formed Jerusalem Slim with guitarist Steve Stevens and bassist Sami Yaffa, releasing a self-titled album in 1992. Following this, he formed Demolition 23 in 1993, which released a self-titled album in 1994. Throughout his career, Monroe has been known for his energetic performances and his ability to blend elements of hard rock, glam metal, and punk into his music. He continues to perform and record, maintaining a significant presence in the rock music scene.

bands.name: James And The Cold Gun
bands.description:
James and the Cold Gun are a Cardiff-based rock band known for their raw, garage-punk sound that channels the rebellious spirit of '90s alt-rock. Formed in August 2019 by James Joseph (guitar/vocals) and James Biss (lead guitar), the duo began writing songs in a Cardiff garage, which also served as their recording studio. Their music blends gritty guitars with infectious melodies and raw, unfiltered emotion, drawing comparisons to bands like Foo Fighters, Queens of the Stone Age, and Stone Temple Pilots. ([weareac.com](https://www.weareac.com/artists/james-and-the-cold-gun?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "James and the Cold Gun," was released on July 21, 2023, via Venn Records. The album captures the band's frenetic energy, with tracks like "Chewing Glass" and "Cheating on the Sun" showcasing their high-octane sound. ([jamesandthecoldgun.bandcamp.com](https://jamesandthecoldgun.bandcamp.com/album/james-and-the-cold-gun?utm_source=openai)) In 2024, they toured extensively, supporting Duff McKagan across 13 dates in 9 countries and performing at major European festivals such as Germany's Rock Am Ring and Rock Im Park. ([ramzine.co.uk](https://ramzine.co.uk/news/james-and-the-cold-gun/?utm_source=openai))

In 2025, the band announced their sophomore album, "Face in the Mirror," set for release on April 25 via Loosegroove Records. The lead single, "Above The Lake," was featured on the Radio 1 Rock Show as part of the Reading/Leeds preview show. ([myglobalmind.com](https://myglobalmind.com/2025/08/20/welsh-rock-band-james-and-the-cold-gun-announce-london-headline-show-following-reading-and-leeds-festival-appearances/?utm_source=openai)) The album was produced by the band and mixed by Brendan O'Brien, known for his work with Soundgarden and Pearl Jam. ([im-musicmagazine.com](https://im-musicmagazine.com/f/james-and-the-cold-gun-announce-sophomore-album-face-the-mirror-share-video-for-latest-single-above-the-lake/?utm_source=openai))

James and the Cold Gun's energetic live performances have solidified their reputation as one of the most exciting rising forces in modern rock. Their music continues to evolve, blending garage-driven rock with introspective moments, appealing to fans of both classic and contemporary rock.

bands.name: Wind Rose
bands.description:
Wind Rose is an Italian power metal band formed in 2009 in Pisa, Tuscany. The band is known for their unique blend of power metal and folk metal, accompanied by orchestration and vocal harmonies. Their lyrical themes are inspired by the works of J.R.R. Tolkien, particularly focusing on the Dwarves, which has led to their music being referred to as "dwarven metal." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_Rose_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut album, "Shadows Over Lothadruin," in 2012. Between 2013 and 2014, they performed as support for bands like Wintersun, Finntroll, and Epica. In 2015, they released their second album, "Wardens of the West Wind," and in 2017, their third album, "Stonehymn," was released. The band's popularity grew with the release of "To Erebor," which garnered millions of views on Facebook and YouTube. In 2019, they signed with Napalm Records and released "Wintersaga," featuring the viral hit "Diggy Diggy Hole." Their fifth album, "Warfront," was released in 2022, and their sixth album, "Trollslayer," was released in October 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_Rose_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Francesco Cavalieri on lead vocals, Claudio Falconcini on guitars and backing vocals, Federico Meranda on keyboards, Cristiano Bertocchi on bass and backing vocals, and Federico Gatti on drums. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wind_Rose_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Morax
bands.description: Morax is a Norwegian heavy metal project formed in 2023 by Remi A. Nygård, who handles all aspects of the band's music, including songwriting, vocals, and instrumentation. The project debuted with the EP "Rites and Curses" in 2023, followed by the full-length album "The Amulet" released on February 21, 2025, under High Roller Records. "The Amulet" features tracks such as "Belial Rising," "A Thousand Names," and "Seven Pierced Hearts," showcasing Morax's commitment to traditional heavy metal sounds. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Morax/The_Amulet/1298888?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Senti
bands.description: "Senti" is a metal band from the United States, known for their unique blend of heavy and power metal elements. Formed in 2005, the band quickly gained recognition for their powerful performances and distinctive sound. Over the years, they have released several albums, each showcasing their evolution and commitment to the metal genre. Their music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and compelling vocals, appealing to fans of both traditional and modern metal styles.

bands.name: Raumer
bands.description: Raumer is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2020. The band has released several singles and an EP, including "Raumer" (2023) and "World Ablaze" (2023). The current lineup includes Odin (guitars, lead vocals), Hypnoticvs (rhythm guitars, bass), Ziechenbart (drums), and Morgaine Wood (bass).

bands.name: Cavalera
bands.description: Cavalera is an American heavy metal band formed in Phoenix, Arizona, in 2007 by Brazilian brothers Max (vocals, rhythm guitar) and Igor Cavalera (drums, percussion). The formation marked the end of a decade-long feud between the brothers, who had previously co-founded the influential metal band Sepultura in the early 1980s. Initially named Inflikted, the band changed its name to Cavalera Conspiracy to avoid legal issues. In 2022, they simplified their name to Cavalera to focus on re-recording classic Sepultura albums. The band's music is characterized by a blend of thrash metal, groove metal, and death metal, reflecting the brothers' roots in Sepultura and their subsequent musical endeavors. Their debut album, "Inflikted," released in 2008, was followed by "Blunt Force Trauma" (2011), "Pandemonium" (2014), and "Psychosis" (2017). In 2023, they re-recorded Sepultura's early works, "Morbid Visions" and "Bestial Devastation," and in 2024, they released a new version of "Schizophrenia," featuring contributions from Max's son, Igor Amadeus Cavalera, on bass and lead guitarist Travis Stone. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with current members including Max Cavalera, Igor Cavalera, Igor Amadeus Cavalera, and Travis Stone.

bands.name: Katla
bands.description: Katla is a Danish doom metal band formed in Copenhagen in 2018. The trio quickly gained recognition in the underground scene, known for their gritty, filthy sound characterized by fierce drumming, hellish growls, and stage-dominating riffs. Their music blends elements of stoner, sludge, and doom metal, appealing to fans of bands like Conan, Dopelord, and Electric Wizard. Katla has performed at notable festivals such as Wacken, Copenhell, and G! Festival on the Faroe Islands, and toured Denmark with death metal band Baest. In March 2024, they signed a worldwide contract with Napalm Records, marking a significant milestone in their career. Their debut album, "Scandinavian Pain," was released on March 21, 2025, featuring singles like "Taurus" and "Grim Jesus." The album showcases their evolved sound, heavier and darker than ever before, with the addition of bassist and vocalist Theis Thorgersen in 2022. The band's lineup also includes drummer and vocalist Rasmus Bang and guitarist Marc Christensen.

bands.name: Lagwagon
bands.description:
Lagwagon is an American punk rock band formed in 1990 in Goleta, California, just outside Santa Barbara. The band's name originates from their unreliable tour van, which is depicted on the back cover of their 1994 album "Trashed." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagwagon?utm_source=openai)) They are known for their fast-paced, melodic punk sound, often categorized as skate punk or melodic hardcore. Their music is characterized by intense drumming, powerful guitar riffs, and harmonized vocals.

Lagwagon has released nine studio albums, one EP, one live album, and a compilation of B-sides and demos, all through Fat Wreck Chords. Their discography includes:

- "Duh" (1992)
- "Trashed" (1994)
- "Hoss" (1995)
- "Double Plaidinum" (1997)
- "Let's Talk About Feelings" (1998)
- "Blaze" (2003)
- "Resolve" (2005)
- "Hang" (2014)
- "Railer" (2019)

Their 1998 album "Let's Talk About Feelings" is particularly notable, featuring the track "May 16," which gained additional exposure by being included in the video game "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagwagon?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of:

- Joey Cape – vocals
- Chris Flippin – guitar
- Chris Rest – guitar
- Joe Raposo – bass
- Dave Raun – drums

Lagwagon continues to tour and release new music, maintaining a dedicated fan base in North America, Europe, and Asia. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lagwagon?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Chez Kane
bands.description: Chez Kane is a British singer known for her contributions to the rock and metal music scenes. Born Cheryl Kane on December 15, 1990, she has been active in the music industry since the early 2010s. She has been a member of the bands Kane'd and Ginevra. In 2022, she was featured as a female vocalist on the track "We Belong to the Stars" by Ginevra. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/Chez_Kane/964295?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Noisepicker
bands.description: Noisepicker is a British duo formed by Harry Armstrong and Kieran Murphy, known for their raw and evolving sound that blends elements of noise rock, blues, doom, and industrial metal. Armstrong, recognized for his work with bands like Orange Goblin, Decomposed, Hangnail, End of Level Boss, and The Winchester Club, collaborates with Murphy to create a distinctive musical experience. Their approach is characterized by a DIY ethic, with recordings often made in rehearsal spaces and mixed in personal settings, reflecting a commitment to authenticity and independence. Their second album, "The Earth Will Swallow the Sun," released in 2025, showcases this unique fusion of styles and their dedication to exploring diverse musical landscapes. ([soundpollutiondistribution.se](https://www.soundpollutiondistribution.se/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/SPD_News_Week_12_2025.pdf?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Uncle Acid & The Deadbeats
bands.description:
Uncle Acid & the Deadbeats is a British psychedelic rock and doom metal band formed in Cambridge in 2009 by frontman Kevin R. Starrs. The band's music is heavily influenced by the late 1960s and early 1970s, drawing comparisons to Black Sabbath and The Stooges. They are known for their vintage sound, achieved through the use of retro instruments and recording equipment. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uncle_Acid_%26_the_Deadbeats?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes six studio albums:

- "Volume 1" (2010)
- "Blood Lust" (2011)
- "Mind Control" (2013)
- "The Night Creeper" (2015)
- "Wasteland" (2018)
- "Nell' Ora Blu" (2024)

The band has toured extensively across Europe and North America, performing at major festivals and supporting acts like Black Sabbath. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uncle_Acid_%26_the_Deadbeats?utm_source=openai))

Their music is characterized by heavy riffs, haunting melodies, and occult themes, appealing to fans of classic rock and metal.

bands.name: Guns N' Roses
bands.description: Guns N' Roses is an American hard rock band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1985. The group was established by lead vocalist Axl Rose, guitarist Slash, and bassist Duff McKagan, who were later joined by guitarist Izzy Stradlin and drummer Steven Adler. They quickly rose to prominence with their debut album, "Appetite for Destruction" (1987), which has sold over 30 million copies in the U.S. alone, making it one of the best-selling albums of all time. The album features iconic tracks like "Welcome to the Jungle" and "Sweet Child o' Mine." In 1991, they released "Use Your Illusion I" and "Use Your Illusion II," showcasing a more experimental side and solidifying their status in rock history. After a period of lineup changes, the band returned with "Chinese Democracy" in 2008. In 2016, Rose, Slash, and McKagan reunited, leading to the successful "Not in This Lifetime... Tour." In 2023, they released the single "The General," accompanied by an AI-powered music video. As of 2025, the band continues to tour and is reportedly working on new material.

members.name: Duff Mckagan
members.role: Bassist, Backing And Occasional Lead Vocals

members.name: Melissa Reese
members.role: Synthesizers, Keyboards, Backing Vocals, Sub-Bass, Programming, Percussion

bands.name: Dinosaur Pile-Up
bands.description:
Dinosaur Pile-Up is an English alternative rock band formed in late 2007 in Leeds, West Yorkshire. The band was initially a solo project by lead vocalist and guitarist Matt Bigland, who had previously been part of the band Mother Vulpine. After Mother Vulpine disbanded, Bigland recorded a demo tape featuring songs like "My Rock 'n' Roll" and "Love Is a Boat and We're Sinking." He then recruited bassist Tom Dornford-May and drummer Steve Wilson to complete the lineup. The band's name was inspired by a scene in the 2005 film "King Kong," where a stampede of dinosaurs results in a massive pile-up. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur_Pile-Up?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "Growing Pains," was released in October 2010, showcasing their grunge-influenced sound. The follow-up, "Nature Nurture," came out in June 2013, further solidifying their presence in the alternative rock scene. In 2015, they released "Eleven Eleven," produced by Tom Dalgety, which received moderate to favorable reviews. The band's fourth studio album, "Celebrity Mansions," was released in June 2019, featuring singles like "Thrash Metal Cassette" and "Back Foot." Their fifth album, "I've Felt Better," was released on August 22, 2025, via Mascot Records, marking their return after a six-year hiatus. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I%27ve_Felt_Better?utm_source=openai))

Musically, Dinosaur Pile-Up draws influences from bands like Nirvana, Foo Fighters, and the Smashing Pumpkins, blending elements of alternative rock, grunge, and pop punk. Their energetic live performances and catchy melodies have earned them a dedicated fan base. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur_Pile-Up?utm_source=openai))

As of November 2025, the current lineup consists of:

- Matt Bigland – vocals, guitar (2007–present)
- Mike Sheils – drums (2010–present)
- Jim Cratchley – bass (2013–present)

Former members include Tom Dornford-May (bass, 2008–2010), Steve Wilson (drums, 2008–2010), Harry Johns (bass, 2010–2011), Johnny Seymour (bass, 2012), and James Sacha (bass, 2013). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dinosaur_Pile-Up?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [dinosaurpileup.com](http://www.dinosaurpileup.com/).

bands.name: Sex Pistols Feat Frank Carter
bands.description: In 2024, the Sex Pistols reunited with Frank Carter, known for his work with Gallows and Frank Carter & The Rattlesnakes, as the lead vocalist. This collaboration began with two charity concerts at London's Bush Hall on August 13 and 14, 2024, where they performed their seminal 1977 album, "Never Mind the Bollocks, Here's the Sex Pistols," in its entirety. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_Pistols?utm_source=openai)) The success of these performances led to a series of UK tour dates in September 2024, including shows in Nottingham, Birmingham, Glasgow, Manchester, and London. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sex_Pistols?utm_source=openai)) In April 2025, the band embarked on their first Australian and New Zealand tour in nearly three decades, playing the full "Never Mind the Bollocks" album at venues across both countries. ([therockpit.net](https://www.therockpit.net/2025/sex-pistols-feat-frank-carter-australia-new-zealand-tour-april-2025-playing-never-mind-the-bollocks-in-full/?utm_source=openai)) The collaboration continued with a North American tour in September and October 2025, marking the band's first U.S. tour since 2003. ([revolvermag.com](https://www.revolvermag.com/events/sex-pistols-featuring-frank-carter-announce-u-s-tour/?utm_source=openai)) Throughout these performances, Carter's dynamic stage presence and vocal prowess have been integral to the band's revitalized energy, introducing the iconic punk sound to a new generation of fans.

bands.name: Gurt
bands.description:
Gurt is a sludge metal band formed in London in 2010. The band comprises vocalist Gareth Kelly, guitarist Rich Williams, bassist Dave Blakemore, and drummer Bill Jacobs. They are known for their unique blend of 70s rock blues and groove, infused with the raw energy of sludge metal. Their music is characterized by thunderous drums, demonic vocals, and down-tuned, down-tempo guitars. Gurt's influences include bands like EyeHateGod, Weedeater, Down, Crowbar, and Iron Monkey. ([gurt.bigcartel.com](https://gurt.bigcartel.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Since their formation, Gurt has released several albums, including "Horrendosaurus" in 2014, "Skullossus" in 2017, and "Bongs of Praise" in 2019. Their latest album, "Satan Etc," was released on June 7, 2024. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Gurt/Satan_Etc/1246005?utm_source=openai)) The band has also released singles such as "Jailhouse" in 2025. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/gurt/1731024949?utm_source=openai))

Gurt has performed at various festivals, including Bloodstock and Desertfest, and has shared the stage with bands like Red Fang, EyeHateGod, and PIST.ON. They have also toured Europe with Dopethrone and opened for bands like Weedeater, Black Tusk, and Valient Thorr. ([doomedandstoned.com](https://doomedandstoned.com/post/187489982353/gurt?utm_source=openai))

Their music is available on platforms like Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/gurt/518342831?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Dogma
bands.description: Dogma is a Chilean groove metal band formed in 1993 in Santiago. The original lineup consisted of Gabriel Almazán (vocals and guitar), Sebastián Rojas (drums), and Gustavo and Mauricio Romero (bass and guitar, respectively). In 1994, they recorded their first demo, "Truth Without Question," which sold out quickly. The band gained national recognition after performing at the Nancagua Festival in 1994, playing to an audience of approximately 4,000 people. Over the years, Dogma underwent several lineup changes, with Lucas Yaksic (guitar) and Sandro Trabucco (bass) joining in 1995. In 1997, Pablo Ortiz (guitar) replaced Yaksic. That same year, they released their first music video for "Demadness," which received airplay on Radio Concierto and UCTV's "Más Música" program, further boosting their popularity. Throughout the late 1990s, Dogma performed extensively across Chile, including notable shows in Chillán, Valparaíso, and Copiapó. They also headlined the 26th Anniversary of Radio Concierto at Discotheque Zoom, drawing a crowd of approximately 1,300 people. In 1999, Dogma expanded their reach by joining MP3.com, exposing their music to an international audience. Later that year, they reunited with former guitarist Lucas Yaksic. Under the executive production of Fire Works Music, they recorded their second album, "$uper FiX," in Santiago's Akustik Studios, produced by Mariano Pavez. The album, featuring 14 tracks including a remake of Del Shannon's "Runaway," showcased a more experimental and polished sound. Released in June 2000 under Big Sur Records, "$uper FiX" marked a new chapter for Dogma. With over 200 live performances to date, Dogma continues to promote their music through extensive media plans and live shows.

bands.name: Sonata Arctica
bands.description: Sonata Arctica is a Finnish power metal band formed in 1996 in Kemi, Finland. Originally known as Tricky Beans, they transitioned to Tricky Means before adopting the name Sonata Arctica in 1999. The band's lineup consists of drummer Tommy Portimo, lead vocalist Tony Kakko, keyboardist Henrik Klingenberg, guitarist Elias Viljanen, and bassist Pasi Kauppinen. Their music is characterized by melodic power metal with symphonic and progressive elements. They have released eleven studio albums, including "Ecliptica" (1999), "Silence" (2001), "Winterheart's Guild" (2003), "Reckoning Night" (2004), "Unia" (2007), "The Days of Grays" (2009), "Stones Grow Her Name" (2012), "Pariah's Child" (2014), "The Ninth Hour" (2016), "Talviyö" (2019), and "Clear Cold Beyond" (2024). The band has announced a 30th-anniversary tour across Finland in the winter of 2025. ([sonataarctica.info](https://www.sonataarctica.info/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Unpeople
bands.description: Unpeople is a British alternative rock band formed in 2023, known for their energetic performances and impassioned commentary on societal issues. The quartet comprises Jake Crawford (guitar and lead vocals), Luke Caley (guitar and vocals), Meg Mash (bass and vocals), and Richard Rayner (drums and vocals). In April 2024, they released their debut self-titled EP via SharpTone Records, featuring tracks like "waste," "smother," "overthinking," "going numb," and "moon baboon." The EP received acclaim from outlets such as Metal Hammer, which described it as "UK metal’s most promising first impression of 2024," and Distorted Sound, which praised its "arena-worthy hooks... hellacious screams... gloriously heavy guitars." ([kerrang.com](https://www.kerrang.com/unpeople-unleash-new-single-waste-announce-debut-ep?utm_source=openai)) The band has also been nominated for Best UK Breakthrough Artist at the Heavy Music Awards. Their music has garnered support from BBC Radio 1, with DJs Daniel P. Carter, Alyx Holcombe, and Jack Saunders highlighting their tracks. In October 2024, Unpeople released the single "the garden," accompanied by a music video and a headline show in London. ([therockpit.net](https://www.therockpit.net/2024/unpeople-release-new-single-the-garden/?utm_source=openai)) They have performed at various festivals, including Collision Festival, The Great Escape Festival, 2000Trees Festival, Radar Festival, Bloodstock Festival, and Burn It Down Festival. ([livewiremusic.org](https://www.livewiremusic.org/home/unpeoplerelease26022024?utm_source=openai)) Their music is characterized by a blend of alternative rock with elements of metal, featuring heavy riffs, catchy melodies, and introspective lyrics.

bands.name: Dream State
bands.description: Dream State is a Welsh post-hardcore band formed in 2014 in South Wales. The group initially consisted of vocalist Charlotte-Jayne "CJ" Gilpin, guitarists Aled Evans and Sam Harrison-Little, bassist Danny Rayer, and drummer Jamie Lee. They released their debut EP, "Consequences," in November 2015, followed by "Recovery" in May 2018. In October 2019, they released their first full-length album, "Primrose Path," which peaked at number 100 on the UK Albums Chart. The band's musical style blends post-hardcore with elements of alternative rock, metalcore, and punk, drawing influences from bands like While She Sleeps, A Day to Remember, Slipknot, Tool, and Linkin Park. In February 2022, Gilpin and guitarist Rhys Wilcox departed, and were replaced by vocalist Jessie Powell, bassist Jake Bowen, and drummer Tom Connolly. The new lineup released the "Untethered" EP in February 2023 and the "Still Dreaming" mini-album in January 2024. The current members are Aled Evans (lead guitar), Jake Bowen (bass guitar), Tom Connolly (drums), and Jessie Powell (lead vocals).

bands.name: Das Lumpenpack
bands.description: Das Lumpenpack is a German band known for their energetic performances and witty lyrics. Originally formed as a duo in 2012 by Maximilian Kennel and Jonas Frömming, they expanded to a five-piece lineup in 2020, adding Alexandra Eckert on drums, Jason Bartsch on guitar and keyboards, and Lola Schrode on bass. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Das_Lumpenpack?utm_source=openai)) Their music blends elements of pop, rock, ska, and punk, often incorporating humor and satire to address social issues. With roots in the poetry slam scene, Das Lumpenpack has evolved into a dynamic live act, performing at numerous festivals and venues across Germany. Their energetic performances and engaging lyrics have earned them a significant following, with over 700,000 monthly Spotify listeners and more than 350 million streams. ([recentmusic.com](https://recentmusic.com/artist/1yoERhqOE1iKKzKELHhEWM/?utm_source=openai)) Their discography includes albums such as "Steil-geh-LP" (2013), "Steil II" (2015), "Die Zukunft wird groß" (2017), "Eine herbe Enttäuschung" (2019), "Emotions" (2021), "Wach" (2023), and "Nie wieder W.A.C.H." (2024). ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Das_Lumpenpack?utm_source=openai)) Their latest album, "Nie wieder W.A.C.H.", released in 2024, features collaborations with artists like Alligatoah, Sebastian Madsen, and Adam Angst. ([daslumpenpack.de](https://daslumpenpack.de/?utm_source=openai)) The band is set to embark on their "Bevor der Mut dich verlässt" tour in 2026, with dates in cities like Wiesbaden, Munich, Nuremberg, Berlin, Hamburg, Hannover, Cologne, Leipzig, Osnabrück, Ludwigsburg, and Oberhausen. ([daslumpenpack.de](https://daslumpenpack.de/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Whoredom Rife
bands.description:
Whoredom Rife is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2014 in Trondheim, Trøndelag. The band was founded by V. Einride and K.R., aiming to revive the essence of True Norwegian Black Metal. Their music is characterized by a raw, aggressive style reminiscent of the mid-1990s Norwegian black metal scene, drawing influences from bands like Mayhem, Darkthrone, and Burzum. Lyrically, Whoredom Rife explores themes such as the Left-Hand Path, Paganism, and Norse mythology. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Whoredom_Rife/3540416792?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes several notable releases:

- **"Nid - Hymner av hat" (2017):** A full-length album that received critical acclaim for its uncompromising and focused approach. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/reviews/Whoredom_Rife/Whoredom_Rife/953800/?utm_source=openai))

- **"Ride the Final Tide" (2020):** An EP featuring original tracks and a cover of Manes' "Maanens natt." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Whoredom_Rife/Ride_the_Final_Tide/875331?utm_source=openai))

- **"Winds of Wrath" (2021):** A full-length album released on 12" vinyl, showcasing the band's evolving sound. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Whoredom_Rife/Winds_of_Wrath/993234?utm_source=openai))

- **"Den vrede makt" (2024):** Their latest full-length album, continuing their tradition of intense and atmospheric black metal. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Whoredom_Rife/Den_vrede_makt/1235202?utm_source=openai))

Whoredom Rife has performed at various festivals, including the Inferno Metal Festival in 2020, where they shared the stage with bands like Vreid and 1914. ([infernofestival.net](https://www.infernofestival.net/pm2020/vreid_eng.pdf?utm_source=openai))

The band's lineup consists of:

- **V. Einride:** All instruments, lyrics, and songwriting

- **K.R.:** Vocals

For more information, visit their official website.

bands.name: Heavy//Hitter
bands.description: Heavy//Hitter is a deathcore band from Orlando, Florida, known for their aggressive and intense sound that blends elements of deathcore, hardcore, and beatdown. Formed in 2019, the band consists of Austin Hayes (vocals), Dane Loeprich (guitar), Chris Perez (bass), and Josh Archeval (drums). They first gained attention with their 2021 release, "Street Violence," which showcased their raw energy and solidified their presence in the underground metal scene. In 2024, they signed with Blue Grape Music and released the "Moments of Misery" EP, featuring the single "No Mercy, No Remorse," a track about betrayal and revenge. In October 2025, they released the "Coming to Terms" EP, featuring a guest appearance from Zayna Youssef of Sweet Pill. Their music is available on platforms like Bandcamp and Apple Music. ([heavyhitterfl.bandcamp.com](https://heavyhitterfl.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Drain
bands.description: Drain is an American hardcore punk band formed in Santa Cruz, California, in 2014. Initially, the band lacked a defined musical style, but the 2015 addition of vocalist Sammy Ciaramitaro and bassist-turned-guitarist Cody Chavez led them to embrace a crossover thrash sound. Their music blends elements of hardcore punk, crossover thrash, and metalcore, often described as old-school California fight music with a thrash-metal influence. The band released their debut EP, "Over Thinking," in 2016, followed by "Time Enough at Last" in 2017. In 2020, they released their first full-length album, "California Cursed," which received critical acclaim. Their second album, "Living Proof," was released in 2023, further solidifying their presence in the hardcore scene. In June 2025, Drain announced their third album, "...Is Your Friend," set to release on November 7, 2025. The band has toured extensively, performing at festivals such as Alcatraz Hard Rock & Metal Festival, Dynamo Metal Fest, Riot Fest, and Wacken Open Air. They have also supported bands like Comeback Kid and Neck Deep on various tours.

bands.name: Moonspell
bands.description: Moonspell is a Portuguese gothic metal band formed in 1989. Originally known as Morbid God, they changed their name to Moonspell in 1992. The band released their first EP, "Under the Moonspell," in 1994, followed by their debut album, "Wolfheart," in 1995. They quickly became the most recognizable metal band from Portugal and a key figure in gothic metal. Their 1998 album, "Sin/Pecado," achieved gold status in Portugal, making them the first Portuguese metal band to do so. Moonspell's music blends elements of gothic metal, doom metal, and melodic death metal, characterized by atmospheric compositions and poetic lyrics. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Irreligious" (1996), "Night Eternal" (2008), and "1755" (2017), the latter being sung entirely in Portuguese and detailing the 1755 Lisbon earthquake. In 2024, they performed "Opus Diabolicum," a symphonic show with the Lisbon Sinfonietta Orchestra, which was released on October 31, 2025. ([label.napalmrecords.com](https://label.napalmrecords.com/moonspell/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Ankor
bands.description: Ankor is an alternative metal band from Catalonia, Spain, formed in 2003 in the village of Els Pallaresos, near Barcelona. The band consists of vocalist Jessie Williams (Bristol, UK), drummer Eleni Nota (Athens, Greece), guitarists David Romeu and Fito Martínez, and bassist Julio López (Tarragona, Catalonia). Initially, Ankor's music was characterized by heavy and power metal influences, but over time, they have evolved their sound to incorporate elements of alternative metal, metalcore, and EDM. This evolution is evident in their 2019 album 'White Dragon,' which blends various styles, including metal, rock, rap, electronic, and even funk. In 2014, Ankor was recognized as the best newcomer band by the readers of the prestigious Spanish and South American rock magazine La Heavy. Their subsequent albums, 'Beyond the Silence of These Years' (2017) and 'White Dragon' (2019), propelled the band to new heights, leading to headlining tours across Europe and Asia. In 2024, Ankor signed with Australian label UNFD and released their label-debut album, 'Shoganai,' a mini album that compiles songs released in 2023 and 2024. This release marked a significant milestone, allowing the band to perform sold-out shows during their headlining DARKBEAT European Tour in October 2023 and participate in major metal festivals such as Wacken Open Air (Germany), Hellfest (France), Tuska (Finland), Bloodstock Open Air (UK), and Resurrection Fest (Spain).

bands.name: Die Spitz
bands.description: Die Spitz is an American alternative rock band formed in Austin, Texas, in 2022. The group comprises Ava Schrobilgen, Chloe De St. Aubin, Ellie Livingston, and Kate Halter. They debuted with the EP "The Revenge of Evangeline" in 2022, followed by "Teeth" in 2023. Their first full-length album, "Something to Consume," was released on September 12, 2025, via Third Man Records. The album features eleven tracks blending punk, grunge, stoner, and doom influences, with singles like "Throw Yourself to the Sword," "Pop Punk Anthem (Sorry for the Delay)," and "Punishers." Critics have praised the album for its fierce and fearless sound, with Clash magazine describing it as "a doom metal thrasher straight out of Electric Wizard's universe." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Something_to_Consume?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Blood Fire Death
bands.description: "Blood Fire Death" is the fourth studio album by Swedish extreme metal band Bathory, released on October 8, 1988. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_Fire_Death?utm_source=openai)) This album marks a significant evolution in Bathory's musical style, blending traditional black metal with elements that would later define the Viking metal subgenre. The album's lyrics draw inspiration from various literary sources, including a poem by Erica Jong and Robert W. Chambers' "The King in Yellow." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_Fire_Death?utm_source=openai)) The cover art features "The Wild Hunt of Odin" by Peter Nicolai Arbo, reflecting the album's thematic focus on Norse mythology. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_Fire_Death?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Quorthon
members.role: Guitars, Vocals, Percussion, Effects, Producer, Engineer, Mixing

bands.name: Trivax
bands.description:
Trivax is an extreme metal band that seamlessly blends ferocious black metal with haunting Middle Eastern influences. Formed in Iran in the late 2000s by guitarist and vocalist Shayan, the band faced severe risks due to the country's stringent laws against music, particularly black metal. In 2011, seeking greater freedom, Shayan relocated to the UK, where he connected with bassist Sully, who had similarly fled Syria to escape persecution for his metal affiliations. The lineup was completed by British drummer M. Croton, bringing a wealth of experience to the ensemble. ([toxicmetalzine.com](https://www.toxicmetalzine.com/post/trivax-reveal-new-music-video-against-all-opposition?utm_source=openai))

Trivax's music is characterized by its intense fusion of black and death metal, enriched with dark Middle Eastern themes. Their discography includes several notable releases:

- **"SIN" (2016):** Their debut full-length album, released independently, showcases the band's raw energy and distinctive style. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Trivax/SIN/604069?utm_source=openai))

- **"The Serpent's Gaze" (2022):** A mini-album that set the tone for their subsequent works, featuring guest appearances from artists like Wraath (Behexen) and Naut (Winterfylleth). ([cultneverdies.com](https://www.cultneverdies.com/music/trivax?utm_source=openai))

- **"Eloah Burns Out" (2023):** A concept album narrating the story of Death, released via Cult Never Dies, marking a significant evolution in their sound. ([trivax.bandcamp.com](https://trivax.bandcamp.com/album/eloah-burns-out?utm_source=openai))

- **"The Great Satan" (2025):** Their latest album, released on 30 May 2025 through Osmose Productions, continues their tradition of intense and defiant performances. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Great_Satan_%28album%29?utm_source=openai))

Trivax's music often addresses themes of resistance and rebellion, reflecting their personal experiences and broader socio-political issues. Their unique sound has garnered them a dedicated following, and they continue to deliver electrifying live performances that captivate audiences worldwide.


## Trivax Releases New Music Video for 'Against All Opposition':
- [TRIVAX reveal new music video “Against All Opposition”](https://www.toxicmetalzine.com/post/trivax-reveal-new-music-video-against-all-opposition?utm_source=openai)

bands.name: Mork
bands.description: Mork is a Norwegian black metal band formed in 2004 in Halden, Østfold. The band was established by Thomas Eriksen, who serves as the primary songwriter, vocalist, and instrumentalist.
