Mork's music is characterized by grim and frost-bitten riffs, harsh vocal melodies, and a hypnotic black metal atmosphere. Their lyrical themes often explore misanthropy, Satanism, occultism, paganism, and the Norwegian nature. Since their formation, Mork has released several albums, including "Katedralen" in 2021 and "Dypet" in 2025, both under Peaceville Records. ([metal-roos.com.au](https://metal-roos.com.au/norwegian-black-metallers-mork-announce-new-album-dypet/?utm_source=openai)) The band's lineup has remained consistent, with Thomas Eriksen as the sole member. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/mork/3540372524?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Monkeys On Mars
bands.description:
Monkeys on Mars is a collaborative project between the Swiss rock band Monkey3 and the French stoner rock trio Mars Red Sky. Formed in April 2025, the supergroup announced their partnership with plans to release an EP in October 2025 and embark on a joint tour later that year. ([fr.wikipedia.org](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monkey3?utm_source=openai))

**Genres:**
- Stoner Rock

bands.name: Frontside
bands.description: Frontside is a Polish metalcore and deathcore band formed in 1993 in Sosnowiec, Poland. The group is known for blending hardcore, metal, and death metal to create a unique and heavy sound. Their work often touches on themes of religion, politics, and human weaknesses, reflected in their intense and sometimes controversial lyrics. Frontside gained popularity thanks to their energetic live performances and standout albums, such as “Zmierzch bogów” and “I odpuść nam nasze winy.” The band is considered one of the most important acts on the Polish metal scene. ([b90.pl](https://www.b90.pl/en/artists/frontside-en/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Apocalyptica
bands.description: Apocalyptica is a Finnish symphonic metal band formed in 1993 in Helsinki. The group consists of three classically trained cellists—Eicca Toppinen, Paavo Lötjönen, and Perttu Kivilaakso—and a drummer, Mikko Sirén. Initially, they gained recognition by performing Metallica covers exclusively with cellos, leading to the release of their debut album, "Plays Metallica by Four Cellos," in 1996. This album featured instrumental renditions of Metallica's tracks, showcasing the band's unique approach to heavy metal music. Their second album, "Inquisition Symphony," released in 1998, expanded their repertoire to include covers of songs by Faith No More, Sepultura, and Pantera, along with original compositions by Toppinen. In 1999, Antero Manninen departed, and Perttu Kivilaakso joined the band. The 2000 album "Cult" marked a shift towards original material, blending symphonic elements with heavy metal influences. The band's 2003 album "Reflections" introduced drums to their recordings and live performances, adding a new dimension to their sound. Their 2005 self-titled album featured collaborations with artists like Ville Valo of HIM and Lauri Ylönen of The Rasmus. In 2007, "Worlds Collide" included guest appearances from Till Lindemann of Rammstein and Adam Gontier of Three Days Grace. The 2010 album "7th Symphony" continued their evolution, incorporating diverse musical styles. In 2015, "Shadowmaker" was released, with Franky Perez providing vocals on all tracks. The 2020 album "Cell-0" returned to their instrumental roots, and in 2024, they released "Plays Metallica, Vol. 2," a sequel to their debut album, featuring new Metallica covers and collaborations with Metallica members. Throughout their career, Apocalyptica has sold over four million albums worldwide, establishing themselves as pioneers in the symphonic metal genre.

bands.name: Møl
bands.description:
MØL is a Danish blackgaze band formed in 2012 in Aarhus. The band's name, "MØL," translates to "moth" in Danish. Their music uniquely blends the intensity of black metal with the ethereal qualities of shoegaze, creating a soundscape that is both aggressive and atmospheric. Influenced by bands like My Bloody Valentine, Slowdive, and Alcest, MØL has been recognized as a prominent act in the blackgaze movement. ([gettingitout.net](https://gettingitout.net/artists/mol/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of vocalist Kim Song Sternkopf, guitarists Nicolai Hansen and Frederik Lippert, bassist Holger Rumph-Frost, and drummer Ken Klejs. Sternkopf joined the band in 2016, bringing his experience as a concert photographer and his previous work with the band Antennas to Nowhere. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%98L?utm_source=openai))

MØL's discography includes their self-titled debut EP released in 2014, followed by "II" in 2015. Their debut album, "Jord," was released in 2018 under Holy Roar Records, receiving critical acclaim and marking their international breakthrough. In 2021, they signed with Nuclear Blast Records and released their second album, "Diorama," which further solidified their reputation in the metal scene. ([gettingitout.net](https://gettingitout.net/artists/mol/?utm_source=openai))

The band's official website is [https://www.molband.com](https://www.molband.com).

bands.name: Steve'n'seagulls
bands.description: Steve'n'Seagulls is a Finnish band renowned for their unique bluegrass renditions of classic hard rock and metal songs. Formed in Jyväskylä in 2011, the group gained international attention in 2014 with their viral cover of AC/DC's "Thunderstruck," which has amassed over 180 million views on YouTube. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_%27n%27_Seagulls?utm_source=openai)) This success led to the release of their debut album, "Farm Machine," in May 2015, featuring bluegrass versions of popular rock and metal tracks. ([loudwire.com](https://loudwire.com/steve-n-seagulls-debut-album-farm-machine-may/?utm_source=openai)) The band's subsequent albums include "Brothers in Farms" (2016), "Grainsville" (2018), "Another Miracle" (2020), and "The Dark Side of the Moo" (2025). ([newarkadvertiser.co.uk](https://www.newarkadvertiser.co.uk/whats-on/flock-back-in-the-uk-9401082/?utm_source=openai)) Their music blends elements of bluegrass, country, and folk, offering a fresh take on well-known rock and metal classics. ([viberate.com](https://www.viberate.com/artist/stevenseagulls/?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Remmel
members.role: Vocals, Acoustic Guitar, Mandolin, Balalaika, Anvil

bands.name: Catch Your Breath
bands.description:
Catch Your Breath is an American rock band from Austin, Texas, formed in 2017. The lineup consists of vocalist Josh Mowery, guitarist Teddy Herrera, bassist Cianan Madigan, and drummer Onell Hernandez. The band blends elements of alternative rock, post-hardcore, hard rock, and metalcore, creating a distinctive sound characterized by emotive vocals, dynamic guitar riffs, and powerful rhythms. Their music often features synth soundscapes and imaginative production, aiming to connect with listeners on a personal level.

The band debuted with the single "Burn" in 2017, followed by "Frontline" and "Yesterday" in 2018. In 2020, they released "Ricochet" and "Criminal," showcasing their evolving sound. Their 2021 single "Blood in the Water" marked a significant milestone, leading to their signing with Thriller Records in December 2022. Under this label, they released their debut studio album, "Shame on Me," in October 2023. The album includes tracks like "Dial Tone," which achieved notable success, debuting on Sirius XM Octane radio, reaching #3 on Spotify Metal’s worldwide chart, and #7 on Billboard’s Hot Hard Rock Songs. The band has also released singles such as "Savages," "No Evil," "21 Gun Salute," "Y.S.K.W. (You Should Know Why)," and "Mirror," further solidifying their presence in the rock and metal scenes.

Catch Your Breath has performed at major festivals like Aftershock and Welcome to Rockville, sharing stages with bands like Metallica, Disturbed, and Deftones. They have also toured with Falling in Reverse, Ice Nine Kills, Our Last Night, Slaughter to Prevail, and Crown the Empire, gaining a reputation for their energetic live performances. Their music is available on platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, and YouTube, and they maintain an active presence on social media platforms, engaging with a growing fanbase.

bands.name: Nevertel
bands.description:
Nevertel is an American band from Tampa, Florida, formed in 2014. The group consists of vocalist Jeremy Michael, guitarist and rapper Raul Lopez, and guitarist Alec Davis. Their music blends elements of nu metal, metalcore, hip-hop, and EDM, drawing inspiration from bands like Linkin Park, Bring Me the Horizon, and Logic. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevertel?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut album, "Living Fiction," in 2016, followed by the EP "Deep Down" in 2018. Their second studio album, "Everything in My Mind," came out in 2021. In March 2024, Nevertel signed with Epitaph Records and toured North America with Currents and Boundaries as supporting acts for Beartooth. Their third studio album, "Start Again," was released on September 12, 2025. The single "Break the Silence," featuring Sleep Theory, peaked at number 23 on the Mainstream Rock Airplay chart. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevertel?utm_source=openai))

Nevertel's music is characterized by a fusion of heavy guitar riffs, electronic elements, and rap vocals, creating a dynamic and energetic sound. Their lyrics often explore themes of personal struggle, resilience, and self-discovery.

For more information, visit their official website at [https://www.nevertelband.com/](https://www.nevertelband.com/).

bands.name: Zero 9:36
bands.description:
Zero 9:36 is an American musician from Langhorne, Pennsylvania, known for blending hip-hop with various rock genres, including hard rock, alternative rock, and heavy metal. Born Matthew Cullen on May 11, 1997, he began creating music at age 11, initially inspired by hip-hop before discovering rock and heavy metal, leading him to fuse these genres into his unique sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_9%3A36?utm_source=openai))

In 2016, under the moniker Zero, he released the mixtape "Paradise Campground," featuring guest appearances from Tory Lanez and Huey Mack. The following year, he changed his stage name to Zero 9:36 and signed with Atco Records. His debut EP, "You Will Not Be Saved," was released in 2019, followed by "Barebones, Vol. 1" in 2020, which included acoustic versions of previously released tracks. In 2021, he released "...If You Don't Save Yourself," featuring collaborations with Travis Barker, Ice Nine Kills, and Scarlxrd. His 2024 album, "None of Us Are Getting Out," included the single "Chasing Shadows," which peaked at number 20 on the US Mainstream Rock chart. In 2025, he released "They Were Always Here," featuring the single "Here to Bleed," which reached number 42 on the Mainstream Rock chart. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_9%3A36?utm_source=openai))

Zero 9:36's music is characterized by a fusion of hip-hop and rock elements, incorporating styles such as alternative rock, heavy metal, hard rock, rap metal, rap rock, metalcore, and pop punk. He cites influences including Tory Lanez, Blackbear, D-Pryde, Slipknot (particularly vocalist Corey Taylor), Hollywood Undead, Lil Wayne, Meek Mill, Limp Bizkit, DMX, Kanye West, and Shinedown. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_9%3A36?utm_source=openai))

As of November 2025, Zero 9:36 is on tour supporting metalcore band Atreyu. ([slrmagazine.com](https://slrmagazine.com/2025/11/22/post-genre-insurgent-zero-936-shares-new-single-holding-on-and-music-video/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit his official website at https://zero936.com/.

bands.name: Alunah
bands.description:
Alunah is a British doom metal band formed in Birmingham in 2006. Known for their fusion of doom, stoner, and psychedelic rock, they have been a significant presence in the European metal scene. Their music is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, hypnotic rhythms, and earthy vocals, often drawing inspiration from nature and English folklore.

**History and Style**

Since their inception, Alunah has been dedicated to creating music that reflects their passion for nature and the mystical. Their sound has evolved over the years, incorporating elements of doom, stoner, and psychedelic rock. They have been recognized for their unique blend of heavy riffs and melodic vocals, setting them apart in the doom metal genre.

**Albums**

- **Call of Avernus** (2010): Their debut album, released through Catacomb Records, established their presence in the doom metal scene.

- **White Hoarhound** (2012): Released via PsycheDOOMelic Records, this album received critical acclaim and was later re-released on vinyl by Napalm Records.

- **Awakening the Forest** (2014): Their third album, released through Napalm Records, continued to showcase their evolving sound.

- **Violet Hour** (2019): Released under Heavy Psych Sounds, this album marked a new chapter in their musical journey.

- **Strange Machine** (2022): Their fifth album, released through Heavy Psych Sounds, received positive reviews for its consistent and captivating sound.

- **Amber & Gold** (2021): An EP released via Solitude Productions, featuring tracks like "Mångata" and a cover of Chris Isaak's "Wicked Game." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Alunah/Amber_%26_Gold/926779?utm_source=openai))

- **Fever Dream** (2024): Their latest album, released on September 20, 2024, through Heavy Psych Sounds, has been praised for its accomplished and emotive journey. ([metalepidemic.com](https://www.metalepidemic.com/alunah-fever-dream/?utm_source=openai))

**Current Lineup**

- Daisy Savage – Vocals
- Matt Noble – Guitar
- Daniel Burchmore – Bass
- Jake Mason – Drums

**Genres**

- Doom Metal
- Stoner Rock
- Psychedelic Rock

**Website**

[Alunah Official Website](https://www.alunah.co.uk/)

**Headline Image**

![Alunah Band Photo](https://www.alunah.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/Alunah-Fever-Dream-Album-Cover.jpg)

**Logo**

![Alunah Logo](https://www.alunah.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/Alunah-Logo.png)

bands.name: Jad
bands.description: JAD is a Polish punk band formed in Warsaw in March 2017. The band has released several works, including the album "Odwet" in 2025. ([jadpunk.bandcamp.com](https://jadpunk.bandcamp.com/album/odwet?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Heľenine Oči
bands.description:
Heľenine Oči is a dynamic seven-member band from Prešov, Slovakia, known for their energetic fusion of rock, folk, ska, punk, reggae, and metal elements. Formed in 1999, they initially began as a folk-rock group named Nová Rieka. The band gained significant recognition after winning the Stropkov Music League in 2003, which marked a pivotal moment in their career. ([apagesatana.com](https://www.apagesatana.com/61/band/helenine-oci/?utm_source=openai))

Their music is characterized by a distinctive blend of genres, creating a sound that is both unique and captivating. The band refers to their style as "eskimo-punk," reflecting their eclectic approach to music. ([apagesatana.com](https://www.apagesatana.com/61/band/helenine-oci/?utm_source=openai)) Lyrically, they often explore humorous and satirical themes, offering a unique commentary on life, Slovakian society, and the human experience.

Over the years, Heľenine Oči has released several albums, each showcasing their evolving musical prowess:

- "Impérium Lahodných Chutí" (2004)
- "Tafasasamáš" (2008)
- "Mimozemšťanie" (2013)
- "Vajco" (2017)
- "CIRKUS 22" (2022)

Their latest release, "CIRKUS 22," features 13 tracks and was released on June 17, 2025. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/au/artist/he%C4%BEenine-o%C4%8Di/727046065?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes:

- Martin Mihalčín (lead vocals)
- Jakub Tirčo (guitar)
- Tomáš Durkáč (bass and backing vocals)
- Pavol Balčák (drums and backing vocals)
- Igor Polorecký (guitar and backing vocals)
- Gregor Chalupecký (trombone)
- Richard Solárik (trumpet)

Heľenine Oči has become a significant presence in the Eastern European music scene, known for their electrifying live performances and their ability to blend traditional Slovakian elements with contemporary styles. They have performed at numerous festivals and club concerts throughout Slovakia, the Czech Republic, Poland, the Netherlands, the USA, England, and Ireland. ([goout.net](https://goout.net/pl/helenine-oci/sztbddy/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [hel.sk](https://hel.sk).

bands.name: Boundaries
bands.description:
Boundaries is an American metalcore band from Hartford, Connecticut, formed in 2013. The current lineup consists of vocalist Matthew McDougal, guitarists Cory Emond and Cody DelVecchio, drummer/vocalist Tim Sullivan, and bassist/vocalist Nathan Calcagno. They are known for their aggressive soundscapes, emotional intensity, and explosive live performances. ([ticketmaster.com](https://www.ticketmaster.com/boundaries-tickets/artist/1696291?utm_source=openai))

The band released their first full-length album, "Your Receding Warmth," in 2020 via Unbeaten Records, featuring the lead single "Carve." They followed up with "Burying Brightness" in 2022, which included tracks like "Heaven's Broken Heart" and "Your Own Murder." In 2024, Boundaries released "Death Is Little More," featuring guest appearances from members of Kublai Khan TX, Alpha Wolf, and Invent Animate. The album includes the lead single "Easily Erased." ([ticketmaster.com](https://www.ticketmaster.com/boundaries-tickets/artist/1696291?utm_source=openai))

Boundaries are known for combining raw emotional intensity, technical riffing, melodic moments, and a consistent drive toward evolution across albums. ([heavymetal.ch](https://heavymetal.ch/artists/5437/boundaries?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [boundariesct.com](https://boundariesct.com).

bands.name: Hard-Ons
bands.description: The Hard-Ons are an Australian punk rock band formed in 1982 in Punchbowl, New South Wales. The original lineup consisted of Keish de Silva on lead vocals and drums, Peter "Blackie" Black on guitar and backing vocals, and Ray Ahn on bass guitar. Initially known as Dead Rats, the band changed their name to The Plebs and eventually to The Hard-Ons in late 1982. They began performing at birthday parties and school dances due to age restrictions at pubs. Their first official show was on June 20, 1984, at the Vulcan Hotel in Ultimo. The band's early recordings, such as "Smell My Finger," "Dickcheese," "Love Is a Battlefield of Wounded Hearts," and "Yummy!" blended punk tempos, hardcore attitude, heavy metal riffs, and surf-pop melodies into a seamless ball of energy. In 1994, after releasing five studio albums, the band disbanded. They reunited in 1997, and in 2002, de Silva departed, with Black taking over lead vocals and Pete Kostic joining on drums. Kostic was replaced by Murray Ruse in 2011. In 2021, de Silva returned as a guest vocalist and permanently rejoined in 2016. However, in March 2021, de Silva was removed from the band following allegations of sexual misconduct. Tim Rogers of You Am I became the new lead vocalist in August 2021. The band's thirteenth studio album, "I'm Sorry Sir, That Riff's Been Taken," was released on October 8, 2021, debuting at number 4 on the ARIA charts. Their fifteenth studio album, "I Like You a Lot Getting Older," was released on October 4, 2024, reaching number five on the ARIA Australian music charts by October 16, 2024. The band celebrated their 40th anniversary with an Australian tour starting on October 8, 2024. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hard-Ons?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Bruit ≤
bands.description:
Bruit ≤ is an experimental post-rock and modern classical quartet from Toulouse, France, formed in 2018. The band's name, "Bruit," translates to "noise" in French, reflecting their avant-garde approach to music. They debuted with the EP "Monolith" in 2018, showcasing their ability to blend atmospheric soundscapes with intricate compositions. ([whatthefrance.org](https://whatthefrance.org/a-made-in-france-selection-by-bruit/?utm_source=openai))

In April 2021, Bruit ≤ released their first full-length album, "The Machine Is Burning and Now Everyone Knows It Could Happen Again," which received critical acclaim for its innovative fusion of post-rock and modern classical elements. ([sputnikmusic.com](https://www.sputnikmusic.com/review/83140/BRUIT-The-Machine-is-burning.../?utm_source=openai)) The album was re-released on vinyl in December 2021 under Pelagic Records, selling out 3,000 copies in less than a year. ([theprogspace.com](https://theprogspace.com/bruit-apologie-du-temps-perdu-vol-1-ep/?utm_source=openai))

Their second album, "Apologie du Temps Perdu, Vol. 1," was released in January 2023, further solidifying their reputation in the experimental music scene. ([theprogspace.com](https://theprogspace.com/bruit-apologie-du-temps-perdu-vol-1-ep/?utm_source=openai)) In April 2025, Bruit ≤ released "The Age of Ephemerality," which they chose to premiere exclusively on YouTube, bypassing mainstream streaming platforms. ([goodcallmusic.com](https://www.goodcallmusic.com/newmusic-2-1/bruit-the-age-of-ephemerality-full-album-stream?utm_source=openai))

In October 2025, Bruit ≤ joined Alcest on their European tour, performing in over a dozen concerts across France and other European countries. ([metalawards.org](https://metalawards.org/2025/03/01/alcest-will-bring-bruit-%E2%89%A4-on-their-2025-european-tour-with-more-than-a-dozen-concerts-in-france/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes:

- Théophile Antolinos (Guitars/Tapes)
- Clément Libes (Violins/Violas/Keyboards/Bass)
- Julien Aoufi (Drums)
- Luc Blanchot (Cello)

For more information and to explore their discography, visit their official Bandcamp page. ([bruitofficial.bandcamp.com](https://bruitofficial.bandcamp.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Black Veil Brides
bands.description:
Black Veil Brides is an American rock band formed in 2006 in Cincinnati, Ohio. The group is currently composed of lead vocalist Andy Biersack, rhythm guitarist and violinist Jinxx, lead guitarist Jake Pitts, drummer Christian "CC" Coma, and bassist Lonny Eagleton. Known for their theatrical stage presence, the band draws inspiration from 1980s glam metal acts like Kiss and Mötley Crüe, evident in their use of black makeup, body paint, tight black studded clothing, and long hair. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Veil_Brides?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "We Stitch These Wounds," was released on July 20, 2010, selling over 10,000 copies in its first week and reaching No. 36 on the Billboard Top 200 chart. The band's self-titled fourth album, "Black Veil Brides," was released on October 28, 2014, featuring tracks like "Heart of Fire" and "Faithless." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Veil_Brides_%28album%29?utm_source=openai)) Their fifth studio album, "Vale," released on January 12, 2018, serves as a prequel to their previous concept album "Wretched and Divine: The Story of the Wild Ones." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vale_%28album%29?utm_source=openai)) In 2020, they released "The Phantom Tomorrow," followed by "The Mourning" EP in 2022. In April 2024, they signed with Spinefarm Records and released the "Bleeders" EP, inspired by the musical "Sweeney Todd." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Veil_Brides?utm_source=openai))

Musically, Black Veil Brides' style has evolved over the years, incorporating elements of hard rock, alternative metal, metalcore, and glam metal. Their influences include Marilyn Manson, Kiss, Metallica, Pantera, Avenged Sevenfold, Mötley Crüe, Poison, AFI, W.A.S.P., Rob Zombie, L.A. Guns, Aerosmith, Misfits, Dead Boys, The Damned, Slipknot, Dropkick Murphys, David Bowie, Queen, Twisted Sister, Def Leppard, Skid Row, Social Distortion, Rise Against, Billy Idol, Alice Cooper, and Hot Water Music. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Veil_Brides?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at https://www.blackveilbrides.net/.

bands.name: Tx2
bands.description:
TX2 is an American rock band formed in Fort Collins, Colorado, in 2015 by singer-songwriter Timothy Evan Thomas, known professionally as TX2. Initially a solo project, TX2 expanded into a full band, gaining attention through social media platforms such as TikTok and YouTube. In July 2023, they signed with Hopeless Records, a label known for its roster of alternative and punk artists. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TX2?utm_source=openai))

The band's music combines elements of emo, pop-punk, alternative rock, and hip-hop, frequently employing a blend of distorted guitars, driving drums, electronic production touches, and direct, sometimes aggressive vocal delivery. Their lyrics are distinguished by their confessional tone, often grappling with themes of mental health, alienation, resilience, social injustice, and subcultural identity. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TX2?utm_source=openai))

In 2024, TX2 released the EP "Cruel World," featuring collaborations with Ice Nine Kills and From First to Last. The EP includes tracks like "MAD," "Cruel World," "So Numb," "Swing At Me," "Violent Nature," and "THIS ISN'T ABOUT DRUGS (I SWEAR)." ([pozerclub.com](https://www.pozerclub.com/2024/11/tx2-has-released-new-ep-cruel-world.html?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of Evan Thomas (lead vocals, primary songwriter), Cam Rostami (guitar, backup vocals), Corky Howard (bass guitar), and Ethan Church (drummer). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TX2?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [www.officialtx2.com](https://www.officialtx2.com/).

bands.name: Rap Martin Rap
bands.description: I couldn't find any information on a metal band named "Rap Martin Rap" in the available sources. It's possible that the band is relatively unknown, has a different name, or is not listed in major music databases. If you have any additional details about the band, such as their discography, members, or any other identifying information, please provide them, and I'll do my best to assist you further.

bands.name: Grade 2
bands.description: Grade 2 is a punk rock band from Ryde on the Isle of Wight, England, formed in May 2013. The trio consists of Sid Ryan (bass and lead vocals), Jack Chatfield (guitar and vocals), and Jacob Hull (drums). Initially, they performed covers of punk classics by bands like The Stranglers and The Jam, as well as Oi! music by Booze and Glory and Lion’s Law. Over time, they began writing original material and performing regularly in local venues, gaining exposure by supporting established bands. In 2014, they released their first EP, "Broken Youth," under the German label Contra Records. Their debut album, "Mainstream View," was released in 2016, followed by "Break the Routine" in 2017. In 2019, they signed with Hellcat Records and released "Graveyard Island," produced by Tim Armstrong of Rancid. The album received positive reviews for its blend of punk rock and Oi! influences. In 2023, they released their self-titled fourth album, "Grade 2," which continues their tradition of energetic punk music. The band has toured extensively across Europe and North America, supporting acts like The Interrupters, Dropkick Murphys, Social Distortion, Rancid, and Guns N' Roses. Their music is characterized by a classic punk sound with lyrics addressing everyday issues, resonating with fans of traditional punk rock.

bands.name: Ash
bands.description: Ash is a Northern Irish rock band formed in Downpatrick in 1992 by vocalist and guitarist Tim Wheeler, bassist Mark Hamilton, and drummer Rick McMurray. Initially inspired by heavy metal acts like Twisted Sister and Iron Maiden, they began as a band named Vietnam. However, they soon shifted their musical direction towards alternative rock, drawing influences from bands such as Nirvana, Mudhoney, and the Pixies. This evolution led to the formation of Ash and the release of their debut single, "Jack Names the Planets," in 1994. Their first full-length album, "1977," released in 1996, received critical acclaim and was named by NME as one of the 500 greatest albums of all time. In 1997, guitarist and vocalist Charlotte Hatherley joined the band, contributing to their second album, "Nu-Clear Sounds," released in 1998. Hatherley departed in 2006 to pursue a solo career, and Ash returned to their original three-piece lineup. The band has since released several albums, including "Free All Angels" (2001), "Meltdown" (2004), "Twilight of the Innocents" (2007), "Kablammo!" (2015), "Islands" (2018), "Race the Night" (2023), and "Ad Astra" (2025). Their music is characterized by a blend of pop-punk, alternative rock, power pop, punk rock, indie rock, and Britpop elements. Ash continues to tour and release new material, maintaining a dedicated fan base worldwide.

bands.name: The Kovenant
bands.description: The Kovenant is a Norwegian metal band from Hamar, originally formed in 1993 as Covenant. Due to a naming dispute with a Swedish band of the same name, they changed their name to The Kovenant in 1999. This change marked a shift in their musical style from symphonic black metal to a more industrial and cyber metal sound, heavily influenced by Europe's electronic body music (EBM) scene. Their discography includes notable albums such as "In Times Before the Light" (1997), "Nexus Polaris" (1998), "Animatronic" (1999), and "SETI" (2003). The Kovenant has been recognized with Norwegian Grammy awards for Best Hard Rock Band in 1998 and 1999. After a period of inactivity, the band reunited in 2024 and began performing live shows, including full-album performances of "Nexus Polaris." ([metalinsider.net](https://metalinsider.net/news/the-kovenant-are-back-announce-live-performances?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Cost
bands.description: The Cost was a San Francisco Bay Area band active between 1999 and 2003. They released an album, "Chimera" (2002), on Lookout! Records, an EP on New Disorder Records, a split 7-inch with Canadian punk band d.b.s., and were featured on several compilations over the years. They toured extensively on the west coast, mainly in the Pacific Northwest, and also across the United States. The Cost played their last show at Berkeley's 924 Gilman Street, the venue they called home, on July 5, 2003. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cost_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Nortt
bands.description:
Nortt is a Danish one-man band formed in 1995, known for its unique blend of black metal and funeral doom. The project is the sole creation of the artist Nortt, who handles all aspects of the music, including vocals, instruments, and production. Nortt's music is characterized by its slow tempos, melancholic melodies, and a pervasive atmosphere of despair.

In 2003, Nortt released his first full-length album, "Gudsforladt," which translates to "Forsaken by God." This album was initially released as a limited edition LP by Sombre Records, with only 350 copies produced. The CD version, which included the bonus track "Evig Hvile," was released in 2004 by Diehard Bloodline. The album features tracks such as "Graven," "Døden," "Glemt," and "Gravfred," showcasing Nortt's ability to create a haunting and immersive listening experience. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Nortt/Gudsforladt/716699?utm_source=openai))

Nortt's discography includes several notable releases:

- **"Mournful Monuments 1998–2002" (2003):** A compilation album that includes demos and EPs from the early years of Nortt's career.

- **"Ligfærd" (2006):** The second full-length album, continuing the themes of despair and melancholy.

- **"Nortt/Xasthur" (2004):** A split album with the American depressive black metal project Xasthur.

- **"Gudsforladt" (2018):** A reissue of the original album, released on vinyl by Avantgarde Music. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Nortt/Gudsforladt/716699?utm_source=openai))

Nortt's music is often described as "Pure Depressive Black Funeral Doom Metal," reflecting its deep, somber tones and introspective themes. The project has garnered a dedicated following among fans of the genre, appreciated for its authenticity and emotional depth.

For more information, you can visit Nortt's official website.

bands.name: Vianova
bands.description:
Vianova is a dynamic metalcore band from Berlin, Germany, formed in 2014 by brothers Felix and Paul Vogelsang. The duo relocated to Berlin with a shared vision of creating authentic, emotionally-driven music. In 2017, they solidified their lineup with the addition of vocalist Alexander Kerski. Between 2015 and 2019, Vianova released a five-track EP and two singles, establishing a presence in the German live music scene despite navigating lineup changes. ([holdtight.co](https://www.holdtight.co/news/2024/10/4/berlin-metalcore-act-vianova-sign-to-arising-empire-and-stream-new-single?utm_source=openai))

During the 2020 pandemic, the band reinvented their musical and visual identity, embracing a more technical, aggressive, and imaginative style. This evolution culminated in their EP "Looking For..." and the follow-up "...A Way Out," released in 2023. These efforts garnered international attention and led to management by Lukas Magyar of Veil of Maya in mid-2023. Vianova has since performed extensively across Germany, solidifying their position as a rising force in the metalcore genre. ([holdtight.co](https://www.holdtight.co/news/2025/8/15/inventive-metalcore-act-vianova-stream-new-single-obsolete?utm_source=openai))

In August 2025, Vianova released the single "Obsolete," which begins smoothly and erupts into a powerful burst of energy, driven by Kerski's standout vocal performance and the band's explosive instrumental work. The track reflects on human value in a world shaped by automation, societal pressure, and emotional detachment. ([metalhammer.it](https://www.metalhammer.it/2025/08/30/vianova-online-il-video-di-obsolete/?utm_source=openai))

Vianova's music blends metalcore with influences from soul, jazz, R&B, and 80s synths, reflecting their commitment to breaking genre boundaries. Their vibrant visual transformation injects fun into a metalcore landscape often perceived as stagnant. ([holdtight.co](https://www.holdtight.co/news/2025/8/15/inventive-metalcore-act-vianova-stream-new-single-obsolete?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Alexander Kerski on vocals, Felix Vogelsang on guitar, Raoul Zillani on bass, and Paul Vogelsang on drums. ([holdtight.co](https://www.holdtight.co/news/2025/8/15/inventive-metalcore-act-vianova-stream-new-single-obsolete?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Thrown Into Exile
bands.description:
Thrown Into Exile is an American heavy metal band from Los Angeles, California, formed in 2011. The band gained early recognition by winning the "Road to Mayhem" competition in 2012, earning them a spot on the Rockstar Mayhem Festival alongside bands like Slipknot, Motörhead, Anthrax, and Slayer. They have also shared stages with notable acts such as Sepultura, Fear Factory, Chimaira, All Shall Perish, Testament, and Morbid Angel. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thrown_into_Exile?utm_source=openai))

Their musical style blends elements of metalcore and thrash metal, characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and powerful vocals. The band released their self-titled debut EP in 2013, produced by Mike Spreitzer of DevilDriver. This was followed by their first full-length album, "Safe Inside," in 2016, and "Illusion of Control" in 2020. In 2024, they released the EP "Passageways," showcasing their evolving sound. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thrown_into_Exile?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Mario Rubio on guitars, Evan Seidlitz on vocals, Javier Quinto on bass, Austin Monzon on guitars, and Hank Lin on drums. Former members include Colin Reed, Erik Tisinger, Chase Brickenden, Ray Sanchez, Dave Corsile, Henry Derek, Zac Morris, Joey Dalo, Scott Shelko, and Edwin Haroutonian. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thrown_into_Exile?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [www.thrownintoexile.com](http://www.thrownintoexile.com).

bands.name: Vengaboys
bands.description: Vengaboys is a Dutch Eurodance music group formed in 1997 in Rotterdam. The group was created by producers Wessel van Diepen and Dennis van den Driesschen, known as Danski and Delmundo, who selected the members and produced their music. The original lineup included lead vocalist Kim Sasabone, female vocalist Denise van Rijswijk, and male vocalists Robin Pors and Roy den Burger. They achieved significant commercial success in the late 1990s and early 2000s with hit singles such as "We Like to Party! (The Vengabus)", "Boom, Boom, Boom, Boom!!", and "We're Going to Ibiza!". These tracks topped charts in multiple countries and contributed to the group's international popularity. Their debut album, "Up & Down - The Party Album!" (1998), was certified gold in the Netherlands and Belgium. In 2000, they released "The Platinum Album", which continued their success with singles like "Kiss (When the Sun Don't Shine)", "Shalala Lala", and "Uncle John from Jamaica". The group experienced lineup changes over the years, with members leaving and returning. Notably, Robin Pors left in 1999 and was replaced by Yorick Bakker, but Pors returned in 2009. In 2024, Kim Sasabone announced a hiatus, and Cilla Niekoop from Ch!pz joined as a temporary replacement. Despite these changes, Vengaboys has maintained a presence in the music scene, performing at various events and releasing new material. Their energetic performances and catchy tunes have solidified their status as icons of the Eurodance genre.

bands.name: The Baboon Show
bands.description: The Baboon Show is a Swedish punk rock band formed in Stockholm in late 2003. The original lineup consisted of Cecilia Boström (vocals), Håkan Sörle (guitar), and Niclas Svensson (drums). In 2004, they released their debut EP, "This Is It!" The band quickly gained a reputation as one of Sweden's best live acts, leading to a contract with the Swedish indie label National. They released their first three albums—"Don't Don't Don't" (2005), "Pep Talk" (2006), and "Betsy's Revenge" (2007)—within a year and seven months. Their energetic performances have taken them across Europe, including tours in Germany, Spain, and Scandinavia, and they have played at major festivals such as Wacken Open Air, Hellfest, and Download Festival. In 2015, they recorded "Havanna Sessions," collaborating with Cuban musicians to blend punk rock with Cuban rhythms. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with Frida Ståhl joining as bassist in 2013 and Simon Dahlberg replacing Håkan Sörle on guitar in 2023. Their latest release, "Forward in Reverse," a 10-inch EP featuring three new songs, was released in February 2025. Celebrating their 20th anniversary in 2025, The Baboon Show embarked on an extensive European tour, performing in nine countries with a total of 27 concerts. ([thebaboonshow.com](https://thebaboonshow.com/about-us/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Voidspire
bands.description: Voidspire is an American metal band known for their unique blend of atmospheric black metal, cosmic horror themes, and esoteric lyrics. Formed in 2024 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany, the band consists of two members: Duratror (guitars, rhythm) and Vornoth (vocals, lead guitars, bass). Their music delves into themes of cosmic horror, nihilism, esotericism, occultism, and death, creating a haunting and immersive listening experience. As of now, Voidspire remains unsigned and independent, allowing them creative freedom in their musical endeavors.

bands.name: Silent Planet
bands.description: Silent Planet is an American metalcore band formed in Azusa, California, in 2009. Their name is inspired by C.S. Lewis' science fiction novel "Out of the Silent Planet." The current lineup includes vocalist Garrett Russell, guitarist Mitchell Stark, drummer Alex Camarena, and bassist Nick Pocock. The band is known for their intricate sound, blending metalcore with progressive elements and post-rock textures. Their lyrics delve into themes such as war, psychology, religion, and politics, reflecting a commitment to thought-provoking content. Silent Planet has released five studio albums: "The Night God Slept" (2014), "Everything Was Sound" (2016), "When the End Began" (2018), "Iridescent" (2021), and "Superbloom" (2023). "Superbloom," released on November 3, 2023, is their latest album. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superbloom_%28Silent_Planet_album%29?utm_source=openai)) The band has toured with acts like Norma Jean, Beartooth, and For Today, and has been recognized for their dynamic performances and impactful music. ([heavymetal.ch](https://www.heavymetal.ch/artists/2950/silent-planet?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: In Extremo
bands.description: In Extremo is a German medieval metal band formed in Berlin in 1995. Their music uniquely blends heavy metal with traditional medieval songs, incorporating instruments such as bagpipes, harp, hurdy-gurdy, and shawm. The band is known for performing in medieval attire and using aliases for their members. Their repertoire includes both original compositions and versions of traditional ballads in various languages, including Latin and Old High German. Over the years, In Extremo has released numerous albums, with their third studio album, "Weckt die Toten!" (1998), achieving significant success. Their 2005 album, "Mein rasend Herz," peaked at number 3 on the German album charts. In 2024, they announced their 13th studio album, "Wolkenschieber," set for release on September 6, 2024. ([reflectionsofdarkness.com](https://www.reflectionsofdarkness.com/releases/23315-in-extremo-announce-new-studio-album-wolkenschieber-for-september-6-2024?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Michael Robert Rhein
members.role: Vocals, Cittern, Harp, Darbuka, Davul, Binioù, Guitar, Piccolo, Harmonica

members.name: Marco Ernst-Felix Zorzytzky
members.role: German Bagpipes, Shawm, Flute, Uilleann Pipes, Hurdy-Gurdy

bands.name: Drowning Pool
bands.description: Drowning Pool is an American rock band formed in Dallas, Texas, in 1996. The band was named after the 1975 film "The Drowning Pool." The original lineup consisted of guitarist C.J. Pierce, drummer Mike Luce, and bassist Stevie Benton. They gained prominence with their debut album, "Sinner," released in 2001, which achieved platinum status within six weeks. The album featured the hit single "Bodies," which became their most popular song. Tragically, original vocalist Dave Williams passed away on August 14, 2002, due to heart disease. Following Williams' death, the band underwent several lineup changes. Jason "Gong" Jones replaced Williams in 2003 and recorded the album "Desensitized" (2004) before departing in 2005. Ryan McCombs, formerly of SOiL, joined in 2005, contributing to "Full Circle" (2007) and "Drowning Pool" (2010). McCombs left in 2011 to rejoin SOiL. Jasen Moreno took over as lead vocalist in 2012, recording "Resilience" (2013), "Hellelujah" (2016), and "Strike a Nerve" (2022). In March 2023, McCombs rejoined the band, replacing Moreno. Drowning Pool's music is characterized by a blend of alternative metal, nu metal, and post-grunge elements. Their energetic sound and dynamic performances have solidified their place in the rock music scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drowning_Pool?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Lowen
bands.description:
Lowen is a London-based heavy metal band formed in 2017 by vocalist and multi-instrumentalist Nina Saeidi and guitarist Shem Lucas. Saeidi, born to Iranian refugee parents, sought to create a musical act that blends metal with Middle Eastern elements, reflecting her heritage and the challenges faced by women in Iran, where playing metal is illegal and unaccompanied female singing is punishable by execution. The band's name, "Lowen," is inspired by the Lion Hunt of Ashurbanipal and symbolizes a balance between Eastern and Western cultures, with the lion representing chaos and power in the East and pride in the West.

Their debut album, "A Crypt in the Stars," was released in 2018, recorded in just 12 hours, and drew inspiration from Mesopotamian themes and the Ziggurat of Ur. In 2021, they released the EP "Unceasing Lamentations," featuring acoustic folk improvisations. Their second album, "Do Not Go to War With the Demons of Mazandaran," released in October 2024, is inspired by the Shahnameh's Div-e Sepid and contemporary issues like the Woman, Life, Freedom movement. The album includes tracks like "Corruption on Earth," referencing a legal term used by the Iranian government against political prisoners sentenced to death. The band has been recognized for their unique fusion of progressive, doom, death, and stoner metal with Middle Eastern music, consulting musicologists to incorporate microtonal elements into their sound. Saeidi's vocals, sung in English, Farsi, Akkadian, and Sumerian, are influenced by traditional Iranian music, employing the Tahrir technique. The band's lyrics draw inspiration from ancient mythology, science fiction, and fantasy. In 2025, they toured with Zakk Sabbath and performed at festivals like Download and ArcTanGent. As of August 2025, they are working on their third album, which will include samples of Israeli bombs dropped in Iran in June 2025.

members.name: Nina Saeidi
members.role: Lead Vocals, Folk Instruments (Santur, Daf, Shruti Box)

bands.name: Blood Fire Death – A Tribute To Quorthon And The Music Of Bathory
bands.description: Blood Fire Death – A Tribute to Quorthon and the Music of Bathory is a collaborative project that brings together prominent figures from the black metal scene to honor the legacy of Thomas "Quorthon" Forsberg, the mastermind behind Bathory. This tribute aims to faithfully recreate the atmosphere and energy of Bathory's Viking era, focusing on albums like "Hammerheart," "Twilight of the Gods," and "Blood on Ice." The project features a lineup of esteemed musicians, including Erik Danielsson (Watain) on vocals, Ivar Bjørnson (Enslaved) and Blasphemer (Vltimas, ex-Mayhem) on guitars, Apollyon (Aura Noir) on bass and vocals, and Faust (Djevel, ex-Emperor) on drums. Together, they deliver powerful renditions of Bathory's classics, accompanied by guest appearances from artists such as Grutle Kjellson (Enslaved), Gaahl (Trelldom, ex-Gorgoroth), and Frederick Melander (ex-Bathory). The project has been showcased at various festivals, including the Beyond the Gates Festival in 2024 and the Mystic Festival in 2025, receiving acclaim for its authentic and energetic performances.

bands.name: Dam
bands.description: Dam is a heavy metal band from Quito, Ecuador, formed in 2002. The band consists of Dario Jarrín on bass, Alejandro Izurieta on vocals, Alexis Jarrín on guitar, and Esteban Caro on drums. They have released at least one album, "Purity (The Darwinian Paradox)", under Candlelight Records.

bands.name: Uada
bands.description:
Uada is an American black metal band from Portland, Oregon, formed in 2014. The band's name, "Uada," is Latin for "haunted." ([wikitia.com](https://wikitia.com/wiki/Uada?utm_source=openai)) They are known for their anonymous aesthetic, performing in black hoods to focus on the music rather than individual identities. ([wweek.com](https://www.wweek.com/music/2018/06/27/uada-is-portlands-anonymous-metal-collective-but-is-it-really-possible-for-a-band-not-to-have-an-image/?utm_source=openai))

Their musical style is characterized as melodic black metal, drawing influences from bands like Dissection and Mgła. Uada's discography includes four albums:

- "Devoid of Light" (2016)
- "Cult of a Dying Sun" (2018)
- "Djinn" (2020)
- "Crepuscule Natura" (2023)

"Crepuscule Natura" continues their tradition of blending raw black metal with spectral melodies, featuring tracks like "The Abyss Gazing Back" and "Through the Wax and Through the Wane." ([uadaband.com](https://uadaband.com/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of:

- Jake Superchi (vocals, guitar)
- Nate Verschoor (bass)
- Josiah Babcock (drums)

Former members include James Sloan (guitar), Mike Beck (bass), Trevor Matthews (drums), Robb Bockman (bass), and Brent Boutté (drums). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Uada/3540409911?utm_source=openai))

Uada has toured extensively, performing at festivals like Party.San and Summer Breeze, and has been featured in publications such as Kerrang! and Decibel Magazine. ([uadaband.com](https://uadaband.com/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website: ([uadaband.com](https://uadaband.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Crimson Glory
bands.description: Crimson Glory is an American heavy metal band formed in 1983 in Sarasota, Florida. Initially known as Pierced Arrow and later Beowulf, the band adopted the name Crimson Glory in 1983. They gained prominence in the mid-1980s as pioneers of the American progressive metal movement, alongside bands like Queensrÿche and Dream Theater. The classic lineup featured vocalist Midnight, guitarists Jon Drenning and Ben Jackson, bassist Jeff Lords, and drummer Dana Burnell. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1986, showcased tight dual-lead harmonies and soaring vocals, setting the stage for their rise in the metal scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimson_Glory?utm_source=openai)) In 1988, they released "Transcendence," which included the hit single "Lonely." This album is often cited as one of the greatest progressive metal albums of all time. The band toured extensively, sharing stages with Metallica, Ozzy Osbourne, and Queensrÿche. After a hiatus, Crimson Glory reunited in 2023 with new vocalist Travis Wills and guitarist Mark "Borgy" Borgmeyer. They released the single "Triskaideka" and announced plans for a new album in late 2025 or early 2026. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimson_Glory?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: W.a.s.p.
bands.description:
W.A.S.P. is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1982. Founded by vocalist and bassist Blackie Lawless, the band quickly gained notoriety for their provocative live performances and explicit lyrics, which often drew comparisons to shock rock pioneers like Alice Cooper. Their self-titled debut album, released in 1984, featured the controversial single "Animal (F**k Like a Beast)" and established them as a formidable force in the heavy metal scene. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W.A.S.P._%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Throughout the 1980s, W.A.S.P. released several successful albums, including "The Last Command" (1985) and "Inside the Electric Circus" (1986). The band's music is characterized by a blend of heavy metal and glam metal, with anthemic choruses and energetic guitar riffs. In 1992, they released "The Crimson Idol," a concept album that received critical acclaim and is often regarded as one of their best works. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W.A.S.P._%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Over the years, W.A.S.P. has undergone several lineup changes, with Blackie Lawless remaining the constant member. As of 2025, the current lineup includes:

- Blackie Lawless – lead vocals, rhythm guitar, keyboards, percussion (1982–present)
- Mike Duda – bass, backing vocals (1995–present)
- Doug Blair – lead guitar, backing vocals (2006–present; touring 1992 and 2001)
- Aquiles Priester – drums (2017–present)

W.A.S.P. continues to tour and record new material, maintaining a dedicated fan base worldwide. Their music remains influential in the heavy metal genre, known for its theatrical live shows and unapologetic lyrics. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/W.A.S.P._%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Blackie Lawless
members.role: Lead Vocals, Rhythm Guitar, Keyboards, Percussion

bands.name: D.t.
bands.description: D.T. is an American metal project led by Derek Todaro, known for his work in various underground metal bands. Operating under the moniker D.T., Todaro has been involved in multiple musical endeavors, including projects like Spectral Torture and Pitch Black Tomb. In 2023, he released "Demo I" under the D.T. name, showcasing his versatility and commitment to the metal genre. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/D._T./800352?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Eshwar
bands.description: Eshwar is an Indian metal band that has been active since 2010. The band is known for its unique blend of traditional Indian music with heavy metal, creating a distinctive sound that sets them apart in the metal scene. Over the years, Eshwar has released several singles and albums, gaining a dedicated fan base both domestically and internationally. Their music often explores themes rooted in Indian mythology and culture, offering a fresh perspective within the metal genre. The band's lineup has evolved over time, with the current members contributing to their dynamic and evolving sound.

bands.name: Madsen
bands.description: Madsen is a German rock band formed in 2004 in Priesseck, a district of Clenze in the Wendland region. The band comprises three brothers—Sebastian (vocals and guitar), Johannes (guitar), and Sascha (drums)—along with bassist Niko Maurer and keyboardist Folkert Jahnke. Initially, the Madsen brothers were part of bands like Alice's Gun and Hoerstuatz, the latter experimenting with hip-hop and crossover elements. In 2004, they rebranded as Madsen, focusing on punk and rock genres. Their self-titled debut album, released in 2005, peaked at No. 23 on the German charts, leading to performances at major festivals such as Rock am Ring and Nova Rock. The band's music blends elements of rock, punk, and pop, with lyrics predominantly in German. They have released several albums, including "Goodbye Logik" (2006), "Frieden im Krieg" (2008), "Labyrinth" (2010), "Wo es beginnt" (2012), "Kompass" (2015), "Lichtjahre" (2018), "Na Gut Dann Nicht" (2020), "Hollywood" (2023), and "Die Weihnachtsplatte" (2024). Madsen is known for their energetic performances and commitment to anti-racist causes, often participating in campaigns against right-wing extremism. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madsen_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Lightchapter
bands.description: Lightchapter is a Danish melodic death metal band formed in 2019 in Aarhus, Midtjylland. The band comprises Mikkel Ottosen (vocals, guitars), Anders Berg (guitars), Kalle Herborg (bass), and Tobias Høst (drums). They have released several singles and two full-length albums: "Time to Obey" (2023) and "Where All Hope Begins" (2025). Their music is characterized by aggressive guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and intense vocals, drawing influences from bands like At the Gates and Dark Tranquillity. Lyrically, they explore themes of personal struggle, societal issues, and introspection. The band has been active in the Danish metal scene, performing at various venues and festivals, and has received support from local music grants to further their development.

bands.name: Brutal Thin
bands.description: Brutal Thin is a Spanish metal band formed in 1991 in Algeciras, Andalusia. Initially, they played thrash and death metal, but over time, their style evolved to incorporate groove metal and alternative rock elements. Their lyrics often address themes such as society, violence, drugs, and anti-Christianity. The band has released several albums, including "La cultura del miedo" (1997), "Nuevo catálogo sobre demonología moderna" (2005), and "Tercera comunión" (1999). In December 2024, they released a single titled "El dictador" through Maldito Records. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Brutal_Thin/40277?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Protest The Hero
bands.description: Protest the Hero is a Canadian progressive metal band from Whitby, Ontario, formed in 1999. Originally known as Happy Go Lucky, they changed their name to Protest the Hero in 2001 and released their debut EP, "Search for the Truth," in 2002. Their first full-length album, "Kezia," was released in 2005, followed by "Fortress" in 2008. The band's style has evolved from post-hardcore to progressive metal, incorporating elements of mathcore and metalcore. They have been recognized with awards such as the 2014 Juno Award for Metal/Hard Music Album of the Year for "Volition." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protest_the_Hero?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Pan Lynx
bands.description: Pan Lynx is a Czech music and art project founded by Michal Skořepa, formerly of the band Stroy. The project introduces a unique blend of grunge, rock, and alternative metal, characterized by raw guitar riffs, expressive vocals, and atmospheric compositions. Their debut album, "Kdo se bojí, musí do lesa" ("Who is Afraid, Must Go to the Forest"), showcases Skořepa's versatility, as he performs most of the instruments and vocals, with guest appearances from notable artists like Michael Kocáb and Michal Pavlíček. The music draws inspiration from bands such as Pražský Výběr, Queen, and Alice In Chains. For live performances, Pan Lynx collaborates with accomplished musicians, including Jan Lichtenberg (guitar), Josh Root (guitar), Filip Vavřička (keyboards), Zdeněk Imramovský (bass), and Luboš Samek (drums). The project is also closely associated with Skořepa's distinctive artistic style, evident in the hand-drawn music videos and merchandise. Pan Lynx made their live debut at the Brutal Assault festival in 2024. ([brutalassault.cz](https://brutalassault.cz/cs/band/pan-lynx?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Tankard
bands.description:
Tankard is a German thrash metal band formed in Frankfurt in 1982. Alongside Kreator, Destruction, and Sodom, they are often considered part of the "Big Four" of Teutonic thrash metal. The band's music is characterized by fast-paced thrash metal with themes centered around alcohol, particularly beer, leading them to self-proclaim as "Kings of Beer." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tankard_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Their debut album, "Zombie Attack," was released in 1986 under Noise Records. This was followed by "Chemical Invasion" in 1987, which featured cover art by Sebastian Krüger. The band's popularity grew with "The Morning After" in 1988, marking their first significant commercial success. In 1989, they released the "Alien" EP, introducing their green alien mascot. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tankard_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Over the years, Tankard has maintained a consistent lineup, with Andreas "Gerre" Geremia on vocals, Frank Thorwarth on bass, and Olaf Zissel on drums. Guitarist Andreas Gutjahr joined in 1999, solidifying the current formation. Their 17th studio album, "One Foot in the Grave," was released on June 2, 2017, followed by "Pavlov's Dawgs" on September 30, 2022. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tankard_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Tankard's discography includes notable albums such as "Zombie Attack" (1986), "Chemical Invasion" (1987), "The Morning After" (1988), "The Meaning of Life" (1990), "Stone Cold Sober" (1992), "Two-Faced" (1994), "The Tankard" (1995), "Himbeergeist Zum Frühstück" (1996), "Disco Destroyer" (1998), "Kings of Beer" (2000), "B-Day" (2002), "Vol(l)ume 14" (2008), "A Girl Called Cerveza" (2012), "R.I.B." (2014), "One Foot in the Grave" (2017), and "Pavlov's Dawgs" (2022). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tankard_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [tankard.info](https://tankard.info).

bands.name: Cutterred Flesh
bands.description:
Cutterred Flesh is a death metal band from Karlovy Vary, Czechia, formed in 2001. Initially known for their brutal death metal style, they have evolved to incorporate elements of deathcore in their music. The band's themes often revolve around annihilation, disease, and gore. Their discography includes several full-length albums:

- **Torture Is Medicine** (2007): Their debut album, establishing their presence in the death metal scene.

- **Cause the Apocalypse** (2010): Continued their exploration of intense and aggressive soundscapes.

- **Code: Violence** (2018): Showcased their evolving style with a mix of brutality and technicality.

- **Sharing Is Caring** (2022): Released as a limited edition 12" vinyl, reflecting their commitment to the genre.

- **Love at First Bite** (2024): Their latest album, released on May 24, 2024, under Transcending Obscurity Records. The album features tracks like "Xenomorphic Annihilation: Earth Ravaged" and "Human Protein Concentrate," highlighting their continued evolution in the death metal scene. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Cutterred_Flesh/Love_at_First_Bite/1219277?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Vitalij V. Novák on guitars and vocals, Miroslav Frček on drums, Zdeněk on bass, and David Krombholz on guitars. Notably, bassist Ondrej Klaban joined the band in 2023. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/artists/Klabi/634144?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website.

bands.name: Ratos De Porão
bands.description: Ratos de Porão is a Brazilian crossover thrash band formed in São Paulo in 1981. They are one of the most influential and enduring bands in the Brazilian punk and metal scenes. The band's lineup has remained remarkably consistent, with João Gordo on vocals and Jão on guitar and drums. Their music blends elements of hardcore punk and thrash metal, characterized by aggressive riffs and politically charged lyrics. Over the years, Ratos de Porão has released numerous albums, including "Crucificados pelo Sistema" (1984), "Descanse em Paz" (1986), and "Carniceria Tropical" (1996). They have toured extensively in South America, North America, Asia, and Europe, earning a dedicated international following. Their official website is [rdpeido.com.br](https://rdpeido.com.br/).

bands.name: Myrkur
bands.description: Myrkur is a Danish musical project led by singer and multi-instrumentalist Amalie Bruun, blending elements of black metal with traditional Scandinavian folk music. Formed in 2013, Bruun initially kept her identity secret, releasing a self-titled EP in 2014 that showcased her vocals, guitar, and bass skills, with drum programming by Rex Myrnur. The project gained significant attention with the release of the debut album "M" in 2015, produced by Kristoffer Rygg of Ulver, featuring guest musicians from Mayhem and Nidingr. In 2016, Myrkur released "Mausoleum," a live album recorded at the Emanuel Vigeland Mausoleum in Oslo, Norway, offering acoustic and choral reinterpretations of earlier material. The second full-length album, "Mareridt," released in 2017, received critical acclaim and won the "Album of the Year" award at Metal Hammer's Golden Gods Awards in 2018. In 2020, Bruun released "Folkesange," an album entirely composed of traditional Scandinavian folk songs performed with period instruments, reflecting a deep connection to her Nordic heritage. The most recent album, "Spine," was released on October 20, 2023, through Relapse Records, continuing to explore the fusion of black metal and folk elements. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Myrkur?utm_source=openai))

members.name: Amalie Bruun
members.role: Vocals, Guitars, Bass, Keyboards, Piano, Organ, Violin, Nyckelharpa, Percussion (2013–Present)

bands.name: Vhäldemar
bands.description: Vhäldemar is a Spanish power metal band formed in 1999 in Barakaldo, Vizcaya. The group was established by guitarist Pedro J. Monge and vocalist/guitarist Carlos Escudero. They were soon joined by bassist Óscar Cuadrado and drummer Eduardo Martínez, who previously played in the thrash metal band Anarko. Their debut album, "Fight to the End," was released in March 2002 under Arise Records, followed by "I Made My Own Hell" in November 2003. In 2007, they headlined the Bilbao BBK Live Festival and released their third album, "Metal of the World." The band has since released several more albums, including "Shadows of Combat" (2013), "Against All Kings" (2017), "Straight to Hell" (2020), and "Sanctuary of Death" (2024). Their music is characterized by aggressive and fast-paced power metal, often compared to bands like Manowar and Gamma Ray. ([vhaldemar.net](https://www.vhaldemar.net/biografia/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Crypta
bands.description: Crypta is a Brazilian death metal band formed in São Paulo in 2019 by former Nervosa members Fernanda Lira (bass, vocals) and Luana Dametto (drums). They were later joined by guitarist Tainá Bergamaschi. The band signed with Napalm Records and released their debut album, "Echoes of the Soul," in 2021, which received critical acclaim and charted in multiple countries. In 2023, they released their second album, "Shades of Sorrow," continuing their exploration of death metal with elements of black metal. The band's lineup has seen changes, including the departure of guitarist Sonia Anubis in 2022 and the addition of guitarist Jéssica di Falchi. Despite these changes, Crypta has maintained a strong presence in the metal scene, performing at major festivals like Wacken Open Air and Rock in Rio.

bands.name: Docka Pussel
bands.description: Docka Pussel is a Swedish metal band that emerged in 2024, blending elements of rock and metal with various other styles to create a unique and original sound. The band gained recognition by winning the II Concurso Musical Guillena Suena in June 2024, where they impressed audiences with their powerful live performances. ([guillena.org](https://guillena.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/no-139-baja.pdf?utm_source=openai)) In July 2024, they released their debut full-length album, "Minnen," which features tracks like "Det finns inget att göra," "Tårar från en bortglömd docka," and "Minnenas ängel." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Suffering_from_Apathy/Minnen/1257163?utm_source=openai)) The current lineup includes Docka on drums and vocals, and Matacuri on guitars, bass, vocals, and lyrics. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Suffering_from_Apathy/3540548148?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Pussyliquor
bands.description: "Pussyliquor" is a death metal band from the United States, known for their aggressive sound and provocative name. Formed in the early 2000s, they quickly gained attention in the underground metal scene. Their music is characterized by fast tempos, guttural vocals, and intricate guitar work, drawing influences from classic death metal bands. The band has released several demos and EPs, building a dedicated fanbase. They are recognized for their energetic live performances and have toured extensively across the country. Despite their controversial name, "Pussyliquor" has maintained a reputation for musical integrity and has contributed to the evolution of the death metal genre.

bands.name: Double Square
bands.description: Double Square is a Greek thrash metal and hardcore band formed in Athens in 2004. The band has been active since its formation and is currently unsigned. As of now, there is no detailed information available regarding their discography, lineup, or musical style.

bands.name: Jolly Joker
bands.description:
Jolly Joker is a Spanish glam and hard rock band formed in 2009. Since their inception, they've been dedicated to leading the glam, sleazy, and hard rock scenes both in Spain and internationally. Over the years, they've shared stages with iconic bands such as Adam Bomb, The Quireboys, Hardcore Superstar, L.A. Guns, and Backyard Babies. They've also performed at renowned festivals like Leyendas del Rock. Their discography includes:

- **Sex Booze & Tattoos** (2012): Their debut album, showcasing their raw energy and hard rock roots.

- **Here Come The Jokers!!** (2016): Released under The Fish Factory label, this album solidified their presence in the rock scene.

- **Never Say Forever** (2018): Continuing their hard rock journey, this album received positive reviews for its energetic tracks.

- **Loud & Proud** (2022): Their fourth album, released through Dark Rails Records, marked a significant milestone in their career. The album was produced by Manuel Tomás, a Grammy-winning producer, and Carlos Gómez. The cover art was designed by David Octane. ([metalfamily.es](https://metalfamily.es/jolly-joker-pone-fecha-al-inicio-del-loud-proud-tour/?utm_source=openai))

In 2025, they released their self-titled album, "Jolly Joker," under ON FIRE Records, featuring 10 tracks that continue their tradition of high-energy rock music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/album/jolly-joker/1792303805?utm_source=openai))

Their music is available on various platforms, including Apple Music. ([music.apple.com](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/jolly-joker/446408237?utm_source=openai))

Jolly Joker's dynamic performances and dedication to their craft have established them as a leading force in the Spanish rock scene.

bands.name: Mind Driller
bands.description:
Mind Driller is a Spanish industrial metal band formed in 2011 in Alicante by guitarist Javier Oriente, known for his work with Blood, Hasswut, and Stoneheads. The band is characterized by its powerful and varied industrial metal sound, featuring three vocalists: V Stone, Daniel N.Q., and Estefanía Aledo. Their lyrics are primarily in Spanish, English, and German.

Their discography includes:

- **Red Industrial** (2012): Their debut album, released under Mutant-e Records, was recorded and produced by the band and later remastered by Alexander Krull in Germany.

- **Zirkus** (2015): The second album, also remastered by Krull, accompanied by an extensive tour in Spain and Germany.

- **Involution** (2019): Produced by Mind Driller and Raúl Abellán, mixed by Abellán, and mastered by Marco D'Agostino, released under Art Gates Records.

- **inBolution** (2020): An EP featuring instrumental tracks, remixes, and new singles, released under Art Gates Records.

- **The Void** (2024): Their fourth studio album, produced by Raúl Abellán and released under Art Gates Records, with singles "Game Over," "The Fallout," and "End Of The World."

Mind Driller has shared stages with bands like Oomph! in Madrid and Barcelona, and performed in German cities such as Olpe, Krefeld, and Osnabrück. Their music is often compared to Rammstein, though they believe they offer more than the typical industrial metal sound.

bands.name: Dragonfly
bands.description: Dragonfly is a heavy/power metal band formed in 2000 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Initially active in Buenos Aires, the band relocated to Valencia, Spain, in the Valencian Community. Their music is characterized by themes of fantasy, sadness, and love. They have released several albums, including "Alma Irae" in 2009 and "El guardián del tiempo" in 2019. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Dragonfly/Alma_Irae/202380?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Azrael
bands.description: Azrael is a Spanish heavy metal band formed in Granada in 1991. They gained international recognition, especially in Latin America, with their debut album "Nada Por Nadie" in 1996. The band has since released several albums, including "Futuro" (1998), "Mafia" (2000), "IV Dimensión" (2001), "Libre" (2007), "Metal Arena" (2010), "Código Infinito" (2015), "Azrael" (2019), "Dimensión V" (2023), and "Aquelarre" (2025). Their music has evolved over the years, maintaining a distinctive style that blends elements of heavy metal with power and speed metal influences. Azrael has shared stages with notable bands such as Saxon, Mercyful Fate, and Mägo De Oz. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azrael_%28banda%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Dry River
bands.description: Dry River is a Spanish progressive rock band from Castellón, formed in 2010. Their music blends elements of progressive rock, classic heavy metal, and melodic rock, drawing influences from bands like Dream Theater, Queen, Deep Purple, Pink Floyd, and Iron Maiden. ([themetalcircus.com](https://www.themetalcircus.com/entrevistas/dry-river-somos-un-pais-extrano-hay-propuestas-musicales-realmente-brillantes-que-deberian-estar-moviendose-por-toda-la-peninsula-a-bombo-y-platillo-y-que-a-duras-penas-consiguen-cubrir-gastos/?utm_source=openai)) The band released their debut album, "El Circo de la Tierra," in 2012, showcasing their intricate compositions and dynamic performances. ([themetalcircus.com](https://www.themetalcircus.com/noticias/dry-river-estrenan-disco-debut/?utm_source=openai)) They have since gained recognition in the Spanish rock scene, performing at notable festivals such as Costa de Fuego in Benicàssim. ([themetalcircus.com](https://www.themetalcircus.com/noticias/novedades-de-dry-river/?utm_source=openai)) Their music is available on various streaming platforms, including Spotify.

bands.name: Querbeat
bands.description: Querbeat is a German pop band formed in 2001 in Bonn. Initially a school band at the Kardinal-Frings-Gymnasium, they began by performing at local events in Bonn and Cologne. In 2007, they expanded their reach by participating in the Cologne Carnival, gaining recognition through appearances on WDR radio and television programs. Over the years, Querbeat has released several albums, including "Cuba Colonia" (2014), featuring Latin American-style covers of popular Carnival songs, and "Fettes Q" (2016), their first album of original compositions. Their 2018 album "Randale & Hurra" marked their first Top 10 entry in the German Music Charts. In 2021, they released "Radikal Positiv," which debuted at number 2 on the charts. The band is known for their energetic live performances and has played at major German festivals such as Lollapalooza Berlin, Hurricane Festival, and OpenAir St. Gallen. They also organized their own festival, "Randale & Freunde," in Bonn in 2022 and 2023, attracting large audiences. In 2023, they released the politically charged single "Kein Kölsch für Nazis," collaborating with Peter Brings and Lugatti & 9ine to take a stand against right-wing extremism.

bands.name: Håndgemeng
bands.description:
Håndgemeng is a heavy metal band from Drøbak, Norway, formed in 2017. The band's name translates to "brawl" or "fistfight," reflecting their aggressive and energetic musical style. Their sound is characterized as "Doom'n'Roll," blending elements of stoner, doom, hardcore, black metal, grunge, and traditional metal. ([jamyetimusicblog.com](https://jamyetimusicblog.com/handgemeng-satanic-panic-attack/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes:

- **Martin Wennberg** – Vocals
- **Charlie Ytterli** – Guitars
- **Ola Holseth** – Drums
- **Kim Grannes** – Bass
- **Magnus Halvorsen** – Guitars

Håndgemeng's discography includes:

- **"Motorcycle Death Cult"** (EP, 2019)
- **"Grim Riffer"** (Album, 2020)
- **"Ultraritual"** (Album, 2023)
- **"Satanic Panic Attack"** (Album, 2025)

"Satanic Panic Attack," released on April 11, 2025, is their latest album. The album features tracks like "The Cauldron Born" and "Medieval Knievel," showcasing the band's ability to seamlessly mix hook-driven riffs and melodic arrangements. ([jamyetimusicblog.com](https://jamyetimusicblog.com/handgemeng-satanic-panic-attack/?utm_source=openai))

Håndgemeng has toured extensively across Norway and Europe, sharing stages with prominent bands and performing at various festivals. Their energetic live shows have been praised for their intensity and entertainment value. ([visitnorway.no](https://www.visitnorway.no/event/h%C3%A5ndgemeng/460181/?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website: ([handgemeng.com](https://www.handgemeng.com/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: See You In Hell
bands.description: "See You In Hell" is a heavy metal band from Baltimore, Maryland, formed in 2020. The band emerged from the local metal scene, bringing together musicians with a shared passion for traditional heavy metal sounds. Their music is characterized by powerful vocals, aggressive guitar riffs, and a rhythm section that drives their energetic performances. In July 2025, they released their debut album, also titled "See You In Hell," which showcases their commitment to the classic heavy metal genre. The album features tracks like "Breathe In, Breathe Out" and "Untitled 03//Obelisk," reflecting the band's dedication to delivering raw and authentic metal music. ([seeyouinhell4ever.bandcamp.com](https://seeyouinhell4ever.bandcamp.com/album/see-you-in-hell?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Omnium Gatherum
bands.description:
Omnium Gatherum is a Finnish melodic death metal band formed in 1996 in Kotka, Finland. The band's name, "Omnium Gatherum," translates to "a collection of all things," reflecting their diverse musical influences. Their music is characterized by a blend of melodic death metal with progressive elements, drawing inspiration from bands like At the Gates, In Flames, Dissection, Dark Tranquillity, Iron Maiden, Death, Anathema, and Megadeth. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omnium_Gatherum?utm_source=openai))

The band released their debut full-length album, "Spirits and August Light," in April 2003, which garnered attention within the underground metal community. They signed with Nuclear Blast in 2004 and released their second album, "Years in Waste," in November 2004. In 2006, vocalist Antti Filppu was replaced by Jukka Pelkonen. Their 2007 album, "Stuck Here on Snakes Way," marked a more technical and progressive direction for the band. In 2016, they released "Grey Heavens," followed by "Origin" in 2021. Their latest album, "May the Bridges We Burn Light the Way," was released on November 7, 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omnium_Gatherum?utm_source=openai))

Omnium Gatherum's music is known for its melodic death metal roots, incorporating progressive elements that set them apart in the genre. Their lyrics often explore themes of humanity, civilization, personal subjects, and emotions. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Omnium_Gatherum/3306?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes:

- Jukka Pelkonen – vocals
- Markus Vanhala – guitars and clean vocals
- Aapo Koivisto – keyboards
- Mikko Kivistö – bass and clean vocals
- Atte Pesonen – drums

For more information, visit their official website at omniumgatherum.org. ([omniumgatherum.org](https://www.omniumgatherum.org/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Cyclone
bands.description: Cyclone is a Belgian thrash metal band formed in 1981 in Vilvoorde, Flemish Brabant. Originally known as Centurion, they changed their name to Cyclone in 1982. The band's lineup has evolved over the years, with notable members including guitarist Didier Kapelle, bassist Geert Vanoverloop, and drummer Giancarlo Langhendries.
