Cyclone's music is characterized by aggressive riffs and high-pitched vocals, drawing comparisons to bands like Overkill, Metallica, and Exodus. Their discography includes "Brutal Destruction" (1986) and "Inferior to None" (1990). After a hiatus, Cyclone reunited in 2019 and released their first new song in 35 years, "Eliminate," in November 2025. ([metalanarchy.com](https://metalanarchy.com/2025/11/06/cyclone-release-first-new-song-in-35-years-eliminate/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Henret
bands.description: Henret is a dynamic metal band from Copenhagen, Denmark, formed in 2019. The band's name, "Henret," translates to "execute" in Danish, reflecting the intensity and aggression inherent in their music. Drawing inspiration from bands like Kublai Khan TX and Knocked Loose, Henret blends elements of hardcore, metalcore, and deathcore to create a sound characterized by heavy riffs, crushing breakdowns, and high-energy performances. Their debut EP, "Abandon Hope," released in February 2023, received critical acclaim and established them as a formidable presence in the Danish metal scene. The EP was recorded at Slåskamp Studios and mixed and mastered by Chris Kreutzfeldt. The band has since performed at notable events such as the UHØRT Festival and shared stages with prominent acts like Cabal and EYES. In September 2025, Henret released their follow-up EP, "Depths Below," further solidifying their reputation for delivering raw and powerful music. The EP continues to showcase their aggressive sound and unyielding intensity, creating shows packed with mosh pits and headbanging. Henret's relentless energy and commitment to their craft have made them a rising force in the metal community.

bands.name: Shakra
bands.description:
Shakra is a Swiss hard rock and heavy metal band formed in the early 1990s. Originally known as Ruckus, they changed their name to Shakra in 1995. The band's music is characterized by powerful guitar riffs, melodic hooks, and energetic performances, drawing comparisons to fellow Swiss rock bands like Gotthard and Krokus. Over the years, Shakra has built a strong reputation in the European rock scene, sharing stages with renowned acts such as Iron Maiden, HammerFall, Stratovarius, and Guns N' Roses. ([react.metalcountdown.com](https://react.metalcountdown.com/artists/shakra?utm_source=openai))

Their discography includes several studio albums, with their thirteenth studio album, "Invincible," released on June 9, 2023. The album features twelve tracks that showcase the band's dynamic signature sound, blending hard rock and heavy metal elements. ([metal-rules.com](https://www.metal-rules.com/2023/06/10/mark-fox-of-shakra-on-new-album-invincible-its-important-to-stick-with-our-dynamic-signature-sound/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup consists of vocalist Mark Fox, guitarist Thom Blunier, guitarist Thomas Muster, bassist Dominik Pfister, and drummer Roger Tanner. ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shakra?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Batushka
bands.description: Batushka is a Polish black metal band formed in 2015 by multi-instrumentalist Krzysztof "Derph" Drabikowski in Białystok. The band's music and lyrics, written exclusively in Church Slavonic, draw inspiration from the Eastern Orthodox Church. Members perform in religious attire to maintain anonymity, and they utilize eight-string guitars, distinguishing them from many other black metal bands. Their debut album, "Litourgiya," released in December 2015, received critical acclaim and commercial success in Poland. In 2018, a dispute between Drabikowski and vocalist Bartłomiej "Bart" Krysiuk led to Krysiuk forming his own version of Batushka, resulting in two separate entities using the same name. In May 2024, Polish courts ruled in favor of Drabikowski, granting him exclusive rights to the Batushka name. Following this ruling, Krysiuk's band rebranded as Patriarkh in September 2024. Drabikowski's Batushka continues to perform and release music under the original name.

bands.name: Kabrones
bands.description:
Kabrones is a Spanish metal band formed in 2023, featuring former members of the renowned group Mägo de Oz. The lineup includes Carlitos (Juan Carlos Marín López) on lead guitar, Salva (Salvador Rogelio García Sáenz) on bass, and Frank (Francisco Javier Octavio Alejandro Gómez de la Serna Alvariño) on rhythm guitar. These musicians bring a wealth of experience from their previous work with Mägo de Oz, where they contributed to various albums and live performances. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/M%C3%A4go_de_Oz?utm_source=openai))

Kabrones' musical style is characterized by a blend of heavy metal and folk elements, reminiscent of their previous band's sound. Their compositions often incorporate intricate guitar melodies, dynamic rhythms, and thematic lyrics that explore a range of subjects. The band's debut single, "Un nuevo comienzo," released in 2020, marked their entry into the metal scene, followed by subsequent singles such as "Océanos de soledad" and "Keltoi." These tracks showcase their commitment to delivering high-quality metal music with a fresh perspective.

As of November 2025, Kabrones continues to develop their musical identity, drawing from their rich history in the Spanish metal scene. Their work reflects a dedication to the genre, blending traditional metal sounds with contemporary influences to create a distinctive and engaging listening experience.

bands.name: H2o
bands.description: H2O is an American hardcore punk band formed in New York City in 1994. The band was founded by lead vocalist Toby Morse, who had previously worked as a roadie for Sick of It All. He was joined by guitarist Rusty Pistachio, bassist Eric Rice, drummer Todd Friend, and guitarist Todd Morse, Toby's brother. Their self-titled debut album was released in 1996, showcasing a blend of melodic hardcore and punk rock. The album received positive reviews and established the band's presence in the hardcore scene. In 1997, they released "Thicker Than Water," which further solidified their reputation. The band's energetic performances and socially conscious lyrics have earned them a dedicated fan base worldwide. Over the years, H2O has released several albums, including "F.T.T.W." (1999), "Go" (2001), "Nothing to Prove" (2008), "Don't Forget Your Roots" (2011), and "Use Your Voice" (2015). Their music often addresses themes of personal integrity, social issues, and the importance of community. H2O continues to tour and record, maintaining their status as influential figures in the hardcore punk genre.

bands.name: Gods
bands.description: Gods were a British experimental band formed in London in 1987 by Kevin Martin. The band's lineup expanded to include nine members, releasing two studio albums before disbanding in 1996. Their music was an abrasive combination of ambient, dub, free jazz, and noise rock, earning them respect from peers such as Bill Laswell, Ministry, My Bloody Valentine, J.G. Thirlwell, and John Zorn. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God_%28British_band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Gudsforladt
bands.description: Gudsforladt is the debut studio album by Danish funeral doom band Nortt, released in 2003. The album is characterized by its melancholic and minimalist compositions, blending elements of black doom, depressive black metal, and funeral doom. Nortt, the sole member of the project, recorded all instruments and vocals, creating a deeply atmospheric and introspective work. The album was initially released as a limited edition LP by Sombre Records, with only 350 copies produced. In 2004, Diehard Music reissued the album on CD, including a bonus track titled "Evig Hvile," bringing the total track count to 12. The reissue featured a digibook format and was limited to 1,000 copies. The album's tracks include "Graven," "Døden," "Glemt," "Gravfred," "Hinsides," "Hedengangen," "Død Og Borte," "Nattetale," "De Dødes Kor," "Dystert Sind," and the bonus track "Evig Hvile." The music is noted for its heavy use of distorted guitars, minimalist piano melodies, and guttural vocals, creating a haunting and immersive listening experience. The album has been praised for its originality and emotional depth, with some reviewers describing it as a perfect embodiment of pure depressive black funeral doom metal. Gudsforladt has been reissued several times, including a 2010 release by Cyclone Empire and a 2018 edition by Avantgarde Music, each time bringing the album to a new audience and solidifying its status as a seminal work in the funeral doom genre.

bands.name: All Them Witches
bands.description:
All Them Witches is an American rock band from Nashville, Tennessee, formed on January 6, 2012. The group consists of vocalist and multi-instrumentalist Charles Michael Parks Jr., guitarist Ben McLeod, keyboardist and multi-instrumentalist Allan Van Cleave, and drummer Christian Powers. The band's musical style blends elements of blues rock, hard rock, stoner rock, acid rock, neo-psychedelia, heavy metal, and alternative rock. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Them_Witches?utm_source=openai))

The band's name is inspired by a book of witchcraft, "All of Them Witches," featured in the 1968 film "Rosemary's Baby." ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Them_Witches?utm_source=openai))

All Them Witches has released several studio albums, including "Our Mother Electricity" (2012), "Lightning at the Door" (2013), "Dying Surfer Meets His Maker" (2015), "Sleeping Through the War" (2017), "ATW" (2018), and "Nothing as the Ideal" (2020). They have also produced live albums such as "At the Garage" (2015), "Live in Brussels" (2016), and "Live on the Internet" (2021). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Them_Witches?utm_source=openai))

The band is known for their energetic live performances and has toured extensively, performing at festivals like Voodoo Music & Arts, Bonnaroo, Forecastle Festival, and Pukkelpop, and sharing stages with acts such as Mastodon, Ghost, and Primus. ([theduckclub.com](https://theduckclub.com/artist/all-them-witches/?utm_source=openai))

In April 2024, drummer and founding member Robby Staebler announced his departure from the group to focus on other projects. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Them_Witches?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Charles Michael Parks Jr. (bass, vocals), Ben McLeod (guitar, vocals), Allan Van Cleave (keyboard, violin), and Christian Powers (drums). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Them_Witches?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [allthemwitches.org](http://www.allthemwitches.org/).

bands.name: Soldier
bands.description:
Soldier is a British heavy metal band formed in 1979 in Northampton, England. They are associated with the New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM) movement, which emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. The band's lineup has seen several changes over the years, with guitarist Ian Dick being a consistent member since its inception. Other notable members include vocalist Richard Frost, guitarist Miles Goodman, bassist Steve Barlow, and drummer Tim Churchman. ([nwobhm.com](https://nwobhm.com/soldier/?utm_source=openai))

Soldier's music is characterized by energetic guitar riffs, powerful vocals, and themes of fantasy and life. They gained recognition in the early 1980s with the release of their single "Sheralee" in 1982, which received European success. ([heavymetalrecords.com](https://www.heavymetalrecords.com/artists/soldier?utm_source=openai)) Their discography includes several albums and singles, such as "Sins of the Warrior" (2005), "Dogs of War" (2014), and "Defiant" (2015). ([de.wikipedia.org](https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier_%28Band%29?utm_source=openai))

The band continues to perform live, participating in various gigs and festivals, and has maintained a dedicated fan base over the decades.

bands.name: Leo Jiménez
bands.description: Leo Jiménez, born Juan Daniel Jiménez González on August 17, 1979, in Fuenlabrada, Spain, is a renowned Spanish singer, composer, guitarist, actor, and producer. He first gained prominence in 1999 as the lead vocalist of the heavy metal band Saratoga, contributing to their success with albums like "Agotarás" (2002) and "Tierra de lobos" (2005). In 2006, Jiménez left Saratoga to focus on Stravaganzza, a gothic metal band he had founded in 2004. Stravaganzza's music blends gothic, symphonic, and progressive metal elements, with Jiménez's distinctive vocals at the forefront. In 2009, he launched his solo career with the album "Títere con cabeza," followed by "Los fuertes sobreviven" (2011) and "Animal solitario" (2013). His solo work showcases a mix of heavy metal and hard rock influences, reflecting his versatility as an artist. Jiménez has also participated in the rock opera "Jesucristo Superstar," portraying the character of Jesus in 2010 and 2011. His contributions to the Spanish metal scene have solidified his reputation as a leading figure in the genre. ([es.wikipedia.org](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_Jim%C3%A9nez?utm_source=openai))

(0) is a Danish alternative metal quintet that emerged in 2017, known for their unique fusion of black, progressive, drone, and post-metal elements. The band has chosen to remain anonymous, allowing their intense and experimental soundscapes to take center stage. Their self-titled debut EP, released in 2017, introduced listeners to their distinctive style, characterized by a wall of guitars, growling vocals in Danish, and a drone-based melancholy. In April 2020, (0) released their debut album, "SkamHan," via Napalm Records. This album delved deeper into the darker aspects of the human psyche, offering a journey through seven tracks that explore themes of grief, depression, guilt, and frustration. The release coincided with the COVID-19 pandemic, limiting their ability to tour until the following year. In 2021, they embarked on a 14-day European tour, performing at international festivals such as the Mystic Festival in Poland and the Gefle Metal Festival in Sweden. In 2023, (0) returned with their second album, "Knæk.Mørke.Mod.Lys," recorded with producer Lasse Ballade. The album features nine new compositions that continue to explore the band's signature blend of black, progressive, drone, and sludge metal. The lyrics focus on themes like grief, depression, guilt, and frustration, while also addressing broader issues such as climate change. The title track, "Knæk.Mørke.Mod.Lys," translates to "Break Darkness Against Light," reflecting the band's exploration of light and darkness. The album was released on vinyl and digital formats, with limited edition versions available for pre-order. ([suffermagazine.com](https://www.suffermagazine.com/0-danish-alternative-metal-quintet-releases-second-single-and-video-skyldnersol-from-forthcoming-album/?utm_source=openai)) Throughout their career, (0) has captivated audiences with their raw and untamed performances, combining intense sound with elaborate visuals to create a compelling live experience.

bands.name: Opera Magna
bands.description: Opera Magna is a Spanish symphonic power metal band formed in 1997 in Valencia by guitarists Enrique Mompó and Francisco Javier Nula. They began composing their debut album, "El Último Caballero," in 2000, and after recruiting members, released a demo in 2002 featuring tracks that would later appear on their first full-length album. The band has since released several albums, including "Poe" in 2010, a concept album based on Edgar Allan Poe's works, and "Del Amor y Otros Demonios" in 2019, a three-part EP series. Their latest album, "Heroica," was released on March 1, 2024, showcasing their evolution in the symphonic power metal genre.

bands.name: Opeth
bands.description: Opeth is a Swedish progressive metal band formed in 1990 in Stockholm. The band is renowned for blending death metal ferocity with elements of progressive rock, folk, jazz, and blues, creating compositions that are both intricate and dynamic. Their early works, such as the debut album "Orchid" (1995) and "Morningrise" (1996), showcased a raw death metal sound. However, with the release of "Blackwater Park" in 2001, produced by Steven Wilson, Opeth began incorporating more progressive rock elements, marking a significant evolution in their musical style. This shift continued with albums like "Ghost Reveries" (2005) and "Watershed" (2008), which featured a mix of heavy and mellow passages. In 2011, the band released "Heritage," embracing a more classic progressive rock sound. Their 14th studio album, "The Last Will and Testament," released in November 2024, marked a return to death metal elements, including growled vocals, reminiscent of their earlier works. The album received critical acclaim and won the Swedish Grammis award for Best Hard Rock/Metal album in 2025. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opeth?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sphinx
bands.description: Sphinx is a Spanish heavy metal band formed in Cádiz in 1992 by vocalist Manuel Rodríguez and drummer Carlos Delgado. Initially performing covers, they transitioned to original compositions sung in Spanish, adopting the name Sphinx in 1995. Their early work includes three demos: "Demomaqueta I" (1997), "Demomaqueta II" (1998), and "Demo '99" (1999), which garnered attention from major record labels and media outlets. In 2001, they signed with Fonomusic, releasing their self-titled debut album, "Sphinx," featuring tracks like "Ángel sin piedad" and "Mundo oscuro." The band's lineup during this period included Justi Bala and Santi Suárez on guitars, Andrés Duende on bass, Carlos Delgado on drums, and Manuel Rodríguez on vocals and keyboards. Their second album, "Mar de dioses," released in 2003, was followed by "Paraíso en la eternidad" in 2005 and "Renacer" in 2008. After a hiatus, Sphinx returned in 2019 with new guitarist Álex Sánchez and bassist Juanlu Ripalda, releasing "Vida virtual" in 2025. The current lineup comprises Manuel Rodríguez (vocals, keyboards), Justi Bala (guitar), Santi Suárez (guitar), Juanlu Ripalda (bass), and Pablo Casas (drums).

bands.name: Levee
bands.description: "Levee" is a metal band from the United States. Unfortunately, there is limited publicly available information about this band, including their history, musical style, discography, and current lineup. The lack of detailed information may be due to the band's underground status or limited media coverage. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, it is recommended to visit the band's official website or their profiles on music streaming platforms.

bands.name: Daeria
bands.description:
Daeria is a Spanish metal band from Barcelona, Catalonia, formed in 2018. Originally known as Döria, the band rebranded to Daeria in February 2018, marking a new chapter in their musical journey. Their sound is characterized by a blend of melodic heavy and power metal, featuring strong guitar riffs, intricate percussion, and soaring vocals that create an immersive listening experience. Since their formation, Daeria has been recognized as one of the most promising bands in the Spanish metal scene.

Their debut album, "Fénix," released on September 24, 2018, comprises ten original tracks and two bonus versions from their previous Döria era. The album received critical acclaim for its energy and quality, with standout tracks like "Fénix," "Lestat," and "Vacío." The band embarked on the "Esto Empieza Ahora Tour," performing extensively across Spain to promote the album.

In 2020, Daeria released their second album, "Alter," which further solidified their unique identity in the metal genre. The album includes tracks such as "Miedo," "El ojo de Aughra," and "Bailarina." The band continued to expand their reach, performing in Mexico in 2022.

Their third album, "Morfeo," was released on May 5, 2023, showcasing their most ambitious work to date. The album was accompanied by an extensive national tour, including performances at Rock Arena and Sun and Thunder festivals, as well as their first appearance in Portugal at the Milagre Metaleiro Open Air.

Daeria's music often delves into personal and universal themes, allowing listeners to connect deeply with their work. Their ability to blend hauntingly beautiful melodies with the raw energy of metal has earned them a dedicated fan base and a respected spot in the music scene.

bands.name: Babymetal
bands.description: Babymetal is a Japanese kawaii metal band formed in Tokyo in 2010, blending heavy metal with J-pop elements. The group consists of lead vocalist Suzuka Nakamoto (Su-metal), Moa Kikuchi (Moametal), and Momoko Okazaki (Momometal), who joined as an official member in 2023. Initially a sub-unit of the idol group Sakura Gakuin, Babymetal became independent in 2013 following Nakamoto's graduation. They have released five studio albums: 'Babymetal' (2014), 'Metal Resistance' (2016), 'Metal Galaxy' (2019), 'The Other One' (2023), and 'Metal Forth' (2025). 'Metal Forth' debuted at number nine on the Billboard 200, marking the first time a Japanese act reached the top ten in the U.S. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metal_Forth?utm_source=openai)) The band's unique fusion of metal and pop has garnered a global following, with performances in Europe and the Americas. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Babymetal?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Heidevolk
bands.description:
Heidevolk is a Dutch folk metal band formed in 2002 in Arnhem, Gelderland. Initially named Hymir, they changed their name to Heidevolk, meaning 'heath-folk' or 'heather folk', inspired by the Veluwe landscape. The band's music is characterized by dual clean male vocals, blending heavy metal with traditional folk elements, and lyrics sung in Dutch that draw from nature, the history of Gelderland, and Germanic mythology. They have released seven full-length studio albums:

- De Strijdlust Is Geboren (2005)
- Walhalla Wacht (2008)
- Uit Oude Grond (2010)
- Batavi (2012)
- Velua (2015)
- Vuur Van Verzet (2018)
- Wederkeer (2023)

Their 2023 album, Wederkeer, continues their tradition of combining metal riffs with folk melodies, reflecting their commitment to pagan themes and the rich cultural heritage of their homeland.

The current lineup includes:

- Jacco Bühnebeest – vocals, accordion
- Daniël Den Dorstighe – vocals
- Koen Vuurdichter – guitar, backing vocals
- Mat Snaerenslijper – guitar
- Rowan Roodbaert – bass guitar, backing vocals
- Kevin Houtsplijter – drums

Heidevolk has established a reputation for energetic live performances, captivating audiences with their unique blend of metal and folk influences.

bands.name: Celtibeerian
bands.description: Celtibeerian is a Spanish folk metal band formed in Ciudad Real in 2011. The band blends traditional Celtic and Iberian music with heavy metal, creating a unique sound they describe as "Folk Fucking Metal." Their lyrics often explore themes of history and festive music, focusing on Celtic, Iberian, and Celtiberian cultures. The band has released several albums, including "Tirikantam" (2011), "Keltorevolution" (2014), "From Soil to Soul" (2016), and "Deiwos" (2017). In 2023, they released "Nertos," their most recent album, showcasing their evolved sound and energy. The current lineup includes Gus (vocals and bass), Dagda (whistle, bagpipe, bouzouki, and vocals), Clara (hurdy-gurdy, whistle, and vocals), Sergio (guitar and vocals), and Ru (drums and vocals).

bands.name: Legion Of The Damned
bands.description: Legion of the Damned is a Dutch thrash metal and death metal band formed in 1992 under the name Occult. In 2006, they rebranded as Legion of the Damned. The band's lyrics often explore themes of horror, occultism, religion, and apocalyptic events. They have released several albums, including "Malevolent Rapture" (2006), "Sons of the Jackal" (2007), "Feel the Blade" (2008), "Cult of the Dead" (2008), "Descent into Chaos" (2011), "Ravenous Plague" (2014), "Slaves of the Shadow Realm" (2019), and "The Poison Chalice" (2023). ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legion_of_the_Damned_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Calva Louise
bands.description: Calva Louise is a dynamic rock band formed in London in 2016, comprising Venezuelan-born vocalist and guitarist Jess Allanic, French bassist Alizon Taho, and New Zealand drummer Ben Parker. Their music is a fusion of alternative rock, post-hardcore, and Latin influences, creating a distinctive sound that has garnered international attention. The band has released four full-length albums: 'Rhinoceros' (2019), 'Euphoric' (2021), 'Over the Threshold' (2023), and 'Edge of the Abyss' (2025). They have performed at major festivals such as Reading & Leeds, Rock For People, and SXSW, and have supported artists like Albert Hammond Jr. and The Blinders. Their music often alternates between English and Spanish, exploring themes of identity, duality, and alternate realities. The band was named one of the 'Artists You Need to Know' in 2024 by BBC Radio 1. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calva_Louise?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Uriah Heep
bands.description: Uriah Heep is an English rock band formed in London in 1969. Over the years, they've become pioneers in hard rock, progressive rock, and heavy metal, known for their distinctive sound characterized by powerful keyboard melodies and strong vocal harmonies. The band's current lineup includes guitarist Mick Box, keyboardist Phil Lanzon, lead vocalist Bernie Shaw, drummer Russell Gilbrook, and bassist Dave Rimmer. Throughout their career, Uriah Heep has released 25 studio albums, with notable works like "Demons and Wizards" (1972) and "The Magician's Birthday" (1972). Their 1972 album "Demons and Wizards" is particularly acclaimed, solidifying their reputation in the heavy metal genre. The band has sold over 40 million albums worldwide, with significant followings in Germany, Japan, and Russia. In 2024, they announced "The Magician's Farewell" tour to celebrate their 55th anniversary, marking a significant milestone in their enduring career. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uriah_Heep_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Freedom Call
bands.description: Freedom Call is a German power metal band formed in 1998 in Nuremberg. The band was founded by lead vocalist and guitarist Chris Bay and drummer Dan Zimmermann during a hiatus from Zimmermann's main band, Gamma Ray. They were later joined by bassist Ilker Ersin and guitarist Sascha Gerstner. Their debut album, "Stairway to Fairyland," was released in 1999, followed by the EP "Taragon," which included a cover of Ultravox's "Dancing with Tears in My Eyes." Over the years, Freedom Call has released 14 albums, with "Silver Romance" being their latest, released in 2024 to celebrate their 25th anniversary. The band's music is characterized by melodic power metal with themes of fantasy, adventure, and optimism. ([freedom-call.net](https://freedom-call.net/index.php/bio?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Voila
bands.description: Voila is a four-piece band formed in 2010 in Prague, Czech Republic. The lineup consists of Zdenka Trvalcová (vocals), Michal Mihok (accordion), Antonín Dlapa (guitar), and Matěj Černý (double bass, programming). Initially, they began as a traditional French chanson band but later evolved their music into a fusion of jazz, chanson, swing, klezmer, and folk. Their unique blend of genres has garnered them a dedicated following and critical acclaim.

bands.name: Týr
bands.description:
Týr is a folk metal band from the Faroe Islands, formed in 1998. Their music blends heavy metal with Nordic folklore, history, and mythology, creating a unique sound that has garnered international acclaim. The band's name is derived from Týr, the Norse god of war. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%C3%BDr_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Heri Joensen (vocals and guitar), Gunnar H. Thomsen (bass), Tadeusz Rieckmann (drums), and Hans Hammer (guitar). ([tyr.fo](https://tyr.fo/?utm_source=openai))

Týr's discography showcases their evolution and commitment to their craft. Their ninth studio album, "Battle Ballads," was released on April 12, 2024, through Metal Blade Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Ballads?utm_source=openai))

The band has been characterized as one of "the islands' two most successful metal bands," with their subject matter revolving almost entirely around Viking lore, mythology, and history. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%C3%BDr_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

For more information, visit their official website at [tyr.fo](https://tyr.fo/).

bands.name: Marked As An Enemy
bands.description:
Marked As An Enemy (MAAE) is a metalcore band from Prague, Czech Republic, formed in 2016. The band is known for its dark and aggressive musical style, characterized by emotionally charged lyrics and intricate technical riffs. Their music delves into themes of personal struggles, mental well-being, and the darker aspects of human nature.

Since their formation, MAAE has released several notable works:

- **"Crossroads" (2018):** An EP that introduced the band's intense sound, featuring tracks that blend metalcore with melodic elements. ([maae.bandcamp.com](https://maae.bandcamp.com/album/crossroads?utm_source=openai))

- **"Fire Find Me" (2020):** Another EP that continued to explore themes of personal conflict and introspection, released during the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. ([maae.bandcamp.com](https://maae.bandcamp.com/album/fire-find-me-2?utm_source=openai))

- **"Meanwhile" (2022):** Their debut full-length album, showcasing a more refined and mature sound, with tracks like "How Does It Feel?" that highlight the band's evolution. ([maae.bandcamp.com](https://maae.bandcamp.com/track/how-does-it-feel-2?utm_source=openai))

- **"War of Mine" (2025):** An EP released under the ParanoiaCVLT label, further solidifying their presence in the metalcore scene. ([maae.bandcamp.com](https://maae.bandcamp.com/album/crossroads?utm_source=openai))

In August 2025, MAAE performed at the Brutal Assault festival in Jaroměř, Czech Republic, sharing the stage with renowned acts like Mastodon and Opeth. ([concertarchives.org](https://www.concertarchives.org/bands/marked-as-an-enemy?utm_source=openai))

The band's lineup has seen changes over the years. In 2019, vocalist Radek Polansky, formerly of Unravel, joined MAAE, bringing a fresh dynamic to their sound. ([last.fm](https://www.last.fm/music/Marked%2BAs%2BAn%2BEnemy?utm_source=openai))

For more information and updates, you can visit their official website at [maaeofficial.com](https://maaeofficial.com).

bands.name: Whitesnake
bands.description: Whitesnake is a British rock band formed in London in 1978 by former Deep Purple vocalist David Coverdale. Initially conceived as a backing band for Coverdale, Whitesnake quickly evolved into a standalone entity, with Coverdale remaining the sole constant member throughout its history. The band's early sound blended hard rock, blues, and soul influences, as showcased in their 1978 EP "Snakebite" and their 1978 debut album "Trouble." Their 1984 album "Slide It In" marked a shift towards a more commercial hard rock style, leading to greater international success. The 1987 self-titled album, often referred to as "1987," propelled them to superstardom with hits like "Still of the Night," "Here I Go Again," and "Is This Love." Over the years, Whitesnake has undergone numerous lineup changes, with Coverdale being the only consistent member. The band's musical style has evolved, incorporating elements of hard rock, blues rock, glam metal, and heavy metal. Their discography includes notable albums such as "Slip of the Tongue" (1989), "Restless Heart" (1997), "Good to Be Bad" (2008), and "Flesh & Blood" (2019). In 2022, Whitesnake embarked on their farewell tour, celebrating over four decades of music. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitesnake?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Eluveitie
bands.description:
Eluveitie is a Swiss folk metal band formed in 2002, known for blending melodic death metal with traditional Celtic music. The band's name is derived from the ancient Gaulish word "elu" meaning "I will" and "veitie" meaning "voice," translating to "I will voice" or "I will speak." This reflects their commitment to preserving and promoting the ancient Celtic heritage through their music.

Their discography includes several notable albums:

- **Spirit** (2006): Their debut album, which established their unique sound by integrating traditional instruments like the hurdy-gurdy and bagpipes with metal elements.

- **Slania** (2008): This album gained international recognition, featuring tracks like "Inis Mona" and "Primordial Breath."

- **Everything Remains (As It Never Was)** (2010): Continued their exploration of Celtic themes, with songs such as "Thousandfold."

- **Helvetios** (2012): A concept album centered around the Roman Empire's conquest of Gaul, showcasing their storytelling prowess.

- **Ategnatos** (2019): Delved into themes of rebirth and transformation, reflecting the band's evolution.

Eluveitie's music is characterized by its energetic blend of metal and folk elements, creating a distinctive sound that has resonated with fans worldwide.

For more information, visit their official website at [www.eluveitie.ch](https://www.eluveitie.ch/).

bands.name: Astray Valley
bands.description:
Astray Valley is a metalcore band from Barcelona, Spain, formed in 2014. The band has been active since their formation, releasing several singles and albums. Their discography includes:

- **Unneth** (2018): A full-length album featuring tracks like "Hollow" and "The Wilderness." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Astray_Valley/Unneth/729803?utm_source=openai))

- **Midnight Sun** (2023): Their latest album, released on December 15, 2023, includes songs such as "Darkest Times" and "Neon Misery." ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Astray_Valley/Midnight_Sun/1177201?utm_source=openai))

The band's music is characterized by a blend of metalcore elements, featuring aggressive guitar riffs, dynamic drumming, and a mix of clean and unclean vocals. Their lyrics often explore themes of personal struggle, resilience, and introspection.

As of November 2025, the current lineup includes:

- **Clau Violette** – Vocals
- **Adri Funérailles** – Guitars
- **Unai Splinters** – Drums
- **Alex Albano** – Bass

The band is currently signed to Art Gates Records.

bands.name: Besna
bands.description: Besna is a post-black metal band from Bratislava, Slovakia, formed in 2017. The band's music blends black metal, post-rock, and elements of Slovak folk music, creating a sound that is both melancholic and intense. Their debut album, "Zverstvá" (Atrocities), released in 2022, delves into themes such as societal issues, ecological concerns, and personal isolation. In January 2025, they released their second full-length album, "Krásno" (Beauty), which explores themes of societal stagnation, personal isolation, ecological collapse, and the search for meaning in an unjust world. The album critiques passive acceptance of authority and the cyclical nature of cynicism, urging listeners to fight apathy and despair. The band's lineup includes Martin Pinter (vocals, guitar), Samuel Dudlák (vocals, guitar), Timotej Jurášek (bass), and Anton Samokhvalov (drums). ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Besna/3540441398?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: The Electric Alley
bands.description:
The Electric Alley is a hard rock band formed in Cádiz, Spain, in late 2012. Drawing inspiration from 1970s music, they began composing songs for their debut album, "Backward States of Society," which received significant acclaim from the national press. Notably, five tracks from the album were featured on Channel F1, produced by Movistar TV, with "No Control" serving as the main theme for the Formula 1 World Championship broadcasts in 2014 and 2015. ([theelectricalley.es](https://theelectricalley.es/en/bio/?utm_source=openai))

In 2015, the band released their second album, "Get Electrified!" This album showcased a more mature sound, with the track "A Lonely Sun Story" being selected as the soundtrack for a Spanish short animated film of the same name. The film received nominations for the Goya Awards and the ASECAN Andalusian Film Awards in 2015 and 2016, respectively. ([theelectricalley.es](https://theelectricalley.es/en/bio/?utm_source=openai))

Their third album, "Turning Wheels," was released in 2018, followed by "Apache" in 2022. "Apache" has been praised for its classic rock vibe, drawing comparisons to bands like Jeff Beck, Scorpions, and Europe. The album features standout tracks such as "Make It Through the Night," "Apache," "Son of a Gun," "Bliss," and "One Lasting Light." ([globaltexanchronicles.com](https://globaltexanchronicles.com/the-electric-alley-apache/?utm_source=openai))

The Electric Alley has been recognized as one of the most prominent rock bands in Spain's underground scene, known for their energetic performances and dedication to rock and roll. ([theelectricalley.es](https://theelectricalley.es/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Channel Zero
bands.description:
Channel Zero is a Belgian groove and thrash metal band formed in Brussels in 1990. They are among the most prominent heavy metal bands from Belgium. The band initially disbanded in 1997 but reunited in 2009, continuing to perform and release new material. Their music is characterized by powerful vocals, aggressive guitar riffs, and energetic live performances.

**History and Style**

Channel Zero's musical style blends elements of thrash and groove metal, drawing influences from bands like Metallica and Pantera. Their lyrics often explore themes such as society, violence, struggles, politics, life, hate, death, and religion. The band's dynamic sound and compelling stage presence have earned them a dedicated fan base both in Belgium and internationally.

**Albums**

- *Channel Zero* (1992): The band's self-titled debut album, released under Shark Records.

- *Stigmatized for Life* (1993): Produced by Vinnie Paul of Pantera, this album helped the band gain recognition in the metal community.

- *Unsafe* (1994): Marked a new, sharper, more focused sound for the band.

- *Black Fuel* (1996): Their last studio album before their initial breakup.

- *Feed 'Em with a Brick* (2011): Released after their reunion, produced by Logan Mader.

- *Kill All Kings* (2014): Released under Metal Blade Records.

- *Exit Humanity* (2017): Their latest studio album, released under CNR Records.

**Current Lineup**

- Franky De Smet-Van Damme – Vocals

- Tino De Martino – Bass

- Mikey Doling – Lead Guitar

- Seven Antonopoulos – Drums

- Christophe Depree – Rhythm Guitar

**Website**

For more information, visit their official website: ([channel-zero.be](https://www.channel-zero.be/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Scimitar
bands.description: Scimitar is a thrash metal band from Haddon Heights, New Jersey, formed in 2008. The band consists of Andy Marino (bass, backing vocals) and John Jansma (vocals, guitars). They have performed alongside acts such as Exhumed, Monarch!, Hatred, Putrefy, Red Six, Rats Blood, War Iron, and Rabid Bitch of the North. Scimitar released a six-track EP titled "The Act of War," recorded by Niall Doran at Start Together Studios in Belfast. They followed this with a three-track EP, "Plague In The Vatican," recorded and mixed by guitarist John Thompson, released on October 31, 2014. ([irishmetalarchive.com](https://irishmetalarchive.com/artists/scimitar/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Jelusick
bands.description: Jelusick is a Croatian hard rock and heavy metal band formed in 2021 by vocalist and keyboardist Dino Jelusick, following the disbandment of his previous group, Animal Drive. The lineup includes guitarist Ivan Keller, bassist Luka Brodarić, and drummer Mario Lepoglavec. In September 2023, they released their debut album, "Follow the Blind Man," under Escape Records, featuring 11 tracks that showcase their technical prowess and emotional depth. The album received critical acclaim, winning the Porin award for Best Rock Album in Croatia. ([cms.disway.id](https://cms.disway.id/uploads/bank_img/HARIAN_DISWAY_30_SEPTEMBER_2023.pdf?utm_source=openai)) Their music blends elements of hard rock and heavy metal, drawing influences from bands like Whitesnake and Dream Theater. Jelusick's dynamic performances and powerful compositions have established them as a prominent act in the Croatian rock scene.

bands.name: Breed 77
bands.description:
Breed 77 is a Gibraltarian rock band formed in 1996, known for their unique fusion of alternative metal, nu metal, and flamenco rock. The band was established by school friends Paul Isola, Danny Felice, and Stuart Cavilla, who met in London and became informally known as the 'Gibraltarian Mafia'. Initially named 'Breed', they were compelled to change their name to 'Breed 77' due to a prior registration by Steve Hewitt of Placebo. The name '77' was inspired by Cavilla's motorcycle courier call sign, 'Kilo 77'.

In 1998, Breed 77 was voted 'Best Unsigned Band' by Kerrang! readers, and in 1999, they won both the Metal Hammer and Kerrang! awards for 'Best New Band'. Their debut album, 'Breed 77', was released in 2000, followed by 'Cultura' in 2004, which peaked at number 3 on the UK Rock Albums Chart. The band continued to release music, including 'In My Blood (En Mi Sangre)' in 2006 and 'Insects' in 2009. After a hiatus in 2015, Breed 77 returned in 2024 with the single 'End of the Line' and announced UK tour dates for May 2024.

Breed 77's music is characterized by a blend of heavy guitar riffs and flamenco rhythms, creating a distinctive sound that sets them apart in the rock and metal scenes. Their energetic live performances have garnered them a dedicated fan base, and they have toured extensively, sharing stages with bands like Black Sabbath, Machine Head, and Korn. The band's ability to seamlessly integrate diverse musical influences has made them a unique presence in the music industry.

bands.name: Souldevice
bands.description: Souldevice was an American power metal band formed in Springfield, Ohio, in 2002. The band was active until their disbandment, with no further information available regarding their activities or releases. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Souldevice/3540311776?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Blackbriar
bands.description: Blackbriar is a Dutch alternative metal band from Assen, formed in 2012. The band has released three studio albums: 'The Cause of Shipwreck' (2021), 'A Dark Euphony' (2023), and 'A Thousand Little Deaths' (2025). Their music blends alternative metal, gothic metal, and symphonic metal elements, creating a dark and cinematic soundscape. In October 2019, Blackbriar supported Epica on their Design Your Universe 10th Anniversary Tour. In November 2019, they performed at the AFAS Live in Amsterdam, opening for Halestorm and In This Moment. In November 2022, they signed with Nuclear Blast Records. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackbriar_%28band%29?utm_source=openai)) The band has also released several EPs and singles, with their music videos amassing millions of views on platforms like YouTube. ([metalfrom.nl](https://www.metalfrom.nl/blackbriar/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Triskell
bands.description: Triskell is an Italian heavy metal band formed in 2002 in Monza, Lombardy. Initially known as Triskellbound, they later adopted the name Triskell. The band's lineup has included Christian La Spina (bass, acoustic guitars, backing vocals), Sergio Giovenzana (drums), Mauro Comparin (guitars), Fabio Cerizza-Cerry (lead vocals, guitars), and Cristiano Patuzzi - Zemog (keyboards, backing vocals). Their musical style is characterized by heavy metal elements, and they have released material under the label Emania. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/bands/Triskell/60831?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Paradise Lost
bands.description:
Paradise Lost is a British gothic metal band formed in Halifax, West Yorkshire, in 1988. They are considered pioneers of the death-doom genre and have significantly influenced the gothic metal movement. The band's lineup has remained consistent over the years, featuring vocalist Nick Holmes, guitarists Greg Mackintosh and Aaron Aedy, and bassist Steve Edmondson. Drummer Jeff Singer rejoined the band in May 2025, replacing Guido Montanarini. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paradise_Lost_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Paradise Lost's musical style has evolved over time, transitioning from death-doom to incorporate elements of gothic metal, synth-pop, and electronic rock. Their 1991 album "Gothic" is considered a defining work in the gothic metal genre. In 2025, they released their 17th studio album, "Ascension," which continues to showcase their dynamic sound. ([nuclearblast.com](https://www.nuclearblast.com/pages/paradise-lost?utm_source=openai))

The band has achieved significant commercial success, with over two million albums sold worldwide as of 2005. They have been signed to various labels, including Peaceville Records, Music for Nations, EMI Electrola, and Nuclear Blast. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paradise_Lost_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

Paradise Lost's influence extends beyond their own releases, inspiring bands such as Anathema, My Dying Bride, and Cradle of Filth. Their ability to blend heavy metal with atmospheric and melodic elements has solidified their status as a seminal act in the metal genre. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paradise_Lost_%28band%29?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Magic Kingdom
bands.description: Magic Kingdom is a Belgian power metal band formed in 1998 by guitarist Dushan Petrossi. Known for their symphonic and epic metal style, they have released several albums, including "The Arrival" (1999), "Metallic Tragedy" (2004), "Symphony of War" (2010), "Savage Requiem" (2015), "MetAlmighty" (2019), and "Blaze of Rage" (2024). The band's music often features powerful anthemic choruses, majestic orchestrations, and captivating melodies. "Blaze of Rage" is a concept album with 12 tracks, continuing the "Metal Opera" series with "The Great Retribution" as its third chapter. ([magickingdom.be](https://www.magickingdom.be/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Mortal Sin
bands.description: Mortal Sin is an Australian thrash metal band formed in Sydney in 1985. They are recognized as one of the pioneering thrash metal acts in Australia, known for their aggressive sound and energetic performances. The original lineup consisted of vocalist Mat Maurer, bassist Andy Eftichiou, guitarist Keith Krstin, guitarist Paul Carwana, and drummer Wayne Campbell. Their debut album, "Mayhemic Destruction," released in 1987, garnered international attention and was re-released worldwide by Vertigo Records. The band's second album, "Face of Despair," released in 1989, showcased a more refined sound and further solidified their reputation in the thrash metal scene. Over the years, Mortal Sin has undergone several lineup changes but has maintained a consistent presence in the metal community. In July 2025, the band announced a reunion to celebrate the 40th anniversary of "Mayhemic Destruction," with plans for Australian shows in 2026 and an appearance at the Keep It True festival in Germany. ([mortalsinband.com](https://mortalsinband.com/BAND.html?utm_source=openai))

802 is a Danish metal band from Djursland, Denmark, known for their unique blend of metal, shoegaze, and pop influences. Formed in 2023, the trio consists of lead vocalist and guitarist Luca Crosta, guitarist and keyboardist Alfie Reeves, and bassist Clara Conquest. Their music is characterized by dense layers of crunchy metal riffs, thunderous drumming, and atmospheric synths, drawing comparisons to early Metallica and contemporary shoegaze bands. The band debuted with the single "My Girl," followed by "22 (Velvet Vampire)," both featured in award-winning horror shorts. Their third single, "1986," further solidified their sound, leading to performances at major Scandinavian festivals like Copenhell and Roskilde. In 2024, they released "Princess," showcasing their dance-floor-friendly style. Their fifth single, "H.I.T.S.," continues to blend metal and pop elements, reflecting themes of good versus evil. The band has been nominated for New Artist of the Year and New Live Artist of the Year at Denmark's Den Hårde Tone awards, winning the former. ([joyofviolentmovement.com](https://joyofviolentmovement.com/category/metal/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Sarcófago
bands.description: Sarcófago was a Brazilian extreme metal band formed in 1985, known for pioneering black and death metal with their raw and aggressive sound. Their 1991 album, "The Laws of Scourge," marked a shift to a more technical death/thrash metal style, featuring tracks like "Midnight Queen" and "Screeches from the Silence." The band disbanded in 2000, leaving a lasting impact on the metal scene.

bands.name: Argion
bands.description: Argion is a Spanish power metal band formed in 2019 in Oviedo, Asturias. The band emerged from the ashes of DarkAge, a heavy metal group active from 2014 to 2019. Argion's music is characterized by powerful melodies and themes centered around ancient heroes and history. Their discography includes the full-length album "Tiempo de héroes" (2020), the single "La ciudad eterna" (2023), and "Fuerza y honor" (2023), all released under Maldito Records. The band is currently working on their upcoming album "Lux Umbra," with the single "Anne Bonny" released in 2023. ([metal-archives.com](https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Argion/Tiempo_de_h%C3%A9roes/837445?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Rainover
bands.description:
Rainover is a Spanish gothic metal band formed in 2003 in Murcia. Originally known as Remembrances, the group underwent a significant transformation in 2011, adopting the name Rainover and introducing Andrea Casanova as the new vocalist. This lineup change marked a new era for the band, leading to the release of their second album, "Transcending the Blue and Drifting into Rebirth," in 2014. The album was produced in Italy and mastered in Germany, showcasing the band's commitment to high-quality production. ([rainoverofficial.com](https://www.rainoverofficial.com/en/biography/?utm_source=openai))

In 2020, Rainover released their third album, "NOX," which delved into darker and more atmospheric themes. The album was produced and recorded in Italy, with mastering by Dennis Koehne in Germany. It featured special guest vocalist Anders Jacobsson of the Swedish band Draconian on the track "Lumina Omnia." ([rainoverofficial.com](https://www.rainoverofficial.com/en/biography/?utm_source=openai))

Their fourth album, "Between Dream and Nightmare," was released in July 2025. The album was recorded in Mia Estudio in Murcia, mixed by Mikko Karmila, and mastered by Mika Jussila. The band also released a music video for the track "Coma," adding a visual dimension to their latest work. ([tntradiorock.com](https://tntradiorock.com/rainover-publican-between-dream-and-nightmare-su-cuarto-album-entre-la-ensonacion-y-la-penumbra/?utm_source=openai))

Rainover's music is characterized by a blend of gothic and doom metal elements, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. Their sound is defined by a powerful, versatile, and recognizable female voice, occasionally accompanied by distorted male vocals, guiding listeners through memorable stories and melodies. ([rainoverofficial.com](https://www.rainoverofficial.com/en/?utm_source=openai))

The current lineup includes Tatiana Martínez (vocals), Sergio Pérez (guitar), Rubén Asunción (drums), Arturo Hernández (keyboards), and Carlos Pulido (bass). The band continues to perform live, with upcoming events scheduled in Spain. ([tntradiorock.com](https://tntradiorock.com/rainover-publican-between-dream-and-nightmare-su-cuarto-album-entre-la-ensonacion-y-la-penumbra/?utm_source=openai))

bands.name: Vita Imana
bands.description:
Vita Imana is a groove metal band from Madrid, Spain, formed in 2005. The band is known for blending aggressive and atmospheric sounds, with a distinctive rhythm section that incorporates various percussion instruments, creating a tribal and powerful live performance. Their music is influenced by bands like Gojira, Machine Head, Slipknot, Sepultura, and Chimaira. The current lineup includes Mero Mero (vocals), David Ramos (guitar), Diego López (guitar), Pepe Blanco (bass and backing vocals), Míriam Baz (percussion and vocals), and Daniel García (drums). Their discography includes the following albums:

- "En Otro Lugar" (2010): Their debut album, featuring tracks like "Gondwana" and "Paranoia."

- "Uluh" (2012): Produced by David Sobrino and mixed by Carlos Santos, this album includes songs such as "Romper con Todo" and "Un Nuevo Sol."

- "Oceanidae" (2014): Released in March 2014, this album continues their exploration of groove metal.

- "El M4L" (2017): Released in April 2017, this album was produced by Álex Cappa and includes tracks like "Mi Camino."

- "Bosa" (2019): Released in March 2019, this album was recorded at The Metal Factory Studios and features 10 tracks.

- "VI" (2022): Released on October 17, 2022, this album includes songs like "Coltán" and "Virtual."

Vita Imana has been recognized for their energetic live performances and has participated in various festivals, including the Kabiefest Metal 2024. Their music is available on platforms like Metal Archives and Apple Music.
